Description: This rich and slightly earthy wine has an aroma of dried figs and ripe black plums plus a slight funky note that blows off. That's followed by juicy and friendly cherry and berry flavors and a smooth sleek texture. It's medium bodied, not overtly oaky and light on tannin.
Name: The Winery SF 2013 Merlot (North Coast)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's pretty strawberry and spicy/tart cherry fruit shines, with medium concentration and length. Its light tannins and supportive acids are in fine balance, making it a nice alternative to more elegant Pinot Noir-based Oregon rosés.
Name: Eliana 2017 Rosé of Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Description: This ruby colored wine has aromas of cherry cola and red raspberry. On the palate, there are flavors of red raspberry, blackberry and red plum before the fruit-filled finish.
Name: Delea 2016 Ismaro Merlot (Ticino)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's bittersweet chocolate, currant and baking spice aromas are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors, with cocoa notes on the finish. Though sophisticated, it seems dominated by oak.
Name: Obelisco Estate 2014 Estate Grown BDX Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Hints of mint and cedar make the aroma of this full-bodied wine tempting, and the flavors deliver lots of plump berries and light, spicy accents. It's well-balanced and easy to appreciate.
Name: Steele 2015 Merlot (Lake County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine was aged in 20% new French oak. Its raspberry, green herb and spice aromas lead to ripe fruit flavors that coat the palate. It's lovely and exquisitely made but seems a bit green for the variety.
Name: Adamant Cellars 2013 Winemaker's Select Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A play on the famous line from the film Sideways, this bottling attempts to resurrect Merlot's image, starting with rich fresh aromas of blackberry sorbet, tangy black-plum skins and crushed gravel. It's a very young wine throughout, as the lighter bodied palate offers candied black-raspberry and plum flavors. Good with a chill.
Name: Bonny Doon 2016 I Am Not Drinking Any $%&*# Merlot (Monterey County)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry, dried herbs and baked earth show on the nose of this bottling from a new producer based in Monterey County. It's a clean, down-the-middle expression of the grape, with dark red cherry, cocoa spice and herb flavors framed by medium tannins and acidity.
Name: Comanche 2013 Zajak Vineyard Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: This is a ripe and fruit-forward wine, with intense notes of jammy plum, cherry and blueberry on the nose and mouth. A slight creaminess and plush flavors create a broad, tasty mouthfeel that finishes with a hint of milk chocolate.
Name: Les Domaines Auriol Claude Vialade 2017 Maison Vialade Grande Réserve Merlot (Pays d'Oc)

Description: This wine is oaky first and fruity second, showing smoky spicy aromas and equally spicy, lightly charred flavors. Medium body and moderate tannins give it heft on the palate and there's just enough blackberry flavor underneath to counterbalance the oakiness.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2014 Merlot (California)

Description: This wine's dark berry aromas recall cassis and raisin. Citrusy acidity and hard tannins make for a lively mouthfeel, framing roasted plum and currant flavors. Mint and herbal notes linger on the finish, which is bold with acidity.
Name: Concha y Toro 2015 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (San Clemente)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Anise, cherry, green herb, orange peel and spice aromas carry the nose. These tones carry to the full, fleshy fruit flavors on the palate.
Name: Adamant Cellars 2014 Winemaker's Select Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's light aromas suggest woodspice and cherry. The palate mixes fruit and barrel flavors, showing pleasing texture and a tart finish. There's a barbeque note that seems out of place.
Name: Basalt 2014 Winemaker's Barrel Select Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is very flavorful and unapologetically oaky, from the smoky aromas to the almost-sweet maple and brown-sugar flavors that blend with a jammy fruit character. It is quite deep in color, saturated in flavor but not overly full bodied.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2016 The Revivalist Merlot (Clarksburg)

Description: Aromas of cherry, vanilla and freshly baked brioche carry the nose. The palate is smooth in feel, with soft tannins supported by flavors of tart cherry and plum.
Name: Stone Castle 2014 Merlot (Rahoveci Valley)

Description: Ruby in the glass, this wine has aromas of freshly baked cherry pie and red plum. On the palate, there are flavors of cherry preserves and black plum.
Name: Stone Castle 2015 Merlot (Rahoveci Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Conner Lee (42%), Dionysus (33%), Bacchus (21%) and Stillwater Creek vineyards. Its medicine cabinet, dried cherry, pencil lead and woodspice aromas lead to fruit leather flavors. It seems dried out.
Name: Arbor Crest 2015 Four Vineyards Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of underripe elderberry, black currant, sweet smoke and chocolate cake make for an intriguing (if unfamiliar) nose on this bottling from a new producer in Atascadero. Ripe flavors of prune ice cream, figs and raisins show on the sip, which shows decent acid and texture.
Name: Ruby Cellars 2014 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Ripe plum, chocolate-covered cherry and boysenberry flood the nose and palate of this straightforward but easy-drinking wine. It's rich in sweet-fruit flavors, but not overdone, with soft tannins that lend a touch of texture.
Name: La Forge Estate 2016 Merlot (Pays d'Oc)

Description: Vivid cherry and strawberry flavors give a cheery personality to this generous wine. It smells bright and fruity, and tastes more ripe, showing light spicy accents and a good focus on fruit.
Name: Mad Housewife 2016 Merlot (California)

Description: Garnet in the glass, this wine has aromas of red cherry, vanilla and black raspberry. On the palate, there are flavors of cherry vanilla and cocoa powder that are bolstered by chewy tannins.
Name: Vini 2016 Veni Vidi Vici Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: This wine's generic berry aromas are earthy and a touch baked, with clove and chocolate notes. The palate is dense and blocky, with leafy berry and chocolate flavors that finish with a residual minty note.
Name: Balduzzi 2015 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Sweet spice and potpourri grace the black plum core of this accessible wine. It's medium in acidity and soft in tannin, with a clean, fruit-forward finish. Drink now.
Name: Blanville 2017 Château Haut-Blanville Collection Solal Merlot (Pays d'Oc)

Description: This brilliant garnet colored wine has aromas of black cherry and raspberry that translate to the palate. The finish is bright and crisp.
Name: Casic 2015 100% Organic 100% Unforgettable Merlot (Croatia)

Description: Stewed plum aromas lead the nose of this wine, losing clarity with airing. It smacks of superficial acidity and tastes of plums and berries, with a touch of chocolate in the backdrop. The finish is creamy and artificial-seeming in both flavor and texture.
Name: Kon Tiki 2016 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Light and easy, this offers softly spiced plum and cherry tones throughout the nose and mouth. The palate is clean and direct, with fleeting tannins and a light, tart-fruit accent on the close.
Name: Luc Pirlet 2016 Réserve Merlot (Pays d'Oc)

Description: This Merlot's herbal berry aromas are tinged with brett and vinegar. It's tannic on the palate, without the body to support that kind of edginess. Its plum and currant flavors are grassy and green, and its tannins are scratchy.
Name: Viña Maipo 2016 Vitral Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: This wine's jammy raspberry and plum aromas are stretched thin. The palate is soft, lacking acidity. Strawberry and cassis flavors lead to an herb-laced finish.
Name: Sombras del Sol 2016 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Aromas of blackberry leaf, plum and balsamic reduction lead the nose of this direct wine. It's medium in weight, with surprisingly gripping tannins and abundant black-fruit flavors.
Name: Domaine de la Baume 2016 Grand Châtaignier Merlot (Pays d'Oc)

Description: This medium-bodied wine smells and tastes overtly oaky, as notes of maple syrup, brown sugar and cinnamon blanket the mild fruit flavors underneath.
Name: Mirassou 2016 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine explodes with aromas of cinnamon stick and oak. The entry is thick and dense on impact, with powerful, polished tannins. Dark cherry, raspberry and dusty clove combine with ease around a palate of structure and grace.
Name: Trefethen 2015 Family Owned Estate Grown Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Description: Dark, inky and earthy, this is a powerfully dense and rich expression of the variety, that is varietal in its mix of fruit, spice and herb. Black-cherry and mocha flavors dance around spicy toasted oak and polished, billowy tannin. Enjoy best 2022–2025.
Name: Venge 2015 Estate Merlot (Oakville)

Description: This is a full-bodied, structured and youthful wine, varietal in its softness and approachability. Cassis and cherry exude forcefully around a core of thick tannin and oak, with an undertone of dried herb.
Name: St. Francis 2015 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded red-berry fruit meets with vanilla, caramel, smoke and wet soil on the nose of this bottling from a winery near Morgan Hill. Hickory smoke and rich red-fruit flavors start the palate, where grippy tannins lead into a cocoa-laced finish. It needs some time to smooth out.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2014 Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in just 30% new oak, the aromas offer appealing notes of vanilla, red raspberry, cedar and cocoa. The flavors are plump, soft and pure, pulling up ever so slightly on the vanilla-filled finish.
Name: Dumas Station 2014 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Blackberry, tobacco and dusty tannins define this blockbuster. It is a full-bodied red that is varietal in its underlying softness and approachability. There's an intensity and heat to the lingering finish.
Name: St. Francis 2015 Behler Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a true pan-Washington Merlot, with fruit coming from nine vineyards across the state. Blended with a good whack of Cabernet Franc (13%) which reveals itself, baking-spice, plum, raspberry and herb aromas are followed by soft ripe fruit flavors, with the tannins pulled back. Herb and raspberry notes linger on the tart finish.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine offers a substantial nose of bay leaf and eucalyptus—pleasant and defiant. Huge sweet tannins wrap around sizable power and ripeness, a mix of black cherry and cinnamon-dusted plum.
Name: John Anthony 2014 Crane Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This big wine is hugely fragrant in strawberry, cherry and a slightly reduced hint of oaky tar. Dense rich layers of flavor etch themselves against a backdrop of tobacco, cedar and ripe black cherry.
Name: Risk 2014 Reserve Merlot (Oakville)

Description: Cedar, oak, leather and vanilla dominate the nose and carry over to the palate, where vibrant cranberry and pomegranate flavors pop with a wash of fresh acidity over attractive peppery notes and grippy tannins. Tangy fruit lingers on the finish with a pinch of pepper.
Name: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Reserve Merlot (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Description: The smoky nose shows aromas of black pepper, tobacco and leather. Ample acidity on the palate is highlighted by juicy blue fruit flavors, alongside green tobacco leaf, black pepper and wood smoke with spicy, gritty tannins. This finishes on strong notes of leather over cranberry and smoked pepper.
Name: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Merlot (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a new offering from the winery. Almost all varietal with just a splash of Cabernet Franc (3%) coming from Quintessence and Red Willow vineyards, the aromas of toast, spice, cedar, black raspberry and dried herb aren't entirely revealing. The palate seems a bit linear and wound up. Perhaps some time will flesh it out?
Name: Mark Ryan 2015 Little Sister Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very rocky expression of the grape, this bottling shows mud, clay and just a hint of dark red fruit on the nose. Dark cherry starts the sip alongside cola spice, but it's the texture and structure that take center stage, with thick tannins and strong grip. A smoky meat character shows on the finish.
Name: Opolo 2015 Summit Creek Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Tart red fruit tones are peppered with a leafy, green tobacco note on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is round and soft, with no hard edges, letting the fleshy red plum and cranberry-skin flavors do all the talking.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2015 Estate Bottled Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-purple fruits meet with deep-violet aromas and loamy soil on the nose of this bottling. There's a powerful and earthy richness on the sip, showing flavors of boysenberry, cut by an acidity that's almost overpowering.
Name: Davine Cellars 2014 Symphony Regan Vineyard Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is a smooth and supple Merlot that offers a mix of red plum, blackberry and a mild leafy, herbal twang. Its mildly grippy tannins and soft acidity lend to its easy-drinking appeal.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2015 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This blends in 7% Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine is pungent and earthy in forest and tobacco, with smooth thick full-bodied waves of green tannin and light accents of clove spice.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2014 Right Bank Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's a mix of fresh- and stewed-fruit tones in this wine, with baked red currant and fresher cranberry notes. The palate is round and juicy in feel, with grainy tannins and a mild oak flavor.
Name: Heron Hill 2015 Reserve Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red currant, rose petals and crushed slate show on the nose of this bottling. It's fairly rigid on the palate at first, slowly unveiling black raspberry and loamy soils. The structure is firm and the acidity quite zippy.
Name: Villa San Juliette 2014 Reserve Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: This Merlot is superfloral and bright, with aromas and flavors of kirsch, red cherry, violet, lavender and cinnamon that carry to the palate. The finish is long and flavorful.
Name: Lovingston 2016 Josie's Knoll Merlot (Monticello)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Not entirely appealing aromas of green wood, macerated cranberry and cherry lead to wood-dominated fruit flavors (60% new French). The oak takes over the show, completely overwhelming the variety.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Kiona Vineyards Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color, the aromas bring unusual notes of seaweed, cherry, wet penny and exotic spice. The palate is full of ripe raspberry and red-cherry flavors with a short finish. If the aromas and flavors sync up, it might move up a notch or two.
Name: Columbia Winery 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a thick, dense and oaky red wine, with a generosity of tannin and slight whiff of reduction. Reserved in fruit, it traffics more substantially in leathery tobacco and cigar box.
Name: St. Francis 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Leaning on the herbal side, this Merlot shows fresh fennel and tobacco on the nose, with a core of red plum. There's some green bitterness on the palate yet a darker plum note offers some counterbalance.
Name: Atwater 2015 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of currant, dark plum, herb and spice are followed by light elegant fruit flavors, with the extraction pulled back. It finishes with strangely tart cranberry flavors that distract.
Name: Merry Cellars 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Merlot has aromas of black cherry, juniper, and white pepper. The palate is spicy in tones of clove and cinnamon, with an undercurrent of black plum and cherry. Ample acidity, a full body and generous tannic structure lead to a long, spicy finish.
Name: Chatham 2014 Church Creek Merlot (Virginia's Eastern Shore)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied red fruit, turned earth, crushed rocks and purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling. There's a cherry-cough-syrup touch to the sip alongside brown spice, but it's fumbling a bit over flavor and texture.
Name: Chloe 2015 San Lucas Estate Vineyard Merlot (Monterey County)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Racy red plum and blackberry tones meet leafy tobacco on the nose and palate. This is plush in feel, with soft tannins and racing acidity that cuts the flavors short.
Name: Bellangelo 2014 Merlot (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This widely available bottling is very fruity on the nose with boysenberry aromas alongside hints of clay and mud. Dark spice and pungent red fruit show on the sip alongside those earthy tones.
Name: Hahn 2016 Merlot (Central Coast)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with notes of baking spice, red currant, herb and tire rubber that seem a little unsettled. The plum flavors are light and fall a bit flat.
Name: Kestrel 2014 Falcon Series Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: A 100% varietal wine, this is spicy and succulent, with expert touches of clove and cinnamon. Roundly rich, it delivers a complexity of long-lasting red plum and cherry flavor accented in dark chocolate and lightly toasted oak.
Name: Pellet Estate 2015 Pellet Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a tremendous value for the quality— an earthy, sanguine and dried herbal wine that's tightly wound in structure and composure. Accents of pencil lead and cocoa powder add complexity and savory components to the full-bodied whole.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine brings richness and ripe opulent flavors to the fore. Tobacco, cedar and black-plum aromas come before blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors while firm tannins and good acidity wrap around the palate for support.
Name: Fenestra 2012 Thatcher Bay Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: This elegant medium-bodied wine has everything in place, from fresh plummy aromas to warm layered flavors to an appetizing and moderately tannic texture. It has excellent balance, with a sense of freshness and depth that is compelling.
Name: Bonterra 2015 Made with Organic Grapes Merlot (California)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Extra richness and depth lift this wine to a high level of quality and deliciousness. Its ripe blueberry, blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors seem layered and generous, and it fills the palate with fine-grained tannins and a full body.
Name: Lava Cap 2015 Estate Bottled Merlot (El Dorado)

Description: This wine has a fruity entry of dark cherry and plum: flavors that are dusted in a lightness of cinnamon spice. Well put together, it's soft and round on the palate with a full-bodied ripeness that minds its manners and plays well with its more elegant intentions.
Name: Medlock Ames 2015 Heritage Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Description: This soft, round Merlot blends in small amounts of Malbec and Syrah to offer a powerful, full-bodied frame. It's lengthy on the palate in tart red fruit, integrated oak and fresh acidity.
Name: Roth 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: Deep ruby in the glass, this wine has a bouquet of black plum and anisette. Supportive tannins provide a background for flavors of cassis, black cherry, vanilla, licorice and a touch of smoke that lingers into the smooth finish.
Name: Tulip Winery 2016 Just Merlot (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very down-the-middle red wine, sure to please most, this bottling starts with dark blackberry, elderflower, char and vanilla aromas. The palate offers dried blueberry and hints of thyme, riding fine-grained tannins and strong acidity into the finish. Still a tad sticky, so it could use more time.
Name: Arndt 2014 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Sanguine and herbal, this wine is hugely concentrated in extracted and intense flavors of blackberry, red currant and cedar. It showcases meaty tannins and rich oak.
Name: Kunde 2015 Estate Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Dark ruby in color, this wine features aromas of cassis, coffee and green pepper. It offers a nice mix of fruit and savory flavors, notably cassis, stewed plums, smoke and espresso. Mellow tannins continue into a coffee-bean finish.
Name: Tabor 2014 Adama Merlot (Galilee)

Description: This full-bodied Merlot has jammy, raisiny dark berry aromas. It's round on the palate, with nice acidity balancing its blackberry and baked black plum flavors. It finishes short but spicy, with drying tannins. A classic meat-friendly Uruguayan red.
Name: Bouza 2016 Reserva Merlot (Montevideo)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a handsome full-bodied wine that's full of flavor and has the kind of bold, moderately tannic texture that goes great with big proteins. It shows lots of ripe blackberry and cherry aromas that continue on the palate.
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2015 One Oak Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: Big and beefy, this wine has huge aromas of wood smoke, beef jus and cedar followed by generous blackberry and black-cherry flavors and a firm tannic texture. Earthy roasted elements indicate it's fully mature now.
Name: LangeTwins 2013 Miller Vineyard Merlot (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a lot of stony earth and deep red-cherry fruit to the nose of this soft and rich bottling, with a pinch of dust as well. The palate is framed with decent tannins, showing dried berry, leather and herb flavors. Very down-the-middle wine, great for midweek dinners.
Name: Le Vigne 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Good depth and concentration help this full-bodied wine stand out, and the chocolaty flavors are hard to resist. It feels rich and smooth in texture, spreads nicely across the palate and is backed by moderate tannins.
Name: Jessie's Grove 2015 Merlot (Lodi)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry, black licorice and wood spice aromas lead to smooth cherry flavors in this wine. It pulls up short on the finish.
Name: Muret-Gaston 2014 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: This full-bodied wine was given 20 months in oak and another two or so years in bottle before release. It has a soft texture and lengthy tannins accented in earthy compost, graphite, red cherry and dark chocolate.
Name: Violet-Green Winery 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's blueberry, herb and barrel spice aromas are appealing. Its fruit flavors are light in style and glide toward the finish. It's an enjoyable, straightfoward Merlot.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine offers ground cranberry, red currant, dried herb and golden raisin aromas. The flavors are surprisingly elegant, considering the warmth of the vintage and region; they taper toward the finish.
Name: Kiona 2015 Estate Grown Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An early red release from the vintage, this is light in color and notably blue fruited for a Merlot, with spice and orange peel accents. The flavors bring more of the same, adding boysenberry and plum notes that coat the palate before tapering on the finish. You'd never have it pegged as Merlot, but it's tasty all the same.
Name: Bridgman 2016 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Good and grapy, this wine has lots of dark-fruit flavors and enough body and tannin for a grippy texture. It is very clean and well made and will be a good go-to wine for casual occasions.
Name: Chacewater 2014 Merlot (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From one of the state's finest vineyards, this offers high-toned raspberry, blueberry and spice aromas and a well balanced, fruitful palate.
Name: Helix by Reininger 2013 Bacchus Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this delivers plum, red fruit, mocha, green herb, barrel spice and dark raspberry aromas. It's light in style on the palate, with fruit-forward flavors and dried tobacco-inflected finish. The tannins are surprisingly dialed back for Washington Merlot.
Name: Johnson Ridge 2014 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Smooth and easy to drink, this medium-bodied wine has plenty of fruit flavor, with shades of vanilla and nutmeg. The texture is silky, showing a hint of tannin but overall is ripe and juicy.
Name: McManis 2016 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A distinct green tinge colors the aromas in this blend from Olsen (60%) and Boushey vineyards, with herb and green tea notes more characteristic of Cabernet Franc. The palate brings soft-feeling orange peel and raspberry flavors
Name: Structure 2015 Spire Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Exotic spice, dark raspberry and barrel spice aromas lead to restrained fruit flavors in this wine, with cocoa notes on the finish. Despite the warmth of the vintage, it seems underripe.
Name: Reininger 2013 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This medium-bodied wine has a dusty grip of clove and tobacco, savory elements that play well against a backdrop of soft expansive dark cherry and cassis.
Name: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2015 Estate Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Description: This medium-boded oaky style of wine has baking-spice aromas and sweet-seeming flavors like blackberry jam along with moderate tannins.
Name: The Crusher 2015 Merlot (California)

Description: Spicy aromas, good concentration and an off-dry flavor make this wine robust while staying rather soft and friendly for people who don't love aggressive tannins.
Name: Barefoot NV Merlot (California)

Description: This wine smells sweet and spicy like ginger cookies and tastes relatively light, fruity and off dry. It's medium bodied, has a touch of good tannin and a lot of oak influence.
Name: Bogle 2015 Merlot (California)

Description: Spicy aromas and jammy flavors make this medium-bodied wine exuberant and rich, turning off dry on the palate where the texture is velvety.
Name: 786 Wines 2016 Merlot (California)

Description: This medium-bodied wine smells like brown sugar and carries lots of jammy fruit flavors. Moderate tannins give it some structure.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2015 The Revivalist Merlot (Clarksburg)

Description: This medium-bodied value-priced wine has relatively light herb and veggie accents as well as modest raspberry and plum flavors. It is quite smooth and soft in texture.
Name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Merlot (California)

Description: This light-bodied wine smells like candied fruit, and tastes fresh of raspberries and strawberries that meet a soft texture.
Name: Cambridge & Sunset 2016 Merlot (California)

Description: Juicy red fruits are supported by soft tannins in this broad, ripe wine. It has acidity, berry flavors and a succulent aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Reserva Merlot (Tejo)

Description: This involves 25% Cabernet Sauvignon—the two varieties combining for a muted dusty texture of broad-shouldered richness and brawn. Plum, tobacco and chocolate all play a part.
Name: Sutro 2014 Warnecke Ranch Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Description: Spicy oaky accents give a little momentum to this mostly light and appealing wine. It has cinnamon, ginger and vanilla flavors blended with cherry notes.
Name: Oak Grove 2016 Family Reserve Merlot (California)

Description: This is a light oaky off-dry wine with a soda-pop freshness and flavors like strawberries and cherry candy.
Name: Happy Camper 2016 Merlot (California)

Description: This wine is thick, heavy and tannic, with an herbaceous quality of cedar and pencil. Flavors of dark cherry and chocolate highlight the full-bodied concentration.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Grand Reserve Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: Aromas of violet and baked biscuit invite one in before this earthy herbal wine imparts harsh tannins that give it a tart sour taste.
Name: Camp 2016 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This Merlot has unripe, rubbery berry aromas that bring road tar to mind. It's highly acidic and light bodied, with tart tomato, red plum and red currant flavors and a rough, peppery finish.
Name: Marichal 2016 Premium Varietal Merlot (Canelones)

Description: This wine dramatically brings out the veggie side of Merlot. It smells like beets and herbs and tastes like plums with a side of greens.
Name: Michael Sullberg 2016 Reserve Merlot (California)

Description: Aromas of cedar, red berry, pipe tobacco and a whiff of toasted oak lift out of the glass. The elegant but restrained palate delivers red cherry, cassis, licorice and exotic spice alongside bright acidity and fine-grained polished tannins. It's an admirable effort for the cool wet vintage.
Name: Masseto 2014 Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Pure Merlot, this wine comes from a property that borders on Pomerol proper. Its juicy red-berry flavors are classics for the vintage. Ripe while crisp and with acidity balancing the tannins, the wine is developing well. It should be ready to drink from 2021.
Name: Château de Roquebrune 2014 Cuvée Reine  (Lalande de Pomerol)

Description: Spicy and toasty from the wood aging, this wine is ripe and dense. It has enough juicy black fruits to balance the serious amount of wood, at least in the future. Wait for this concentrated wine with its good potential to develop over the next few years. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château des Landes 2015 Grand Héritage  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

Description: This Merlot offers aromas of black-skinned berry, roasted coffee bean, cedar and bell pepper. On the dense palate, close-grained tannins grip black currant jam, vanilla and a hint of mocha. Drink through 2022.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2013 Lamaione Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has subtle aromas of black plum, scorched earth and toast. On the concentrated palate, firm but polished tannins support black cherry jam, cedar and licorice.
Name: Urlari 2013 L'Urlo Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Garnet in the glass, this Merlot has aromas of cherry cola, saddle leather, black plums and a whiff of tobacco leaf. The palate offers flavors of black plum and sour cherry, while the tannins are a bit grippy, but pleasant.
Name: Gitana 2014 Autograf Merlot (Moldova)

Description: This is an easy drinking red perfect for a weeknight bowl of spaghetti bolognese or a pizza. It's medium to full bodied, with soft tannins and flavors of juicy berries, cherry cola, chocolate and some savory herbal notes. Drink now.
Name: Oyster Bay 2016 Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very tangy and youthful blackberry fruit meets with licorice and roasted plum on the nose of this bottling from south of Paso Robles. The palate is very zesty and fresh, with bright raspberry, blackberry, vanilla and brown spice atop squeaky tannins and strong acidity.
Name: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Estate Merlot (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Close to the Fronsac vineyards, the estate has produced a ripe, structured 2015. A light touch of acidity and poised black-currant fruit makes it both accessible and refreshing. Drink this attractive wine from 2020.
Name: Château Tour d'Auron 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is fruity in notes of raspberry and plum, with plenty of mocha accents. The flavors are soft and supple, intermingling fruit and barrel tones, with the latter stealing the show on the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2015 Reserve Four Feathers Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of baking spice, red apple and raspberry are followed by plump cherry flavors. It provides appeal if not a lot of complexity.
Name: Sawtooth 2015 Classic Fly Series Merlot

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked earth, crushed slate, dried sage and dried red fruits show on the dusty nose of this bottling. The palate is driven by tobacco flavors and dried garden herbs, proving rather Old World in style albeit a bit single-noted.
Name: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Reserve Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coffee bean, red apple and spice aromas are followed by elegantly styled fruit flavors. There's interest to be had but it doesn't all quite come together by the finish.
Name: Two Vintners 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of plum, boysenberry, vanilla and spice carry the nose of this wine. The flavors are surprisingly elegant in style considering the warmth of the vintage and it shows a sense of sleekness that provides appeal.
Name: Basel Cellars 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Les Collines, McKinley Springs and Elephant Mountain vineyards. Expressive aromas of raspberry jam, red currant and exotic spice are followed by plentiful red fruit flavors and backed by firm tannins.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a simple yet approachable Merlot offering notes of ripe dark-berry fruit, chocolate and vanillin oak. The palate is full bodied and plush but the oak is on the clunky side, particularly on the finish.
Name: Glazebrook 2016 041°S-174°E Regional Reserve Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit forward aromas of raspberry jam, baking spice and oak lead to lightly styled red fruit flavors. This lacks in concentration but what's there is an enjoyable, straightforward expression.
Name: Waterbrook 2016 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This estate, in the center of the Entre-deux-Mers region, has produced a successful wine in this warm vintage. The 100% Merlot delivers great fruit while allowing a place for dry tannins. The wine has a lightness to it and is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Jad 2015  Bordeaux

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Called authentic because there is no added sulphur, this wine is all fruit, without any wood aging. On the palate, it is juicy, packed with acidity and red-fruit flavors. The aftertaste brings out a metallic, tight edge to the wine.
Name: Château Moulin de Clotte 2016 L'Authentique  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: A touch of residual sweetness can't mask the thinness of the fruit—this simply hasn't ripened sufficiently in this location. Flavors revolve around stem, thin berry, vanilla and green tannins.
Name: Reif Estate 2016 Merlot (Niagara Peninsula)

Description: This is the luxury cuvée from vineyards in the Seze family since 1918. With its perfumed fruits and firm tannins it is serious as well as sumptuous. It has weight and a dry texture that will soften into the blackberry fruits and generous structure. This wine, with its still-firm texture, needs to age, so drink from 2022.
Name: Château Mayne Vieil 2015 Cuvée Aliénor  (Fronsac)

Description: Deep garnet to the eye, this wine has a nose of lingonberry, raspberry and a touch of rosemary. Soft tannins provide a framework for flavors of tart cherry, strawberry, clove and chocolate, with a touch of smoked meat. The pleasing finish provides a lingering sense of brightness on the palate.
Name: Hayotzer 2014 Virtuoso Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the winery's Mountain Terrace Vineyard 1,700-feet up, this is a floral, subdued and brightly woven red wine. Vanilla and milk chocolate flavors provide a richness and likability, with a pronounced bite of oak and tannin on the finish.
Name: Ledson 2014 Estate Vineyard Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the winery's Mountain Terrace Vineyard 1,700-feet up, this is a floral, subdued and brightly woven red wine. Vanilla and milk chocolate flavors provide a richness and likability, with a pronounced bite of oak and tannin on the finish.
Name: Ledson 2014 Estate Vineyard Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Description: Thick, firm tannin is pronounced in this reserve-level wine. Coconut and vanilla-seasoned oak rides along a roadway of dried herb, clove and blackberry as the texture softens and teases in complexity.
Name: Pride Mountain 2014 Vintner Select Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This wine features a bouquet of raspberry, black cherry and violet. It is smooth on the palate, with flavors of blackberry, cherry, pomegranate, vanilla and almond blossom. Cool minty notes come into play towards the finish, followed by lingering brightness.
Name: Hayotzer 2014 Genesis Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a section of the producer's vineyard, this wine is juicy and herbal, with a full-bodied robustness of ripe red currant and cherry. The fleshy fruity character is buoyed by a richness of blueberry and vanilla biscuit, as the finish offers black pepper and clove.
Name: Ty Caton 2015 Upper Bench Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of dried herb, dark cherry, black raspberry and barrel spice are at the fore on this 100% varietal wine. They lead to sleek cherry and cranberry flavors that provide intrigue.
Name: Efeste 2014 Upright Klipsun Vineyards Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: Merlot gives this wine its richness and density. Partial oak aging adds to the ripe, smooth texture. Tannins, layers of spice and bold red fruits add concentration as well as juicy acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Mayne Vieil 2015  Fronsac

Description: A bouquet of raspberry, strawberry and Mediterranean herbs preps the palate for flavors of blackberry, cassis, vanilla, lavender and black pepper. It is well integrated, with velvety tannins and spicy finish.
Name: Galil Mountain 2016 Merlot (Upper Galilee)

Description: Deep violet in the glass, this wine offers aromas of black cherry, strawberry and black pepper. It is bright on the palate, with soft tannins and flavors of tart cherry, cranberry, juniper berry and black pepper that round off in a zippy finish.
Name: Recanati 2016 Merlot (Upper Galilee)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has aromas of roasted coffee bean, coconut and black-skinned berry. The concentrated palate offers black-currant jam, mocha and bay leaf alongside assertive tannins that grip the finish.
Name: Rocca di Frassinello 2015 Baffonero  (Maremma Toscana)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This soft, approachable red impresses in a mix of earthy mushroom, soy and cedar, its body thickly constructed around a core of ripe tannin and charred oak. Well structured, it finishes in bursts of black pepper and leather.
Name: Frei Brothers 2015 Reserve Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: A bouquet of black plum, cassis and licorice leads into flavors of black cherry, raspberry, anise, white chocolate and violet. It is rich on the palate, with velvety tannins and touches of floral and spice notes on the finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2014 Yarden Odem Vineyard Merlot (Galilee)

Description: This is a hearty version of the variety, blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Petite Sirah. Black licorice, Dr. Pepper and densely rich, extracted black cherry and blueberry accent a full-bodied softly textured palate of approachability.
Name: Markham 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: From one of the properties owned by the Ducourt family, this wine is structured and firm. It also has juicy fruit, rich tannins and plenty of crisp acidity, with a touch of spice from wood aging. With its firm tannins, it needs to age, so drink from 2021.
Name: Château Jacques Noir 2015  Saint-Émilion

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A lieu-dit in French is a place historically recognized for what was there, a hazelnut (coudrat) tree. This wine comes from a single vineyard named after the trees grew there. It is a rich wine, packed with the bright fruit of the vintage as well as some firm tannins. Aged in wood, it has spice and toast as well as the black-currant fruits. Drink this wine from 2021.
Name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2014 Lieu-Dit Coudrat  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: This is a well-made approachable wine, aromatic in black cherry, cola and plum. Thick ripe flavors are highlighted in brick, black pepper and toasted oak.
Name: Franciscan 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Inviting aromas of cherry cordial, dried herb and chalk lead to generous, well-fashioned fruit flavors. Light tannins provide support.
Name: Twin Cedars 2014 Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas seem unsettled, with notes of dust, herb and cherry. The flavors are plush and ripe, delivering plenty of enjoyment.
Name: Eternal 2015 Eternal Gratitude Gamache Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Deep red-violet to the eye, this wine has aromas of dark plum, cherry and juniper. It might be a little too restrained for some, with flavors of black cherry and Red Delicious apple, joined by strong notes of eucalyptus, spearmint and anise. Smooth tannins fill the palate right into a cool mint finish.
Name: Jerusalem Wineries 2016 2900 Merlot (Judean Hills)

Description: Aromas of black currant, vanilla and violet pave the way for flavors of tart cherry, strawberry, lavender and vanilla. Soft tannins lay a groundwork for bright fruit flavors that work their way across the entire palate, leading into a zippy cranberry finish.
Name: Hayotzer 2016 Vintner's Select Merlot (Judean Hills)

Description: This Merlot brings a lot of aromas and flavors to the table, with tones of baked red and black fruits, nutmeg, clove and balsamic. The tannins are silky and the acidity gives a fresh lift to the feel.
Name: Narmada 2012 Merlot (Virginia)

Description: Perfumed in black cherry and smoky oak, this is a robust, richly ripe red, meaty and brawny in leather and blackberry jam.
Name: Peju 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of mint, woodspice, raspberry and coffee are followed by ripe red-currant flavors. Soft, lightly grainy tannins provide support. It has good things going on and is varietally correct but seems a bit woody.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: All the winery's wines are 100% varietal, and this is a solid effort with substantial flavors of mulberry and blackberry fruit. There's a streak of cola and lightly earthy tannins. Flavors are broad and accessible, and the wine finishes with a streak of vanilla.
Name: Schmidt 2014 Merlot (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from both Volcano Ridge and The Pines vineyards, this is a smooth, supple wine, 100% varietal, with a mix of plum and blueberry fruit. Somewhat high toned and bright, it is ready to drink over the next couple of years.
Name: The Pines 1852 2015 Merlot (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: This wine offers aromas and flavors of baked red currant, red plum, eucalyptus, black pepper and rare meat. Its zippy acidity is a great match for the full body and depth of flavors.
Name: Veramar 2013 Estate Club Merlot (Virginia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of red currant are bright and fresh, with little apparent new-oak influence. Raspberry and currant flavors bring more of the same. It's a straightforward, easy drinker.
Name: Boomtown 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dull aromatics open the way to thick dense red fruit, oak and a thickness of tannin in this estate-driven red which drinks heavy on the palate. Cedar and pencil shavings accent it well.
Name: Merriam 2013 Windacre Vineyard Estate Merlot (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: A hearty 12% Cabernet Sauvignon is added to this wine, which is aged in 100% French oak. Reduced, with sizable oak influence, it shows dried herb components wrapped in bittersweet black pepper and leather.
Name: Pride Mountain 2014 Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Merlot seems to struggle a bit in Oregon, lacking the volume of other West Coast versions. Quite tart with simple berry flavors, this wine shows no real flesh, but goes directly from a sappy start into a tangy finish.
Name: Melrose 2015 Merlot (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This Merlot shows aromas and flavors of bright cherry, red plum and baking spices. The fruit comes off as tart on the palate but the oak spices are appealing. Not much tannic expression but a nice acidic lift keeps the finish going strong.
Name: Rosemont 2015 Merlot (Virginia)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is extreme in bay leaf and green, herbal flavors, with a touch of oxidation.
Name: Trecini 2015 Merlot (Russian River Valley)

Description: Blended with 10% Petit Verdot, this age-worthy beauty is impressively oaked and tannic in its youth, with a concentration of densely packed red and black currants. Coconut shavings and vanilla appear from the background alongside black pepper and cinnamon. This should drink best from 2024–2034.
Name: La Jota Vineyard 2014 Merlot (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is deep in fruit flavors, and has impressive structure in terms of extraction, body and an abundance of fine-grained tannin. It brings soft black cherry and cedar to the aroma, dark chocolate and blueberry to the palate and coats the mouth with a firm but velvety texture. Best after 2020.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Old Vines Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: Largely structured and weighty, this well-made wine is youthful in its grippy tannins and full embrace of huckleberry and black-cherry fruit, the exuberance tempered by complements of black licorice and toasted oak. This will be happy in the cellar; enjoy best 2024–2029.
Name: Mt. Brave 2014 Merlot (Mount Veeder)

Description: From a single site in Carneros, the Stewart Vineyard, this wine is exuberant in red fruit, with a sly hint of tobacco and tomato leaf. Big ripe tannins wrap around a meaty side show of garrigue and black pepper, finishing in elegant ripeness.
Name: Peter Franus 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Mint and violet notes accent a dense black-cherry core in this full-bodied, juicy wine. Light touches of baking spices and dried herbs add complexity and play into a layering effect on the palate.
Name: Paris Valley Road 2014 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas show nuance, with notes of toast, assorted dried herb, cherry and plum. The fruit flavors are seamless in feel, showing concentration and depth. It's thoroughly enchanting.
Name: Gård 2014 Lawrence Vineyards Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Immediately appealing on the nose, this reserve offers a wealth of aromas in brandied cherry, anise, clove and savory dried meat tones. The palate works to further integrate these notes into flavors of juicy cherry, rich plum and shots of cranberry. Sultry in feel, with integrated, bolstering tannins, drink this wine through 2020 to enjoy its luscious primary flavors and developing sanguine tones.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2012 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Concentrated black cherry and black olive aromas have an earthy edge in this full-bodied wine, while the flavors are dry and potent black fruits with touches of dark chocolate. It's a well-structured wine that will improve through at least 2021.
Name: Geyser Peak 2014 Merlot (California)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Spicy bramble berry aromas take on a slight brandied character, bathed in anise and savory dried meat tones. The plush, silken palate boasts some additional savory streaks, with shots of cranberry acidity keeping the weight in check. Soft tannins offer just enough support to carry this wine to the lingering rich, cherry finish.
Name: McCall 2010 Corchaug Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A slight reduction on the nose gives way to a brawny full-bodied expression of leather, black pepper and meat—the fruit elusive at first. Soft and sinewy, it shines on the finish in more discreet elements of cassis and red currant.
Name: Hoopes 2014 Maya's Block Merlot (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine all comes from Riverbend Vineyard and saw just 10% new French oak. Blended with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon, a medley of fresh herbs pop on the aromas, which also show notes of cigar box and whiffs of pencil lead. The palate brings cranberry-tart fruit flavors that offer pleasing depth and stretch out on the finish. It provides a lot of quality and value.
Name: Estrin 2014 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: A dark color and concentrated aromas of black cherry, cassis, licorice and even some charcoal are good indicators of what's coming—namely a dense palate with tartaric bite and ripe plum and blackberry flavors. A full finish with scratchy tannins tastes of chocolate and oak.
Name: Lapostolle 2015 Grand Selection Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Engaging on the nose in racy red cherry and currant, a bit of funk along with smoke and clove offer some intrigue. Grippy, sandy tannins, crisp acidity and a medium body carry similar flavors, with warm spices and toast leading to a cranberry-tannin finish.
Name: Benmarl 2015 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This twist-top bottling is fun and fresh, perfect with a light chill. Aromas of red plums, strawberries, carnations and cola lead into a zippy palate full of plum and more strawberry fruit.
Name: Brander 2016 Merlot (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Striking tones of roasted coffee, cocoa and toasty oak ride over a dense core of ripe dark cherry and plum. The palate is silken in feel, with a plush, round texture supported by grainy tannins and bright acidity. More oak shows in the flavors, yet it's integrated among bright cherry, dark currant and granite tones which lead to a lingering dark cocoa finish.
Name: Raphael 2014 First Label Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Franc and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon from Riverbend, this wine principally comes from Red Mountain Vineyard. The aromas are all high toned at present, with notes of vanilla, herb and exotic spice, not quite ready to reveal their charms. The red-fruit flavors are plump in feel, lingering on the finish.
Name: Estrin 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soft and elegant on the nose, this bottling presents rounded violets, plump blackberries, broken asphalt and dried dill on the nose. The palate is plush with blueberry and lilac flavors that ride chiseled tannins and benefit from peppercorn and marjoram spices. It is complex and flavorful.
Name: Pear Valley 2014 Pear Valley Vineyard Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A deep color and potent aromas of blackberry and black currant are the first impressions from this full-bodied, firmly structured and well concentrated wine. They lead to a palate full of deep blackberry flavors, a nicely dry balance and mouth-filling texture.
Name: Shooting Star 2015 Merlot (Lake County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light on first pour, opening up over time with notes of herb, cherry, wood spice and black licorice. The ripe currant flavors are a bit linear in style, but show polish and appeal, seeming ever so slightly dried out.
Name: Substance 2014 Me Vineyard Collection Stoneridge Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are high toned, with notes of char, plum, butterscotch, vanilla and spice, needing some coaxing to get at them initially. The palate mixes cherry and cranberry flavors that show intensity and length. There are good things going on but they don't all seem to come together at present.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Seductive cinnamon aromas lead to ripe red-cherry flavors in this attractively oaky wine. It adds nutmeg and clove to a pleasant and almost sweet fruitiness, while the texture is smooth and just lightly tannic.
Name: Tangley Oaks 2015 Lot #15 Merlot (Mendocino)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: High-toned aromas of cherry and red plum mix with cinnamon and clove on the nose. Soft on the palate, with plenty of grip from building tannins, juicy red fruit carries to soft vanilla and earthy moss notes.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2014 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Coming from one of the state's coolest vintages, this comes in at an alcohol level rarely seen in modern day reds in the state. The aromas are a bit unusual for this variety, with notes of herb, blue fruit and wood, along with a light floral note. The palate brings sleekly styled fruit flavors backed by tart acidity, tapering toward the finish. Light medicinal notes linger.
Name: Boudreaux Cellars 2011 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are fruit forward, with notes of cherry, plum, herb, raspberry and wood spice. The flavors are rich, sappy and full, backed by soft tannins. Barrel notes linger on the finish.
Name: Rio Vista 2015 Estate Grown and Bottled Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of licorice, black fruit and dried herb bring a slightly baked quality. The flavors are full and up front, showing pleasing concentration while retaining elegance. There are a lot of good things going on here but I can't see them evolving much. Drink it in the near term.
Name: Substance 2014 Me Vineyard Collection Northridge Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Soft and varietal in nature, this wine offers dusty plum, leather and black currant and cherry, its structure simple and richly round. There's a hint of black licorice on the lengthy finish.
Name: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Showing the green, earthy side of the variety, this Merlot opens on aromas of fresh-cut herbs and eucalyptus, with dark cherry, plum, vanilla and cedar providing a dense core. Soft in feel, balanced acidity and building tannins provide a solid structure for the red plum and cranberry spice flavors to run rampant.
Name: Fjord 2014 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a broad, deeply flavored wine, highlighted in dark plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors. Big boned, it offers a softness of texture accounted in clove and toasted oak.
Name: Greyscale 2015 Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine offers a wealth of structured tannins that integrate well with its fresh tart red fruit. Soy, baked bread and cedar add nuance and additional flavor.
Name: Monticello Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Very ripe and saturated with dark fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine combines a jammy character with wisps of smoke and grilled herbs. It gets points for good fruit concentration and feels smooth and full on the palate.
Name: Nine North Wine Company 2015 Parcel 41 Merlot (North Coast)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A pleasant intensity of bramble-berry and red-currant aromas blend with a crushed black pepper tone on the nose. The palate is light and lithe, focused on tart red fruit, flecked with peppery tones. Mild, sandy tannins keep the feel smooth and linger on the cranberry-skin finish.
Name: Bedell 2014 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are high toned, with notes of wood spice, dried herb and tire rubber, not seeming very varietal. The palate is ripe with plum and barrel flavors that paint around the edges. Mocha notes linger on the finish.
Name: Mercer 2015 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This is a well-behaved, nicely balanced wine with good cherry and sage flavors, an appetizing texture livened by light tannins and a touch of acidity. It should be versatile with food and easy to pour for a crowd.
Name: Michael Sullberg 2015 Lot 91 Reserve Merlot (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas seem unsettled, with notes of vanilla, baking spice and dark fruit that don't seem entirely in harmony. The palate is chock-full of raspberry and barrel-spice flavors, with loads of coconut on the finish. The aromas and flavors seem out of sync.
Name: Gamache 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bright, fruity tones of red cherry resound on the nose, leading to a softly structured palate that carries more bright red fruit alongside shots of granite and vanilla. Aged 10 months in Hungarian oak, this is a straightforward, pleasing Merlot.
Name: Lieb 2015 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Attractive dark-fruit flavors and a smooth texture lend a lot of appeal to this medium-bodied wine despite a reduced, earthy character in the aroma at first, which is not uncommon in screw-capped wines.
Name: CK Mondavi 2015 Merlot (California)

Description: Oaky and extroverted, this full-bodied wine smells lightly smoky and full of baking spices. The flavors resemble sweet cherries, strawberry jam and a touch of maple.
Name: Gnarly Head 2015 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Dried blueberries, thick blackberry jam and gingerbread aromas show on the nose of this older bottling from the Agua Dulce region. The palate is thick and tarry with flavors of charred beef and more blueberries. It's still alive, at least.
Name: Reyes 2009 Merlot (Los Angeles County)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A rich, slight boozy, nose of brandied cherry, cinnamon and bubble gum spice leads to a primary, ripe palate. Medium in weight, with soft tannins, its showy fruit lingers on the finish.
Name: Sannino 2014 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from one of the state's top vineyards and 100% varietal, this has aromas of cherry, cranberry, vanilla and freshly chopped wood which lead to tart cherry flavors that display a bitter note that distracts. Barrel aged for 20 months in 60% new French oak, the wood influence seems heavy, getting in the way of the finish.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark plum, mulberry, wet river stones and a touch of caramel show on the nose of this bottling. Candied pomegranate and baked red plum arise on the sip, with strong vanilla and baking spice flavors. The tannins are oddly both thin and chalky.
Name: Rolling Plains 2014 Reserve Merlot (Monterey County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed asphalt and wet gravel meet with baked black cherry and a slight hint of herbs on the nose of this bottling. Though the acidity is balanced, the tannins are a bit clunky on the palate, where boysenberry, tar, cocoa and coffee flavors arise.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While oak-driven on the nose, boasting swathes of espresso bean and cocoa nibs, there's a core of ripe cherry and plum that carries the palate. A judicious balance of acid keeps this wine in check, while mild-grained tannins offer further support. A slight note of green stems arises on the midpalate through the astringent finish.
Name: T'Jara 2013 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Sweet-seeming oak aromas and flavors grab the attention in this medium-bodied wine, while moderate tannins and rather soft acidity make it easy to sip.
Name: Sand Point 2015 Merlot (Clarksburg)

Description: This straightforward and fruity wine is relatively light bodied, offering juicy black cherry and strawberry flavors and a hint of sweetness. It's soft and easy to sip.
Name: Beringer 2015 Founders' Estate Merlot (California)

Description: Wood-heavy aromas of bacon and clove don't allow for much fruit expression. This is tannic and weighty on the palate, with flavors of baked berry fruits, clove and burnt wood. Bacon and clove notes remain out front on a finish that's all about oak.
Name: MontGras 2013 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very shy on the nose, this bottling offers dark red fruit and baking spice aromas with patience. The palate is flat and dull yet inoffensive, with flavors of sweet red fruit, herbs and char on the finish.
Name: Firefly Ridge 2015 Merlot (Central Coast)

Description: Aromas of licorice, prune and leather try hard to hold up but fade to herbal and soupy. High tartaric acidity throws the palate out of balance, while this tastes of generic plum and prune. A short chewy finish closes this out.
Name: Santa Carolina 2016 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Built to be simple and cheery, at a solid price point, this wine is indeed simple and soft, with flavors of charred oak, soy, black cherry and an intensely herbaceous character.
Name: Cannonball 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This value wine has an astringency that adds to an overall puckering notion of ripeness and oak. Earthy mushroom and compost underlie red fruit, yeast and cedar.
Name: Eagle Glen 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Barnyard aromas and massive, drying tannins really stand out in this unusually raw-boned wine. It smells earthy and smoky, tastes meaty and herbaceous, while the texture is full of potent, gripping astringency on first sip that eventually moderates with subsequent tastes.
Name: Donkey & Goat 2014 Blakeman Vineyard Merlot (Anderson Valley)

Description: Huge oak and an intensity of ripe flavor give this wine a harsh edginess that's hard to dispel. Compost, coconut and a green hint of bay leaf or cedar mix in a disjointed way.
Name: Uptick Vineyards 2013 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: Rustic gamy aromas of burnt leaves and stewed fruit are sketchy. A raw edgy palate feels tannic and resiny. Stalky berry flavors topped with forced oak end with a mix of wood resin and chocolate notes.
Name: Junta 2013 Reserve Momentos Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this elegantly structured wine has enticing aromas of cassis, purple flower, dark spice and Mediterranean scrub. The firm palate offers wild cherry, blackberry and licorice alongside polished tannins and bright acidity.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Patrimo Merlot (Campania)

Description: This deep ruby wine has a nose of blackberry, strawberry, sage and thyme. It is soft on entry, with a nice balance of fruit and spice flavors, in particular black cherry, dark plum, fennel, sage and mocha. The tannins start off very mild and gradually increase in intensity, lingering through a licorice and cherry finish.
Name: Çamlibağ 2012 Merlot (Turkey)

Description: Hugely concentrated, this wine has power to spare, within its full-bodied richness and fruity succulence. Blackberry, black cherry and milk chocolate combine effortlessly to provide a pleasurable experience of complexity met by supportive acidity and exotic spice.
Name: Hall 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of black cherry, earthy rust, cedar and warm vanilla make for a very pleasing and standard nose on this bottling. There is a lot of baking spice on the palate as well as plums, black cherries, sandalwood and a hint of cocoa, making for a complex sip.
Name: LXV 2015 X Reserve Cira Vineyard Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: This is a highly impressive wine that's 100% varietal and blissfully well-priced. Dusty blackberry cobbler comes first to mind, held in check by robust tannin and powerful structure. A wine that will appeal to Cabernet Sauvignon fans, it balances that power with a soft side embedded in peppery clove.
Name: Stewart Cellars 2013 Brokenrock Ranch Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Red fruit aromas are at the fore in this wine, with pleasing raspberry and Red Vines notes, along with spice accents. The palate shows remarkable restraint, refinement and balance considering the warmth of the vintage, and its firm tannic core should allow it to evolve nicely for a few years in the cellar.
Name: Owen Roe 2015 DuBrul Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: All the secondary characters that come into play as a wine matures are really working for this Merlot. The fruit is heading into raisin territory; there're earthy, vineyard floor and horse saddle notes. The palate is silky and savory, although the oak is still a little obvious. Drink now with autumnal cuisine.
Name: Hardys 2013 Stamp of Australia Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Description: This is a sanguine Old World-style wine, rounded in tannin and generously soft. Coconut, bay leaf, cherry and vanilla give it a yin and yang quality that flirts with both savory and rich flavors, finding balance despite its full-bodied concentration.
Name: Flanagan 2014 Merlot (Bennett Valley)

Description: Hailing from Istria, this Croatian Merlot has aromas of blackberry, raspberry and red plum. In the mouth there are flavors of red plum and black cherry with a persistent finish.
Name: Punta Greca 2013 Merlot (Istria)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This is a dark fruited, dense Merlot, with notes of cola, cabbage leaf, fig and raisiny dark fruit. The palate has richness but it's balanced by lifted acidity, keeping it firmly in a medium-bodied bracket.
Name: Yellow Tail 2016 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Pretty red fruit and herbs are backed by a little earthy, stalky notes. The palate is a little on the tart side, but it's also juicy and easygoing, with soft tannins and a light to medium body.
Name: Banrock Station 2015 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Description: This Moldovan Merlot carries aromas of black raspberry, vanilla and fresh red cherries. The smooth palate is balanced, with flavors of black raspberry and black cherry.
Name: Milestii Mici 2005 Merlot (Moldova)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite being a full four years old, this wine's aromas aren't yet fully revealing their charms, with high-toned vanilla, spice, cedar and cherry notes. The flavors are tightly wound as well, with a light gamy streak throughout. It's not clear if it will open with additional time or if what you see is what you get.
Name: Goose Ridge 2013 Estate Bottled Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas are at the fore in this wine, with vanilla and baking spice notes in front of plum. The palate mixes fruit and barrel flavors, and drying tannins provide the frame.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2013 Wild Child Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: With small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this is a reduced and juicy wine, showy in notes of oak and cinnamon. Juicy plum and black cherry provide concentrated fruit flavors alongside a richness of milk chocolate.
Name: Educated Guess 2015 Merlot (Napa County)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Shy at first, several swirls in the glass reveal notes of sour cherry, florals, cocoa nibs and some oak spice. The palate follows with more ripe, tangy fruit and florals. It's medium bodied with balanced acidity. Drink now.
Name: Little Penguin 2015 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Description: A simple but appealing Merlot. Ripe red and black fruit, chocolate and some herbal oak notes are followed by a plush, fruity palate. The alcohol is a little hot but this is nevertheless an easygoing weeknight red.
Name: Oxford Landing 2016 Merlot (South Australia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Wood, sweet spice and plum aromas are out front in this wine. The palate is broad, with abundant plum flavors and astringent tannins. Baking spice notes linger on the finish. It's not obviously Merlot, but there's enjoyment to be had.
Name: 14 Hands 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle dark-berry aromas meet with hearty spices, including pepper dust, cigar box and wood varnish. The oak is prominent throughout, with flavors of pine, bay leaf, eucalyptus oil and dried cherries on the sip.
Name: Oak Mountain 2014 Estate Merlot (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plum, baking spice and licorice aromas lead to lightly styled fruit flavors in this wine. The wood influence seems quite intense, distracting from the fruit.
Name: Goose Ridge 2015 g3 Estate Bottled Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is from a site 2,000-feet high in elevation, and made in tiny amounts. It opens with a massive concentration of plum and up-front tannin, imparting heady oak aromas and power. The finish is simple and bright in cassis.
Name: Y Rousseau 2014 Pépé Cavedale Vineyard Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Really flat on the nose, this shows aromas of black cherry and cedar. The palate offers bland cherry and blackberry fruit with a hint of pepper and leather.
Name: Kings' Range 2014 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: This wine offers an herbaceous nose of dusty gravel, bell pepper and thick black cherry, the body somewhat thin and simple in structure. The tannins pierce through on the finish.
Name: City Winery Chicago 2015 Reserve Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Soft and layered, this perennially impressive vineyard-designate speaks highly of the variety, showing balanced offerings of plum, dark cherry, leather and spice. A smoky oak  character lies beneath the fruit, complementing it well, while an expansive tannic presence supports the wine's overall breadth and depth. Big boned, this is built to age yet entirely enjoyable now.
Name: Duckhorn 2014 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a powerfully structured wine from one of the pioneers of Merlot in Bairrada. It is dark with tannins while also brimming with great black-fruit flavors. Rounded, balancing fruit and acidity, the wine is smooth, rich and now ready to drink.
Name: Nelson Neves 2013 Reserva Merlot (Bairrada)

Description: Made in a balanced and graceful style, this light-bodied red comes from vineyards in both Oak Knoll and Oakville. Tart cherry, plum and coconut shavings are supported by light oak and firm tannins. The finish is complex and spicy.
Name: Textbook 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This 100% varietal wine, a steal of a deal, works in its offering of juicy plum, just enough grip and pleasant structure. Integrated oak helps it maintain a lightly firm texture on the palate, piquing in cranberry and red currant flavors on the finish.
Name: Toad Hollow 2015 Richard McDowell's Selection Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: Given additional structure from the addition of 21% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot, this well-made wine shows a wealth of plum and raspberry that's succulent on the palate. Soft supple tannin provides support and a touch of heat, the finish is awash in cinnamon and vanilla.
Name: Rombauer 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This 100% varietal wine is brawny and blustery in style: big boned with a lot of heat. Sturdy tannins surround extracted black fruit and shards of cinnamon, with fresh tobacco taking root on the finish.
Name: Tamber Bey 2014 Deux Chevaux Vineyard Merlot (Yountville)

Description: Aromas of mint, talcum powder and dried cherry lead you to a delightful palate of red and black plums and black raspberries. Soft tannins and a persistent finish make this a notable Bulgarian Merlot.
Name: Domaine Boyar 2015 Reserve Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: Thick and chocolatey, this brawny wine is full bodied and richly concentrated. It is a mighty force of blackberry, blueberry and toasted oak.
Name: Charles Krug 2013 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very pleasing aromas of red berries, wet slate and red flowers make for a very floral and fruity entry to this bottling from a single vineyard. The palate is very easy to enjoy as well, with fat red-cherry fruit, decently chalky tannins and hints of licorice and caramel toward the finish.
Name: Chloe 2015 San Lucas Estate Vineyard Merlot (Monterey County)

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This soft wine is full of red fruit. It has a fine balance of acidity and gentle tannins. From the fruity 2012 vintage, it's now ready to drink.
Name: Château Tour Grand Mayne 2012  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This spicy wine, with its strongly minty flavors and touch of pepper, is also rich with fine black fruits. It shows its wood aging strongly, contrasting with berry flavors and acidity. The wine is still young and will be better from 2019.
Name: Adega Mãe 2014 Merlot (Lisboa)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Floral and soft, this is an enjoyable well-crafted varietal wine, spicy in plum and cherry. Full bodied, the midpalate is relaxed and integrated in nuanced oak.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2013 Right Bank Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Description: Nelson Neves has made a rich wine, recognizably Portuguese in its tannic structure while also having a jammy, juicy red-fruit character that comes from the Merlot. This ripe wine is ready to drink.
Name: Nelson Neves 2013 Neves Merlot (Bairrada)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon and aged for 28 months in French oak, this broad-shouldered red is powerfully concentrated and tightly wound. Raisin cake, cigar box and baked plum play nicely together within an intense texture of leathery spice.
Name: J. McClelland 2013 Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Description: This is a forceful, simple wine, with a slight herbaceous quality that keeps it varietal and cooler-climate in style and weight. Bright red fruit shines in a light-bodied frame.
Name: Kenwood 2014 Merlot (Sonoma County)
