Description: With vines close to the Garonne river south of Bordeaux, this small vineyard has produced a light and fruity wine with red berry flavors. It's soft, just lightly tannic and ready to drink now.
Name: Clos des Justices 2014  Bordeaux

Description: Soft, ripe, red fruit-flavored Merlot gives a round character to this rich wine. It has plenty of spice, juicy acidity and gentle tannins that make it drinkable young.
Name: Grand Bateau 2016 Sécret de Grand Bateau  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Walla Walla County, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of boysenberry and barrel spice are followed by ripe pleasing purple-fruit flavors. The tannins deliver a light squeeze. It's hard to find the variety exactly, but it still brings appeal.
Name: Wilridge 2015 Lodmell Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a strong green-peppercorn tinge to the nose of this bottling, along with hints of ancho chile and cedar. The palate shows oregano, thyme and dill, proving quite Old World in style, with only the slightest presence of blackberry fruit.
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2015 Flood Family Vineyard Merlot (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Simple in its bright embrace of plummy flavor, this wine contains smaller additions of Syrah. Mocha and leather lurk beneath the full-bodied concentration of fruit.
Name: Ferrari-Carano 2014 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: Dark garnet in color, this wine carries aromas of cherry and black raspberry on the nose. The palate brings flavors of tart cherry and ripe plum. Tannins show good grip yet there's a touch of aggressive acidity in the finish.
Name: Budureasca 2015 Premium Merlot (Dealu Mare)

Description: This is a full-bodied big-shouldered wine blended with Malbec and Syrah, that's inky and dark. Grippy tenacious oak surrounds a mouthful of black olive, black plum and tobacco.
Name: Thorn 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This straight forward crowd pleaser brings aromas of apple, raspberry and plum. The palate is ripe and goes down easy. It should bring plenty of fans.
Name: Original House Wine 2015 Mountain Merlot (America)

Description: Soft and supple, this wine aims to please across a wide range of palates, offering mellowed tannins and oak around a layering of plum, cherry and cinnamon.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Vintner's Reserve Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: With no added sulfur, this ripe, young wine is broad with spice and some firm tannins. Its berry flavors are still dominated by the structure. Drink from 2018.
Designation: Le Petit du Château de Lagarde
Name: Château de Lagarde 2016 Le Petit du Château de Lagarde  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Thin aromas of cherries and oregano show on the nose of this simple but quaffable bottling. The palate combines fruit punch and candied cherries with a hint of more herbs.
Name: Esser 2014 Merlot (Monterey County)

Description: This is a fat, soft and smooth wine. It has juicy red fruit and acidity, with light tannins that lend support. It's ready to drink.
Name: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Le Phare Merlot Merlot (Atlantique)

Description: This wine is flat and simple, with touches of herbaceous earthiness and cedar. Plum and blueberry-fruit flavors are welcoming if lacking in complexity, with the finish offering a hint of cinnamon.
Name: Benziger 2014 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This wine has a smoky char quality and a decadent richness of cured meat and bacon grease. Light, it's dusted modestly in spice, with an herbaceous tease of tannin on the finish.
Name: Ca' Momi 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This soft wine has a smooth texture and little in the way of tannins. That brings out its red fruit, juicy acidity and light spice notes. Ready to drink.
Name: Calvet 2016 Limited Release  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are a bit unsettled, bringing a wilted-flower note that is off-putting. The ripe cherry, blackberry and smoky flavors seem disconnected. It doesn't all come together, and the variety seems impossible to find.
Designation: Ascent One-Half Mile Closer to the Moon
Name: Stemilt Creek 2014 Ascent One-Half Mile Closer to the Moon Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is overwhelmingly smoky in char and bacon flavor, with a side note of herbal mint. Extracted, the oak is intrusive.
Name: La Storia 2014 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Pelona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Cut by a splash of Viognier, this rosé is a dark-rust color in the glass, and smells of wet soil, black plum skins and a slight pepper spice. The sip is sweet, unctuous and bitter all at once, with sour orange, sugar plums and plum juice flavors.
Name: Reyes 2016 Rosé of Merlot (Sierra Pelona Valley)

Description: A nose based on candied fruit is pretty much the script for all of the Macaw reds. Like the others, this Merlot is sticky but also acidic. Flavors of raspberry Kool-Aid and foxy plum are mercifully short on the finish.
Name: Casa Perini 2016 Macaw Smooth Merlot (Vale Trentino)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very delicious and accessible wine for all palates, both lavish in style and complex. Candied blackberry, fragrant rose and fennel pollen aromas introduce a palate of baked red fruit, maple syrup and brown sugar flavors. That fruit-forward richness is balanced by extreme floral character and lively acidity.
Name: Sextant 2015 Estate Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Precise and polished, this wine offers up a mix of fig, plum, black cherry, chocolate and caramel. A streak of graphite underscores the polished tannins. Good already, this can be cellared and enjoyed through 2028 and perhaps beyond.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2013 Oldfield Series Merlot (Okanagan Valley)

Description: This impressive, pure Merlot offers plenty of grip and concentration. Black-cherry fruit and dark chocolate, espresso and fine-grained tannins are all in play. The structure, length and polish make this a standout, especially at this price.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2014 Merlot (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed peppercorn, black plum, leather, dried violet, game and cedar touches show on the nose of this bottling from Ryan Roark. Sandalwood and pine notes emerge on the palate, accenting its black pepper-laced cranberry fruit. A vibrant and chillable red wine for summer.
Name: Roark Wine Co. 2015 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Willow Creek, North Coast, California, US
Description: This very fresh and lively wine shows tart black currant, black plum and candied black cherry aromas, as well as elegant hints of lilac and potpourri. That purple flower note fuels the palate, with more lilac and lavender, and the structure is quite firm for its relatively light weight.
Name: Midnight 2014 Estate Merlot (Willow Creek)

Description: Ripe, stout and smoky dark-berry aromas are spicy and a bit hot. This lush Merlot from a warm year is voluminous and chubby, with heft and full extraction. Spicy, toasty blackberry and cassis flavors come with chocolaty oak, while this is dense, chewy and mouth coating on the finish. Drink through 2019.
Name: Enate 2012 Merlot (Somontano)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of vanilla, cocoa and milk chocolate out in front of blackberry and black cherry. The palate also mixes fruit and barrel, showing pleasing depth of flavors and intensity along with a silky texture.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Indian Wells Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Only one barrel of this limited release wine was produced. It shows baked black cherry, caramel and barbecue smoke notes on the nose. The palate offers more smoky character, along with blackberry, boysenberry and anise flavors. It's well structured, with background notes of dried herb and spice that carry into the finish.
Name: Brave & Maiden 2014 Limited Estate Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry, cocoa, coffee and vanilla aromas lead to plump, focused fruit flavors. It's both appealing and quite varietally correct. For those looking for a quality value Merlot, look no further.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of plum and blue fruit are accented by high-toned spices and milk chocolate. Flavors are soft, palate coating and poised, with blue-fruit flavors lingering on the finish. It doesn't necessarily taste like Merlot but still brings plenty of appeal.
Name: Columbia Crest 2015 H3 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This single-vineyard, pure varietal wine shows the strengths of the region. It offers lovely floral aromatics along with cured, smoked meat. Those flavors thread through a midpalate with purple and black fruits, more smoke, olives and chewy tannins.
Name: Township 7 2014 Blue Terrace Vineyard Reserve Merlot (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas are high toned and barrel-forward, with notes of vanilla, green wood and cocoa. The fruit is able to break through on the palate that shows a pleasing sense of balance.
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a mixture of Mirage and Blackrock vineyards, this wine offers aromas of baking spice, vanilla and dark fruit. These are followed by full-bodied black-cherry and spice flavors along with gritty tannins. It dips a bit in the middle and the oak seems a bit heavy, but it still delivers enjoyment.
Name: Waterbrook 2014 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of toasty barrel spices, vanilla, cedar, high-toned herbs and plums lead to tart cranberry flavors. The tannins give a firm squeeze and this wine shows a bit of heat, but is otherwise appealing.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2014 Reserve Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas seem a bit locked up, with notes of plum, herb and cedar. The raspberry flavors similarly seem bunched up, with lightly dry tannins providing support. Vanilla flavors linger on the finish. The variety gets a bit lost.
Name: Desert Wind 2015 Estate Grown Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With the fruit from equal parts The Benches and Canoe Ridge Vineyard, the addition of Syrah (9%) stands out on the aromas, with its notes of plum followed by vanilla and licorice. The palate is lightly sweet, with bunched-up tannins.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2015 The Expedition Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, cocoa and woodspice are at the fore. The palate starts out broadly but then trails as it moves toward the finish. This wine doesn't entirely come together.
Name: Waterbrook 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Chocolate and plum flavors abound in syrupy concentration in this rich, round and ripe wine. Blended with small amounts of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Petite Sirah, it finishes on a brawny black cherry jam note.
Name: Ballentine 2015 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Foxy plum and other jumpy aromas set up a raw, choppy palate. This Merlot tastes of salty, herbal plum and cherry, while the finish is lasting, which might not be a benefit.
Name: Mureda 2016 Mureda Organic Merlot (Tierra de Castilla)

Description: Cheesy tomato-based aromas are rubbery and fiery. This feels lean and monotone. Stewed, salty flavors of earthy berry fruits are off base and dirty, while this is cheesy tasting on the finish.
Name: Vega del Castillo 2013 Finca el Espartal Merlot Roble Merlot (Navarra)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegantly woven aromas of cassis, sandalwood and truffle show on the nose of this wine, which also includes 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Cabernet Franc, 3% Malbec and 2% Petit Verdot. The palate also combines that plummy fruit with woody spice, showing cedar and crushed pepper, creating a savory experience that makes the mouth water into the finish.
Name: Barrack 2013 Brand Happy Canyon Vineyard Merlot (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This combines Merlot from Minnick Hills and Birch Creek vineyards in the Walla Walla Valley and Candy Mountain in the larger Columbia Valley with smaller amounts of Malbec from StoneTree and Petit Verdot from Dionysus. It's generous in aroma, with with plentiful coffee, raspberry, bittersweet chocolate, flower and graphite notes. The palate displays a lot of elegance, with tart acidity providing support. It's a very pretty expression of the variety that should show especially well at the dinner table.
Name: Forgeron 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine opens with pleasing cocoa, dark raspberry and graphite aromas. The palate offers medium-bodied, tart fruit flavors cinched with tannin. A big, bold interpretation of Merlot.
Name: Pedestal 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's raspberry jam, cocoa, fig and barrel spice aromas really pop. Its red fruit flavors are rich and ripe, providing hedonistic appeal.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2014 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's plum, vanilla, milk chocolate and blue fruit aromas are followed by a palate saturated with supersmooth fruit and barrel flavors. The variety isn't immediately apparent, but it's delicious all the same.
Name: Januik 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This leads with plum, vanilla, barrel spice and herb aromas. The palate is soft and velvety, keeping the vineyard's often burly tannins well in check and providing a lot of textural appeal. Cocoa notes linger on the finish, delivering a yum factor that is hard to ignore.
Name: Januik 2014 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: Attractive roasted, smoky aromas join ripe plum and blackberry flavors in this full-bodied, broadly textured wine. It's a great value and packs plenty of fruitiness into a rather big, moderately tannic frame.
Name: Noble Vines 2014 181 Merlot (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Espresso, dark chocolate, herb and purple fruit aromas lead to a soft, smooth palate in this wine. Fruit and barrel notes play equal parts, yet it comes up short on the finish.
Name: Novelty Hill 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's milk chocolate, herb, cherry, barrel spice and plum aromas lead to a plush, soft palate loaded with chocolate and plum flavors. It strikes a lovely balance.
Name: Novelty Hill 2014 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine has an extra measure of creaminess in the texture while giving up floral, lightly spicy and wonderfully fruity flavors. There's no obvious oak influence, just ripe raspberry, strawberry and macerated black-cherry notes that softly coat the palate and cling to the finish.
Name: Red Rock 2015 Reserve Merlot (California)

Description: A touch of green pepper dances on the nose of this otherwise bold, darkly fruited wine. Notes of coffee and brownie lend richness to the palate, fleshing out the crushed-velvet texture and black plum and currant flavors. A final hit of tobacco spice graces the finish.
Name: Famille Valéry 2015 Domaine des Deux Ruisseaux Merlot (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, herb, cherry, coconut and barrel spice aromas are followed by supple cherry and spice flavors in this wine. The barrel influence is a bit up-front, but it still provides plenty of pleasure.
Name: Fielding Hills 2014 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This delivers smoke, coffee bean, dark red fruit and spice aromas. It's oak-forward on the palate, somewhat obscuring the fruit flavors, but it still brings appeal.
Name: Baer 2014 Star Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Lots of fruit flavor and light spicy touches make this medium-bodied, dry and moderately tannic wine very attractive. Black cherry meets clove and cinnamon, while ample acidity joins with a touch of tannin for a well-balanced texture.
Name: Parducci 2014 Small Lot Merlot (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aromas bring cherry and chocolate to mind. The palate provides pleasing fruit and barrel notes, but the two seem disconnected.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A lush texture, ripe fruit and spice flavors make this wine mouthfilling, soft and easy on the palate. Along with red cherry and black plum, it offers light nuances of baking spice.
Name: Dark Horse 2014 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This combines fruit from Ferguson (60%) and Seven Hills vineyards to deliver barrel spice, clove, raspberry and mineral scents. The palate is medium bodied and full of chewy, slightly dry tannins. The oak shows prominently at present, needing more time in bottle to integrate.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2014 Estate Grown Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dried herb, purple flower, vanilla, baking spice, black licorice and barrel spice aromas lead to ripe dark fruit flavors in this wine. Generous barrel accents run throughout while tannins bring a touch of dryness.
Name: Finn Hill 2013 Merveille Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Pure and fruity, this medium-bodied wine is supersmooth in texture, quietly flavorful and well balanced. The light acidity and mild tannins are well integrated and support delicious black-cherry and blueberry flavors perfectly.
Name: Fetzer 2015 Eagle Peak Merlot (California)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this 100% varietal wine, tire rubber, spice box and flower aromas are followed by seamless dark fruit flavors backed by firm but well integrated tannins. It shows a pleasant balance that sustains through the finish.
Name: :Nota Bene 2013 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: Pine sap and dried ginger meet with hearty soil aromas and deep black plum on the nose of this bottling. There are lots of spice and herbs converging on the palate along with sandalwood, cedar, dark chocolate and a touch of prune.
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Merlot (Paicines)

Description: This is a very fresh medium-bodied wine that overflows with ripe raspberry and blackberry flavors. It's the opposite of a serious age-worthy wine, but wonderful to drink now for its effusive fruit flavors that come along with just enough tannin for support on the palate.
Name: AVA Grace Vineyards 2015 Fruity Silky Soft Merlot (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aromas are quite generous, suggesting herbs, vanilla, baking spice and purple fruit. Its cranberry and cherry flavors are both tart and ripe, supported by soft tannins and a lingering café au lait note. The oak influence gets in the way of the fruit at times, but it's pleasant all the same.
Name: Stottle 2013 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Willow Creek, North Coast, California, US
Description: Very focused and vibrant, this wine has plenty of good acidity that lends a crisp mouthfeel, along with fresh and buoyant flavors of red cherry and cranberry that are nicely concentrated. Moderate tannins add to the grippy texture, and will make this wine work well with rich foods.
Name: Stargazer Barn 2013 Merlot (Willow Creek)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, herb, pencil box and spice aromas are followed by sweet cherry flavors in this wine. Lightly tacky tannins provide support.
Name: Bonair 2014 Chateau Puryear Vineyard Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's barrel spice, licorice, cranberry and cherry aromas are high toned. The palate is broad, with generous fruit flavors that taper toward the finish.
Name: Kestrel 2013 Falcon Series Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark, fresh and somewhat sour red-fruit aromas meet with cedar on the nose of this bottling. The palate is juicy with red plums and strawberries at first, then shows more of a pine-needle edge. The tannins are a bit chunky and chewy, though, but may smooth out with time.
Name: Rabble 2015 Mossfire Ranch Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Minty berry aromas settle well and hold up to airing. This everyday Merlot is more than competent on the palate. Berry and spice flavors finish chewy, with standard ripeness and follow through.
Name: Cuyen 2016 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: This wine shows a ton of oak influence, from the smoky charred aromas to the sweet-seeming maple syrup flavors to the velvety clinging texture. It is medium bodied, lush in mouthfeel and high in spice content that dominates the fruit flavors underneath.
Name: Ironstone 2015 Merlot (Lodi)

Description: This big soft wine smells and tastes a little sweet, as an aroma like maple syrup leads to flavors of blackberry jam, cinnamon and butter.
Name: Gen5 2015 Merlot (Clarksburg)

Description: Herbal berry and plum aromas are earthy at best and a touch green at worst. Salty plum and berry flavors are tomatoey and chunky, while drying tannins and herbal flavors drive the finish.
Designation: Gran Reserva de Los Andes Estate Bottled
Name: Santa Alicia 2015 Gran Reserva de Los Andes Estate Bottled Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: With time, initial smoky and rubbery aromas become more savory and fruity on the palate. This wine has ripe red- and black-cherry flavors, a crisp balance and a smooth texture that's low in tannin.
Name: Leaping Horse 2015 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Santa Clara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is very herbal on the nose, with bay leaf, pine needle, juniper, tart strawberry and black-pepper aromas. The palate shows sour red fruit, dried leather and much more forest-floor flavors.
Name: Castillo's Hillside Shire 2014 Merlot (Santa Clara County)

Description: Foxy, spicy berry aromas settle on briny plum and currant. This is dry, grabby and mildly abrasive in feel. Herbal plum flavors seem a bit roasted. It's scratchy and tannic on the finish, with controlled bitterness.
Name: Santa Rita 2015 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Foxy berry and currant flavors carry a note of wet dog fur. This is clampy and saucy feeling on the palate, with herbal flavors of plum, berry and tomato sauce. A hollow finish tastes slightly green.
Name: Santa Rita 2016 120 Reserva Especial Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Saucy tomato and herbal berry aromas are a bit green. This feels creamy and thick, but also bumpy. Oaky, herbal black-fruit flavors are a touch stewy. It tastes green, minty and herbal on the finish.
Name: Las Niñas 2015 Reserva Merlot (Apalta)

Description: From the producer's organically farmed estate, this light elegant red is Old World in approach and execution, offering delicate aromas of leather pouch and black pepper. Wraparound tannins provide structure within a graceful framework of plum and cedar, as the oak integrates to preserve a freshness of acidity and lively complexity.
Name: G & L Lurton 2014 Merlot (Chalk Hill)

Description: Burly and brawny in tar and leather, this muscular wine is showy and yet totally delicious. It's worthwhile and hard to resist in its full embrace of smoky oak, black-cherry liqueur and blackberry jam. Soft and succulent, it finishes as robust as it started—a good poster child for the oft-maligned variety.
Name: Duckhorn 2014 Merlot (Atlas Peak)

Description: This richly structured wine comes from the the state-owned Companhia das Lezirias, the largest estate in Portugal. With equestrian events, wine, olive oil and an ecological sanctuary just east of Lisbon, the property merits a visit. Named for the barn owl that nests in estate forests, the wine is opulent, dense and packed with tannins and ripe black fruits. Give it time, at least until late 2018.
Name: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Merlot (Tejo)

Description: Tart acidity provides freshness and succulence to the palate of this vineyard-designate—a well-resolved expression of plum, cranberry and red currant. Plush and soft, it does the variety justice, making the case for complexity and approachability in one glass.
Name: Duckhorn 2013 Stout Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Candied blueberry, vanilla bean, dried dill and anise make for a very approachable and layered nose on this bottling from winemaker Tim Kramer, a mentor to many in the region. Ripe black fruit, licorice spice and shaved chocolate show on the sip, where soft tannins and balanced acidity lead into a chalky finish.
Name: Leoness 2013 Los Caballos Vineyard Merlot (Temecula Valley)

Description: Deep garnet in color, this wine has a nose marked by black cherry and blackberry scents. It's soft on entry but brightens as it washes across the palate, offering blackberry, cassis and chocolate flavors. Velvety tannins persist into the zesty, cranberry-tinged finish.
Name: Dalton 2014 Estate Merlot (Galilee)

Description: Smoky gunpowder and leather greet the nose and palate in this cooler-climate wine, which doesn't hold back on ripeness or grip. Plush and plump red fruit and a perfumed nose of rose make for a compelling experience that's forceful and generous.
Name: Duckhorn 2014 Merlot (Carneros)

Description: This wine offers a wealth of big flavor and plush structure within a context of savory oak and firm tannin. Black olive and licorice highlight a nicely composed framework of plum and dark cherry, dotted with fresh tobacco.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This producer makes a perennial standout of the variety. It is subdued and elegant in its approach to the lengthy layered weight and the integrated fruit. Plum, cedar and black licorice form a core of flavor over soft supple tannin and peppery oak, ending in a burst of spice and leather.
Name: Ehlers Estate 2014 Merlot (St. Helena)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Given the vineyard location, on the eastern edge of the Columbia Gorge, this is a unique take on Merlot, falling somewhere between the broad, fleshy Washington style, and the thinner, more herbal southern Oregon style. The layered flavors mix berry, citrus and red plum, in an open, easy-drinking wine that should pair well with a variety of transitional autumn entrées.
Name: Heart Catcher 2014 Volcano Ridge Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: Waxy plum is given ample richness from a taste of milk chocolate in this luxuriously full-bodied voluptuous wine. Big lush tannins are met by a smoky backdrop of robust oak and a spicy hit of clove on the finish.
Name: Duckhorn 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine evokes black cherry pie cooling in a window sill. Kirsch, clove, anise and toast form a powerful bouquet that carries through to the palate. Fleshy tannins and a creaminess suggest a rich body and makes for a long finish that ends with a zing of tart cherry.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2015 Reserve Merlot (Virginia)

Description: Woody in cedar and toasted oak, this mild-mannered red is juicy in red currant and plum, offering a lush and plush body and texture. Tannins coat the back of the palate as notes of clove and mocha spark the finish.
Name: Napa Cellars 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Spicy, soft and robust in mouthfeel and texture, this elegant varietal wine offers firmly defined flavors of cedar, tobacco and plum. Lengthy and easy to enjoy, it'll do well at the table with a range of fare.
Name: Oberon 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This full-bodied wine shows smooth and rounded plum fruit. The flavors are mouth-filling, but the rather quick fade suggests it's best consumed in the near term, as it's already five years past harvest.
Name: Schultz 2012 Steelhead Run Vineyard Blessed Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Description: Tobacco leaf, black currant and cinnamon color the nose of this Merlot. Suggestions of black fruits are buried by oak flavors of cigar box, vanilla, cinnamon and tobacco on the palate. Intensely tannic, the wine finishes with a strong cigar box flavor.
Name: Becker 2012 Estate Reserve Merlot (Texas Hill Country)

Description: Tightly wound in youthful tannins, this midtier red is structured and robust, chalky in tannin and toasty oak. Herbal, it has a juicy underbelly of fresh plum and currant that succeeds on its light-bodied frame.
Name: Decoy 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This Merlot is driven by cherry, anise, cloves and cedar. Lively acididty carries through on the finish, where the tannins are soft and mellow.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2015 Wessex Hundred Merlot (Virginia)

Description: Black cherry and pomegranate shine through the smoke, licorice and cedar aromas. The medium-bodied palate is lightly smoky, with more notes of cedar and vanilla. Dark fruits persist, supported by soft, dusty tannins and a pleasant lift of acidity on the finish.
Name: Sutcliffe 2014 Merlot (Colorado)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a smooth, ripe and generous wine befitting southern Merlot. It has just the right amount of acidity, black currant fruitiness and a smoky aftertaste.
Name: Florent Descombe NV Merlot (Vin de France)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This feels a bit thin, even in this warm, ripe vintage. Its rhubarb and mountain berry fruit comes with green tannins, finishing with light coffee and mocha suggestions.
Name: Grizzly Peak 2014 Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Black fruit and soft tannins yield a wine that is rounded with some attractive texture. Its ripe black currant fruitiness is lifted by its crisp acidity. Drink now.
Name: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015 Merlot (Vin de France)

Description: This medium-pink rosé shows some heft but is mostly about refreshment. Passion fruit and peach notes give way to citrus zest on its crisp, vibrant finish. Drink now.
Name: Marrenon 2016 Les Grains Rosé de Merlot (Mediterranée)

Description: Thick and richly concentrated, this reserve-tier wine shows a wealth of tart tannins and leather on the palate, baked in black pepper and a strong element of cigar box flavor. Big boned and full flavored, it packs a powerful punch.
Name: Tin Barn 2014 Pickberry Vineyard Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: The sunshine of the Languedoc comes through in this wine's warm, soft fruit. A touch of acidity and a backdrop of tannins give it contrast and a fine, ready-to-drink character.
Name: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Merlot (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: The is a soft, gentle wine with ripe berry fruit. Minimal tannins are embedded in its fruitiness and rounded texture. Drink now.
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2015 La Châsse Merlot (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This wine is soft and smooth. Its juicy black currant character makes it instantly attractive and drinkable now.
Name: M. & J-F Bertrand 2015 Fleur de Carbonnel Merlot (Vin de France)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tremendously delicious, this bottling combines hedonistic flair with elegant depth, satisfying both carnal and intellectual desires. Waves of hot cherry pie with vanilla ice cream and cola spice show on the nose, but the sip grows more dry and refined. Black cherry is enhanced with crushed nutmeg, black pepper and a pinch of dill, balanced via underlying acidity and a leathery tannic frame.
Name: Grassini 2014 Merlot (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is 82% Merlot and 18% Cabernet Sauvignon, coming from Cold Creek and Four Feathers vineyards. Designed with the specific intent of aging, brooding aromas of blue and red fruit, earth and spice lead to a saturated seamless palate. It drinks beautifully now, but should have a long life in front of it. Best after 2022.
Name: Northstar 2014 Premier Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Loess Vineyard and Leonetti Old Block, this wine is 100% varietal. The aromas are bright and pure, with notes of raspberry, cherry, plum, anise and spice. The flavors deliver, with a sense of understated appeal.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2015 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: A hearty addition of 19% Malbec and 4% Cabernet Sauvignon contribute to this wine's complexity and soft, round profile of hearty tannin and oak. It offers well-defined flavors of salty leather, plum and dark chocolate.
Name: St. Francis 2014 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked black plum, gingerbread, cherry compote and nutmeg show on the rich and lavish nose of this bottling. It's a mouthful once sipped, with cooked blackberries and blueberries heavily spiced by crushed clove, and wrapped in tannins that stand up tall toward the finish.
Name: HammerSky 2013 Red Handed Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cocoa powder, cherry, medicinal notes and herb lead to a palate chock-full of black-fruit flavors with bittersweet-chocolate accents. It's an unabashedly delicious and ripe offering of this variety with a finish that sails.
Name: J. Bookwalter 2014 1RDRS4 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: As part of a single-parcel single-varietal range, this 100% Merlot is rich while keeping a fine sense of proportion and balance. With red fruits (laden with young tannins), touches of wood and plenty of acidity, this is developing into a ripe wine. Juicy and fruity as well as structured, it will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2014 Lieu-Dit Au Pin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Still with its tannins intact, this is a firm wine with as much dry structure as fruit. It will need time for that structure to soften, giving a wine that will remain firm, which is typical for the vintage. The acidity gives the wine a lift at the end.
Name: Château Haut-Cardinal 2011  Saint-Émilion

Appellation: Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This top cuvée from Carignan has too much wood. That trait, along with its extracted character, makes it hard to like at this stage. With powerful tannins from superripe Merlot, this is going to take many years to reveal any balance. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Carignan 2014 Prima  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Sanguine in cranberry while offering a velvety smooth, rounded approachability, this well-made, robust wine will appeal to a wide range of palates, expressing a big, leathery backbone of tannin and toasted oak.
Name: St. Francis 2014 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasing aromas of cocoa, coffee, vanilla, smoke and blue and red berries lead to a palate full of plump fruit flavors with barrel accents throughout. It's a very pretty and elegant expression of the variety.
Name: Northstar 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Champoux, Charbonneau, Ciel du Cheval, Elephant Mountain, Klipsun, and Slide Mountain vineyards make up this wine. The aromas are lightly styled, with notes of baking spice, caramel, licorice, raspberry and dried herb. It comes off as full bodied, rich and liquorous, coating the palate from end to end with ripe red and black-fruit flavors. It's a hedonistic delight.
Name: Soos Creek 2014 Palisades Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are bright, with notes of fresh herb, red cherry, Red Vines, orange peel and barrel spice. The palate shows a pleasing sense of concentration and richness, with light meaty notes on the finish.
Name: Stevens 2014 StevensMerlot Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This wine, from selected vineyards owned by the Carrille family, is rich and now mature. Its tannins are merging with the secondary flavors of the fruit as it softens and develops a spice and tobacco character. Drink this wine now.
Name: Poupille 2011  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This pure Merlot special cuvée is intense, rich and extracted. It has serious layers of spice and toast from wood aging. That lies over a solid structure that is concentrated and dense. The fruit is more masked and the bitter licorice character of the wine means it will take several years to come together. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Léon 2014 Prima  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 13% Cabernet Franc and 4% Cabernet Sauvignon, the aromas offer notes of herb, cherry and spice. The palate shows a very pretty, elegant styling that carries through the finish. It shows a touch of greenness and finishes a bit warm.
Name: Matthews 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are so light you need to strain to get at them, with notes of vanilla, coffee and cherry. The palate brings plentiful coffee and cherry flavors that show a pleasing sense of texture. One wants more aromatically, but the palate delivers.
Name: Seven Falls 2013 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Petit Verdot makes up a full 14% of this wine, which also includes 9% Cabernet Franc. Penetrating aromas of raspberries, fresh cherries, licorice, herb, vanilla and barrel spices are at the fore. The flavors are plush and juicy, bringing a sense of elegance and poise. The barrel aromas and flavors are prominent, but it still brings appeal.
Name: Ambassador Vineyard 2014 Estate Grown Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: The aromas in this wine are bright, with notes of herb, tire rubber and red currant, with the oak influence dialed back. The fruit flavors are lighter styled, direct and pure, going down easy with blue-fruit flavors on the finish. It's a pleasant easy drinker.
Name: Charles Smith 2015 The Velvet Devil Merlot (Washington)

Description: Sweet tannins wrap around a robust flavor profile of plum, cherry and leather saddle in this vineyard-designated wine. Softly textured, it remains generous in oak and power as it winds to a finish dusted in black pepper and tobacco.
Name: St. Francis 2014 Behler Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Big oak and tannin combine for a forceful, powerful experience of the variety, ample in body and ripeness. Smoky leather, cedar and pencil are complemented by baked plum and cherry, finishing in tobacco.
Name: Chelsea Goldschmidt 2015 Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky oak and toast add to a soft, supple expression of the variety, full bodied and concentrated on the palate, with additional flavors of leather and dried herb. Black cherry contributes a welcome fruitiness complemented by chocolate.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2014 Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Seriously structured, this wine is almost too rich. It is concentrated, with dense tannins, dark chocolate and cocoa flavors. The juicy, jammy black fruits come with the acidity to give the wine some welcome crispness and fruitiness. Drink from 2020.
Name: Belliard Vins Selections 2012 Excellence de Belliard  (Saint-Émilion)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Obelisco, Olsen, Oasis and Kiona vineyards. Wood-forward aromas (60% new French oak) of char and coffee are out in front of herb and black cherry. The palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied, pulling up short on the finish. There's enjoyment to be had but the variety seems hard to find.
Name: Sparkman 2014 Outlaw Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: The wine is ripe, rounded and with fine rich fruit. Its structure is balanced with the blackberry fruits, giving density as well as fine acidity. Drink this well-made wine from 2018.
Name: Groupe Clinet 2015 Ronan by Clinet 100%  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are direct and appealing, with notes of macerated cherries, cranberry, currant, vanilla and wood spice. The palate brings alternately sweet and tart fruit flavors, backed by firm tannins. It shows some heat on the finish.
Name: Mount Si 2013 Arianses Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas seem slightly dried out, with notes of dried black raspberry, cigar box, herb, fruit leather, vanilla and barrel spice. The flavors are lightly jammy but at the same time the concentration doesn't all seem to be there. The tannins give a gentle squeeze.
Name: Kiona 2014 Estate Bottled Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of barrel spice, herb and cherry are light and elusive. The red-fruit flavors are medium bodied, pulling up short on the finish.
Name: Kontos 2013 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: In its antique bottle, this wine (one of a limited series) is laden with more wood than fruit. It will certainly soften, allowing the black fruits to come through, but this amount of wood will be hard to balance out. Drink from 2020.
Name: Belliard Vins Selections 2014 Excellence de Belliard  (Pomerol)

Description: Balanced spice and ripe black fruits give this wine a smooth fruity character. Of course, it has tannins but they are there in a supporting role, lending weight to the fruitiness and the nutmeg spiciness. Drink now.
Name: Château Moulin de Beauséjour 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a wine on the cusp of being mature. The red-berry flavors are dissipating into a secondary aromatic character. The tannins, though, are still there—very firm and showing no sign of budging. Wait and see, or decant before drinking. This is part of a single-parcel (lieu-dit)single-varietal range.
Name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2012 Lieu-Dit Coudrat  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dried fruit aromas of elderberry and raisins meet with potent nutmeg, clove and rustic leather on the nose of this bottling from the Pozo area. Raisins and prunes dominate the palate, with a hint of gingerbread and chocolate cake.
Name: Vintage Cowboy 2014 Estate Merlot (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: This Jean-Pierre and Philippe Rivière label benefits from the ripeness of the vintage to bring out red plum and a rich structure. The acidity and tannins perfectly emphasize the generous fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château de Garros 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 31% Cabernet Franc and 29% Merlot from Stillwater Creek Vineyard. Aromas of flowers, purple fruit, herb, barrel spice and cranberry lead to medium-bodied cherry flavors. Firm tannins provide support.
Name: Guardian 2014 The Wanted Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite shy on the nose, this bottling offers crushed lava rocks, pencil shavings, dried herbs and prune aromas. The flavors are also reserved, with dried oregano, black olive and elderberry emerging.
Name: Firestone 2013 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: From grapes grown at this estate and vinified by the Tutiac cooperative in Blaye on the north bank of the Gironde Estuary, this wine is easy, soft and fruity. With black-currant fruit and acidity, it reflects the fruitiness of the vintage and is likely to be ready to drink soon. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2014 Château les Jouberts Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: The wine shows the richness of the vintage while also showing some firm extracted tannins. At this stage, the wine is too dry and firm. Give it until 2018 for a little softening.
Name: Château des Arnauds 2015  Bordeaux

Description: This soft and creamy wine has a really bubbly rosé mousse. It has fruit and a crisp clean edge. The strawberry fruits give this wine a sweet character, certainly off dry. It is ready to drink.
Name: Jaillance NV Cuvée de l'Abbaye Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

Description: This stellar, gracefully understated Merlot is bolstered by small additions of four other red Bordeaux varieties. It opens with a fresh tropical note that's unexpectedly bright and slowly unwinds to reveal threads of plum, cinnamon, mocha and espresso bean flavor.
Name: Gundlach Bundschu 2014 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from the original Merlot blocks at this vineyard, planted in 1982. It's aromatic, with notes of plum, raspberry, clove and generous spices. The flavors coat the palate from end to end, backed by firm tannins that need time to soften out but have the strength to go the distance. It will be best after 2022.
Name: Seven Hills 2014 Seven Hills Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This wine blends Merlot from Stagecoach and Antinori vineyards on Atlas Peak with Malbec from the Trefethens in Oak Knoll and Merlot and Syrah from Hudson Vineyards in Carneros. Together the varieties provide a juicy hit of dark cherry and plum that's densely built and moderate in acidity. The finish is marked by meat and tobacco.
Name: Thorn 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Plummy cinnamon and grape notes highlight this well-made, full-bodied wine's lush, soft-textured expression. It boasts integrated oak and compelling concentration, finishing in a plume of smoke.
Name: Sbragia 2014 Home Ranch Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Most of the fruit for this wine comes from the esteemed Cold Creek Vineyard. It brings an aromatic medley of plum, cocoa, vanilla, milk chocolate and spice. The flavors are plush in feel, barrel heavy, but still bringing plenty of appeal.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Ethos Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Black cherry flavor stars in this full-bodied, brawny and expressive red that's thick with jammy fruit and interwoven tannins and oak.
Name: Sutro 2013 Warnecke Ranch Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Description: This 100% varietal wine from Truchard Vineyard is dark and inky, made in big, bold style. Cedar, pine and tart black-currant notes provide one side of its personality, as more richly concentrated chocolate and blackberry flavors give it oomph.
Name: Merryvale 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This 100% varietal wine is sanguine and meaty, with a big, brawny texture of soft, integrated tannin. Cinnamon, black cherry and plum highlights complete the picture.
Name: Frostwatch 2013 Merlot (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas are all high toned, with notes of raspberries, blueberries, dark chocolate and spice, with the barrel notes up front. The palate is rich and flavorful, backed by tightly wound tannins. It needs some time to strut its stuff, and will be best after 2020.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A really perfumed wine, full of oak and truffle aromas. With its juicy rich fruit, it is not a shy wine. Bold red fruits, balanced tannins and a ripe texture all contribute to the dense concentration. The alcohol shows in the pepper edge. Drink this just mature wine now.
Name: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2012 Merlot (Lisboa)

Description: This 100% varietal wine delivers blackberry and black cherry fruit and richer, bolder coffee and meat flavors. Powerful and high-toned, it also shows chocolate and leather notes within a firm yet light structure.
Name: Starmont 2014 Merlot (Carneros)

Description: Oaky spice and toast scents are key components on the nose of this fuller-bodied block-selection Merlot. Noticeable tartaric acidity gives this some sizzle while keeping the palate lively. Flavors of clove, baking spices, black plum and sugar beets finish with woody leftovers, including a lasting shot of clove.
Name: Ritual 2015 Arroyo Block Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Salt and pepper aromas, full body and a meaty flavor give this wine a bold personality that's fun to experience. Firm tannins add grip to the layered mouthfeel, while ripe cherry and blackberry fruit provides a counterpoint to the spicy character. 45% new oak and the addition of Rhône varieties help amp up the spiciness.
Name: Bonterra 2014 Merlot (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine shows light aromas of blue fruit, plum and spice. The palate boasts sculpted fruit and barrel flavors, conveying a good sense of structure and balance.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2014 Canoe Ridge Estate Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Already five years old, this wine still doesn't hasn't opened up, seeming fairly muted aromatically. The flavors are medium bodied, round in the middle and tapering toward the finish.
Name: Gamache 2012 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Punchy red fruit meets brawny tannin and substantial oak in this red, which includes small amounts of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Its cherry and cassis notes are seasoned with dried herb highlights.
Name: Rutherford Hill 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Given extra time in bottle, this reserve-tier wine offers a generous layering of chocolate and blueberry flavor, the tannins soft and pillowy. Simple in its rich coconut and leather tones, it finishes without fuss.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2012 Cunat Reserve Estate Grown Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Description: The addition of 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Cabernet Franc add an apparent spiciness and structure to this young, tightly wound wine that's otherwise showy with oak and savory clove notes. Firm tannins and a strong streak of dried herb and cedar add to the mix.
Name: Silenus 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Bay leaf, mint and cedar notes open this soft, nondescript wine, which is somewhat flat in tone and style. Mocha and cola notes provide flavor.
Name: Havens 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Leafy, slightly damp aromas include notes of spiced plum and herbs. On the palate, this is fairly stocky and chewy. A mixture of berry, spice and peppery flavors finishes with perceptible spicy oak.
Name: Ritual 2015 Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Likably round and approachable, this medium-bodied red is mellow and fruity, showing red cherry fruit spiked with vanilla bean. It finishes on charred oak.
Name: Markham 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though labeled as Merlot, this smells more like Syrah which makes up 20% of the blend, with aromas of blue and purple fruit along with whiffs of smoked meat and dried herb. The fruit flavors are sweet and plump, backed by soft, luxurious tannins. It's enjoyable but doesn't seem varietally correct.
Name: Drumheller 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Baking spice and vanilla aromas are at the fore, followed by blue fruit and barrel spices. The barrel influence (71% new French and American) leads on the palate as well, with abundant vanilla flavors that wash over the fruit. There's some good fruit underneath, if you can get to it.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Cold Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Light, smoky aromas and juicy, fruity flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy. From a breezy delta vineyard, it's neither big nor overtly oaky but well-balanced and smooth in texture.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2014 The Revitalist Merlot (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Iron-laced beef aromas meet boysenberry and wet stone on the nose of this widely available and smartly priced wine from the historic producer. Red cherry fruit shows on the palate along with a touch of turned earth, making for a pleasant yet simple sip.
Name: Edna Valley Vineyard 2015 Merlot (Central Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated blackberry and blueberry flavors are lifted by hints of fennel and smoke on the nose of this bottling. The first impression on the palate is thick cherry syrup, but a definitive structure and prominent acidity emerge to brighten the experience.
Name: Graveyard 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A dark and brooding exploration of black fruit with soft edges, this wine shows generous smoky oak and cinnamon notes, along with an unexpected streak of egg cream.
Name: Martorana 2013 Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Merlot remains a challenge for most Oregon producers who attempt it. This does not rise past the impression of light and grapey soda flavors, with some stiff earthy tannins.
Name: Sweet Cheeks 2015 Barrel Reserve Merlot (Oregon)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plum aromas meet dried oregano, graphite and bell pepper touches on the nose of this bottling. Light strawberry flavors are accented with an iron-tinged character and more bell pepper on the palate.
Name: Cupcake 2014 Merlot (Central Coast)

Description: Candied berry aromas are jumpy, herbal and foxy. This has a raw pinched mouthfeel and minty herbal plum and berry flavors. On the finish, green elements rise to the level of herbaceous.
Name: Kon Tiki 2015 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: This wine has aromas of pomegranate juice and dried cherry. Flavors suggest pomegranate juice and tart cherry conserves.
Name: Côtnar Hills 2014 Merlot (Ukraine)

Description: Spicy aromas of green tobacco blend with plum and berry notes. This Merlot is drying and tannic on the palate. Leafy flavors are fairly green, with generic black-fruit notes keeping it afloat.
Name: Santa Carolina 2015 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Heavy oak aromas of marshmallow, vanilla and clove are forced and candied. This has a dense blocky feel, while pounding flavors of clove and chocolate dominate.
Name: Santa Ema 2015 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This pure varietal spent 40 months in neutral oak, and is the current release. It's volatile, raisined, even pruney. Let's call it rustic to a fault, with alcohol approaching 16% adding to a hot finish.
Name: Eliana 2013 Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Father-and-son vintners Joe and Sam Miller consistently deliver solid wines, including this twist-top Merlot that's aged in 50% new French oak. Its boysenberry fruit is awash in the green peppercorn, herb and crushed graphite character associated with the mountainous region. That pyrazine touch hits the palate, along with black pepper and dark chocolate spice, accenting the tangy red fruit.
Name: Rexford 2013 Regan Vineyards Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark raspberry, barrel spice and smoke aromas are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors. The tannins bring a slight sense of astringency. Perhaps some time in the bottle will help them settle.
Name: Pepper Bridge 2014 Estate Vineyards Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of cocoa, herb, cedar, cherry and barrel spice. The palate is somewhat barrel-forward but otherwise shows a pleasing sense of balance along with a lingering finish.
Name: Apex 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas are out front on this 100% varietal wine, with notes of wood spice, vanilla, pencil lead and baking spice followed by dark plum. The flavors are dense, dark and palate coating. The wood shows quite prominently on the palate as well but if you can get beyond it, there are good things happening.
Name: Fidelitas 2014 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasing aromas of herb, cherry, vanilla, and cocoa are followed by soft subtle cherry flavors. Lightly grainy tannins provide support. It doesn't seem entirely varietal but still provides enjoyment.
Name: Mercer 2014 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though not treating the grape with quite the same reverence as other varieties, Central Coast vintners are having fun with Merlot, making quaffable, easygoing bottlings like this one. It shows caramelized blueberry, black currant and asphalt touches on the nose. The graphite minerality also pops on the palate, giving a tension to the cassis flavors.
Name: Brander 2015 Merlot (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an intriguing wine, with the extraction and the alcohol seemingly dialed back. Somewhat light in color, it brings aromas of fresh herb, sweet spice, cedar and cherry. The flavors are elegant and cranberry tart. It doesn't come off as entirely varietal but there's plenty of enjoyment to be had, especially if paired with food.
Name: Hightower 2013 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are barrel-forward at present, with notes of baking spice and vanilla in front of red fruit. The flavors are plump in feel but also come off as quite woody. There are lots of good things going on. Perhaps some additional time in the bottle will pull them all together.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The plum, herb and spice aromas are followed by ever so slightly dried-out-seeming cherry flavors. There's enjoyment to be had, but it seems slightly more evolved than its age indicates.
Name: Hightower 2013 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: The wine shows the richness that the Merlot attained in this vintage. Happily, it also has acidity and red fruits to balance the pepper and wood-aging flavors. It will always be a superripe wine although it will develop a smoother mature side. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Laulerie 2015 Merlot (Bergerac)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Intensely ripe, almost raisinated in tone, this full-bodied Merlot offers loads of fleshy black-cherry and berry flavors. Yielding acidity accentuates its round lush mouthfeel but fine grippy tannins lend upright structure to the finish.
Name: Millbrook 2015 Merlot (New York)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Long maturation in French oak lends a distinctly nutty, smoky tone to this brambly berried Merlot. While bold in body and a touch warm in alcohol, its ripe black-fruit flavors are sharpened by cranberry acidity and firm, penetrating tannins. A hint of cocoa powder lingers on the finish.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2013 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light in color, this wine offers aromas of herb, red currant, graphite, raspberry and barrel spice. The fruit and barrel flavors are elegantly styled, playing off each other through the finish.
Name: Hogue 2013 Genesis Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas seem quite dried out, with notes of blackberry bramble and fruit leather. The flavors also seem considerably more evolved than its age. It's a big miss.
Name: Hogue 2013 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The plum, herb and spice aromas are elusive. The cherry flavors are light but come straight down the fairway. One wants more concentration, but it delivers easy-drinking pleasure.
Name: Hogue 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This pure Merlot wine suffers from excessive wood aging giving an extra-dry character. To compensate, the red fruit is perfumed and rich. Another year will help the softening process although probably not enough.
Name: Domaine Guillaman 2014 Les Hauts de Guillaman Merlot (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Tart black cherry meets plum, strawberry and clove, while softened tannins belie the wine's overall density and sense of generosity. A smoky waft of cigar amplifies the power and sinewy nature of the full-bodied wine, which is ready to lie down for a rest. Enjoy best 2020 through 2024.
Name: Shafer 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Spicy in clove and allspice on the nose, this wine invites in bold, brambly currant and berry, retaining a softness on the palate despite its full-bodied ripeness and richness. That silky, fleshy character gives it a finesse that lingers and remains indelibly etched on the brain.
Name: Provenance Vineyards 2013 Barrel Select Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Fully oaked plum and berry aromas are dense and inviting. This feels flush and full, with scratchy tannins. The flavor profile offers plenty of oak and related chocolate to go with blackberry and plum notes. Oak remains in the lead on the finish, which is stacked with blackberry, dark plum and wild-berry flavors. Drink through 2025.
Designation: Cuvée Alexandre Apalta Vineyard Made With Organic Grapes
Name: Lapostolle 2013 Cuvée Alexandre Apalta Vineyard Made With Organic Grapes Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Baked blueberry and boysenberry aromas are more ripe than delicate. This Merlot is saturated and deeply tannic. Flavors of coffee, chocolate and lemon peel precede a toasty finish that overflows with chocolaty oak and lingering tannins. Drink through 2023.
Name: Cono Sur 2012 20 Barrels Limited Edition Peralillo Estate Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of dried herb, vanilla bean, wood spice and black cherry. The flavors are rich and luscious, supported by plump ripe tannins. The finish lingers.
Name: Abeja 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Soft, supple and structured, this wine is richly crafted in pencil shavings and cedar, with denser, fuller flavors of red cherry and raspberry. With a bite of burly power, it contains 9% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot.
Name: Raymond 2013 Reserve Selection Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The cherry flavors are rich and broad in feel while the aromas are considerably less generous. If they both come together it could move up a notch or two.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2014 Panorama Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Gritty aromas of tire rubber, burnt meat and herbal black fruits introduce a grabby palate with lightly herbal but heavily oaked flavors of plum and berry. A firm snappy finish tastes a touch salty as well as minty. Drink through 2024.
Designation: Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2014 Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Juicy and smoky, this robust wine is thickly textured and earthy in dusty dried herb. Blackberry, tar and leather provide ample additional intrigue, with a pleasing taste of strawberry jam and supportive, toasty oak.
Name: Kenefick Ranch 2013 Estate Grown Merlot (Calistoga)

Description: Aromas of balsam wood, sandalwood-scented soap, blackberry and rubber feed into a drawing palate with abrasive tannins. A heavy oak character leads blackberry and licorice flavors, while this feels tannic and grabby on the finish, with acidity that sticks out. Drink through 2023.
Name: Concha y Toro 2014 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Juicy black fruit shines in this full-bodied wine with structured tannins. Weighty and concentrated, with light dustings of black pepper and cinnamon, its oak is supportive and seasoned in a touch of vanilla.
Name: Rutherford Hill 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pepper Bridge fruit makes up the majority of this wine, with the balance coming from Sheridan and Olsen vineyards. It offers aromas of barrel spice, herb, anise and exotic spice that lead to pitch-black, ever-so-slightly dried-out fruit flavors.
Name: Two Vintners 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Baked earthy black-fruit aromas are followed by a blocky palate with jagged tannins and bold acidity. Blackberry, chocolate, coffee and raw-oak flavors finish with black cherry and plum notes as well as some hollowness.
Name: Aresti 2015 Trisquel Series Altitud Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Prominent aromas of toast, dried cranberry, herb and cherry lead to straight down the fairway to more cranberry flavor. It delivers a lot of appeal.
Name: Bonair 2013 Chateau Puryear Vineyard Estate Bottled Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Dark plum fruit shows on the nose of this bottling from a quality-focused property in the region, with touches of smoked meat and dried herbs adding complexity. A fairly rigid, chalky and sticky tannic structure consumes the palate, so it needs a bit more time to fully unleashed the black fruits, chopped herb, black pepper and tar flavors.
Name: Falkner 2014 Merlot (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of barrel spice and red and black fruit are followed by sweet fruit flavors. It delivers enjoyment, but the flavors seem slightly dried out.
Name: Kiona 2013 Estate Bottled Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: Inviting in succulent, brambly berry, this is a balanced wine that takes a light approach to ripeness. Clove and vanilla add to its admirable length and breadth.
Name: Peter Cellars 2014 Estate Merlot (Carneros)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas on this wine are quite reticent but the palate delivers plenty of smooth, sensuous cherry and vanilla flavors. Dark chocolate notes persist on the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2014 H3 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine offers predominant aromas of wood spice along with herb and dark fruit. The palate is medium bodied, showing a mixture of fruit and barrel.
Name: DeLille 2014 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is a larger production offering that is integrated and well-structured, moderately flavored in feral game, black pepper, clove and plenty of black fruit. The finish tempts in chocolate.
Name: Tangley Oaks 2013 Lot #14 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry syrup, loamy soils and light mint show on the nose of this bottling by self-made vintners Don and Jennifer Arndt. There is a tense and tarry tannic structure to the sip, with deep and brooding flavors of blackened purple fruit most prominent.
Name: Arndt 2013 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Mild red fruit is met by soft texture in this ripe, tart and moderately bodied wine. Cranberry and strawberry flavors are buoyed by fresh acidity and weight.
Name: Judd's Hill 2013 Swig Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County-Napa County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Smoky oak supports a simple, supple texture of blackberry and tobacco in this likable wine from both counties, a good value for the quality and tailor-made for the table.
Name: Ghost Pines 2014 Winemaker's Blend Merlot (Sonoma County-Napa County)

Description: Aromas of roasted savory berry fruits and baked beans are solid. This Merlot exhibits good grip on a medium-bodied palate. Salty earthy flavors of berry fruits and dry oak finish leafy and spicy.
Name: Viña Chocalan 2014 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black cherry juice, anise, thyme and pepper show on the nose of this bottling from the Riboli family. The palate is easygoing and lighter in body, with dried blueberry, more pepper and a touch of soy.
Name: Maddalena 2012 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: This hefty Merlot smells of iodine and berry fruits. While the palate is blocky and tannic in feel, that's an appropriate canvas for oaky, spicy herbal black-fruit flavors. On the finish, overt oak and char confirm that this is dark and burly as a whole.
Name: Lapostolle 2014 Casa Grand Selection Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Description: Leafy herbal aromas of tomato sauce and spicy red plum will be attractive or too green depending on your point of view. This has a snappy freshness to the palate, while flavors of red plum, herbs and tomato finish comfortably, with an Old World essence.
Name: Tres Palacios 2014 Family Vintage Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel spice notes are at the fore followed by milk chocolate and plum. The palate is easy drinking with milk chocolate and vanilla flavor backed by lightly grainy tannins.
Name: Columbia Crest 2014 Grand Estates Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This dark-colored Merlot offers reduced berry, chocolate and herbal aromas. In the mouth, it's displaying rubbery tannins. Dried berry and oak-based flavors of spice and wood grain finish with hints of clove on a finish that could use more harmony and depth.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2014 Nimbus Single Vineyard Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The aromas on this wine are a bit weak, showing hints of licorice and a touch of blueberry. The palate offers dark red to purple fruit, with a touch of more bitter coffee grinds. The tannins are squeaky in texture.
Name: San Simeon 2013 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Softened tannins surround a light-bodied, lean and herbal approach to this vineyard-designate, dotted in black pepper, leather and baked cherry.
Name: Passaggio 2014 Blau Vineyards Merlot (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: This high-end wine has a tenacious hold of earthiness, that exhibits as tomato leaf and dried herb. Full-bodied and densely concentrated, its tannins are smooth and fine, while the texture leans gravelly. Black pepper and leather characteristics are hard to ignore.
Name: Rock Wall 2014 Reserve Merlot (Stags Leap District)

Description: Generic red-fruit aromas set up a solid palate. This tastes of roasted plum and berry fruits, while a straightforward finish is grabby in feel and tastes the slightest bit herbal and green.
Name: Cono Sur 2015 Bicicleta Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Juicy aromas of blackberry and blueberry fruit pick up some baking spice notes on the nose of this bottling from atop the mountains above the Malibu Coast. The flavors are also very fruit-forward, with candied blueberry and clove spice.
Name: Colcanyon 2010 Merlot (Los Angeles County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of herb and red fruit lead to dried out but lightly gamy fruit flavors.
Name: Basel Cellars 2013 Estate Double River Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: After starting out quite reduced on first pour, this wine reveals slightly sweet black-fruit flavors. A light grip of tannins provide support.
Name: Drumheller 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Candied, slightly volatile red-berry aromas are topped with chocolaty oak. In the mouth, this is simple and medium-bodied. Salty berry and plum flavors are just ripe enough before this falls off on the finish.
Name: Santa Luz 2015 Alba Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Merlot needs more concentration than this in order to really shine as a stand-alone varietal wine. This is thin, green, and simply generic. Pomegranate fruit peeks through, quickly overlaid with weedy tannins.
Name: Plaisance Ranch 2014 Merlot (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine brings fruit-forward aromas of cranberry, red Fruit Roll-Ups and spice. It's tart, with the flavors seemingly lacking in concentration, backed by lightly gritty tannins.
Name: Mas Chappell 2013 Jeremy's Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Reedy plum and raspberry aromas are a touch floral. This feels highly regular, while medicinal berry flavors carry a mild green and weedy side note. A finish with modest raspberry and cherry notes is par for the course.
Name: Rios de Chile 2015 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Burnt and herbal plum and berry aromas are just good enough. This feels clampy due to hard tannins. Medicinal plum and cherry flavors come with a forced-oak element, while this is dry and tannic on a hollow finish.
Name: Finca Patagonia 2015 Expedicion Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Leafy burnt aromas of compost lack freshness. This feels lean, raw and grabby, while forced flavors of oak and savory, roasted plum finish rubbery and tannic.
Name: Tres Palacios 2014 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Off the bat this smells weedy, with a hint of generic red-berry fruit to help things along. A green-tasting wiry palate finishes with burnt underripe berry notes.
Name: Sombras del Sol 2015 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Volatile aromas of cranberry, cherry and vanilla are followed by gritty lightly sweet cranberry and green-pepper flavors that show some astringency. The concentration seems lacking.
Name: Mas Chappell 2009 Morrison Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Light in color and just as light in body, this Merlot smells like cherry, plum and chewing gum. A lean linear palate generates tart generic red-fruit flavors prior to a sour finish.
Name: Mureda 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Merlot (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Muddled candied aromas smell uniquely unnatural and forced. This is choppy and jagged in the mouth, while a strange set of fake-oak and murky berry flavors are prominently on display.
Name: Love 2015 Merlot (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: A bouquet of cherry, apple and cranberry primes the taste buds for flavors of blackberry, red plum, butterscotch, mint and coffee. There is a good balance of slightly grippy tannins and bold acidity, wrapping up in a bright, lasting cherry finish. One or two years of aging should mellow the tannins to perfection, so try after 2017.
Name: Recanati 2013 Reserve Manara Vineyard Merlot (Galilee)

Description: Dark ruby to the eye, this wine has a nose of raspberry and birch root. Flavors of blackberry, black cherry, smoked meat, vanilla custard and anise move across the palate, with fruit and smoke notes rising and receding in rhythm. Zesty cherry notes linger on the tongue despite strong but pleasant tannins.
Name: Shiloh Winery 2014 Secret Reserve Merlot (Judean Hills)

Description: This wine offers a delightful bouquet of blackberry and rose petal with touches of salinity. It is smooth and silky at first sip, with flavors of black plum, cherry, chocolate, lavender, and freshly roasted coffee. As it makes its way around the mouth, stern tannins make their presence known and then recede into a finish notable for a lingering espresso bean flavor.
Name: Psagot 2014 Merlot (Jerusalem)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Dark, ripe and concentrated, this voluptuous red offers loads of Merlot's characteristically plush plum and cherry flavors. It's also a deeply nuanced wine with pretty violet and chocolate notes mingling into spicy licorice and graphite. Richly textured, yet neatly balanced, it's drinking beautifully now but should hold well over the next decade.
