Name: Damiani 2012 Reserve Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of milk chocolate, spice and red fruit, along with high-toned vanilla accents. The fruit and barrel flavors are plush and full, while still showing a lovely sense of balance.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2014 Indian Wells Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Inky red-violet in the glass, this wine has aromas of black cherry and chocolate. It is pleasing on the palate, with fruit-dominated flavors of cherry, raspberry, pomegranate, vanilla and espresso. Smooth soft tannins linger a moment past a finish marked by a splash of cranberry with a touch of freshly ground coffee.
Name: Recanati 2015 Merlot (Upper Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit and barrel aromas intermingle, with notes of vanilla, coconut, wood spice, clove and red berries. The red fruit flavors are fresh and focused, with lightly grainy tannins providing the frame.
Name: Dunham 2012 Lewis Vineyard Artist Series Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This 100% Merlot opens with delicate aromas of black currant, tilled earth and a whiff of vanilla. The ripe palate offers black-skinned berries, pipe tobacco and hints of toast alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Elena Walch 2013 Kastelaz Riserva Merlot (Alto Adige)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this offers aromas of black-skinned fruit and baking spice. The straightforward approachable palate shows black plum, tobacco and a vanilla note framed in supple tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: De Stefani 2014 Plavis Merlot (Piave)

Description: This 100% Merlot opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, toasted oak and vanilla. The concentrated palate delivers blackberry jam, mocha, tobacco and cedar alongside grainy tannins that clench the finish.
Name: Castellare 2014 Poggio ai Merli Merlot (Toscana)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Appealing aromas of cocoa, vanilla, spice and red fruit are followed by plump ripe fruit and barrel flavors. Chocolate flavors linger on the finish. The oak plays prominently.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though not labeled as such, this wine is all Merlot coming from Stillwater Creek Vineyard on the Royal Slope. Aromas of red currant, dill, vanilla and wood spice are followed by lighter styled red-fruit flavors. There are some intriguing things going on but they don't seem to all come together.
Name: Matteo 2012 Red Wine Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Robust, dry and firmly textured, this wine is built like a higher tier bottling and has the stuffing to pair with steak or prime rib. The flavors suggest black cherry and dark chocolate, with firm tannins providing weight.
Name: Vin Vault NV Merlot (California)

Description: Deep garnet in color, this wine has a bouquet of elderberry, raspberry, and lilac. It is slightly too tart, with flavors of cherry and pomegranate that are boosted by notes of eucalyptus that recede during the zesty finish.
Name: Flam 2012 Reserve Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herb and red-fruit aromas are accented by light volatile notes. The cherry flavors are lush and full but can't make up the difference. Tasted twice with consistent notes.
Name: Obelisco Estate 2013 BDX Estate Grown Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of green wood, herb and cherry lead to ripe but chalky feeling fruit flavors. There's some interesting things going on but a sense of astringency and bitterness proves distracting.
Name: Castle Rock 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is bold for a boxed wine, showing ripe, lightly spicy flavors supported by a firm and moderately tannic texture. It's nearly dry, too.
Name: The Naked Grape NV Merlot (California)

Description: Made from 100% Merlot grapes, this boasts ripe red berry, cassis, espresso, vanilla and chopped mint aromas. The densely concentrated palate doles out ripe cassis, licorice, tobacco and sage flavors, blanketed in velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Le Macchiole 2013 Messorio Merlot (Toscana)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle power and a structure built for aging lift this wine above the crowd. It has deep and concentrated black cherry and cassis flavors, an abundance of fine-grained tannins, velvety texture, and a tasty, lingering finish. Best after 2019.
Name: Occasio 2013 Thatcher Bay Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: French oak, coconut, cassis, menthol and coffee aromas lead the nose of this structured red. Made entirely from Merlot, it's densely concentrated, offering mature plum, black currant, dried sage, anise and espresso flavors. Firm, close-grained tannins give the finish grip. Drink 2018–2025.
Name: Le Macchiole 2012 Messorio Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Under the same ownership as Château la Dominque in neighboring Saint-Emilion, this estate produces 100% Merlot. This generous wine with its rich tannins is dark with tight acidity, juicy black fruits and dark coffee flavors. It is concentrated and is going to take many years to soften. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Fayat 2014  Pomerol

Description: Cedary plum and berry aromas are savory and ripe, but not overt. This feels layered and almost lush, with grabby tannins. Flavors of blackberry, baking spices, cocoa and mocha finish chewy, chocolaty and long. This is a serious Merlot to drink through 2019.
Name: Enate 2011 Merlot (Somontano)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sweet cedar aromas kick off this attention-grabbing bottling, with elderberry and black plum scents combining for an Old World feel in which the structure can be sensed on sniff alone. Wood and graphite notes pop on the palate, where a loamy riverstone minerality courses through black currant flavors, finishing on chocolate cake.
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2014 Flood Family Vineyards Merlot (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This juicy all-Merlot bottling boasts blackberry and green peppercorn aromas. The firm palate doles out black currant, tobacco, clove and licorice flavors, framed by crunchy tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
Name: Terre del Marchesato 2013 Aldone Merlot (Toscana)

Description: It's a treat to find a well-priced Merlot that has some gutsy tannin and dark fruit to go along with its sweeter flavors and mild texture. This wine has concentrated black cherry, clove and oak spice flavors, with a firm structure and lingering finish.
Name: Château Souverain 2014 Merlot (California)

Description: This wine is lush, with aromas of cassis, lavender and kirsch enveloped in wafts of church incense. Bright cherry and violet meld with velvety tannins and delicate acidity. The finish is long and full of cedar and botanicals.
Name: Veramar 2015 JB Winemaker Series Merlot (Virginia)

Description: Made entirely from Merlot, this opens with subtle black currant and bell pepper aromas. The straightforward palate delivers black cherry jam, dark chocolate and vanilla notes, with firm but polished tannins. Drink 2017–2022.
Name: Renieri 2012 Grido Merlot (Toscana)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A nod to the winery's co-owner Judge Royce Lewellen, this bottling is full of campfire smoke, red cherry, hibiscus and roasted pork aromas. That smoky character, which is pleasant if a tad overbearing, follows through to the palate, accenting the plum and black pepper flavors.
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2014 Judge's Reserve Merlot (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherry pie, cherry candy and dried ginger notes converge for a very approachable and inviting nose on this bottling from a sprawling vineyard in eastern Paso Robles. It's light in body, but solid red cherry, cedar and smoked chocolate flavors keep it lively.
Name: Broken Earth 2013 Reserve Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark berry and cherry aromas meet with touches of pasilla chile, peppercorn and sandalwood on the distinctive nose of this bottling from one of the region's first estate wineries. The palate is smooth, with dried berry, juniper, dark chocolate and more chile pepper greenness, which fits nicely into the overall picture.
Name: Firestone 2012 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine spent 18 months in French oak barrels and has a lightly smoky aroma, vivid red cherry and raspberry flavors, a sleek texture and good concentration.
Name: 3 Steves Winery 2013 Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: Nice flavor concentration and light body make this wine a standout. It starts with vivid black cherry aromas that lead to riper, almost-sweet cherry and blackberry flavors. The texture is structured with moderate tannins that keep the flavors going through the finish.
Name: Michael Sullberg 2014 Lot 91 Reserve Merlot (California)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roast beef aromas make for a meaty entry on this bottling from a large vineyard in the southern reaches of Paso Robles. Black currant and rosebud scents round out the nose. Macerated black fruit kicks off the palate but begins to taste sour, while lava rock and gravel notes make for an earthy midpalate.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2014 Merlot (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Description: The emphasis in this light-bodied wine is on fresh, fruity flavors like strawberry and red plum, which go well with the soft, non-tannic texture. A touch of sweetness on the finish keeps the fruity vibe going.
Name: Happy Camper 2014 Merlot (California)

Description: Fruity aromas of blueberry pie, raspberry and Cran-Grape Juice are palpable. Flavors in the same vein are jammy and spicy. Mouthwatering acidity manifests itself in this full-bodied fruit bomb.
Name: Lovingston 2015 Josie's Knoll Merlot (Monticello)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark chocolate, black cherry, plum and wet concrete show on the nose of this bottling from a winery recently acquired by O'Neill Vintners. There are lots of earthy flavors on the palate, from freshly turned loam to dusty rocks, set against tangy dried elderberry fruit.
Name: Robert Hall 2014 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Light aromas of raspberry and berry lead to medium-bodied flavors. The tannins bring a touch of astringency that's offset by the sweetness of the red- and blue-fruit flavors.
Name: Original House Wine 2014 Mountain Merlot (America)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Apparently this is the current release. The winery aims at a Right Bank, Bordeaux-style profile. At this advanced age the wine is showing some bricking at the edges, with mature drying fruit and a big dose of barrel. Smoky, oaky and toasty, it's a wine to drink up, perhaps with a big steak dinner.
Name: Cricket Hill 2009 Merlot (Applegate Valley)

Description: Bright red currant and Cran-Grape juice aromas battle it out with a rare meat note. Flavors of black cherry, red currant, flint, cedar and iron ore are set against smooth tannins. The finish is long and woody.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2014 Wessex Hundred Merlot (Virginia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Exceedingly dark, with chewy herbal tannins and high-toned somewhat volatile aromas, this is a wine that has not knit together. Black cherry, kirsch, fig and balsamic elements are scattered about, but nothing holds the center. Best to drink up soon.
Name: Cathedral Ridge 2013 Reid Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The alcohol would indicate a level of ripeness which does not register in terms of flavor or density. Thin generic red fruit has a slightly burnt edge to it, and it fades out quickly.
Name: Harry & David 2014 Merlot (Southern Oregon)

Description: The La Jota and W.S. Keyes vineyards are the sources for this classically styled wine that is intense and alive in minerality. Clove, black pepper and mountains of dried herb are front and center between firm, dusty tannin and oak. The texture is plush and velvety on the palate, with plenty of length on the finish.
Name: La Jota Vineyard 2013 Merlot (Howell Mountain)

Description: The wine launched cinematically by Robert Redford in “Indecent Proposal,” this delivers a succulently memorable and seductive mix of crisp cassis and meaty rare beef, a sanguine underpinning that gives it intrigue. Full bodied and ripely crafted, it is completely satisfying in its classical components of sage and cedar, with a lingering lust of chocolate-covered cherry.
Name: Pahlmeyer 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: From a site that reaches up to 1,800 feet and dates back grape-growing wise to before the Civil War, this wine is bold and beautiful. It's a study in dusty leather, black pepper and cigar, allowing sauvage, savory aspects to speak louder than fruit. Full bodied and robustly structured, it offers a memorable Tahitian-vanilla note on the finish.
Name: Mt. Brave 2013 Merlot (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intense blackberry and plum perfume burst from the glass of this bold concentrated red. It's a rich lavishly textured wine but keenly balanced in acidity and gilded by subtle layers of spice and toast. While delicious already, it's still brawny in its youth and should meld out gorgeously with more maturation. Drink 2021–2026.
Name: Paumanok 2010 Tuthill's Lane Vineyard Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: The third reserve by this producer made of this variety, this is 100% estate and varietal. It unfurls in fireplace smoke, red and black berry, leather and tobacco, with an edginess of cedar and herb. The texture is soft and integrated around a full-bodied concentration of flavor.
Name: Jarvis 2012 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Reserve Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This polished, vibrant red opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit, mocha, French oak, exotic spice and a whiff of coconut. The elegantly structured palate offers black raspberry, pomegranate, oak-driven spice and espresso alongside bright acidity and tightly knit, close-grained tannins that leave a firm finish. Give it time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2019–2033.
Name: Masseto 2013 Merlot (Toscana)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A marker of Long Island's exceptional 2013 vintage, this exceptionally ripe yet complexed and balanced Merlot offers long aging potential. It's deeply concentrated in fruit, boasting ruddy, ripe streaks of black cherry and plum off set by brisk acidity and fine, penetrating tannins. Shades of dried herb, autumn leaves and mushroom lend finesse and elegance. It's tasty now but should improve further from 2020 through 2025.
Name: Paumanok 2013 Grand Vintage Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This 100% varietal wine hails entirely from Hyde Vineyard, a meticulously farmed and magical site. With a rich nose leading the way, it shows dusty licorice and chocolate plum. Voluptuously well crafted, it finishes in a lengthy tinge of baking spice.
Name: Duckhorn 2013 Merlot (Carneros)

Description: Handfuls of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot figure into this wine, a lovely, medium-bodied beauty that finds balance in its measured use of oak. Vanilla, plum and bold jolts of pepper and cinnamon combine well on the lengthy palate.
Name: Ballentine 2014 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: An integrated, powerful wine from a famous northern Napa Valley site, this wine offers notes of baked plum and cherry wrap around the structured, spicy oak. Lingering accents of a pepper, clove and graphite grace the finish.
Name: Duckhorn 2013 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Smooth and fruity, yet complex and complete, this excellent wine offers ample acid and polished tannins around pretty red fruits. Notes of citrus and spice, tobacco and toast linger through a satisfying finish.
Name: Burrowing Owl 2013 Merlot (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cocoa, milk chocolate, spice and red berries are followed by tart luscious red-cherry and chocolate flavors. It shows a pleasing sense of balance.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Paumanok's standard-label 2013 Merlot shares much of the same ripe ruddy fruit intensity of the Grand Vintage bottling. Lighter in body and a touch crisper on the palate, it's an elegant and nuanced yet more approachable wine. Taut with tannins and still tightly wound, it will still benefit from cellaring through 2022.
Name: Paumanok 2013 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Named for the producer's French grandfather, Pépé is peppery in clove and Mexican cinnamon, with an abundance of black cherry. Made in small amounts, it shows a softness around its rounded edges of structure and moderate body of acidity, finishing with length and grace.
Name: Y Rousseau 2013 Pépé Cavedale Vineyard Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Description: Dusty Mexican chocolate meets black plum, cherry and pomegranate in this light-bodied, rounded wine that's juicy and delicious. It's well balanced and approachable now, so drink up.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Enviable structure marks this lovely wine that appears to have been made in a slightly reductive style. Light oak, a bouquet of dried herb and vanilla ride along a medium-bodied texture that's soft and silky, with a panache of juicy blackberry and currant on the finish.
Name: Jarvis 2012 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Gorgeous rose, plum and bramble notes perfume this exceptionally fragrant Merlot. Its complexity extends through the palate with bright cherry and plum flavors bolstered by savory nuances of olive and dried herb. Crisp acidity and fine persistent tannins guide a long finish.
Name: Keuka Spring 2015 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: This bold, full-bodied wine is understated in its layering of cassis, currant and juicy black cherry, with hints of clove and smoked meat. It's well balanced, with an enduring and evolving finish.
Name: Black Stallion 2013 Limited Release Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This straightforward wine delivers a lot of flavor for the price. The juicy, rounded layering of dark cherry, dried herb and cedar works within a light-bodied, mellowed context of balanced acidity and fruit.
Name: Decoy 2014 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: Juicy black plum and milk chocolate combine for a richly lush, soft and mild experience in this approachable wine, ripe and seasoned in a sprinkling of black pepper.
Name: Mill Creek 2013 Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Description: From entirely estate-grown fruit and blended with 5% Cabernet Franc, this is a soft, full and well-structured wine, sanguine in currant, cassis and a dusting of brambly raspberry. Inviting, it finishes in a pleasing note of mocha.
Name: Ehlers Estate 2013 Merlot (St. Helena)

Description: Cassis, bell pepper, toast, French oak and coconut lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the tightly wound palate along with raw red currant, powdered sage, licorice and a confectionery note. Close-grained tannins leave a rather astringent finish.
Name: Tua Rita 2013 Redigaffi Merlot (Toscana)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Merlot is dark in the glass, with lots of oak, vanilla and caramel aromas against a black-cherry and chocolate-cake backdrop on the nose. Soft and chalky tannins frame the sip, where blueberry, vanilla and chocolate-cream flavors prove lush and inviting.
Name: J. Lohr 2014 Estates Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: This is a thick, rich and chocolate-laden wine, soft and generously ladened with tannin. Cigar, cedar and dried sage remind one of its varietal intent, while its medium-bodied size allows for plushness on the palate.
Name: Saddleback 2014 Merlot (Oakville)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this opens with subdued aromas of ripe plum and vanilla. The aromas carry through to the robust palate, together with tobacco and clove. Round tannins provide soft support. Drink through 2019.
Name: Cafaggio 2011 Basilica del Pruneto Merlot (Toscana)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herb, baking spice and exotic spice aromas are followed by tart luscious cranberry and cherry flavors. It comes off as a bit oaky but it still brings a lot of appeal.
Name: Vino La Monarcha 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has a shy nose that eventually reveals subtle aromas of black-skinned fruit, grilled herb and caramel. The round, accessible palate provides black cherry, vanilla and a hint of baking spice, all framed by smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Fattoria Torre a Cona 2013 Merlot (Toscana)

Description: From a range of sites, including the producer's own Three Palms Vineyard, this wine is muted in spiced plum and a trace of gunpowder, as well as dried herb and mountaintop cedar. Dense and generous in tannin, it's soft and potently round.
Name: Duckhorn 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intense aromas of vanilla and sweet spice waft throughout this ripe voluptuous Merlot. Ruddy rich flavors of plum preserves and black-cherry cola penetrate deeply on the palate edged by fine persistent tannins. Bright cranberry acidity lends freshness, lingering nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Hound's Tree 2015 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this opens with subtle aromas of black-skinned fruit and cocoa. The straightforward palate delivers ripe plum, vanilla and clove alongside close-grained tannins that clench the finish.
Name: Castello di Bossi 2012 Girolamo Merlot (Toscana)

Description: A full-bodied expression of the variety, blended with 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this soft, rounded wine is dense in blueberry and currant, with a complexity of leather, pencil and soy. A pinpoint of reduction on the finish gives it a tinge of bitterness.
Name: Duckhorn 2013 Rector Creek Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Pleasing aromas of raspberry jam and spice lead to soft plump raspberry and cranberry flavors. It's fruit forward and brings a lot of enjoyment.
Name: Huston 2013 Merlot

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, the shy nose eventually reveals notes of black-skinned fruit and clove. The dense palate delivers cedar, espresso and leather alongside gripping tannins.
Name: Conte Ferdinando Guicciardini 2013 La Historia di Italia Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, the shy nose eventually reveals whiffs of violet and clove. The medium-bodied palate offers prune, vanilla and French oak alongside chewy tannins and rather modest acidity.
Name: Sangervasio 2011 I Renai Merlot (Toscana)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A mild current of cinnamon, clove and tobacco provide a spicy entry into this wine, backed up by a fruity mid-palate. Medium weight and body give it some power and substance, while on the finish, it comes under an herbaceous light.
Name: Vanderbilt 2013 Reserve Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry, plum and light herb aromas are followed by a flavorful palate, speckled with vanilla and other spices. Grainy tannins provide support.
Name: Airfield Estates 2014 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: A light, bright version of the variety, this soft and herbaceous wine mixes a subtle richness of toasted oak and dark chocolate with black plum and cherry. It retains its acidity well, showing a tightness of structure with enough approachability.
Name: Bench 2014 Merlot (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This youthful, tannic wine needs time in the glass to unfold, benefiting from the additions of 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc. A reductive style shows slightly on the nose before streaks of soy, leather and tobacco provide plenty of savory elements with which to play.
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2013 Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Gritty black-fruit aromas come with notes of bell pepper and green herbs as well as coffee grounds. A snappy, tough, drawing palate delivers peppery, blackened spice and herbal berry flavors prior to a crisp, tight finish with fresh acidity.
Name: Finca Patagonia 2014 Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Minty oaky aromas of baking spices share space on the nose with earthy black plum and berry notes. This feels tannic and resiny while the oaky spicy berry flavors finish with force and drying tannins.
Name: Alcance 2014 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this opens with delicate aromas of black-skinned fruit and a whiff of baking spice. The mature palate reveals prune and vanilla alongside rather evolved tannins. Enjoy soon.
Name: Podere Ciona 2010 Le Diacce Merlot (Toscana)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas are out front with notes of wood spice, vanilla and cocoa followed by dark cherries and herb, starting to show a bit of age. The palate is fruit filled but shows the restraint of the vintage. The oak seems a bit overweighted.
Name: Liberty Lake 2011 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of red fruit and herb are followed by light but pure cherry flavors. It provides a lot of easy-drinking appeal.
Name: Boomtown 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this opens with aromas of black cherry and caramel that follow through to the dense palate along with a hint of cedar. Clenching tannins leave a mouth-puckering finish.
Name: Pagani de Marchi 2012 Casa Nocera Merlot (Toscana)

Description: This highly concentrated, richly ripe red explores notions of plum, black cherry and tobacco. It finishes with a mildness of dried herb.
Name: Buena Vista 2014 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Basic but clean plum and cherry aromas show a note of orange peel. This is quite tannic for an everyday red, while cassis, plum and prune flavors end tannic, spicy and slightly herbal.
Name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Olallieberry, cedar and lacquered-wood aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a winery based in the Russian River Valley. There is a decently structured tannic chalkiness to the palate, with flavors of black cherry, vanilla and pepper.
Name: Angeline 2014 Reserve Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Made with 100% Merlot, this has subdued aromas suggesting ripe red berry and dark spice. The one-dimensional palate isn't very expressive, offering hints of dried plum and clove alongside rather evolved tannins.
Name: Vignamaggio 2013 Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Plum, tomato and animal aromas feed into a tight, pulling, tannic palate. Salty and savory plum and berry flavors end with dry tannins and an overall scratchy feel that's rugged but stout.
Name: Château Los Boldos 2014 Grand Reserva Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp Concord grape ripeness meets with a touch of chile pepper and dark tobacco on the nose of this bottling. The palate is redolent with aromatic woods, from cedar to sandalwood, as well as blueberries and dried herbs, but it's a tad thin.
Name: Joullian 2013 Merlot (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light dried herbs, cigar box and cranberry aromas arise on the nose of this bottling from the Broken Earth team. It's zesty on the sip, with raspberry and cooked red-plum flavors that are spiced up by pepper and more dried herbs. It's a tad thin.
Name: Pull 2012 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has a shy nose that tries to hide suggestions of plum and bell pepper. The straightforward palate provides plum with hints of vanilla and clove alongside grainy tannins.
Name: Valentini 2013 Atunis Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Thick, rich and woody, this herbal, estate-grown red shows a wealth of baked-plum flavor laced in vanilla, with richness bursting on the finish.
Name: St. Supéry 2013 Dollarhide Estate Vineyard Merlot (Rutherford)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine all comes Chandler Reach Vineyards. The aromas seem to lack clarity while the cranberry, prune and cherry flavors want for midpalate concentration.
Name: Keira 2014 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is a simple wine with a touch of menthol and astringency, a mix of dried herb and grapes picked at an early stage of ripeness.
Name: Camp 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this isn't very expressive, offering aromas and flavors that suggest black-skinned fruit along with whiffs of tangerine and baking spice. It's extremely simple, with loose-knit tannins. Drink soon.
Name: Poggio al Chiuso 2014 Voltaccia 49 Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Gritty marginally ripe plum aromas smell a bit like a wild field. This feels full but pushy, with roughness to the palate. Herbal plum and blackberry flavors finish minty and slightly green.
Name: Santa Helena 2014 Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: This is a basic wine, thick and extracted with a generosity of ripe, bold red fruit and walled-in tannin.
Name: Broadway Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Merlot (Carneros)

Description: Raw abrasive plum and berry aromas are grassy. This passable Merlot is rubbery and pinched in feel, with herbal generic berry flavors that finish with a weedy accent.
Name: Bossy Boots 2014 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: From the outset this is woody and artificial in style. Aromas of milk chocolate and clove are strange and forced. In the mouth, this feels wiry but also gummy, with clove-heavy oak and tannic bite. In general, this is overly woody, candied and seemingly not natural.
Name: Santa Ema 2014 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: One of Argentina's few high-end Merlots, this opens with maple, toasty oak and deep berry aromas. With 9% Petit Verdot and Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc mixed in, this feels juicy, ripped and eminently healthy. Flavors of coffee, blackberry and cherry are deep and pure, while this avoids being overweight by tipping the scales at 13.9% abv. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tapiz 2012 Las Notas de Jean Claude Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brooding aromas of blackberry seed, black currant and licorice are followed by a full-bodied palate, with a tight core of dark-fruit flavors supported by fine-grained tannins. It's near irresistible, showing impeccable styling.
Name: Substance 2013 Super Substance Me Northridge Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's no question about the variety, with its jazzy aromas of raspberries, blackberries and graphite that lead to plump plush layered fruit flavors. It brings an unabashed sense of deliciousness, with a finish that won't quit.
Name: Substance 2013 Super Substance Me Stoneridge Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is the producer's inaugural offering of the variety, made in tiny amounts, but boy oh boy, it's good. Bright blue and black-berry succulence exude vibrancy and freshness on the palate complemented by savory hints of tar, black licorice and char. Velvety soft tannins allow the fruit to speak.
Name: Pellet Estate 2014 Pellet Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a micro-sized nine-acre estate, with vines that are 50 years old. Complex and rich, it is a generous burst of ripe full Merlot that is developing well. Black fruits, spice and juicy acidity all contribute to a wine that will ready to drink from 2017.
Name: Château Vray Croix de Gay 2012  Pomerol

Description: This wine confirms the producer's prowess with the variety, coaxing a soft, integrated expression that's full bodied in a generosity of plum, black pepper and cinnamon. Structured, it shows aging potential and an earned place at the table.
Name: Pride Mountain 2013 Vintner Select Cuvée Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This pure Merlot wine from Mayne-Vieil is ripe and rich. Full of jammy blackberry and black plum, it is a generous wine, enveloping the tannins in a cushioned embrace. It is going to develop into a delicious wine. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Mayne Vieil 2014 Cuvée Aliénor  (Fronsac)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, clove, coffee and dark raspberry lead to a mouthful of rich layered fruit flavors. It shows impressive concentration, with fruit flavors lingering on the long finish.
Name: Basalt 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Plummy cherry and vanilla meet cedar and black pepper wrapped in toasted oak in this bold, full-bodied, ripe wine from Moon Vineyards. Aged for two years in all French oak, it shows a classic structure and firmness, with succulence that builds on the finish.
Name: Enoteca Five 2013 Merlot (Carneros)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Pepper Bridge and Seven Hills vineyards, this wine opens with aromas of vanilla, wood spice, cream, red apple and fruit. The palate brings elegantly styled, tart fruit flavors that linger on the finish. The balance is impeccable.
Name: Reininger 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of savory herbs, mineral, exotic spice and red fruit are followed by fruit flavors that are surprisingly restrained considering the warmth of the vintage. Tart acidity livens it up. It's green for the variety but still brings enjoyment.
Name: Efeste 2013 Upright Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a plushness of succulent black cherry and firm, integrated tannin, making for a complex and lengthy texture on the palate. It finishes laced in spicy cinnamon and clove.
Name: Kokomo 2014 Pauline's Vineyard Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine has all the necessary smoothness, plus deep plum and cherry flavors and touches of spicy oak, too. The texture feels layered and the fruit components are vivid and tasty. It all comes together gracefully on the palate and the finish.
Name: Gnarly Head 2014 Merlot (California)

Description: This bold red wine works its magic by offering hearty helpings of yeasty brioche, baked, stewed plum, black pepper and clove, remaining varietal and unabashed in its hold on the ripe vintage and sun-kissed appellation. Integrated, the tannin imprint is sizable, yet well managed.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Black olive stars in this supple, soft and supremely varietal wine, wrapped in strong, chalky tannin. Full bodied and completely generous in ripe fruit, it shows complexity and lengthiness on the finish.
Name: Cakebread 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Nicely behaved and well balanced, this gentle wine offers medium body, fresh plum flavors and a texture that's smooth and lightly tannic. The color is relatively deep and aromas are fruity, with a touch of earth.
Name: Bogle 2014 Merlot (California)

Description: With 20-year-old vines, this estate has the ability to produce open fruity wines like this. This wine, that is now almost mature, has black-currant fruit, juicy acidity and a layer of tannins to allow it to age further. Drink this attractive wine from 2017.
Name: Château Renard 2012  Fronsac

Description: This 100% Merlot wine from 30-year-old vines is one of the producer's limited productions. The wine is superrich in the plump, generous style. Its black-plum fruits give it the weight and ripeness as well as the smooth texture. There is a bite of pepper from the alcohol that spoils the opulent full aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
Name: Bernard Magrez 2012 Egregore Cuvée d'Exception  (Côtes de Bourg)

Description: Oaky toast, cedar and hint of meat add complexity and flavor to this light-bodied, mellowed wine, highlighted by soft, firm tannin and brooding blackberry.
Name: Franciscan 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of raspberry and herb intermingle on the nose, which also shows a touch of reduction. The palate offers soft tart fruit flavors that provide appeal.
Name: Kestrel 2012 Falcon Series Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is a light-bodied and full-flavored wine with a good, gripping texture and plenty of ripe plum and black pepper aromas. A fruity and beefy flavor carries through the finish.
Name: Leaping Lizard 2014 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of cocoa and dark raspberry are speckled with light barrel accents. The red-fruit flavors are ripe and generous, dipping in the middle before coming back together on the elegant finish.
Name: Brian Carter 2013 One Olsen Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit is at the fore here, with aromas of blue fruit, wet stone and spice, along with a whiff of tire rubber. The palate has sweet fruit flavors with nubby tannins and a tart coffee-filled finish.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine opens with just a touch of reduction followed by quite pure aromas of red and blue fruit. The flavors are sweet and fresh, with the tannins bringing a light grip.
Name: Charles Smith 2014 The Velvet Devil Merlot (Washington)

Description: From vines on the plain of Saint-Émilion, close to the Dordogne river, this is a ripe fruity wine. The tannins are already well integrated into the berry fruits, leaving just a dry core that is typical of the year. Drink the wine from 2018.
Name: Château Abelyce 2011  Saint-Émilion

Description: The second wine of Château le Prieuré, made from 100% pure juicy Merlot, is ripe and concentrated. It still has plenty of firm tannins although the rich fruits will balance out shortly. It is then going to be a generous wine with great final fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château le Prieuré 2014 Délice du Prieuré  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: This classically styled wine offers black olive, dusty-leathery tannin and jolts of clove and cedar, bringing it all together in a soft, seamless varietal expression. Along the way, expect to meet a juicy hit of grenadine and black currant, a comfy marriage between savory and fruity.
Name: Oberon 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Pure Merlot, ripe and fruity, this wine has only the lightest of tannic structure. That makes for a soft rounded wine from the area close to Lussac Saint-Émilion. Black plum and berry flavors are laced with acidity and finish with a smooth aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château des Arnauds 2014  Bordeaux

Description: Thoroughly oaky and spicy, this full-bodied wine smells toasty and smoky. Flavors suggest nutmeg, cinnamon and smoked meat, followed by tangy and fresh black cherry.
Name: McManis 2015 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas are out front, with notes of char, toast and vanilla along with dark raspberry and spice. The palate presents a mixture of fruit and barrel, with the latter showing a bit too prominently.
Name: College Cellars 2014 Clarke Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of green wood, vanilla and cola are followed by plump fruit flavors. The palate brings appeal but the aromas don't seem to match up.
Name: Helix by Reininger 2012 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The vineyards of this estate take their name from their hillside (Puy) position. The wine is still very young with its generous black fruits and acidity still bubbling with energy. With tannins in the background, it will be a wine that develops relatively quickly, certainly ready to drink by 2019.
Name: Château Puy Rigaud 2015  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

Description: This is a bold and ripe wine from the gravel soil of Lalande de Pomerol. It is now reaching maturity. It has rich blackberry fruits, layered with acidity. The tannic core is still firm giving the wine the chance to age further. Drink until 2022.
Name: Château Roc de Boissac 2012 Château la Croix  (Lalande de Pomerol)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of vanilla and wood spice along with herb. The palate brings tart cherry flavors that taper toward the finish. The variety seems to get lost.
Name: Helix by Reininger 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Chalky tannin surrounds succulent baked plum and dark cherry, with chocolate and black licorice riding along in the back seat. This is a full-bodied, ripe wine.
Name: Kenwood 2013 Jack London Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: Closed aromas make it a challenge at first to get a read on this wine that takes time to unfurl touches of herb and dried fruit. Soft in tannin and low in oak, it offers a depth of black cherry and vanilla on the palate, with a touch of cedar and currant.
Name: Bell 2013 Merlot (Yountville)

Description: Dark in color, this hearty, full-bodied red unveils aromas of vanilla and marshmallow in a rich, concentrated opening that veers confectionary. Grippy tannin and leather provide a grit to the texture amid tart black cherry and tobacco.
Name: Greyscale 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Dry earthy herbal aromas of tomato, red-berry fruits and oak set up a full palate with pounding tannins. This tastes roasted and herbal, with notes of bell pepper, tomato and creamy oak. A hard-tannin finish confirms that this Merlot skipped charm school.
Name: Aniello 2015 006 Riverside Estate Merlot (Patagonia)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine seems overtaken with scents and flavors of tree tar and resin. The impression of pine resin cuts out the fruit, leaving some woody flavors in the finish.
Name: Cliff Creek 2012 Sams Valley Vineyard Merlot (Southern Oregon)

Description: This light-colored and light-bodied wine combines an earthy, metallic aroma with mildly fruity, candied flavors. Its texture is mild and smooth.
Name: Grayson 2015 Lot 6 Merlot (California)

Description: Impressively rich, velvety and long, this appears to have all the ingredients for cellaring. Ample oak supports and elevates the fruit-derived notes of cherry preserves, dark chocolate and black olives, while lending hints of cedar, vanilla and mocha. Drink this remarkable effort 2020–2030.
Name: Villa Maria 2014 Reserve Gimblett Gravels Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Since its inception, Wölffer winemaker Roman Roth's namesake Merlot has been one of the best wines in Long Island. The 2012 bottling is no exception. It's a bold, densely fruity wine full of luscious black cherry, plum and currant flavors. Powerful yet finessed, it's keenly anchored by a core of cranberry acidity and complexities of bramble, violet and spice. Delicious already but sure to improve through at least 2030.
Name: The Grapes of Roth 2012 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: The Hallock Lane Reserve is a standout among an ever-improving array of Merlot offerings from Harbes Family Vineyards. Fragrant and lusciously ripe, it boasts deep juicy streaks of black cherry and berry flavors accented by nuanced layers of licorice, earth and smoke. An elegant backbone of acidity and ripe tannins give it a four-square frame of structure. It's delicious already but should develop deeper complexity through 2030.
Name: Harbes Family Vineyard 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Hallock Lane Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This Merlot isn't as big or tannic as VM's 2014 Reserve, but it's close in quality. Cedary oak frames Bing cherry fruit on the nose, while the palate delivers a rich, creamy texture and additional complexity in the form of vanilla, licorice and raspberry. The long, velvety finish folds in hints of dark chocolate and espresso. Drink now–2025.
Name: Villa Maria 2013 Single Vineyard Braided Gravels Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Demonstrating how this meandering region can express warmer-climate grapes from its inland corners, this bottling shows deep and precise aromas of black cherry, cola syrup and condensed violets. A firm structure restrains the ripe blueberry fruit, allowing the dark chocolate and mint elements to lift the palate.
Name: McIntyre Vineyards 2013 Kimberly Vineyards Merlot (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine hails from Stone Tree, Cold Creek and Beverly vineyards. Aromas of vanilla, chocolate, cherry and raspberry lead to exuberant layered fruit flavors. It displays a lot of intensity, focus, and length.
Name: Northstar 2012 Premier Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an expressive wine, with notes of toast, vanilla, baking spices and dark fruit. The palate is full bodied but well balanced, showing a pleasing interplay of fruit and barrel flavors that continues through the finish.
Name: Market Vineyards 2012 Benchmark Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromatically, this wine is currently subdued, with the notes of raspberry, cocoa and cherry that haven't fully blossomed. The flavors meanwhile are generous and ripe, while still showing a fine sense of balance. Additional time in the bottle or a long decant should allow it to open up.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2014 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herb, pencil lead, plum and vanilla aromas are followed by smooth, soft blue-fruit flavors. It shows a beautiful sense of balance.
Name: Northstar 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Klipsun, Slide Mountain, Elephant Mountain and Ciel du Cheval vineyards, this wine offers generous aromas of raspberries, chocolate and spice. The palate is packed to the brim with fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Soos Creek 2013 Palisades Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Harbes' standard-label Merlot offers a plusher, more voluptuous expression of sun-kissed berries and cherries. Rich in body and textures, it's warmed by hints of Graham cracker and cinnamon and soft feathery tannins. Sunny cranberry acidity brightens the finish. Drink now through 2021 to enjoy its fruity forward nature.
Name: Harbes Family Vineyard 2014 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: It's hard to choose a favorite amongst Harbes' 2014 Merlots but this one stands out for its finessed body and subtle spice and licorice tones. Intensely ripened black plum and berry flavors are concentrated but balanced, offset by brisk acidity and fine-grained persistent tannins. The finish is long with a meandering smoky tone.
Name: Harbes Family Vineyard 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Barrel Fermented Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of plum, blueberry, vanilla and spice are followed by plush, ample fruit flavors. It brings a lot of appeal, with baking-spice flavors lingering on the finish.
Name: 14 Hands 2013 The Reserve Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bramble, violet and leather notes lend complexity to this fruity but elegantly composed Merlot. Ripe plum and cherry flavors are plump but pristine, brightened by crisp acidity and a smooth velvety finish of tannins. Drinks well already but should improve through 2021.
Name: One Woman 2012 Estate Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Some of the basic Merlots from Hawke's Bay—like this one—impress for their combination of quality and value. Cherries and dried spices pick up enough hints of earth and olive to be interesting sip after sip in this medium-bodied red that ends on a crisp, mouthwatering note.
Name: Pask 2013 Gimblett Gravels Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Toast, char, wood spice and dark-fruit aromas lead to generous coffee and red-fruit flavors. It shows a pleasing sense of balance along with a finish that sticks around.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2013 Zephyr Ridge Estate Bottled Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This definitely fits the bill as an affordable weekday red. Red berries, vanilla and spice on the nose and palate offer plenty of enjoyment, while there's just enough softly dusty tannins to provide structure on the crisp finish. Drink now through the end of 2018.
Name: Oyster Bay 2014 Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Enticing complexities of bramble, rose and violet lend freshness to this ripe plummy Merlot. The palate is satisfyingly juicy, accented by crisp acidity and subtle notes of nuts and spice. A fine feathery layer of tannins cushions the finish.
Name: Jamesport 2013 Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of green herb and wood spice don't seem entirely varietal. The flavors, however, are more convincing, with plush raspberry notes that appeal to the senses and carry through the finish.
Designation: Aerial Series Reserve Alder Ridge Vineyard Block 8
Name: Revelry 2013 Aerial Series Reserve Alder Ridge Vineyard Block 8 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Wood spice, dill, vanilla and cherry aromas are followed by flavorful yet reserved dark-fruit flavors. It possesses an understated charm.
Name: Waterbrook 2013 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are bright, with raspberry, licorice, green pepper and medicinal notes. The flavors are lighter in style and show a distinct green tinge that provides some distraction.
Name: Market Vineyards 2012 Alpha Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of coffee, red currant and red plum are bright and effusive, with tar and cough medicine notes in the background. The cherry flavors are plush and full, with coffee notes lingering on the finish.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Canoe Ridge Estate Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, spice box, toast and jammy red fruit are followed by quite elegant fruit flavors. The tannins seem a bit bunched up.
Name: Basel Cellars 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intensely ripened flavors of black plum and blueberry are accented by notes of spice, graham cracker and smoked nuts in this concentrated Merlot. It's forward and fruity but briskly composed with hints of dark herb and fine bitter tannins that lend a rustic Old-World feel.
Name: Martha Clara 2014 Island Series Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep aromas of black cherry, mocha and burnt cedar show on the nose of this bottling from one of the more ambitious producers in this region. Scorched black plum, charred black cherry, roasted beef and bay leaf show on the palate.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2012 Estate Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry, oak, wood spice, vanilla and herb aromas are followed by plump, jammy red-fruit flavors that provide appeal.
Name: Airfield Estates 2013 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Prominent aromas of toast and char lead to a supple, elegant palate with red fruit speckled with barrel spices. It's a very pretty wine, though the barrel influence gets out front.
Name: Cougar Crest 2012 Estate Grown Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Milk chocolate, toast and raspberry aromas are followed by quite sweet fruit flavors. It's unabashed in its easy-drinking appeal.
Name: 14 Hands 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Pronounced aromas of char, smoke and bramble lift with time and aeration, revealing prettier notes of fresh herb and red cherry. Plump cherry and berry flavors are supple and concentrated, but have a distinctly green, herbal tone on the midpalate. The finish is marked by a bite of fine-grained but delicately bitter tannins.
Name: Millbrook 2013 Proprietor's Special Reserve Merlot (New York)

Description: From a warmer region about 27 miles inland from Monterey Bay, this bottling shows crushed black rocks, black cherry, light vanilla and the slightest bit of char on the nose. It's relatively demure on the palate, with touches of milk chocolate, red cherry, gravel and graphite.
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2013 Merlot (Paicines)

Description: This garnet-colored Merlot has aromas of black plum, cherry and saddle leather which pave the way for soft flavors of raspberry, red plum and a smooth tannic finish.
Name: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: Scents of perfumed lilac talc, vanilla and smoked meats frame the red and black fruit core of this wine. The medium-length finish has lingering flavors of ripe black cherries.
Name: Rumelia Wine Cellar 2012 Merul Reserve Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is a tad fruit-punchy at first, with light red cherry and candied pomegranate aromas, but then picks up complexity with a leather note. The palate also offers that leather alongside tobacco and light elderberry fruit.
Name: Broadside 2014 Margarita Vineyard Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: This Moldovan Merlot has aromas of eucalyptus, dark chocolate and raspberry with flavors of cherry, black plum and a touch of baking spices. There's a nice minty lift in the midpalate, with a bright fruit finish and persistent tannins.
Name: Lion-Gri 2015 Golden Land Dry Merlot (Moldova)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Plusher and rounder than the Special Reserve bottling, Millbrook's standard label Merlot suggests soft red-cherry flavor accented with cocoa powder, savory mushroom and beetroot. Gentle acidity and fine-grained tannins accentuate its plump juicy feel. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Millbrook 2014 Merlot (New York)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried plum, dried strawberry and dried raspberry meet with cola spice on the fresh if thin nose of this bottling. The palate offers sour plums, peppercorns, damp compost and smoke flavors.
Name: William Hill Estate 2014 Merlot (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coffee, raspberry, green herb, dill and vanilla aromas are followed by light but plump fruit flavors. It goes down easy.
Name: Gordon Estate 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Brazilian Merlot smells rubbery and gaseous, with saucy berry notes. In the mouth, this is severely tannic and drying. Toasty, blackened and bitter in flavor, this ends with peppery notes and hard-pounding tannins.
Name: Lidio Carraro 2014 Agnus Merlot (Serra Gaúcha)

Description: The aromas of blueberry, sugared plum and herb are bright and fresh. The flavors are sweet and full and go down easily.
Name: Washington Hills 2014 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bit thin on the nose, this shows dried oregano, baked red plum and touches of vanilla and caramel on the herbally forward nose. Black tea, cranberry, pomegranate, oregano and marjoram come through on the palate.
Name: Magistrate 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Juicy red cherry meets with wet stone, smoldering oak and dried oregano, marjoram and basil on the nose of this retro-styled bottling. A touch of ancho and pasilla chile to the palate gives peppery, herbal depth to the red-fruit base.
Name: Norma Jeane 2015 18th Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Straightforward plum, cherry and tomato aromas lead to a juicy palate that's lacking in structure. Simple slightly sweet plum and black-currant flavors finish with a note of peppery spice. At only 11.5% ABV, this is Merlot is an easy sipper.
Name: Casa Perini 2014 Macaw Merlot (Serra Gaúcha)

Description: This ruby-garnet wine has a touch of oxidation on the nose with flavors of blackberry, black plum and black cherry in the mouth. It's not perfectly harmonious in the midpalate but there's a fair bit of acidity in the finish that makes it refreshing.
Name: Koblevo NV Reserve Merlot (Ukraine)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: With a tiny bit of breathing room, this wine opens up magically into dark earth, crushed asphalt, blackberry jam, cappuccino and mocha on the nose, which predict a tarry texture. Indeed, the structure is firm and fine-tuned, yet vibrant with boisterous acidity, showing layered flavors of dark fruit enhance by cedar, sandalwood and incense notes. Drink 2017–2033.
Name: Kathryn Kennedy 2013 Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A finely perfumed wine from a mere 2.5-acre vineyard, this is ripe and with great balance between the tannins and the warm berry fruits. It has a generous, while structured, character that will develop well. Owners Viviane and André Vossen's consultant is Michel Rolland whose family owned this castle for 200 years. Drink starting from 2019.
Name: Château Ad Francos 2014 Ad Francos  (Francs Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong cedar notes greet the nose alongside charred red bell pepper, crushed gravel and elderberry fruit. Pencil shavings are prominent on the very full and complex palate, giving nuance to black plums, roasted beef, charcoal and dark chocolate.
Name: Martin Ranch 2013 JD Hurley Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This vineyard is at one of the highest Castillon points. Big in tannins and also fruit, this is a dense wine. It has a dry core as well as rich blackberry fruits. Concentrated and full, the wine will be seriously worth drinking from 2019.
Name: Château Montlandrie 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A structured wine from the Chadronnier family, it is full of tannins and also full of sweeping black-fruit flavors. It is perfumed, rich and concentrated. Don't drink until at least 2020 to get the full generosity of the wine.
Name: Château Marsau 2014  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This wine offers big-shouldered notions of black cherry and damson plum, the fruit providing juicy succulence on the palate. Softly approachable tannins give it texture without distraction, while the entire experience is balanced in weight and body.
Name: Summers 2014 Reserve Merlot (Knights Valley)

Description: Soft in tannin and oak, this wine shows a cool-climate profile, its grapes sourced largely from Mount Veeder's mountainous terrain. Blackberry pie, cedar and crushed herb combine nicely alongside integrated power and full-bodied concentration.
Name: Darioush 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A richness of brown sugar and cinnamon lies at the heart of this soft, supple wine, accented in bold shakes of cinnamon toast. Hints of rustic leather beat softly beneath its full-bodied core.
Name: Kokomo 2013 Pauline's Vineyard Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This nicely concentrated wine smells like black cherries and tastes rich and almost chocolaty. It feels smooth but hefty, laced with fine-grained tannins.
Name: Sanglier Cellars 2012 Right Tusque Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A shy nose of blueberry jelly, lilac and a touch of black tea show on this wine from a project connected to the Thomas Fogarty team. Light red plum, tart pomegranate and even raspberry show on the palate, where a dainty structure proves easy to sip, with additional chipped-slate minerality.
Name: Lexington 2013 Gist Ranch Estate Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Good fruit concentration and mellow oak accents make a good combo in this full-bodied and plush-textured wine. The aromas resemble cedar and tobacco and flavors suggest ripe plum and raspberry.
Name: Longevity 2012 Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: Tempting oaky aromas and flavors in this full-bodied and tannic wine run the gamut from clove to nutmeg to cinnamon and wood smoke, backed by low-key dark-fruit flavors. It's a nicely built, complex and satisfying wine.
Name: Succulent Vineyards 2013 Merlot (California)

Description: Oaky, smoky, earthy aromas and flavors dominate this full-bodied and firm-textured wine. A muscular, assertive wine, it should taste great with a grilled steak or lamb chop.
Name: One Hope 2013 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Offering layers of juicy black currant, this is a soft, malleable wine, subtle in oak and tannin, blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. A touch of cedar and herb provides additional character, while the finish lands softly.
Name: Merriam 2012 Windacre Merlot (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a flavorful, smooth-textured wine drenched with grapy, jammy flavors. Ripe and concentrated, it has a lively mouthfeel due to welcome tannins and acidity. It offers a lot to like.
Name: Yorkville Cellars 2013 Rennie Vineyard Merlot (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: The producer sources fruit among several appellations for this varietal wine, coaxing a wealth of full-bodied flavor and succulence into its mix of cedar, sage, black cherry and oak. The firm tannin profile provides a structured foundation.
Name: Matanzas Creek 2013 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Jean Lissague, one of Bordeaux wine's “new generation,” produced the 100% Merlot with spice and firm tannins. It also has weight and richness from the generous fruitiness. Drink this structured wine starting from 2019.
Name: Château Grand Secret 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This 100% Merlot produced by the Glemet family has spice and layers of wood-aging flavors that are still dominating the fruit. That fruit is there, waiting, with hints of red berry and black-currant flavors. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Chamaille 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Tasty and true to type, this wine smells like ripe plums and cherries accented by dried thyme, and tastes slightly meaty on top of all that fruitiness. It's a smooth-textured wine in which moderate tannins add a good bite to the mouthfeel.
Name: Cambridge & Sunset 2014 California Series Merlot (California)

Description: Intense in mulled spices and juicy blue and black berry, this is a smooth, approachable and likable wine. Medium bodied, it will play well at the table, providing a chocolaty note at its end.
Name: Flora Springs 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Smooth and accented by dried herb, this wine is tart in currant and lush in chocolate, offering a wide spectrum of aroma and flavor. Medium bodied, it picks up power and concentration on the finish, allowing for a ripeness to strike last.
Name: Keenan 2013 Reserve Mailbox Vineyard Merlot (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a perfumed wine. Although the tannins are still firm from 14 months in new oak, it does have fine, fragrant red-fruit and acidity. The texture is dense, still young, and will be fine from 2019.
Name: Château Tertre de Belves 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Bold oak aromas like wood smoke and toasted baguette meet almost-sweet flavors like cherries, plums and a bit of maple syrup in this medium-bodied wine.
Name: Pennywise 2013 Merlot (California)

Description: This medium-bodied wine has a vivid smoky aroma that gives way to fresh strawberry and raspberry notes on the palate. It feels juicy, slightly tart and light.
Name: Ironstone 2014 Merlot (Lodi)

Description: Lean and tannic, this wine has a firm structure that makes it mouthwatering. It will pair well with creamy pasta, Korean barbecue and other rich dishes.
Name: Heron 2013 Merlot (California)

Description: Aromas like cedar and marascino cherries are followed by good red and black cherry flavors. A firm and tannic texture gives this medium-bodied wine a rustic touch.
Name: Brutocao 2013 Bliss Vineyard Estate Bottled Merlot (Mendocino)

Description: Lots of sweet-smelling new-oak flavor permeates this dry, medium-bodied and moderately tannic wine. Aromas suggest toasted French bread and the flavors blend chocolate and cherries.
Name: Leese-Fitch 2014 Merlot (California)

Description: Fine fruits, red-berry flavors and crisp acidity give this wine a fine balance and immediate attraction. It is lively with its bright texture and finishing acidity. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Sainte Barbe 2014 Merlot du Château Sainte Barbe  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This firmly structured wine has a good, gripping texture and lots of black cherry and black-plum flavors. Backed by bracing acidity and a modest layer of tannin, it's a versatile wine for lunch or dinner.
Name: Parducci 2013 Small Lot Blend Merlot (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine smells sugary and floral, but tastes quite dry. Flavors are fruity but spare and the mouthfeel is taut.
Name: Donkey & Goat 2013 Blakeman Vineyard Merlot (Anderson Valley)

Description: Aromas of this medium-bodied wine are smoky and herbal. The flavors combine black pepper, spicy oak notes and and almost-sweet fruits like plum and watermelon.
Name: Red Rock 2014 Reserve Merlot (California)

Description: Blended with 15% Petit Verdot, this wine is big and brooding in tannin and charred oak, with a sizable presence on the palate. It dabbles in ripe, full-bodied black cherry, plum and tar.
Name: Gibbs 2013 Money Road Vineyard Merlot (Oakville)

Description: This is a ripe wine with some of the rich red fruit of Merlot. It does, however, have too much ripeness and bitter chocolate flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserve Merlot (Península de Setúbal)

Description: Grapes come from Alexander, Dry Creek and Russian River valleys to make this wine, first released in 1997. Oaky and mild-mannered on the palate, it shows touches of clove, black pepper and dried herb, while robust tannins play a supporting role.
Name: Toad Hollow 2014 Richard McDowell's Selection Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: Vague black-pepper aromas and almost neutral flavors combine for a simple, muted wine. It is medium bodied and innocuous.
Name: Twisted Cedar 2011 Merlot (Clarksburg)

Description: From a vineyard situated in a forested area of northern Tejo comes this is a structured version of Merlot. It is ripe and rich with black fruits, as well as dark tannins and firm concentration. It could benefit from further aging, so drink from 2018.
Designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas
Name: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas Merlot (Tejo)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coffee, spice, vanilla and pencil lead aromas are followed by rich, luscious, full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. It's hedonistic and pulls no punches but shows balance: an equal mix of fruit and barrel.
Name: Fielding Hills 2013 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: This is a generously full-bodied wine, explosive in dark, brooding black fruit, coffee and bittersweet chocolate that offers firm, integrated tannin and lively acidity in equal measure. It shows varietal character, with an additional 1% Malbec swimming within.
Name: Peju 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of equal parts Seven Hills and Ferguson fruit. Aromas of raspberry, plum, tobacco and dark fruit lead to flavorful, polished tart fruit flavors. It's undeniable in its appeal.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2013 Estate Grown Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is all varietal. It brings aromas of toast, barrel spice, licorice and jammy red fruit that are followed by full-bodied red-fruit flavors. The tannins provide a firm grip.
Name: Tenor 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Syrah, this medium-bodied, soft and juicy red offers notions of berry pie and dusty leather, as backbeats of chocolate and blackberry play on the palate. With an intensely lengthy finish marked by clove this wine is memorably inviting.
Name: Whitehall Lane 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Dusty tannins make for a soft texture in this wine that's subtle in dried fruit, Christmas spice, chocolate and clove. It delivers flavor and complexity without attitude, a savory expression of the grape from a relatively cool climate.
Name: Ca' Momi 2013 Reserve Merlot (Carneros)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: More Bordeaux-style blend than varietal wine, this is a combination of Merlot (75%) from Conner Lee, Dionysus, and the Benches along with Red Mountain Cabernet and Wahluke Cab Franc. Aromas of ripe red currant, blackberry and violets are followed by full-bodied fruit flavors that pack a wallop. It shows the warmth of the vintage but still brings finesse.
Name: Pedestal 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from DuBrul and Meek vineyards, this wine brings light aromas of herb, vanilla, raspberry, orange peel and black licorice. The palate offers a mouthful of tart fruit flavors that are simultaneously sleek and generous.
Name: Stevens 2013 StevensMerlot Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fleshy and unctuous in flavor yet tautly structured, this neatly balanced Merlot offers loads of bright cherry and raspberry flavors layered into wisps of toast, spice and cedar. Its brisk puckery style makes it an ideal dinner wine. Fine-grained but persistent tannins on the finish suggest ageability well into the 2020s.
Name: Waters Crest 2013 Grand Vin Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Good fruit concentration and a velvety texture make this deeply colored, dry wine substantial enough for a special occasion. It smells like spicy oak and tastes like ripe black cherries and blackberries, with a smooth mouthfeel.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2013 Merlot (California)

Description: Wild red berries, crushed pepper, lilacs and a frame of asphalt show on the exuberant nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with meat, smoke, cedar, charcoal and easy boysenberry flavors, the perfect pairing for a hamburger. It is a tad light in body, especially since it hasaged for so many years.
Name: DeTierra Vineyards 2010 Russell Estate Merlot (Monterey)

Description: With an addition of 3% Petit Verdot, this wine sources from Andy Beckstoffer's Missouri Hopper Vineyard in Oakville and Benessere in St. Helena. It impresses in brown sugar and berry pie, the underlying foundation succulently fruity as savory touches of clove and pencil shavings begin to show amidst the firm tannin.
Name: Marilyn Merlot 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This opens with a touch of reduced oak, never letting go of its sizable full-bodied cradling of wood and tannin. In the glass it begins to unfold and reveal juicy, rich red currant, cassis and berry seasoned in clove.
Name: Merryvale 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This squat bottle comes, indeed, straight from the barrel with no filtering, and works quite well. Bright and plump purple fruits mix with vanilla and a tickling acidity on the nose. The palate shows juicy cherry fruit as well as blackberry and blueberry, with richness from vanilla and caramel. The tannins are a bit tough, but rugged in the right ways.
Name: HammerSky 2013 Straight de Barrel Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is an elegant integration of aromas on the nose of this bottling, with black cherry, smoked beef and a touch of tobacco. The mouthfeel is very soft and full, presenting flavors of blueberry, crushed asphalt and tart black plum skin. A solid sipper now, it's likely to improve with some aging.
Name: Ancient Peaks 2013 Merlot (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Char, toast, herb and red-fruit aromas are followed by plump red and blue-fruit flavors, speckled with coffee accents. It shows a pleasing sense of balance.
Name: Novelty Hill 2013 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cocoa, plum and spice aromas are followed by lush blue-fruit flavors. Vanilla notes are speckled throughout.
Name: Januik 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: An aroma like black pepper and turned earth leads to flavors that are more savory and smoky than fruity. This is a sturdy, fairly tannic and full-bodied wine that wants to pair with rich proteins.
Name: Lyeth 2012 Merlot (North Coast)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Subtle whiffs of raspberry and watermelon entice on the nose of this dry Merlot rosé. Elegantly concentrated and pleasantly puckering, it's a thirst-quenching quaffer to enjoy well into the fall season.
Name: Billsboro 2015 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Rosé of Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Subdued herb, red fruit and spice aromas are followed by quite reserved cherry and berry flavors. It displays a lot of restraint.
Name: Gordon Estate 2013 Block 3 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a lushly concentrated, likable wine, soft in tannin and subtle in oak, with strong layers of black plum, berry and espresso.
Name: Wellington 2012 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: Spicy, minty aromas and rich flavors like dark chocolate and black cherries add up to a bold, full-bodied wine from the Lange Twins. It has a deep color, moderate tannins to add grip to the texture and a lingering finish.
Name: Sand Point 2013 Merlot (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasing aromas of cocoa, dried herb and red fruit lead to a full-bodied palate with a tight core of grippy tannins. Vanilla and spice notes run throughout.
Name: Januik 2013 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: A strong element of minty eucalyptus shows in this wine that is full bodied on the palate and integrated in oak, with an accent of clove. Fruity berry pie and mocha round out a softened, approachable texture that'll pair well at the table.
Name: Kenwood 2013 Estate Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Barrel aromas of vanilla and coconut are followed by fruit-forward cranberry and raspberry flavors and a vanilla-filled finish. The oak plays prominently.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2013 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cocoa, toast and char aromas are out in front of red-fruit notes. The flavors are generous and full, with fruit and barrel flavors intertwining on the finish. The tannins bring some grip.
Name: Novelty Hill 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: An attractive oaky theme runs through this medium-bodied and appropriately tannic wine. It smells like toasted bread, cinnamon and vanilla, and tastes both fruity and full of oak spices.
Name: Grayson 2014 Lot 6 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine and the entire brand often punch above their weight, in this case showing black cherry, cedar, dried dill, crushed graphite and peppercorns on the nose. The palate offers oregano and dill at first, but proves silky with dried cherry and cranberry fruit.
Name: Cycles Gladiator 2014 Merlot (Central Coast)

Description: Dry, spicy berry aromas are pedestrian but fine. This is tight, fresh and a touch scraping on the palate, with plum, currant and roasted flavors. Spicy, minty and solid on the finish, this is a perfectly good Merlot with limitations.
