Name: Viña Requingua 2013 Toro de Piedra Grand Reserve Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of pickling spices, cranberry and raspberry, with green herbs lurking in the background. The palate is fruit filled and quite flavorful for the vintage, showing finesse and polish.
Name: Coach House 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tire rubber, smoke, cranberry and red-currant aromas lead to quite-sweet plum flavors. The palate provides appeal but the aromas are difficult to get around.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2014 The Expedition Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Dry peppery currant and red-plum aromas are light and nothing you haven't come across before. Plum flavors are a touch baked, with a chocolaty backdrop. A solid finish with savory, spicy plum notes is satisfying.
Name: Echeverria 2013 Gran Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: There's menthol on the nose of this light-bodied, unfussy red, memorable for its big, drying tannin and oak. Savory fruit is accompanied by a taste of soy.
Name: Ca' Momi 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine has a good, deep color, lots of fruity aromas and flavors, and a smooth mouthfeel. It tastes grapy and jammy but dry, with light spicy accents to add interest.
Name: Domino 2013 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The aromas are shy on this bottling, but with patience show gravel and blackberry juice. The mouthfeel is also a bit light, offering dark red and purple fruit alongside asphalt and espresso bean.
Name: Pomar Junction 2013 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light but relatively interesting aromas of black cherry, oregano, dill, pipe tobacco and cedar show shyly on the nose of this bottling. The shaved cedar is strong on the palate that is light in mouthfeel, and shows the same notes as the nose.
Name: Hayes Valley 2014 Merlot (Central Coast)

Description: Fresh and fruity aromas and flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy. It has an earthy smell at first, but that blows off quickly. The mouthfeel is smooth, almost sweet. .
Name: Gen5 2012 Merlot (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of tire rubber, plum and red currant are followed by sweet plump fruit flavors. Chalky tannins provide the frame.
Name: Diversion 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This easy-to-drink wine combines a lightly oaky aroma with good but light fruit flavors and savory accents. It's dry and well balanced, with a smooth mouthfeel.
Name: Earth's Harvest 2013 Merlot (California)

Description: This is an easy-drinking, crowd-pleaser of a wine. Light to medium bodied, it has fresh strawberry and cherry flavors and a soft, smooth texture.
Name: Coast 2014 Merlot (California)

Description: Raw, earthy plum aromas are spicy and lightly herbal. This feels saucy yet monotone. Tomato, red-plum and herbal flavors end with a hint of brown sugar and a continuation of the wine's herbal plum character.
Name: Chilensis 2013 Reserva Estate Bottled Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Gritty and earthy up front, with generic plum scents, this feels hard, tannic and in need of more body. Roasted, oaky flavors of hickory and saucy plum finish dry, woody and hollow.
Name: Viña el Aromo 2012 Private Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Smooth and soft, this easygoing wine has mild fruit and oak-spice flavors, low acidity and a touch of sweetness to round off any edges.
Name: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Merlot (California)

Description: This rusty-colored Merlot opens with roasted, herbal, burnt aromas of plum and currant. Light, fresh and saucy on the palate, this tastes of tomato sauce, pepper and barely ripe plum. Herbal, savory and green on the finish.
Name: Tres Palacios 2013 Family Vintage Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: This rich, wood-aged wine is impressive and well aged. It may be made from Merlot but it tastes thoroughly Portuguese with its dry tannins, mint flavors and intense ripe fruit. The tannins are cushioned by this juicy, rich fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Nelson Neves 2011 Reserva Merlot (Bairrada)

Description: Offering aromas of blackberry, strawberry and green bell pepper, this wine has flavors of raspberry, strawberry, black cherry and leather. The fruit flavors are jammy on the palate and strong tannins and equally strong acidity make for a pleasing wine.
Name: Hacormim 2014 Adi 13 Merlot (Israel)

Description: Medium ruby along the rim, with purple in the core, this Merlot starts off with ripe red cherry and plum on the nose, with fern and warm spice adding nuance. The palate is soft and plush, with grippy black-tea tannins supporting juicy red-fruit flavors.
Name: Lovingston 2014 Josie's Knoll Merlot (Monticello)

Description: Ripe and soft, this is a smooth wine. With its attractive black fruits and the lightest touch of tannin, it is fruity with a hint of toast. Drink this wine now.
Name: Fiuza 2015 Merlot (Tejo)

Description: The nose of this wine is all about oak, with toast and char leading the way. The palate follows suit yet shows a bit more fruit, with grilled red-berry flavors washing over a lithe, crisp palate.
Name: Veramar 2014 Estate Club Merlot (Virginia)

Description: Underripe red plum and currant aromas are flecked with prickly fern notes on the nose. The light-bodied palate is marked by tart red berries and bitter green stems.
Name: Rosemont 2013 Merlot (Virginia)

Description: From a vineyard 1,500 feet above the valley floor in Soda Canyon, blended with 4% Cabernet Sauvignon from Morisoli Vineyard, this is a beautiful beast of a wine, concentrated in red cherry and plum as well as mocha. Nicely weighted with soft tannin and length, it's well made and should age. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Elyse 2012 Hossfeld Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: One of the producer's signature wines, in a region becoming well-known for the variety, this elegant, herbal-tinged wine does not part with the Napa Valley's imprint of boldness in its length and breadth of rich red fruit, clove, vanilla and toasted oak.
Name: Trefethen 2013 Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Description: The winery's first varietal Merlot is a blend of fruit from the Canoe Ridge, Stone Tree and Cold Creek vineyards. The aromas are locked up at present with notes of dark fruit, crushed flowers and spice that lead to ripe, plush fruit flavors backed by a firm spine of tannins that need time to unwind. It's the most unabashedly forward wine this winery has made to date. Give it plenty of time to open up; it delivers.
Name: Waters 2014 Merlot (Washington)

Description: This wine impresses in its succulence of black cherry and plum, the oak and tannin tamed and integrated to allow for a sensuality of texture along with such a boldness of flavor. Despite the concentration and ripeness, the wine is relatively light and easy to enjoy at the table.
Name: Byington 2013 Frei Vineyard Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Description: This 100% Merlot could be mistaken at first for Cabernet, so structured and bold it initially appears. Cassis, blackberry, spicy clove and pepper combine effortlessly against a layered concentration of body and weight, finding structure along the way. Drink now through 2021.
Name: Yates Family Vineyard 2013 Fleur de Veeder Merlot (Mount Veeder)

Description: This is an impressive undertaking, made from estate vineyards across the region, all certified sustainable. Medium in build and intensity, it allows acidity to balance out the strong, interwoven tannin and power to remain buoyant in high-toned cherry and currant. It finishes with a flourish of cinnamon spice.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Grand Reserve Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of spice, red fruit and milk chocolate are followed by an opulent palate of fruit and barrel flavors. It appeals on every level.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Wisps of cocoa powder and cinnamon lend a warm, spicy tone to this rich, berry-toned wine. Ripe black plum and blackberry flavors are lipsmackingly fruity but calibrated neatly by crisp acidity and fine, chalky tannins. The finish is long and lingering.
Name: McCall 2009 Reserve Corhaug Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This is made from 100% of the variety, organically farmed. It offers a soft approachability that will appeal in its plum and black cherry, the acidity lifted and well integrated with the oak.
Name: Casa Nuestra 2011 Estate Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with 8% Cabernet Sauvignon, this mountain-grown wine offers bold black plum and berry around a compacted, extracted fullness of tannin and French oak. Dried herb, clove and vanilla accent the fruit, while the finish lingers gingerly.
Name: Pride Mountain 2013 Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of cocoa, raspberry, black tea, vanilla and cranberry are in full bloom. The cranberry and cherry flavors are ripe and full, backed by firm tannins. This wine is in a sweet spot. Drink now.
Name: Liberty Lake 2009 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: There's tremendous value in this well-made wine. It's savory in its mix of dried herb and plum notes, with smooth, softened tannins and judicious use of oak that lends richness to the palate. It'll appeal broadly.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Vintner's Reserve Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe yet deftly balanced, this full-bodied wine offers an abundance of blackberry fruitiness balanced by tones of granite and dried herb. It's sumptuous and expansive on the palate, finishing long with fine, sharply edged tannins.
Name: Harbes Family Vineyard 2013 Proprietor Reserve Hallock Lane Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with notes of barrel spice, mocha, herb and red fruit. The palate is very pretty, almost delicate, with the tannins showing some grip.
Name: Pepper Bridge 2013 Estate Vineyards Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe, rich blackberry and plum notes abound from nose to finish in this bold, deeply concentrated wine. The palate is velvety in texture, edged by a fine, chalky frame of tannins and lively cranberry acidity. Hints of pepper, dried herb and lavender lend nuance to a long finish.
Name: Wölffer 2013 Lambardo Merlot (Long Island)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lavish aromas of deep purple violets and blackberry jam are spiced with touches of licorice on this rich, nuanced and tasty bottling. Blueberries and elderberries shine through on the palate, with lavender, black tea and cedar flavors.
Name: Midnight 2012 Merlot (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Despite the trend for dry rosé, there's something to be said for a bright, berried sip accentuated by balanced sweetness. This wine hits just that spot of pristine, delicately sweet cherry flavor juxtaposed with zesty acidity and a spry, mineral feel.
Name: Harbes Family Vineyard 2014 Semi-Dry Rosé Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While demure on the nose, this revitalizing, citrusy rosé offers a firm punch of raspberry and pink-grapefruit flavors. Dry and guzzably thirst-quenching, it's an ideal summer apéritif.
Name: Croteaux 2015 3 Rosé Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A bit firmer and more powerful than the producer's regular bottling, the Vintner's Select boasts a core of black cherry and cassis accented by shades of bramble and forest floor. Rich, rounded and full bodied, it's balanced by a streak of cranberry acidity and lingering notes of anise.
Name: Clovis Point 2013 Vintner's Select Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fresh, fruity flavors of sun-ripened blackberries contrast with savory notes of smoked nut and granite in this elegant wine. Nervy acidity and a clean, mineral edge makes it refreshing and quaffable through the summer, but it's also substantial enough to enjoy with food well into autumn.
Name: McCall 2015 Marjorie's Rosé Corchaug Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal, this wine is a blend of fruit from top sites Ciel du Cheval, Conner Lee, Obelisco and Stonetree. The aromas are quite reserved, with notes of barrel spice that are followed by full-bodied fruit flavors with a spicy finish. It drinks well but the variety seems lost.
Name: Guardian 2013 Confidential Source Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of lavender and violet lend a perfumed, floral edge to this stylishly composed wine. Full bodied and supple on the palate, it's moderately concentrated with crisp blackberry and cherry flavors. Penetrating but fine-grained tannins bristle on the finish.
Name: Lieb 2014 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Savory bramble and crushed-mineral tones lend complexity to ripe flavors of blueberry and plum on the palate of this wine. Medium bodied in style, it's balanced by a streak of cranberry acidity on the midpalate and rigid, fine-grained tannins.
Name: Bedell 2013 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich black cherry, cola, turned earth and smoked meats show strongly in the inviting nose of this bottling from the San Luis Obispo County appellation's namesake winery. A fine-grained tannic structure kicks off the palate, where smoked blueberry and elderberry meet with leather flavors, all carrying a decent weight for such an affordable wine.
Name: Edna Valley Vineyard 2014 Merlot (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer light notes of vanilla, plum and clove. The palate is full and generously flavored, with the tannins bringing some grit.
Name: Three Rivers 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Decadent chocolate and coconut macaroon accent sweet tannin and generous oak in this softly textured wine, made in small amounts. The finish is powerful and ripe.
Name: Joseph Cellars 2012 Limited Edition Release Merlot (Oakville)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Brimming with ripe black plum and cherry flavors, this densely concentrated wine is unabashedly fruity and forward. It's well balanced though, showcasing crisp acidity and nuanced hints of rose petal and granite. Fine-grained but penetrating tannins persist on the finish.
Name: Martha Clara 2014 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas show notes of chocolate and raspberries, sprinkled with violets and fresh herbs, not seeming to have fully blossomed. The palate is elegant and refined, displaying a lovely sense of restraint. Smoked-meat flavors linger on the finish. It doesn't always come off as entirely varietal but brings a lot of enjoyment.
Name: J & J 2013 Estate Wine Middleton Petty Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Exuberant aromas of cocoa and raspberry with light herb accents are followed by fresh, forward fruit flavors backed by lightly grainy tannins that bring some astringency.
Name: Columbia Winery 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Layers of coffee, vanilla and spice lend an oaky undertone to this plump, easygoing red. The palate is approachably fruity, offering a generous dose of fleshy plum and cherry flavors. Feathery fine tannins and a kiss of vanilla mark the finish.
Name: Clovis Point 2013 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of barnyard and bramble lend rusticity to this wine, contrasted by fresher, prettier notes of rose petal and blackberry jam. It's a charming Merlot marked by crisp black-fruit flavor, sprightly acidity and dusty, lingering tannins.
Name: Diliberto 2013 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Red currant and dried-herb aromas lead into sweet cranberry and cherry flavors. It goes down easy.
Name: Original House Wine 2013 Mountain Merlot (America)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of milk chocolate and spice accent this sumptuously rich, silky wine. Ripe black cherry and berry flavors are approachably juicy and fruity, fringed by soft, feathery tannins.
Name: The Old Field 2010 Commodore Perry Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Brisk and bright, this bottling showcases a more cutting expression of Merlot. Crisp black cherry and plum flavors are accented by bramble and a touch of sage. The finish lingers long, fringed by fine, firm tannins.
Name: The Old Field 2010 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of sweet pastry introduce this bright, summery Merlot sparkling. Fun and fizzy, it fills the palate with rich, creamy mousse and sweet-tart strawberry-yogurt flavor.
Name: Croteaux 2015 Cuvée Sparkle Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of baking spice, vanilla and red fruit lead to well-balanced red-fruit and barrel flavors that taper toward the finish, with coffee flavors lingering.
Name: Columbia Crest 2013 H3 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coffee, smoke, herb, blue-fruit and barrel-spice aromas are at the fore. The palate provides soft, easy-drinking fruit and barrel flavors that linger.
Name: Milbrandt 2014 Traditions Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite the warmth of the vintage and the growing region, this wine comes off as green aromatically. The flavors show ripeness but there seems to be a disconnect.
Name: Bunnell 2013 BDX Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Candied cherry and berry aromas abound on the nose of this dry rosé, but the palate is surprisingly elegant. Pristine red cherry and raspberry flavors are fresh and bright, accented by savory, slightly bitter hints that lend nuance to the finish.
Name: Harbes Family Vineyard 2014 Dry Rosé Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vineyard designated Merlot is a rarity in the state, though this is one of the three the winery made in this vintage. Amped volatile aromas and generous barrel spices are followed by light, slightly dried-out cranberry and cherry flavors.
Name: Almquist 2009 Chandler Reach Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Baking spice and dried cherry and cranberry aromas lead to lighter-styled fruit flavors with a gentle grip of tannins. It trails on the finish.
Name: Almquist 2009 Northridge Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cranberries, raspberries and herbs lead to broad rich flavors. The tannins bring a little astringency but it offers enjoyment.
Name: Castle Rock 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tire rubber, currant and spice aromas are followed by pleasing, plentiful dark-fruit flavors. The tannins bring some grit.
Name: Sagelands 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The volatiles are high while the flavors offer notes of cranberry and cherry that provide enjoyment.
Name: Almquist 2009 Konnowac Vineyard Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe blackberry and plum flavors resonate at the core of this big, full-bodied wine. It's a bit jagged in nature though, juggling contrasts of ripe fruit with sharp acidity. Soft, chalky tannins frame the finish.
Name: Sannino 2013 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Off dry and a bit sugary in style, this easygoing rosé offers intensely ripe, slightly ruddy strawberry and cherry flavors. The finish is brisk and clean.
Name: Sannino 2014 Bianca Dolce Rosé Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump blueberry and blackberry fruit meet with crushed slate and root-beer notes on the nose of this widely available bottling. It's a bit thin in body and a tad sweet-leaning, but shows caramelized black fruit and rocky earth on the palate.
Name: Castle Rock 2013 Merlot (Central Coast)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intensely ripe cherry and berry flavors mark this plush, softly structured rosé. It's easygoing, fruity style is approachable.
Name: Sannino 2014 Bianca Rosé Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While initially quite smoky and nutty on the nose, this light-bodied wine does release prettier notes of cherry and raspberry with some aeration. Soft acidity lends heaviness to the plate. The finish is brisk and clean.
Name: The Old Field 2014 Cacklin' Rosé Dry Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: There's a dullness to this wine, which flirts with the idea of plum and cherry flavor yet gets somewhat bogged down in marshmallow. Light bodied, it presents with more ripe sweetness than it may actually have.
Name: Cannonball 2014 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes off as quite green especially considering the variety, vintage and appellation. Aromas of bell pepper and green herbs lead to cherry and savory flavors, with the tannins bringing some heft.
Name: Latah Creek 2012 Fries Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine has classy, complex aromas that combine sophisticated oak and spice notes with very generous, deep fruit flavors. The way it all comes together seamlessly on a posh but firm texture shows the winemaker's skill as well as some great grapes to start with.
Name: The Winery SF 2011 Merlot (North Coast)

Description: Voluptuously full-bodied and smoky, this 100% varietal wine imparts characteristics of cedar, herb and cigar on its grippy and generous palate. This is a reserve-level wine that delivers on that promise, it finishes awash in fists of black pepper.
Name: V. Sattui 2012 Reserve Stock Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very heady and earthy aromas of cedar, tobacco leaf, smoked cigar and the hint of ancho chile show on the nose this unique, cool-climate take on Merlot. The palate is quite woodsy with cedar and pine but also jammy with red fruit, bolstered by bitter dark chocolate and dried chile pepper.
Name: Beauregard 2012 Zayante Vineyard Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Merlot is on the comeback trail and this is a very fun style made by respected vineyard manager Erik Mallea. Woody red and black cherry meet with cola on the nose, while the palate remains bright, fruity, refreshing and easy to quaff. Flavors of black cherry soda meet with a milk chocolate character, yet without any overdone richness.
Name: Mallea 2012 Merlot (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine combines deep, ripe fruit flavors, light spicy accents and a very firm mouthfeel that begs for a bite of a grilled rosemary lamb chop. The wine pushes the stereotype of wimpy Merlot out of the way and does it with fruit concentration rather than obvious oak. Drink through 2020.
Name: Chacewater 2013 Made with Organically Grown Grapes Merlot (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Chocolate and blackberry form an impressively generous and full-bodied personality in this 100% varietal wine aged 22 months in a hearty percentage of new oak. Big tannin and traces of cigar and espresso continue on the brawny theme.
Name: Herencia 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Made at an attractive price point, this wine delivers value and plenty of flavor, from blackberry jam to oak and black pepper. It's sturdy and structured, ready for the table or larger gathering.
Name: Napa Cellars 2013 Classic Collection Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: A healthy addition of 12% Petit Verdot plays well in this wine. This is exuberant in black plum, chocolate and black pepper, with full-bodied and present oak, yet it also has a soft, approachability to the palate.
Name: Beaucanon 2011 Cuvée Louis Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is inky dark in color, potent in flavor and huge in structure. The aromas are like smoke, dried herbs, and blackberry, the flavors are concentrated in black currant, while the texture is saturated with fine tannins that make it almost chewy. This is full bodied, dry, and needs either time to mellow out or some juicy protein alongside.
Name: Silver Palm 2013 Merlot (North Coast)

Description: A powerful and concentrated wine, this has dark fruit aromas like black cherry along with black pepper and wood smoke, plus strong, ripe flavors from cherry to blackberry and black currant. It also has a lot of tannin and good acidity, and will mature into a softer feel over time.
Name: Brutocao 2010 Reserve Merlot (Mendocino)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh pressed black raspberry and light lavender and lilac show on the tart and peppery nose of this bottling from the Riboli family's broad collection. The structure is chalky and thick on the palate, with flavors of olallieberry paste, blueberry and wet clay, all quite tasty though not extremely complex.
Name: San Simeon 2012 Quarry Heights Vineyard Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A strong vein of cedary, spicy oak blends nicely with rich, fruity, savory flavors in this full-bodied and lavishly styled wine. Concentration and a sense of layering combine for good depth of flavor, while a grippy but velvety texture of fine tannins keeps it feeling fresh.
Name: Lava Cap 2013 Estate Bottled Merlot (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Vanilla and caramel show right away on the nose of this bottling, followed by stewed blackberry and black plum sauce, proving quite jammy but layered with burnt sugar aromas. Blackberry pie in a vanilla crust is the flavor that pops on the palate, along with black plum and all manner of purple fruit and flower.
Name: Four Sisters Ranch 2011 Limed-Edition Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Delicious ripe berry and cherry flavors make this medium-bodied wine very lush and fruity. It does have moderate tannins for texture, but the richness of fruit just drenches the palate.
Name: Bonterra 2013 Merlot (Mendocino)

Description: This medium-bodied wine has bold aromas of black pepper, tobacco and clove that merge with straightforward cherry and herb flavors for a nicely complex profile. It has way more depth and interest than the price tag would suggest.
Name: McManis 2014 Merlot (California)

Description: Big tannin overpowers this full-bodied, concentrated wine with lurking acidity, built around complex layers of drying oak, cedar, currant and cola. Soft on the palate, it presents a powerful interpretation of the variety, while retaining its essence.
Name: Saddleback 2013 Estate Merlot (Oakville)

Description: This is an appealing, dry, and well-balanced wine, with everything in good proportions. It has lots of fresh cherry aromas, good and deep fruit flavors and a light but tasty layer of toasted, smoky oak.
Name: Fetzer 2014 Eagle Peak Merlot (California)

Description: Extremely ripe fruit flavors fuel this full-bodied, no-holds barred wine. The aromas are like blackberry jam and raspberry syrup, and the flavors are almost that extreme, but the wine is technically dry. A very viscous texture wraps it up.
Name: Fallbrook 2012 Reserve Merlot (California)

Description: Aromas like cedar and heavily toasted bread meet very ripe black cherry and plum flavors, for a full-bodied wine that's not shy about the oak influence. While the wine is big, the texture is rather soft and smooth.
Name: Noble Vines 2013 181 Merlot (Lodi)

Description: Big, smoky fruit and a nicely honed structure combine well in this full-bodied wine with touches of red cherry and berry and toasted wood.
Name: Pope Valley Winery 2013 Eakle Ranch Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Yes, this is a rosé of Merlot from high altitude vineyards in the south of France. It's medium in weight, offering hints of red berries, wild herbs and wet stones and a clean, refreshing finish. Drink now.
Name: Marrenon 2015 Rosé de Merlot Les Grains Merlot (Mediterranée)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Chewy and tannic, this has plenty of barrel flavors, but is light on the fruit. Coffee, caramel and toasty components are all here, seeming to smother any ripe fruit that might fill out the middle.
Name: Soléna 2014 Wooldridge Creek Vineyard Merlot (Applegate Valley)

Description: This ruby red Merlot has aromas of cherry vanilla, black plum and black cherry and flavors of red plum and dried cherry. The finish is persistent with mouth drying tannins.
Name: Cramele Recas 2014 Legendary Estate Series Merlot (Romania)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Generous flavors of red and black cherry, and a nice, firm coating of fine tannins make this full-bodied wine good and substantive. Those dark fruit flavors are fairly deep and concentrated, and linger on the finish.
Name: Lyeth 2013 Merlot (North Coast)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A fruity and rich-tasting wine, this has black plum and mild oak aromas, ripe cherry and slightly savory, beefy flavors along with a nice, velvety texture. It is dry, medium bodied and drinker friendly.
Name: Greenwood Ridge 2013 Estate Bottled Merlot (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Don't look for much flesh here—it's a light, quaffable style with suggestions of hard cherry candy. Barrel aging adds highlights of ground coffee, with firm acidity carrying the finish.
Name: Reustle 2014 Maranatha Bloc Merlot (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Despite the excellent vintage, this seems more tannic than ripe. The fruit is simple and leafy, with tea flavors and a chalky finish.
Name: Soléna 2012 Wooldridge Creek Vineyard Merlot (Applegate Valley)

Description: This might be a touch volatile at first, but saucy tomato-like aromas are offset by fresh red-plum notes. A tight and tannic palate softens with time in the glass, while berry flavors carry herb and spice notes onto a lightly herbal finish.
Name: Echeverria 2014 Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: A soft fruitiness and smooth texture make this medium-bodied red easy to enjoy. Strawberry and cherry notes rest easily on a bed of light tannin that adds an appetizing mouthfeel.
Name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2013 Merlot (California)

Description: Aromas of black berry and black cherry lead to flavors of cherry vanilla and red plum before a soft tannic finish.
Name: Cramele Recas 2015 Dreambird Merlot (Romania)

Description: Dark in color and jammy on the nose, this seemingly ripe Merlot smells of plum, blackberry and raisin. In the mouth, it's blocky and tannic, with nonintegrated high acidity. Salty, briny blackberry flavors finish peppery and with drying, hard tannins.
Name: Rios de Chile 2014 Reserva Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: This medium-bodied wine smells like a cherry pie, tastes quite ripe and fruity, and has a smooth texture and lightly sweet finish.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2013 The Revivalist Merlot (Lodi)

Description: This medium-bodied wine shows hints of mint and cedar in the aroma, and light cherry and raspberry in the flavor. It's pretty nicely balanced and user friendly.
Name: 786 Wines 2014 Merlot (California)

Description: Spunky, piquant red-berry aromas contain elements of horsehide and grass. This feels mostly full and juicy, with good structure. Herbal, oaky plum and berry flavors end with a touch of oak spice and a lingering herbal, green component.
Name: Concha y Toro 2014 Reserva Casillero del Diablo Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Cedary, spicy aromas and flavors rather than a strong fruit character define this medium-bodied, soft-textured wine. It is heavy on the spice and light on acidity and tannins.
Name: Leaping Horse 2014 Merlot (California)

Description: A very drinkable, light and easy to like Merlot, this offers ripe notes of black plum, cherry and berry on the nose and mouth, with a faint hint of milk chocolate in the background. The soft mouthfeel and fruity palate finish short, but clean.
Name: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Merlot (Pays d'Oc)

Description: Forced, candied aromas of chocolaty oak and herbal, slightly weedy berry fruits feed into a chunky, blocky, creamy palate with saucy berry flavors combined with minty, top-heavy oak. The finish tastes minty, lactic and oaky, with heat.
Name: Montes 2014 Classic Series Merlot (Colchagua Costa)

Description: Cherry and plum aromas lack purity and turn more earthy, horsey and unclean upon airing. Sharp, cutting acidity creates and jagged palate, while flavors of sour black plum and cherry finish with saucy notes on a choppy, short finish.
Name: Kunza 2014 Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Wow. Juicy, expansive and effusive, this wine is made from 100% estate-grown dry-farmed, relatively old vines of the variety, and introduces itself as a Cab-lover's version, with explosions of black pepper and plum that soften to a polished point on the finish. Mouth-filling, it wraps in complex notions of cedar, cigar and dark chocolate. Drink some now and some later; cellar through 2023.
Name: Venge 2013 Oakville Estate Vineyard Merlot (Oakville)

Description: A classically made expression of the variety, with 16% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot, this wine is soft and easygoing, rounded with a subtle grip of black plum, cherry and dark chocolate. Full bodied, it exhibits a tension of leather and black tea with dried herb on the finish, begging for pepper steak, the texture soft and silky. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Twomey 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of balsamic vinegar, leather and spice accent this rustic yet elegant Merlot. Ripe red cherry and raspberry flavors brighten the palate, but complexities of tobacco and riding saddle maintain that deeply savory tone. Coarse, fine-grained tannins and brisk acidity lend structure and gravitas.
Name: Raphael 2012 First Label Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc each make up just 3% of this wine, they seem to show themselves aromatically, with herb and floral notes that provide the backdrop for Merlot's cocoa and cherry. The red fruit flavors are plump and juicy, backed by bright acid that leads to a long, fruit filled finish. It doesn't always come off as completely varietal but it's nearly impossible to resist all the same.
Name: Seven Hills 2013 Seven Hills Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: A succulence veering on sweetness, but of the ripe fruit variety, not cloying kind, lies at the heart of this nicely made wine, highlighted in dark cherry, mocha and cola. A sticky structure with tension drives the palate, balanced by a voluptuous undercurrent.
Name: Passaggio 2013 Coplan Vineyards Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of baking spice, vanilla and dark cherry are followed by lush, thoroughly delicious cranberry and pit-fruit flavors that persist, with soft, plump tannins backing them up. It's a hedonistic example of the variety: equal parts fruit and oak and 100% delicious.
Name: Kontos 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Smoky plum and spicy clove surround a hearty core of barbecued meat aromas and flavors, giving this wine a full-bodied weight of decadence. Toasted oak and soft tannin round out the experience, a nice version of the variety from a specific site.
Name: Trinchero 2012 Vista Montone Vineyard Daybreak Block Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A variety of top sites are blended together for this wine, including Seven Hills, Bacchus, Dionysus, Klipsun and Pepper Bridge. It offers bright aromas of raspberries and chocolate, with herb and floral accents. The palate is flavorful and full, delivering a lot of enjoyment, with the tannins adding some heft.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Like many of Raphael's red wines, there's a deeply savory, leathery rusticity here that resonates powerfully. Ripe black cherry and plum flavors are cut by streaks of tart currant and cranberry acidity and a rigid frame of tannins. It's a bold, densely structured wine that should improve with cellaring. Drink from 2020 through 2025.
Name: Raphael 2013 First Label Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A nicely made wine at an attractive price, this offers crowd-pleasing elements of juicy black cherry, cassis and cedar around smoky oak and a medium-bodied concentration that remains succulent on the palate.
Name: Previous 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Soft, rounded waves of red plum become succulent on the palate without overwhelming, despite a full-bodied style and personality. A heave of subtle tannin plays out to add body and weight as the wine develops in the glass.
Name: St. Francis 2013 Behler Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Description: This is a nice wine, sanguine with specks of cinnamon, chocolate and cherry, held up with polished tannin and a touch of grip that gives it substance, before finishing softly and quietly humbled.
Name: Silenus 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine blends in 13% Cabernet Sauvignon, offering a nose of chocolate, barbecue and tobacco. Burly, yet balanced, the highlights include black currant, cherry, clove and plenty of cedar and sage.
Name: Starmont 2013 Merlot (Carneros)

Description: Light wisps of raspberry and strawberry highlight a restrained sense of winemaking, allowing soft tannin to buoy the fruit and medium acidity.
Name: Corner 103 2012 Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Made from Merlot grapes repassed, or fermented over, the pomace of previously fermented Petit Verdot and Malbec grapes, this powerful Merlot is imbued with a distinctly bold, textured mouthfeel and firmness of tannins. It's deeply, richly concentrated in black cherry and berry flavors, but there's also an intriguingly briny, umami element that reverberates through a long finish.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2014 Ripasso Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Lipstick cherry and vanilla provide a burst of red fruit succulence around a core of big oak and a leathery midpalate marked by dried sage. Drying tannins belabor the finish, before rediscovering its lovely, though bold, expression of fruit.
Name: Folie à Deux 2013 Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Description: Savory in personality and at first austere, this wine blossoms into a full-bodied, concentrated and tight-woven exploration of black cherry and dark chocolate, accented by 1% each of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Elegant, it's also bold, and will successfully appeal to Cab drinkers.
Name: Matanzas Creek 2012 Jackson Park Vineyard Merlot (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Warm spice, vanilla and cedar tones accent blackberry and cherry on the nose of this ripe, luxurious Merlot. Fleshy black fruits are densely concentrated on the palate, refreshed by a cool menthol breeze that extends through the finish. Powerful tannins linger.
Name: Benmarl 2013 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This affordable offering from a prime site within the appellation introduces itself with burly, smoky undertones and a thick skin, remaining grippy and smoky in black fruit throughout. Full bodied, it shows the warmth of the vintage and ripeness of valley floor grapes.
Name: Gibbs 2012 Money Road Cuvée Merlot (Oakville)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The vanilla, coffee, red apple and hay aromas are initially quite light and not fully in sync. The red fruit flavors are rich and full, pulling no punches.
Name: Dumas Station 2013 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: From the cool-climate Beckstoffer Lake Carneros vineyard site, this wine opens in a thickness of blue and red berries, the tannins soft and integrated yet weighted by a puckering persistence to the palate. Dried herb and cedar round out the highly full-bodied, ripe finish.
Name: World's End 2013 Little Sister Reserve Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Fruit comes from three places for this wine, Bennett Valley, Alexander Valley and Knights Valley, exhibiting some good blending skill in the cellar. Red currant, clove, cedar and pencil all appear around a full-bodied, leathery texture and dots of black pepper and sage.
Name: Matanzas Creek 2012 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This is a 100% varietal wine from a site in the heart of the valley, made in big, bold, robust style with layers of black fruit and tea, kept fresh by a trace of lively acidity. Medium tannin and oak underlie plenty of heat. The wine is made by Charlie Tolbert, a longtime resident and winemaker in these parts.
Name: Dunbar 2012 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, oak, toast and a confectionary note come together on this ripe red. On the smooth, structured palate, licorice and ground pepper accent a core of dried black cherry.
Name: Fiegl 2009 Leopoldo Merlot (Collio)

Description: Subdued aromas of scorched earth, dark cooking spice, black currant and a whiff of game emerge in the glass. The ripe palate offers mature dark-skinned berry, vanilla, tobacco and toast alongside mellow tannins. Drink through 2018.
Name: Elena Walch 2011 Kastelaz Riserva Merlot (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged just over a year in American oak, this vineyard-specific wine is leathery and dull at first, before it gains power and a distinct spiciness of clove and cassia in the glass, supported by black cherry and plum. Medium bodied, it's a food-friendly choice.
Name: Pedroncelli 2013 Bench Vineyards Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of coffee, vanilla, woodspice and red fruit are at the fore. The cranberry and cherry flavors are quite sweet, backed by astringent tannins. The oak dominates at times.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2012 Estate Grown Blocks 10, 11 & 12 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicebox, dark raspberry, vanilla and toasty oak aromas are followed by reserved, well constructed fruit flavors that taper toward the finish.
Name: Bridge Press 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Smoky black olive and hints of clove make for a compellingly savory wine that's lean and otherwise soft in crisp red fruit. A bigger grip of tannin shows through on the finish.
Name: Dominican Oaks 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Juicy plum, raspberry, blackberry and vanilla interweave in this straightforward, approachable and pleasant wine, accented in cedar and pretty aromatics of sage and herb.
Name: Summers 2013 Reserve Merlot (Knights Valley)

Description: This is a well-made, larger-production offering of the variety that's appealingly round, soft and juicy, with a luxuriousness to the texture on the palate, generously surrounded in a big-bodied style of black cherry and vanilla.
Name: St. Francis 2013 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Spicy in cinnamon and sultry tropical coconut, this wine offers a freshness of red fruit, true and varietal, with soft, lean layers of body and weight.
Name: Merriam 2011 Windacre Estate Merlot (Russian River Valley)

Description: Considerable aromas of eucalyptus, Bay leaf and cedar rise to the front of this wine, making for an inviting, savory introduction that provides a reasonable complexity. Easygoing, approachable and softly light bodied, it'll do well at the table and big-crowd events.
Name: Benziger 2013 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This is a fine wine, reflective of the vintage's generosity and approachable nature, giving off flavors of vanilla, cherry and currant alongside a sanguine, gamey character and smoky full-bodied ripeness.
Name: Chelsea Goldschmidt 2014 Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Description: This wine presents itself full-bodied and big in style, with an inkling of red plum and cherry fighting for attention against a tide of rounded concentration and darker, smokier tinges of cigar and chocolate.
Name: St. Francis 2013 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Upfront scents of blackberry and plum lead the nose of this wine, while denser notes of muddled berries, chocolate raspberry and tree bark unfold on the medium-weight palate. Hints of earth and pepper lend depth to the finish. Drink now.
Name: Café du Midi 2015 Merlot (Vin de France)

Description: This is a soft, nondescript wine at first, with mild notes of black cherry, plum and black olive, that's likable and rounded on the palate.
Name: Peter Franus 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This fruit-forward wine offers plenty of ripe plum, cherry and berry aromas and flavors, with accents of black-forest cake and chocolate sauce on the palate. The mouthfeel is easy and refreshing, while the finish is short but clean and refreshing.
Name: Voiturette 2015 Merlot (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Herbal scents of carnation and blackberry leaf mingle with fruity tones of blueberry and black cherry on the nose of this accessible Merlot. The light tannins and soft, ripe fruit flavors yield a friendly and approachable structure, making this a clean and easy to drink selection.
Name: L'original French Kiss NV Merlot (Vin de France)

Description: Smoke and oak lounge around heartier notions of black pepper and leather in this soft, approachable wine with vague accents of cedar and herb. Lengthy on the palate, its awash in firm tannin and blackberry-vanilla.
Name: Rodney Strong 2013 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Floral tones of carnation and purple violet are upfront on the nose, followed closely by ripe, jammy fruit notes of raspberry, plum and blackberry that follow through to the softly structured palate. A touch of milk chocolate adds decadence, but the finish fades fast.
Name: Le Val 2015 Merlot (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This offers assertive aromas and flavors of banana, strawberry bubblegum, watermelon and blueberry. The palate is lightweight and fruity, with a sharp acidic edge and a short, fleeting finish.
Name: Romantic 2015 Authentic & Chic Merlot (Vin de France)

Description: This is a 100% varietal wine, with a dullness to the nose and a simplicity to the palate that makes it hard to distinguish, the fruit and acidity diluted.
Name: Tedeschi Family 2012 Stargazer Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine tastes sweet and grapey, with a softness that becomes cloying and a preponderance of baked flavor.
Name: Peter Cellars 2013 Estate Merlot (Carneros)

Description: This is an amazing wine at this price point, fun and easily enjoyable in its mix of soft, velvety red fruit and firm grip of tannin, backed by plenty of acidity. Stock up for larger gatherings and for midweek meals.
Name: Camp 2014 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This full-bodied, voluptuous wine is spicy in red fruit and floral aromas that lend it a finessed, elegant air. Soft and round, with structure and acidity, it ends in bittersweet chocolate and clove. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Snowden 2013 Lost Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: A fairly elegant expression of the variety, this wine is bright in cherry kirsch and pretty aromas of rose petal and lavender, structured to age and enjoy with food. Rector Creek Vineyard is just north of Yountville and planted in rocky alluvial soils. Drink now through 2022.
Name: Duckhorn 2012 Rector Creek Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Made from several high-class sites, including Hyde Vineyard and Beckstoffer's Carneros Lake/Las Amigas Vineyard, this is a cooler-climate, 100% varietal wine. Juicy in crisp red fruit, it also has elements of pencil lead and cedar, giving an edginess of savory complexity that's interesting and long-lasting.
Name: Duckhorn 2012 Merlot (Carneros)

Description: There's a healthy 17% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Cabernet Franc in this wine, which is classically structured in red fruit, soft oak and peppery spice. Its cedar notes speak to the Cab within, while the overall texture and breadth of the wine is lengthy, food-ready and impressive.
Name: Frog's Leap 2013 Merlot (Rutherford)

Description: This is a robust, dense and tannic wine, with 8% each of Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. It needs time to unravel what are now just mere suggestions of coffee and black-cherry jam, with seasonings of cedar, peppercorn and dried sage. Full bodied, ripe and highly structured, this should be enjoyed in years to come, through 2023.
Name: Shafer 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Brawny and concentrated in black fruit, this wine includes 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and is touted as a Cab-lover's Merlot by the winery. It indeed is, with its juicy blackberry, cherry, espresso and clove notes, while remaining varietally correct in terms of its mellowed tannins.
Name: Grgich Hills 2012 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a meaty and soft wine with a lot of power behind it. Plummy, slightly jammy yet structured, it features appropriate accents of peppercorn, cedar and toasted oak. Full bodied, it's enjoyable now and a deal to boot.
Name: Trig Point 2013 Diamond Dust Vineyard Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: This is a strong wine from this region just south of Temecula and north of San Diego. The nose offers smoked cigar, blackberry preserves, raw cut wood and pine-needle aromas, while the palate packs juniper and floral tea elements into a black-plum backbone. Hints of soy and burned caramel add action to the medium-weight mouthfeel.
Name: Fallbrook 2011 33 Degrees North Gracie Hill Vineyard Merlot (South Coast)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is impressively dark, with dense but grapy fruit flavors right out front. The mouthfeel is sharp and spicy, and it thins out surprisingly in the middle, given the color and rather high alcohol. Sappy acids and raspy tannins carry it through the finish.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2014 Aroha Vineyard Merlot (Umpqua Valley)

Description: The producer picks from cooler sites to preserve the wine's freshness and acidity, succeeding in this majority varietal wine, blended with 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Petit Verdot. Light and easygoing on the entry, it traffics in crisp red and black berry plus inviting notes of herb before finishing in powerful tannins.
Name: Hall 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Made in a style that will appeal to Cabernet Sauvignon fans, this full-bodied wine is thickly layered, packed in blueberry and plum with a slap of toasty oak on the backside. With a leathery, rounded texture, it sparks in spicy vanilla as it goes down.
Name: Hanaiali'i 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very reliable and rewarding for everyday drinking, this wine packs lush black cherries, well-integrated purple flowers, savory roasted beef and touches of salted caramel and oak into the nose. Cooked blueberries, caramel and French-toast flavors show on the palate.
Name: San Simeon 2012 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clay and minty cola aromas give nuance to the soft, dark, perfectly ripe blueberry fruit on the nose of this wine. Fine-grained but sticky tannins and a pinch of acidity frame the sip, where dark-roast espresso, beef char and cigar smoke flavors reign.
Name: Hunt Cellars 2010 Unforgettable Destiny Vineyards Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The alcohol doesn't weigh heavily on this rich wine. The wood aging does, at least for now, giving spice and burnt wood aromas. Underneath there are black fruits that are developing into a rich, perfumed wine that will have a smooth texture. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Guillaman 2012 Les Hauts de Guillaman Merlot (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: From the mountainous terrain of Stagecoach Vineyard, this wild, concentrated wine is more like Cabernet in many ways. Red licorice, bitter tannin and whiffs of leather saddle commingle against brambly blackberry and clove, finishing with a tease of coconut.
Name: Duckhorn 2011 Merlot (Atlas Peak)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intriguing notes of sandalwood and cedar meet with dark red fruit and a touch of black pepper on the nose of this wine. The palate is layered with interesting touches of sage, marjoram, gravel and tar, hints of black cherry and loamy earth, and a chalky mouthfeel.
Name: Martellotto 2014 La Gioja Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Made with 21% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Malbec and 1% Petit Verdot, this estate-grown wine is made in small lots and offers aromas of baked bread and red fruit from the get-go. The Cabernet shows its presence, and there's a wealth of bitter, leathery tannin offset by soft, approachable oak.
Name: Medlock Ames 2013 Heritage Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong gravel, slate and other rocky mineral elements show on the nose of this wine, which also boasts black-cherry compote aromas. The palate is also earth-driven, with wet clay and flint flavors holding throughout the sip. It's distinctive if only on one strong note.
Name: Robert Hall 2013 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine plays with the herbal, slightly green side of the Bordeaux grape, with oregano, thyme and just-cracked pepper spicing up the soft red strawberry and plum fruit on the nose. Dried herbs show strongly on the palate, alongside elderberry fruit and cedar.
Name: Maddalena 2011 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is slightly austere at the start, despite its fuller body and style. Leathery and dusty in tannin, the black and blue fruit remain elusive, teasing in between bouts of coffee and chocolate.
Name: Chelsea Goldschmidt 2013 Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The black-cherry fruit on the nose of this wine is a little sour, lifted by coffee grinds and incense. The tip of the sip is ripe with blueberry, then hardens around stiff tannins and zingy acidity, finishing on smoke and crushed herbs.
Name: Broken Earth 2012 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: One of B.C.'s best Merlots, this really shines in 2012. Supple, smoky and harmonious, it boasts lush blackberry and plum fruit, decorated with baking spices and a finishing streak of sea salted caramel. It's smooth, medium weight, and perfectly balanced.
Name: Burrowing Owl 2012 Merlot (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of herbs, pencil lead and blue and red fruit are forward, fresh and appealing. The flavors follow similarly, showing depth and balance uncommon for a wine this price.
Name: Charles Smith 2013 Velvet Devil Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Oak and spice components fill the aroma. The flavors are rich and concentrated, making this a big yet seductive wine. Layered and complex, this full-bodied wine is well supported by fine, velvety tannins.
Name: Steele 2012 Stymie Founder's Reserve Merlot (Lake County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of red currant, raspberry and cranberry are quite ripe, with cedar notes providing an accent. The palate is high octane with the fruit not quite having the intensity to match.
Name: K Vintners 2012 Northridge Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Included in the blend are small portions of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, but this is Merlot with a dark side all its own. Smoke, rubber and tar highlights augment a wine with black fruits, stiff tannins and threads of licorice and sage. It's not your mama's Merlot, but it's authoritative and interesting.
Name: Mission Hill 2013 Reserve Merlot (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blueberries and black cherries meet with rose petals, dark chocolate, brown spice and black tea on the nose of this bottling from a historic vineyard. The mouthfeel is soft with creamy tannins that grow grippier across the sip, showing cedar, black-cherry mousse, baking spice and a tinge of acidity.
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2013 Merlot (Santa Barbara County)

Description: The raspberry aromas are bright and jammy. The flavors are sumptuous yet elegant, going down easy.
Name: Colter's Creek 2012 Colter's Creek Vineyard Merlot (Idaho)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla and baking spice are followed by ample red fruit and spice flavors. The acids are tart, giving the wine a zing.
Name: Merry Cellars 2013 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cocoa and spice notes mix with red currant and plum. The palate is elegant in style and brings a fine sense of balance and appeal to the mouth.
Name: Whispering Tree 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The somewhat prominent herb aromas don't seem varietal. The red-fruit flavors are considerably more germane, though the tannins come off as a bit sticky.
Name: Two Vintners 2012 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Reticent herb, mineral, barrel spice and red-apple aromas are followed by concentrated fruit flavors. The tannins this vineyard is often known for are kept well in check.
Name: Efeste 2012 Upright Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-cherry syrup and gravel touch the nose of this bottling from an estate in northern Paso owned by television producers. The palate shows clove and allspice as well as intriguing olallieberry and dark strawberry fruit, laid across a fairly tannic, asphalt-driven structure.
Name: Villa San Juliette 2013 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bold boysenberry flavors and a broad, juicy texture make this full-bodied wine appealing and easy to enjoy. The texture is moderately tannic and everything tastes well proportioned.
Name: Boeger 2014 Merlot (El Dorado)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Plush black cherry and berry flavors are off set by layers of bramble, herb and dark toast in this slightly savory Merlot. Showing more restraint than intensity, it's an elegant wine framed by crisp acidity a fine fringe of tannins.
Name: Belhurst 2013 Traditions Merlot (New York)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry, herb and sugared-plum aromas are followed by easy-drinking red-fruit flavors that show a sense of balance that keeps the interest high.
Name: Skyfall 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel notes of spice, vanilla, caramel and herbs lead to red- and blue-fruit flavors, with the tannins showing some astringency. Merlot wouldn't be a first guess but it still brings appeal.
Name: Waterbrook 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Merlot has a nose of violets, cherry cola and talc powder. In the mouth, it tastes like red berries, blackberries and finishes with touch of milk chocolate.
Name: Bostavan 2013 Via Etulia Reserve Merlot (Moldova)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of game, vanilla, anise and woodspice are out in front of plump red-fruit flavors backed by grainy, dry tannins. Drink now.
Name: :Nota Bene 2012 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: Good balance, traditional flavors and a great price make this wine an easy-drinking gem. It tastes dry and slightly tannic in a good way that gives it texture, and has Merlot's typical plum and light herb notes.
Name: Bota Box 2013 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Heady notes of cedar and pine lend a woodsy undertone to plump blueberry and black cherry flavors in this slightly soft, yielding Merlot. Delicate acidity and whisper-light tannins add to its plush feel. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Heron Hill 2013 Reserve Ingle Vineyard Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's not much overt fruit on the nose of this wine, which instead shows plenty of papilla chile and bell-pepper elements. The body is light and peppery, proving easy to sip with red fruit and peppercorns, leading into a vanilla-kissed finish.
Name: Firestone 2012 The Chairman Series Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Though it's designated as reserve-level, and lists rather high alcohol, this seems thin, stemmy and green. The fruit is nearly invisible. The addition of 14% Cabernet Franc has not had any noticeable impact. Drink up.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2012 Oldfield Series Merlot (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Turned earth, coffee grounds, asphalt and dried cherries show on the mushroomy nose of this widely available bottling. Black tea and strong coffee flavors emerge through a thick veil of chunky tannins.
Name: Liberty School 2013 Merlot (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Merlot-centric wine brings aromas of herbs, soy and dried raisins, seeminlyg a bit past it prime. The flavors are lightly and the tannins seem dried out. Drink now.
Name: Matteo 2011 Red Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Merlot-based rosé smells cheesy and not all that fruity. Chunky and obtuse on the palate, this tastes of generic citrus and berry fruits. An adequate finish is par for the course.
Name: Otazu 2014 Rosado Merlot (Navarra)

Description: Grapes for this 100% varietal wine—the family's first estate Merlot under this name—are grown on the Grieve Family Vineyard in Lovall Valley, just above cool Carneros. Concentrated and showing integrated oak, it reveals cedar and dried herb around subtle fruit components of plum and cassis. It finishes soft and balanced in a flurry of cocoa.
Name: Grieve 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Inky redviolet to the eye, this wine has a nose of chocolate covered espresso bean, cherry and raspberry. Restrained tannins provide a backdrop for flavors of black cherry, mocha, raspberry, and mint. There is a good balance of fruit and cooling herb flavors, while berry flavors hold their own and linger on the palate through the mint-heavy finish.
Name: Recanati 2014 Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine from a great appellation, this has a weightiness of tannin on the entry that softens in the glass, unveiling classical characteristics of blueberry and violet, the oak subtle and spicy on the finish.
Name: Martin Ray 2013 Merlot (Stags Leap District)

Description: This is a medium-bodied, fleshy and floral wine, happy in violet aromas and a light spiciness of nutmeg behind the soft layers of black plum and cherry. With a yeasty backbone reminiscent of baked bread, it is fulsome and balanced.
Name: Havens 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Aromas of black cherry, clove, black pepper and chocolate lay the groundwork for flavors of ripe black cherry, strawberry, chocolate, fennel bulb and black pepper. A hint of coolness arrives towards the finish in a burst of eucalyptus, but restrained tannins and final notes of bright fruit make for a satisfying experience.
Name: Tulip Winery 2013 Just Merlot (Judean Hills)

Description: Lightly charred cherries and plums take on additional oak tones of cocoa powder and espresso. The palate is fresher in character, boasting juicy red plum around a tight core of dusted minerals. Medium bodied and supported by grippy, sandy tannins, a shading of dark chocolate lingers on the finish of this well-balanced offering.
Name: Hawthorne 2012 Reserve Merlot (Old Mission Peninsula)

Description: Sweet oak aromas of coconut and vanilla sugar cookie are firmly integrated into a layer of red cherry and plum. The plush palate follows suit, with tart currant keeping things in balance. A hint of fuzzy fern fronds lingers on the finish.
Name: Chateau Grand Traverse 2012 Reserve Merlot (Old Mission Peninsula)

Description: This is a young-colored wine that has been wood aged to smooth out the natural fruitiness of the Merlot. That gives the wine a smoky character with juicy acidity balanced by wood and toast flavors. The black plum flavors are rich, full in the mouth with a dry underlay of tannins. Drink from 2017.
Name: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Reserva Tinto Merlot (Tejo)

Description: Cherry stems and red plum aromas show meekly on the nose. This cool-climate Merlot is plush in feel, with soft yet grippy tannins offering support to a palate of fleshy plum and tart currant. A streamlined mineral vein keeps the focus.
Name: Brys 2012 Estate Grown Merlot (Old Mission Peninsula)

Description: Aromas of black cherry and green frying peppers prepare the palate for flavors of cherry, blackberry, green bell pepper and licorice. Smooth tannins and strong fruit flavors are slightly overcome by green notes, and the cool bell pepper finish yields soft touches of cherry.
Name: Tabor 2011 Adama Merlot (Galilee)

Description: This is a well-crafted, likable wine made at a fair value. The tightly wound mix of red fruit and licorice softens on the palate to offer approachability and a bite of tannin and oak.
Name: Kenwood 2013 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: The color of black cherries, this wine offers a bouquet of boysenberry and violet with notes of summer farm stand. It is slightly stiff in the mouth, with flavors of raspberry, cranberry, spearmint and black pepper. Cool sensations hold sway over fruit flavors right into the minty finish.
Name: Tabor 2013 Mt. Tabor Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tart, acidic hard-candy fruit flavors come through, along with hints of sweet spices. But the wine quickly hits a wall, stopping abruptly in a short, tight finish with austere tannins.
Name: Griffin Creek 2012 Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Description: Deep black cherry in the glass, this wine has a fruit-forward nose of raspberry and watermelon. Flavors of tart cherry and cranberry are quickly overcome by tannins that are a little too stiff for their own good.
Name: Recanati 2012 Reserve Manara Vineyard Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This fails to overcome its thin, unripe fruit. Strong scents of smoke and oak carry into the flavors, bringing a bitter end to the finish.
Name: Plaisance Ranch 2012 Merlot (Applegate Valley)

Description: Ruddy black plum and cocoa notes finally emerge with copious swirling in the glass under a blanket of VA. The palate feels a bit tart and astringent, with dark plum-skin flavors dominating.
Name: Three Fires 2010 Reserve Merlot (Lake Michigan Shore)

Description: This pure expression of Merlot opens with enticing scents of red woodland berry, crushed flower, smoke and exotic incense. The silky, structured palate boasts a range of flavors, including juicy wild cherry, raspberry jam, licorice, tobacco, vanilla and cinnamon, while velvety tannins offer seamless, polished support. It's already elegant and thoroughly delicious, but it will age well too. Drink 2018–2028.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2012 Patrimo Merlot (Campania)

Description: Slight smoke and dark plum, a hint of polished mahogany and the merest touch of leather suggest restrained elegance and complexity. The palate is just medium-bodied but of such subtle balance that the entire wine becomes utterly seductive even though heat is palpable. There are dark, brooding elements of fruit that play above the taut, grippy but fine structure. What a distinguished, beautiful rendition of Merlot.
Name: Netzl 2012 Bärnreiser Merlot (Carnuntum)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Woodspice and vanillin are out in front on the aromas followed by mocha, raspberry and dark fruit. The palate brings lush, concentrated flavors and a lingering finish. It drinks beautifully now sbut should have a long life ahead of it.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is a standout, with seasoned, full-bodied layers of peppercorn, clove, cinnamon and jammy plum, balanced in weight and length, with just a hint of sanguine character. While it plays the savory card successfully, it dabbles judiciously in dark chocolate, too, finishing like a chocolate kiss.
Name: Joseph Carr 2012 Merlot (Rutherford)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brooding on the nose, this bottling by a newer producer shows crushed herbs, slate, leathery blackberry and blueberry fruit, smoked meats and a touch of minty tobacco. There is great structure on the palate, with fine-grained, chalky tannins presenting blackberry fruit, black-pepper spice, oak smoke and touches of crushed oregano.
Name: Brave & Maiden 2012 Estate Limited Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This is a lovely, 100% varietal wine, balanced between savory, almost sanguine meaty notes, and complex layers of cassis, plum and blueberry. Medium bodied with an elegance at its core, it has streaks of subtle cinnamon that give spiciness, and a finish dusted in Mexican chocolate.
Name: Flora Springs 2012 Windfall Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This polished wine is accented with small amounts of Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Juicy, spicy and leathery, it has a smoothness to the texture, the tannins well integrated and permissive of the plummy fruit. The finish has a smoky, mocha tinge.
Name: Merryvale 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cedar, vanilla, raspberry, coffee, herbs and barrel spice are followed by concentrated fruit flavors backed by firm tannins. It's a delicious example of the variety.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Cold Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The mocha, spice and dark raspberry aromas seem quite locked-up at present. The red and black fruit flavors meanwhile show subtlety and depth.
Name: Five Star Cellars 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Malbec (17%) and Syrah (6%) in the blend make themselves known, with aromas of dark plum and peppery spices plus a toasty top note. Plump in feel, the flavors trail slightly toward the finish.
Name: J. Bookwalter 2013 Foreshadow Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Old Merlot vines from a five-acre parcel have given this powerful and dense wine. Solid with dark-plum fruits and still-dry tannins, it also has a fine texture and freshness to balance. It is juicy while also young. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Lanbersac 2012 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry, licorice and dark-fruit aromas lead to plump, fleshy fruit flavors. It's an unabashedly warm-vintage wine that brings a lot of drinking pleasure.
Name: Full Pull & Friends 2013 Red Willow Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Structured in young tannins, this wine has a nice mélange of leather, blackberry, clove and black tea that provide substance and flavor, with additional savory specks of graphite. Light bodied and soft, the acidity behind the fruit suggests further aging, through 2020.
Name: Rutherford Hill 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of huckleberry, herbs and spice are fresh and focused. The fruit flavors are concentrated, with a supple feel and soft tannins. It displays a good sense of balance.
Name: Hogue 2013 Genesis Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: On 15 acres on the hill above Angélus and under the same ownership, the vineyard is 100% Merlot. This wine is ripe with red fruits, with a structure that shows the chalk soil. Tannins and a dense texture will allow it to develop over the medium-term. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Bellevue 2013  Saint-Émilion

Description: The first Merlot offering from this producer, this is 100% varietal and totally full-throttle in its fleshy components of vanilla and chocolate, seasoned in cinnamon. Fresh and somewhat floral, it's bright despite its size and lively on the palate. The wine is made in tiny amounts.
Name: Cornerstone 2012 Oakville Station Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a well-structured and elegant wine, despite its size. Bright red cassis and cherry play under tannins that hit on the back of the palate, taking a moment to soften. Herb and cedar mark the finish.
Name: Ballentine 2013 Estate Grown Merlot (St. Helena)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blueberry, grapeseed, leather, cigar box and concentrated lavender combine for an elegantly intriguing nose on this bottling from a winery between Morgan Hill and Gilroy. The palate is fresh and rather light, with plums, figs, crushed peppercorns and a forest floor/pine needle intrigue.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2010 Estate Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A mountaintop vineyard in a cool year delivers the expected lighter elegance, offering a complicated and fascinating array of aromas, from incense and white pepper to patchouli and potpourri. The palate starts with sour cherries before the herbal lift of fennel and dill arrives, proving a light, curious and tasty wine.
Name: Burrell School Vineyards 2011 Honor Roll Estate Reserve Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas of vanilla, coconut and toast are at the fore followed by luxurious coffee and plum flavors that linger. Grainy tannins back it all up.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Indian Wells Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brooding aromas of coffee, vanilla and herbs lead to elegantly styled fruit flavors that taper toward the finish.
Name: Gamache 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High-toned aromas of raspberries, mint, nori and green herbs are followed by black-tea flavors and slightly gritty-feeling tannins. It brings appeal but the variety seems hard to find.
Name: OS Winery 2013 Sonas Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: A big, soft and expressive wine, this will appeal to a wide range of palates with its fair price and easygoing tannins and integrated oak. Between the juicy blackberry and blueberry, hits of espresso take it to more luxurious places.
Name: Markham 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: While unusual for the variety, the herb, lemon and orange zest, berry, green pepper and asphalt aromas provide intrigue. The fruit flavors are plump but light, showing good length. This wine provides enjoyment, though Merlot wouldn't be a first guess.
Name: ded.reckoning 2013 Flintlock Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas of vanilla and graphite take the lead. The red-fruit flavors are ripe and jammy. There are plenty of good things going on but they don't quite all come together.
Name: Mercer 2013 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)
