Description: This pure Merlot is racy, ripe and ready to drink, with fruit that shows maturity. Tannins are well integrated into the structure, leaving plenty of room for the juicy fruit and mature, spicy flavors. Drink now.
Name: Château l'Espérance 2011 Les Cèdres  (Côtes de Bourg)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, coconut shavings, earth and dark-fruit aromas are followed by full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. It delivers enjoyment, but the variety seems to get lost in the oak.
Name: Genoa 2012 Leeway Reserve Boushey Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: From vineyards in Oak Knoll and Yountville, this wine begins with a tranche of thick tannin and smoky barrel-influenced char. In the glass it evolves into a juicy, fruity delight, rich in dark plum and raspberry. Made to please Cabernet Sauvignon fans, it finishes in cedar and chocolate.
Name: Educated Guess 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal, this wine leads with an unusual assortment of aromas that include anise, smoke, cigar box, vanilla and ripe blackberry. The flavors are tart and compact with a grainy feel. It provides intrigue but the variety seems to get lost.
Name: Elevation Cellars 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: An element of menthol-cinnamon chewing gum shows on the nose of this wine, grown at high elevations above the Sonoma Valley. High-pitched acidity buoys velvety red fruit, with a clay-like flavor and texture to the tannins.
Name: Korbin Kameron 2012 Estate Grown Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cherries spiced by cloves and black peppercorns show on the nose of this widely available wine. The palate is tense at first and bright with nearly singeing acidity, showing a touch of richer fudge around the edges.
Name: Irony 2013 Small Lot Reserve Merlot (Monterey County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bit reluctant on the nose, this slowly shows boysenberry, purple flowers and hibiscus aromas. It's relatively light on the palate too, with dainty notes of strawberry, pomegranate and cola, proving uncomplicated and easy to quaff.
Name: HammerSky 2012 Red Handed Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Sourced from vineyards in the Oak Knoll District, this 100% varietal wine is thick in tannins and bright in red fruit, a mix of cherry, cassis and cranberry. Leathery and relatively heavy on the palate, it finishes in black tea and clove.
Name: J. McClelland 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Brambly blackberry and leathery tar make for a full-bodied atmosphere around what is actually a fairly light, integrated and smooth wine. Clove and black currant give the finish a spicy edge.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a value play that succeeds in its smooth, integrated-yet-sizable tannin weight and mix of cherry, plum, chocolate and earthy mushroom. It finishes with a flourish of bittersweet black tea.
Name: Tangley Oaks 2012 Lot 13 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Lactic oak and rubbery black fruit aromas lead to a wiry, acidic palate. This is limited in its flavor range, with plum and berry flavors leading the way. An edgy feeling finish with plum and snappy acidity is not too demanding.
Name: Vistamar 2013 Reserva Sepia Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Made with the addition of 13% Syrah, this wine is leathery, with aromas of saddle, cedar, plus a touch of tar and graphite. Tightly wound, it needs time to open in the glass before revealing softer aspects of black plum and blueberry swaddled in chocolate.
Name: Oberon 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: A thick, tannic wine robust in blackberry, tar and tobacco, this full-bodied experience needs time to open in the glass.
Name: Darjean Jones 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: An earthy, funky block-designated wine, this tastes thin despite its fuller-bodied alcohol level. A plethora of fresh-picked herb and forest characterizes this effort, which finishes in thick tannin.
Name: Hendry 2013 Hendry Block 13 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Edgy, herbal aromas are low on fruit. For basic Merlot, this isn't bad. It's full in body, with solid tannins. An herbal, peppery, green-infused plum-and-raspberry finish is tannic and scratchy.
Name: San Pedro 2013 Castillo de Molina Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Volatile aromas include pie cherry and red plum. In the mouth, this is choppy and aggressive. Herbal red-fruit flavors are woody but also green, while an herbal, oak-driven finish is brisk and edgy.
Name: Caliterra 2013 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of cinnamon, kelp, and dried fruit are unusual and don't seem in harmony. The gamy flavors bring some appeal but don't entirely come together.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sonoma County-Napa County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This puckering, tannic and brawny wine has a lot of body and a shyness of fruit, lingering in clove and tobacco.
Name: Ghost Pines 2013 Winemaker's Blend Merlot (Sonoma County-Napa County)

Description: This wine has an overtly oaky nose. Following suit, the palate is resiny and sticky in feel, with little fruit flavor but a whole lot of cheap-tasting wood character.
Name: Santa Ema 2013 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a vineyard once planted to Golden Delicious apples, this 100% varietal wine is herbal and a touch green, thin with chalky tannins and a taste of dried cranberries.
Name: Toad Hollow 2012 Richard McDowell Vineyard Merlot (Russian River Valley)

Description: Green, soupy aromas of tomato are blatant and harsh. This is decent in terms of mouthfeel, but it reverts to herbaceous, leafy flavors of bell pepper and grass that finish with nothing but pyrazines.
Name: Tres Palacios 2013 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: A burly, full-bodied, high-octane wine, this is brooding in dark plum, chocolate, black peppercorns and thickly rolled cigar. Showing off the vintage's power and warm weather, it starts ripe and ends ripe, a celebration of Napa Valley sun.
Name: Rocca 2012 Grigsby Vineyard Merlot (Yountville)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Opulent fruit flavors and an almost thick texture make this delicious and dramatic. The aromas pop with blackberry and cherry, flavors resemble blueberry juice and the mouthfeel is rich and nicely tannic.
Name: Kimmel 2012 Merlot (Mendocino County)

Description: This bold wine has a very dark color and fresh, concentrated blackberry aromas. Generous berry and black pepper flavors seem to saturate the taste buds, leading to a lingering fruit and spice finish. The texture is almost viscous, as lots of fine tannins add grip. It's the rare wine with no added sulfites.
Name: Frey 2013 Estate Grown Biodynamic Merlot (Mendocino)

Description: Complexity and varietal character come through in this concentrated, well-balanced and smoothly polished wine. It is full bodied and lightly tannic, but so oozing with flavors that it's still easy to sip. The array of black plum, light sage, and black olive flavors is accented with very light oak.
Name: Dark Horse 2013 Merlot (California)

Description: Brioche and vanilla-cherry are the stars in this full-bodied yet savory, herbal wine sourced mostly from the Oak Knoll District. Complex in flavor, it spikes in clove and cinnamon, finishing with a taste of gunpowder and tobacco.
Name: Padis 2011 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Lots of dark-fruit flavor, an ultrasmooth texture and a lingering finish raise this medium-bodied and value-priced wine well above average. Black cherry and blackcurrant flavors are sprinkled with spices recalling nutmeg and cardamom.
Name: Montevina 2013 Omira Hills Merlot (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the producer's estate vineyard, the grapes planted on budwood from Napa Valley's famous Three Palms, this wine is bittersweet in tannin and flavor, a mix of blueberry, cedar, resin and clove. Full bodied in style, it maintains an elegance on the finish, marked irresistibly in dark chocolate.
Name: Longboard 2013 DaKine Vineyard Merlot (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Spicy, oaky aromas grab attention, followed by black plum and cherry flavors and a firm structure of tannins and acidity. This is full bodied and rather powerful in both flavor and mouthfeel.
Name: Cartlidge & Browne 2013 Merlot (North Coast)

Description: Tasty plum and red cherry flavors and an easygoing texture make this medium-bodied wine a pleasure to drink. The aromas are quite fruity and fresh, accented with oaky, spicy notes, and the flavors seem generous. A touch of tannin provides welcome structure.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2012 Merlot (California)

Description: This medium-bodied wine has aromas that suggest strawberry jam and maple syrup, and equally fruity and ripe flavors. Touches of vanilla and chocolate add a bit of unctuous complexity, and the mouthfeel is velvety.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2012 The Revivalist Merlot (Clarksburg)

Description: Soupy tomato, plum and green tobacco aromas feed into a pinched biting rubbery palate. This Merlot tastes roasted and oaky, with baked plum and berry flavors matched by clove and chocolate notes. A drawing tannic finish tastes stewy and woody.
Name: Ferllen 2011 Reserve Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: While this wine is packed with red-berry flavors, it is still too young with its stalky edge. Tannins and smoky flavors are there along with intense acidity. Keep it until late 2016 for it to be at its best.
Name: Château Laulerie 2014 Merlot (Bergerac)

Description: Aromas like brown sugar and bourbon meet bold oaky, spicy flavors in this medium-bodied wine. This will be good for fans of those exotic oak flavors.
Name: Leese-Fitch 2013 Merlot (California)

Description: Made in a relatively light-bodied, soft style, this wine has a weedy, herbal element at its heart, and could use more fruit to balance out. It ends in a taste of bittersweet chocolate and espresso.
Name: Buena Vista 2012 Merlot (Carneros)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This pure varietal seems underripe, with scents of mushrooms and tar, and no fruit in sight. The finish turns bitter, with dry tannins.
Name: Del Rio 2013 Estate Grown Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Description: This wine is soft and juicy without great focus. It has a light feel, with fresh jammy red fruits and a gentle breeze of tannins. Drink now.
Name: Le Haut Païs 2014 Merlot (Périgord)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense and luxurious aromas of oak-laden red currants, blueberry, peppercorns and melted dark chocolate greet the nose on this hearty bottling. The flavors are lighter than the nose suggests, yet the silky texture evolves quickly to deliver plenty of espresso bean, vanilla, blueberry and blackberry elements, all clinging to a strong tannic structure.
Name: San Simeon 2011 Estate Reserve Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: This appellation has shown great promise with the variety and this wine demonstrates why. Aromas and flavors of dried and baked plum center on a juicy, soft core, accented in pencil shavings and cedar. Red cherries and a long finish complement the whole.
Name: Frostwatch 2012 Merlot (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine provides a unique aroma profile of boysenberry, coffee, toast and chocolate. The flavors are full bodied, concentrated and rich with a lingering finish.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Ethos Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The cocoa, cherry, raspberry and toast aromas bring plenty of appeal. The flavors deliver richness but without excessive weight.
Name: Northstar 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's a whole lot of appeal in this wine, with aromas of dark raspberries and barrel spices leading to rich, full-bodied fruit flavors with a velvety texture. It's a shamelessly appealing example of the variety.
Name: Full Pull & Friends 2012 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coffee, dark chocolate, dark raspberry and spice aromas lead to full-bodied, palate-coating dark-fruit flavors backed by grainy tannins. The barrel influence rides high but it generally pulls it off.
Name: Market Vineyards 2011 Alpha Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A fantastic cinnamon and red pepper character helps this full-bodied wine stand out from the crowd. It also has tasty cherry and plum flavors and firm tannins, but the spicy candy personality makes it unique and memorable.
Name: Chacewater 2012 Organically Grown Grapes Merlot (Sierra Foothills)

Description: With just a handful of Malbec, this wine takes time to open before becoming juicy, herbal and elegant, expressive in tobacco and black tea. The tannins fine and dry.
Name: Flora Springs 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Classy, complex aromas and flavors make this full-bodied contribution from the Sierra Foothills quite attractive and interesting to drink. It smells like baking spices and cedar shavings, tastes fruity like cranberries and adds a good amount of acidity and firm tannins to firm up the texture.
Name: Chatom Vineyards 2010 Merlot (Calaveras County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fresh-smelling and generous in flavors, this full-bodied wine tastes like plums and black cherries with hints of dried herbs. A savory, almost meaty quality makes it rather serious and complex in a good way.
Name: Boeger 2013 Merlot (El Dorado)

Description: A mushroomy underbelly lies beneath a layer of leather and graphite, making for a tight, dry wine with sizable tannin structure. Powerfully concentrated, this wine holds 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and is not for the faint of heart.
Name: Kenefick Ranch 2012 Estate Grown Merlot (Calistoga)

Description: From the cooler climes of Carneros, long a good match for the variety, this wine offers sanguine notes of cranberry on the nose, before developing a soft, flavorful core of dusty cinnamon and baked plum.
Name: Beaulieu Vineyard 2012 Maestro Collection Merlot (Carneros-Napa Valley)

Description: Aromas of vanilla, black cherry, toasted coconut and graphite give little insight into a flavor profile that is dominated by ripe cherry and red raspberry. Fruit flavors reign strong, with just a touch of toasty spice on the bright finish.
Name: Quadratus 2011 Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Dark, luxurious streaks of blackberry and cherry lend heft and silkiness to this full-bodied Merlot. Subtly spiced, it's accented by sprightly acidity and fine, feathery tannins in the midpalate.
Name: Ventosa 2009 Merlot (Seneca Lake)

Description: Toasty, roasted aromas of earthy plum and berry fruits set up a full-bodied but friendly palate of soft tannins. Dark, oaky, minty flavors of black fruits finish with peppery spice, good length and some heat.
Name: Alto Los Romeros 2013 Gran Reserva Triumpheros Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cocoa, toast, vanilla, cigar box, coconut and raspberry aromas lead the way on this 100% varietal wine. The palate is full of dark fruit flavors with slightly gritty tannins and tart acids. Give it some time to come together.
Name: Airfield Estates 2012 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A plume of fresh blossoms and herbs lends lift to this plush, full-bodied Merlot. Luscious, creamy swirls of blackberry and cherry syrup penetrate deeply on the palate but are contrasted by sharp notes of sour cherry and cranberry. It's a brawny, fruit-forward wine, but not overbearing in stature.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2012 Block 137 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The toast, freshly ground coffee, dark chocolate and cherry aromas pop. Plum and chocolate flavors are smooth in feel and linger on the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2013 Grand Estates Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Ripe black-plum and black-cherry aromas lead the nose. This is full in body, with comfortable tannins. Blackberry and baked blueberry flavors end with chocolaty, herbal notes and a coating of blackened toast.
Name: Claro 2013 Justo Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This intriguing bottling shows the cool vintage's influence. The nearly vegetal nose conveys snapped twigs, mulch, red cherry and cracked pepper, and the palate shows similar characteristics, proving light in density. It's lively, but may confuse those seeking a rich red.
Name: Standing Sun 2011 Camp Four Vineyard Merlot (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Damp, earthy aromas are a bit murky and leafy. On the palate, this Merlot is high in acid and almost shearing. Back on the flavor profile, it's salty, herbal and pruny. Lasting acidity on the finish keeps this lively; drink through 2017.
Name: Tres Palacios 2011 Cholqui Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Coffee, herbal berry and a light whiff of green herbs announce a solid, well-built wine, with flavors of olive, herbs, plum and blackberry. The finish is smooth, healthy, and a bit toasty.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2014 Cefiro Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Aromas of tomato, plum and spice are fresh and medium in intensity. Flavors of plum, olive, spice and mild oak finish with toasty barrel notes and a spot of licorice.
Name: Santa Carolina 2014 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made from 75% Merlot with the rest Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine saw just a 25% new French oak, putting the focus squarely on the fruit. Aromas of spice, prune, medicine cabinet and cherry cola are followed by luscious, full-bodied black-fruit flavors that bring some warmth on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Dubindil 2012 Quell Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of fresh coffee, cocoa, peppery spices and red fruit lead to silky fruit and barrel flavors. It brings a whole lot of easy-drinking appeal.
Name: 14 Hands 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cocoa and coffee are mixed with black licorice and dark berries, with this wine showing some reduction out of the gate that detracts. The flavors are rich and full bodied, carrying some warmth on the finish. The aromas and flavors seem disconnected.
Name: Milbrandt 2012 The Estates Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine opens with aromas of vanilla and baking spices that are followed by broad, silky-feeling fruit and barrel flavors, finishing on a somewhat bitter note. The oak holds a prominent role but still plays its part well.
Name: Claar 2011 Estate Grown and Bottled Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of spice, dried herbs and plum lead to plump blue-fruit flavors with a touch of sugar stitching them together. This doesn't bring a lot of complexity but still has appeal.
Name: Skyfall 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of herbs and jammy fruit are light while the palate offers plush-feeling cocoa and berry flavors. This offers a lot of enjoyment for the price.
Name: Snoqualmie 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This opens with a strong sense of oak and sawdust, later giving way to herbal berry aromas. This feels plump and resiny, with slick oak. Flavors of wood resin and pepper are on equal footing with berry flavors, while the finish shows moderate residual heat.
Name: Porta 2014 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: This easy-drinking red wine has aromas of cherry, black plum and eucalyptus. Flavors of red cherry, cherry turnover and vanilla remain on the palate through the soft finish.
Name: Cramele Recas 2014 Dreambird Merlot (Viile Timisului)

Description: This Merlot gets going with scratchy berry and plum aromas that come alongside roasted overtones. Choppy and tannic on the palate, this is short on flavors, with baked, loamy berry notes leading to a lightly herbal, briny tasting finish.
Name: Santa Alicia 2013 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: This easygoing red opens with aromas of dark fruit, red berry, toast and a whiff of cooking spice. The palate offers crushed plum, clove and a hint of chocolate alongside soft tannins. It's simple but well made.
Name: Mezzacorona 2013 Merlot (Trentino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a cool vintage, this wine doesn't seem to have fully ripened, with aromas of green herbs, dill and baking spices. It's quite light in style, not entirely holding together.
Name: Market Vineyards 2011 Benchmark Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Wiry, scratchy blueberry and black-currant aromas come with an odd soapy perfume. This feels choppy, with outsized acidity and oak making their presence felt. Salty, briny plum flavors are cutting, while the finish feels raw and astringent.
Name: Concha y Toro 2013 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Combine a cool year with cool-climate, single-vineyard origins and the result is this: olive, bell pepper and saucy tomato aromas, followed by a pointy, high-acid palate that's jagged in feel. Snappy red-plum and red-cherry flavors end with acid-driven crispness.
Name: Lomas del Valle 2013 Coastal Cool Climate Single Vineyard Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Lightly herbal and scratchy on the nose, this somewhat sharp Merlot is linear and piercing, with bright, semitart flavors of raspberry, cherry pie and herbs.
Name: Caliterra 2014 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine combines green, herbal overtones with puckering, bitter tannins, a unsavory mix that doesn't please the palate.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2011 Right Bank Reserve Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Description: From one of the best-known sites for the variety in the Napa Valley, this wine shows classic Merlot-structure, with an almost dusty quality to the well-integrated and resolved tannins. It discloses a density of red fruit that remains in balance with its more rugged minerality, remaining soft on the palate throughout. Drink now through 2025.
Name: Duckhorn 2012 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a rich, inviting wine with characteristics of dried cranberry and red currant, replete with dusty, spicy tannins and spicy, spiked vanilla. Lush, the tannins are soft and supple, a tad smoky, and the secondary elements darker in smoke, black licorice and espresso. Burly, it's balanced and refined.
Name: Ehlers Estate 2012 Estate Merlot (St. Helena)

Description: Benefiting from a larger percentage of Three Palms Vineyard fruit than ever before, this majority Merlot also holds Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. The result is a density of rich, soft and spicy red fruit supported by structured tannins. This is ready for the table and a wide range of pairings.
Name: Duckhorn 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This is pure Merlot, bursting with bright cherry-candy fruit. Stiff at first, it smoothes out beautifully with substantial breathing time, showing polish and purity. The overall balance and flavor intensity propels it to a high level. Drink now through 2025.
Name: LaStella 2011 Maestoso Merlot (Okanagan Valley)

Description: Softly balanced, this is an elegant wine, with less than a handful of Petit Verdot that exhibits savory dried cranberry and plum around larger elements of juicy plum and dark chocolate. It never veers bitter or green, staying juicy and supple on the palate.
Name: Clos du Val 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Oaky and full bodied, this features minty and savory highlights, with big scents and flavors of barrel. Tight cassis fruit, streaked with coffee and dark chocolate, finishes with a dusty coating of graphite. Give this at least a couple of hours in a decanter to loosen it up.
Name: Burrowing Owl 2011 Merlot (Okanagan Valley)

Description: Red plum flavors are spiced with wood aging and enlivened by zesty acidity. It is a fruity, lightly structured wine showing rich fruit tones. Drink now.
Name: Fiuza 2014 Merlot (Tejo)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Light cherry fruit is quickly overtaken by the tannins, and this wine has a sharp, high-toned edge. Quite dry and bordering on sourness in the finish, it's a modest effort from a difficult year.
Name: Cliff Creek 2011 Merlot (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Loess, Mill Creek Upland and Leonetti Old Block, this standout wine opens with alluring aromas of dark chocolate, raspberries, blueberries, sandalwood and assorted spices. The palate is plush and fruit-filled but with well-balanced acidity and impressive length.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2013 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fleshy, sun-kissed black plums and cherries abound in this supple, velvet-textured Merlot. It's mouthfilling and rich, but brisk cranberry acidity lends firm structure. The palate is subtly nuanced, marked by soft tannins and layers of brambly wood, cedar and baking spice. Aged 19 months with a large proportion of new French oak, it drinks well now but should meld beautifully from 2020–2028.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2013 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dwelley Vineyard provides most of the fruit for this Merlot. Toasty barrel aromas are at the fore followed by exotic spices, milk chocolate and cherry. The flavors are plush and jammy, lingering on the finish.
Name: Barrister 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The third vintage of this wine is 100% varietal, with the fruit coming from Stone Tree, Cold Creek and Beverly vineyards. Aromas of coffee, vanilla, clove, dark plum and spice lead to concentrated, layered but still elegant fruit flavors.
Name: Northstar 2011 Premier Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite the Columbia Valley label this is all Red Mountain, old-vine Merlot from the winery's estate vineyard. Raspberry, mocha, clove and spice aromas lead to supple, understated fruit flavors and an extended finish. It's a perfect example of what makes this variety special in Washington.
Name: Kiona 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter in color, this has aromas of char, coffee and vanilla that lead to varietal flavors of raspberry and chocolate, showing an interplay of fruit and barrel. It displays intensity and richness, still needing time to stretch its legs. Drink after 2018.
Name: Fielding Hills 2012 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in a mixture of French and American oak (33% new), this wine shows a combination of fruit and barrel, with aromas and flavors of vanilla, pencil lead, cocoa and blue fruit. It's soft in feel, showing plenty of richness.
Name: 14 Hands 2012 The Reserve Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of coffee, herbs, dark fruit and barrel spices lead on this 100% varietal wine. The palate shows an interplay of fruit and barrel (all new French) with the tannins needing some time to stretch their legs.
Name: Finn Hill 2012 Merveille Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While five years from harvest, this bold, penetrating Merlot is still a baby, with a long, promising future ahead. Subtle whiffs of crisp red cherry and mushroom seem quiet on the nose, but the palate is deeply concentrated. Black plum and cherry flavors are penetrating yet deftly grounded by a core of mouth puckering tannin and acidity. Enjoy starting 2020, but should maintain for much longer.
Name: Waters Crest 2010 Grand Vin Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This directly appealing, 100% varietal wine offers aromas of raspberries, cranberries, fresh tobacco and a touch of spice. The fruit flavors are lush and forward, with soft tannins and a finish that won't quit.
Name: Seven Hills 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All Elephant Mountain Vineyard fruit, this wine provides aromas of coffee, red plum and spice. It's soft and velvety in feel with café au lait flavors that linger.
Name: Stottle 2012 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: From leading Vino Nobile di Montepulciano producer Poliziano, this opens with aromas of black currant, bell pepper and tobacco. On the palate, juicy black cherry makes up the core while notes of licorice and ground pepper offer backup. It's smooth and easy drinking, with plush tannins.
Name: Poliziano 2011 In Violas Merlot (Cortona)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The dried herb, currant and woodspice aromas provide intrigue. Flavors offer a mouthful of fruit with balance, intensity and length that convinces.
Designation: House of Independent Producers Bacchus Vineyard
Name: Hedges NV House of Independent Producers Bacchus Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, espresso, coconut and dried black fruit slowly take shape in the glass. Made entirely with Merlot, the dense palate offers blackberry extract, black cherry, coffee and grilled sage alongside rather astringent tannins that dry out the finish.
Name: Rocca di Frassinello 2013 Baffonero  (Maremma Toscana)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Wet cedar, dried leaves and mushroom notes extend a woodsy, earthy tone to ripe black cherry and plums in this unusually savory, nuanced Merlot. Supple and ripe, it extends languorously on the palate, fringed by fine tannins and an appetizing touch of bitterness on the finish. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Raphael 2013 Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's immediate appeal to this wine's plum and cocoa aromas, with Syrah (11%) adding game and smoke. The flavors are fruit-forward with plenty of plushness that make it hard to resist. It doesn't seem entirely varietally correct but after the second sip all that is forgotten.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a wonderful wine and a great value. An usually complex aroma resembles cedar and cigar tobacco, while flavors combine delicious fruit notes and more of that cigar box complexity. The texture is absolutely silky and the tannins are subtle but supportive.
Name: McManis 2013 Merlot (California)

Description: Structured and spicy, this savory Merlot opens with aromas of cedar, red currant and tobacco. The polished palate offers crushed raspberry, black cherry and savory herb alongside firm but fine-grained tannins. Drink 2016–2020.
Name: Baracchi Riccardo 2012 Smeriglio Merlot (Cortona)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mocha, vanilla, woodspice and cherry aromas are at the front of this barrel-forward wine. Flavors display a mixture of fruit and barrel, with the latter winning out on the finish. The variety seems a bit lost but it provides plenty of pleasure.
Name: Seven Falls 2012 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cocoa, herb, raspberry, vanilla and spice aromas are out front on this wine. The blue and red fruit and barrel flavors are creamy in feel and carry through the finish.
Name: Three Rivers 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from vineyards scattered across the Wahluke Slope, this immediately charming wine has aromas of mocha, coffee, plum, herbs and assorted barrel spices. The sweet blue fruit flavors are soft and bring plenty of appeal.
Name: Milbrandt 2012 Traditions Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 15% Syrah, this is a distinctive wine with aromas of herbs, coffee and vanilla. The palate seems wound up, not quite ready to reveal its charms.
Name: Beresan 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This attractive and medium-bodied wine smells a bit like ginger cookies. It tastes nicely dry, fruity and well structured with tannins and acidity. Nutmeg and ginger notes add extra interest to black cherry and pomegranate flavors.
Name: Alias 2013 Merlot (California)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of cherry Coke and vanilla juxtapose fresh red raspberry perfume on the nose of this fruity, forward Merlot. Sour cherry and berry flavors are juicy and thirst quenching, framed by a fringe of feathery tannins. Drink now to enjoy its fresh, primary flair.
Name: Bedell 2012 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Colli della Toscana Centrale, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of raisin, tobacco, cedar and toasted oak lead the nose on this full-bodied Merlot. The palate offers dried black cherry, black currant, graphite, licorice and clove alongside firm tannins that are rather rough on the finish.
Name: Tenuta di Lilliano 2010 Vignacatena Merlot (Colli della Toscana Centrale)

Description: Lively, lip-smacking fruit flavors and a tangy, tannic texture will make this a great pairing with grilled chicken, steak or portobello mushrooms. Medium bodied and well balanced, it's fun to drink.
Name: Backhouse 2012 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas on this wine lean into the green, with notes of herbs, cedar and woodspice that seem somewhat at odds with the variety. The supple flavors show a mixture of intensity and restraint.
Name: Hogue 2012 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal from Gamache Vineyard, this wine offers aromas of assorted barrel spices (100% new French) and dark fruit, seeming quite closed at present. The palate is also dominated by barrel flavors. It's possible more time will knit fruit and barrel together.
Name: Finn Hill 2012 Bien Fait Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This concentrated red opens with aromas of mature black fruit, toasted oak and a whiff of Mediterranean herbs. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, red currant, powdered sage and espresso alongside bracing, tightly packed tannins that leave an astringent finish.
Name: Stefania Mezzetti 2012 Selvans Merlot (Cortona)

Description: This opens with aromas of dried black currant, roasted coffee beans, oak and aniseed. The warm, low-acid palate offers dried black fruit, licorice, dark chocolate and vanilla, but not much fruit richness. The smooth texture is cut short by wood tannins that impart an astringent finish.
Name: Leuta 2009 1,618 Merlot (Cortona)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This widely available twist-top wine by Adam Lazarre is popular for good reason. Dense aromas of dried blueberry, boysenberry, tar and fudge kick off a thick palate that's driven by dark chocolate, espresso bean and more blueberry flavors.
Name: Cycles Gladiator 2013 Merlot (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A plummy interpretation of Merlot, this also brings aromas and flavors of herbs and spice. Flavors are sweet and easy drinking with lightly grainy tannins.
Name: Boomtown 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Tarry black-cherry aromas are a bit damp, oaky and scratchy, but overall this opens well. A solid, firm, edgy palate offers flavors of herbal blackberry and baked black plum, while the finish is meaty and a touch salty.
Name: Santa Ema 2014 Select Terroir Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel notes of vanilla, cocoa and dill mix with licorice and red fruit. The flavors are tart with light smoky notes and a firm squeeze of tannins.
Designation: Caring Passion Estate Grown Tom TK Mathison
Name: Stemilt Creek 2011 Caring Passion Estate Grown Tom TK Mathison Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The nose isn't very expressive, but subdued aromas of black currant, espresso and a whiff of Mediterranean herbs eventually unfold in the glass. The palate offers dried black fruit, espresso and a pepper note alongside astringent tannins that leave a mouth-drying finish. It's shy on freshness, so drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Vecchia Cantina di Montepulciano 2011 Poggio Stella Merlot (Cortona)

Description: Grassy aromas lead the nose, followed by darker notes of licorice and candied black fruits. This feels fresh but also acidic; flavors of tart berry fruits are simple to process and finish briny and snappy.
Name: Kon Tiki 2014 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Leafy aromas of olive and herbal berry fruits lead the nose. This cool-climate Merlot is light in body and restrained, with juicy acidity. Herbal plum, green bean and bell pepper flavors finish short and snappy.
Name: Lomas del Valle 2014 Coastal Cool Climate Estate Bottled Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a fruit-forward wine, with aromas of red and black currant and herbs with a spice top note. The flavors are sweet and tangy, going down easy.
Name: Hogue 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of herbs, woodspice, tire rubber and red fruit lead to jammy raspberry and spice flavors that provide easy drinking pleasure.
Name: Sagelands 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herb, currant, vanilla and tire-rubber aromas are at the fore. The blackberry flavors drink off dry, sweetening toward the finish.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2013 The Expedition Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This 100% Merlot is firm, dry and structured. Although the fruit is there, it has been submerged by tannins. Give it a few months for the ripe berry flavors to come through. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Sainte Barbe 2013 Merlot du Château Sainte Barbe  (Bordeaux)

Description: Briny, rubbery aromas of asphalt and blackberry set up a fat, wide palate. Herbal, green-infused berry flavors finish with notes of carob, herbs and field greens. The round mouthfeel and textural balance are this wine's strong points.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2014 Petirrojo Reserva Estate Grown Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: While there are firm tannins, this wine also has plenty of fresh black currant fruits. Acidity and a crisp texture give it a lift and brightness. Drink this 100% Merlot from 2016 when the tannins have softened.
Name: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2013 Premium  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Description: This light to medium-bodied wine offers lively fruit flavors like red cherries and raspberries. It has a crisp mouthfeel and and even balance between flavor, acidity and moderate tannins. It goes down easily.
Name: Twisted 2013 Merlot (California)

Description: This is a light 100% Merlot wine, with tangy red berry fruits. Tight and mineral with high levels of acidity, it is not for aging, so drink now.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2013 Intense  (Bordeaux)

Description: Stalky aromas are green and low on pleasantries. This has a sticky, dense feel, with flavors of char, sweet plastic, peppery berry and weeds. An oaky, herbal finish tastes candied and feels hot.
Designation: Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled
Name: Santa Alicia 2014 Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Red cherry aromas lead to a wine that is curiously structured with firm tannins and jammy fruit that is not in balance. “Natur” means the winemaker did not add sulfites during wine production.
Name: Château Penin 2013 Natur  (Bordeaux)

Description: This is a well-done effort from winemaker Riaan Rossouw, which shows how engaging, inviting and refined Merlot can be. Spiced red plum and red currant aromas seductively waft over dried fern and Mediterranean herb tones. Silky, soft tannins provide just enough structure to uphold the curvacious body of ripe red plum, sweet baking spice and additional dried herbs. Amazingly, this plush wine maintains excellent acidic verve, which carries along the entire medley of flavors to a persistent fruit-laden finish. Drink now for utter enjoyment.
Name: Lovingston 2012 Josie's Knoll Merlot (Monticello)

Description: A sophisticated nose of end-of-season cherry with a soft touch of petrol barely prepares the palate for robust flavors of blackberry, brambles and cured meat with medium-weight tannins and a smoky finish.
Name: Bessa 2010 Petit Enira Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: Garnet colored in the glass, this wine has a bouquet of cherry that is heightened by a striking note of bell pepper. It offers flavors of cranberry and pomegranate that meld into a zesty but persistent finish.
Name: K Cellars 2012 Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: Winemaker: Carl Schultz. Hints of fruitcake spice, mint and mocha grace the fruit-forward aromas and flavors of red currant, plum and cherry. The medium-weight mouthfeel boasts soft, supple tannins and an easy, juicy structure. Notes of sweet spice and cocoa carry on through the solid finish. Drink now–2019.
Name: Hartenberg 2013 Cape Winemakers Guild CWG Auction Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: The scents of cherries and green peppers at a farmers' market fill the nose, followed by easy-drinking flavors of cherry and red raspberry.Notes of ripe plum that culminate in a soft finish.
Name: Katarzyna 2013 Halla Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: Garnet to the eye, this wine has a zippy nose of cherry and cranberry. Flavors of pomegranate, cranberry and tart cherry are nestled into well-structured tannins that seem to dissolve in the palate as the bright finish takes hold.
Name: Bulgariana 2012 Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine offers aromas of coffee, green herbs, pencil lead and vanilla followed by silky cherry and dark chocolate flavors. There's plenty of appeal but the variety seems to get lost.
Name: Watermill 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The color is already fading into brick around the rim, and this light Merlot is already drinking at or near its peak. It's soft and smooth, slightly nutty, with round and mature fruit flavors of cherry and berry. All in all it's a pleasant, lightly toasty wine with no rough edges.
Name: Delfino 2011 Merlot (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Bing cherry, sweet vanilla and sawdust aromas ring on the nose of the first Merlot bottling from the winery. True to the variety, the palate shows ample plushness and mild tannins, with juicy red plum leading the way. This accessible red could be easily enjoyed solo.
Name: Stinson 2013 Merlot (Monticello)

Description: Coffee-rubbed red berries and plum pervade on the nose, with a similar character following through to the palate. Ample in weight, with mild tannins, the oak character of this wine dominates from entry to finish.
Name: DuCard 2012 Quaker Run Merlot (Virginia)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Eighteen months in American oak have given this wine aggressive scents and flavors from barrel rather than berry. It's stiff and tannic, with chewy purple fruit more or less buried in the oak.
Name: Weisinger 2012 Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Description: This wine shows underripe red currant and strawberry notes, with a tinge of green stems and black pepper on the nose and palate. The mildly concentrated body is round, approachable and ready-to-drink.
Name: Bogati 2013 Black Label Club Merlot (Virginia)

Description: Medium ruby in color, with already some slight bricking, this wine shows charred blackberry on the nose with ample green and black peppercorn. The palate follows suit offering a bit of structure from grainy, grippy tannins. Sweet herbs round out the finish.
Name: Doukénie 2012 Merlot (Virginia)

Description: So rich it tastes like chocolate, this ambitious and lavishly oak-influenced wine pulls out all the stops to achieve maximum flavor impact. It smells full of baking spices and savory herbs, tastes very ripe, concentrated and feels lush and creamy in texture. While full bodied, it has plenty of firm acidity and lots of fine tannins to stand up to all that flavor. It's ready to enjoy now through 2020.
Name: Hourglass 2013 Blueline Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: A 100% varietal wine, grown in an area called the Lower Mountaintop, this offers a compelling candied cherry and raspberry element, supported by complex accents of vanilla and cured meat. With plenty of body to stay fresh and vibrant on the palate, it never gets bogged down, finishing in richer components of dark chocolate and oak.
Name: Pride Mountain 2012 Vintner Select Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With grapes coming from Weinbau, Klipsun and Ciel du Cheval vineyards, among others, this wine offers brooding aromas of dark raspberries and bittersweet chocolate. The oak (half new French) provides a perfect complement, with flavors of coffee and spice mixing with dark fruit. It's hard to put the glass down.
Name: Januik 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of DuBrul and Meek vineyard fruit broods with aromas of dark raspberries and licorice. Ripe fruit flavors accompany exquisitely balanced tannins and acidity. It's drinking well now but should have a long life in front of it.
Name: Stevens 2012 Stevens Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine commands attention with its aromas of dark raspberries, milk chocolate and barrel spices. Flavors show plenty of richness and intensity with a supple texture that dazzles.
Name: Novelty Hill 2012 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is dark garnet to the eye, with a fragrance of raspberry, cherry and Mediterranean herbs. There is a pleasing balance of fruit and dried herb notes. Smooth tannins prevail, with flavors of black cherry, blueberry, eucalyptus, smoked meat and fresh-cut herbs of thyme and oregano paving the way for a blueberry, oregano and orange rind finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2010 Yarden Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cocoa, dark chocolate, raspberry and barrel spice aromas intoxicate the senses. The flavors are sweet and concentrated with a hedonistic styling.
Name: Abeja 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Deep ruby to the eye, this wine offers rich aromas of cherry, black licorice and orange rind and flavors of blackberry, black cherry, cassis, anisette and eucalyptus. Long-lasting tannins coat the mouth but there is always a sense of fresh fruit on the palate and a brightness that lingers right into the satisfying finish.
Name: Recanati 2013 Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal coming from Seven Hills Vineyard, this displays aromas of café au lait, black raspberries and dried herbs. The fruit and barrel flavors are palate coating, displaying exceptional polish and texture.
Name: Bunchgrass 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Very dense and eminently intriguing on the nose, this wine shows aromas of turned earth, black olive, concentrated strawberry and gravel. Sagebrush and tarragon power the tip of the palate, which emerges into dense yet restrained blueberry and black cherry, all presented in a very appealing way.
Name: Monticello Vineyards 2011 Estate Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is all Merlot coming from equal parts Weinbau and Woodward Canyon Estate vineyards. It charms with aromas of café au lait, cherry, spice and earth. The chocolate and cherry flavors are rich and full bodied with a firm handshake of tannins. It's drinking young now, with the oak up front. Give it plenty of time to open up.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this still has a puckering sense to the tannins, the power and weight of the wine generous and robust. Leather and banana figure into the bouquet, with the savory-laden flavors leaning toward black pepper and dark, ripe plum. This wine needs time; cellar through 2022.
Name: Keenan 2012 Mailbox Vineyard Reserve Merlot (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This leads with aromas of dark raspberries, toast and woodspice, seeming to still be in its shell. Flavors are high-octane, rich and sweet, with enough tannins to go the distance. It doesn't seem entirely integrated right now, but it will go up a notch or two if it comes together.
Name: Pedestal 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Velvety and seductive, this provides a fine example of the variety's sultriness, a study in ripe black cherry, clove and cinnamon that's generous in tannin without going overboard. With a decant or couple swirls of the glass, expect the power to soften and the complexity to take on new vigor.
Name: Darioush 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An attractive array of cedar, cinnamon, red cherry and black currant aromas and flavors fill this medium-bodied wine to the rim. The acidity, tannins and flavors are all well proportioned and balance each other out in a sophisticated way. The result is an elegant but firm wine that will be appetizing at the table now through 2020.
Name: Occasio 2011 Thatcher Bay Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Joined by 8% Cabernet Sauvignon, this stellar wine from an almost 50-50 Napa-Sonoma divide delivers big flavor and tannin and yet exudes vibrant juicy plum and blueberry, keeping it grounded and alive. Silky through and through, it's complex in dark chocolate and a touch of dried herbs.
Name: Pride Mountain 2012 Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Description: Smooth and round, this is a well-structured wine, amply blessed in black cherry, plum and spicy cinnamon. Made in small quantities, it does the variety justice and is fully ready for the table.
Name: Black Stallion 2012 Limited Release Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cracked pepper and blackberry combine for a very fresh and lively nose on this wine from a longtime producer. Chipped slate is the first impression once sipped, but an olallieberry flavor then steadily emerges, picking up some tongue-tingling pepper spice and a touch of vanilla on the finish.
Name: Bargetto 2012 Reserve Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Named for the producer's French grandfather, who loved Merlot, this 100% varietal wine from a high-elevation site is leathery, meaty and quite debonair. With a scent of bacon grease giving a sense of rustic deliciousness, it's also soft and unctuous on the palate, medium to full bodied.
Name: Y Rousseau 2012 Pépé Cavedale Vineyard Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Description: Soft and subdued in black fruit and leather, along with tufts of tobacco and clove, this wine contains an unexpected 4% Zinfandel, which may well add to both the brawniness of the oak and tannin and the juicy core of fruit that keeps it lifted on the palate. Drink now through 2020.
Name: St. Francis 2012 Behler Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Licorice and black plum notes give this wine a sultry edge, layered around generous tannin and leathery tobacco. Soft toward the finish, it provides a polished note of red currant and raspberry midway through, lifting much of the weight off the tongue. Cellar through 2020.
Name: St. Supéry 2012 Estate Merlot (Rutherford)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of toast, espresso, chocolate and dark fruit lead to creamy-feeling fruit and barrel flavors. The oak (54% new French) is a bit out front but there's still much to enjoy.
Name: Guardian 2012 Confidential Source Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Incorporating a small amount of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a floral Merlot, with notes of violet counterpointed by barbecue smokiness and earth. Big, rich tannins are dry and robust, veering on full bodied, before the acidity in the wine pulls things back into balance.
Name: Trefethen 2012 Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Truly a Bordeaux-style blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec from Seven Hills (51%), Pepper Bridge (32%) and Octave vineyards, this wine offers aromas of wood, dark raspberry and licorice. The supple, reserved fruit flavors bring plenty of appeal. Give it time for the oak to fully integrate.
Name: Pepper Bridge 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Milk chocolate, cherry and raspberry aromas lead to sweet, supple luscious fruit flavors. It keeps you coming back for more.
Name: Novelty Hill 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This tastes deep, ripe and yet very smooth and drinkable for its full body and firmly tannic texture. Aromas recall cedar, dark plums, blueberry and black cherry plus a whiff of mint, while the flavors are grand, dark and rich. Enjoy it now through 2019.
Name: McGrail 2009 Picazo Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: More mineral and savory than tutti-frutti, this wine offers scents of damp moss and wet stone. It's medium bodied, with a silky texture and a long, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Marrenon 2014 Les Grains Rosé de Merlot (Mediterranée)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is 100% varietal and comes from a single block and clone (clone 3). Aromas of woodspice, blue fruit and herbs lead to sweet, supple fruit flavors and grainy tannins. There are a lot of good things going on but the wood steps a bit in front of them.
Name: Revelry 2012 Reserve Alder Ridge Vineyard Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of baking spices, clove, vanilla and dark fruit lead to a nuanced palate with fruit and barrel flavors and a light grip of tannins. The alcohol shows through a bit but overall it holds it.
Name: Golden Ridge 2012 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine comes from Mirage, Klipsun, Seven Hills and Force Majeure vineyards. The oak (50% new French) takes the lead with aromas of vanilla, coffee and cinnamon in front of plum and berry. Flavors are reserved, showing a mixture of fruit and barrel that continues through the finish.
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of sweet barrel spices, dried flowers, herbs and dark fruit lead to tart cherry flavors and a cranberry-filled finish.
Name: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2011 Barrel Select Reserve Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made completely from Merlot, this wine comes from Candy Mountain (52%), Birch Creek (25%) and Bacchus vineyards. The oak (35% new American) plays a central role, with aromas of vanilla and green wood out in front of raspberries and cherries. Flavors are light yet concentrated, with the tannins showing some astringency.
Name: Forgeron 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Sweet oak aromas, ripe fruit flavors and a firm texture make a complete and enjoyable package in this full-bodied wine. It has a toasted oak flavor, tasty plum and cinnamon nuances, good acidity and supportive tannins.
Name: Fetzer 2012 Eagle Peak Merlot (California)

Description: Sourced from the winery's estate vineyard, this bottling presents a compelling depth of earthiness, a stony, rocky sense that gives it a savory edge. Tobacco and tea surround ample plum and blueberry. The wine is approachable and soft, with tiny percentages of Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot.
Name: Gundlach Bundschu 2012 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Meaty, dusty aromas of leather, cigar box, old books, roasted lamb, tobacco smoke and purple flowers make for a compelling nose on this wine. The palate is quite leathery, with beef crust, wood smoke and incense ash flavors, delivered in a smooth manner.
Name: Firestone 2011 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The oak (21 months spent in French and American) takes the lead, with aromas of baking spices, green wood and vanilla out in front of cherry. The flavors are sweet, supported by grainy tannins that show some dryness.
Name: Gordon Estate 2012 Block 3 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal coming from Dwelley and Minnick Hills vineyards, this wine leads with aromas of black licorice, dates and green herbs. There's plenty of richness to the flavors, which are backed by a squeeze of grainy tannins.
Name: Adamant Cellars 2012 Winemaker's Select Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Combining estate grapes with others from cooler Carneros, this wine offers a dried herb component and plenty of pencil and cedar. Tannic and oaky before airing, it'll benefit from a decant.
Name: Keenan 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: On the one hand, this wine offers juicy, varietally characteristic layers of juicy plum and red cherry. Seamless tannins provide more pleasure, with a compelling end note of candied cherry and cranberry.
Name: Ramspur 2012 Otton Vineyards Merlot (Carneros)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal from one of the state's most highly regarded vineyards, this wine offers aromas of dark raspberries, green herbs, vanilla and barrel spices. The fruit and barrel flavors show concentration and depth, with a light chalkiness to the tannins.
Name: Januik 2012 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: Pungent clove and cinnamon appear upon entry to this medium-bodied wine, which also offers smooth, rounded tannins and subtle oak. Plum, raspberry and tobacco all make an appearance, finished off by a healthy dose of black pepper.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An unusual aroma profile of sandalwood, broccoli and exotic spices leads to coffee and dark cherries. The fruit flavors are silky in feel, showing plenty of depth with lightly grainy tannins supporting them.
Name: Reininger 2011 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal from up-and-coming Scooteney Flats Vineyard, this wine displays aromas of fresh herbs, dark raspberries and barrel spices. There's no lack of richness to the fruit flavors but the chalky tannins need time to stitch together.
Name: Foundry Vineyards 2012 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: Medicine cabinet, licorice, leather and dried and fresh red and black fruit aromas lead to rich, concentrated flavors. The variety seems subsumed by the style but it's still pretty delicious.
Name: Boudreaux Cellars 2009 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The fruit and herb flavors in this medium-bodied wine have good depth, conveying black cherries, raspberries and a light touch of thyme. It offers an appropriate savory element as well as a core of ripe grape flavors. Tasting solid but smooth, it is well made and unfussy.
Name: Page Mill Winery 2012 Côté Vineyard Merlot (San Francisco Bay)

Description: Billed as a Cabernet lover's Merlot, this wine offers robustness as well as a soft, angular quality that provides a certain level of elegance. Oak, green olive and sage mark its bouquet, followed by flavors of red currant and dried herb.
Name: Grgich Hills 2011 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hailing from Les Collines and Seven Hills vineyards, this 100% varietal wine displays aromas and flavors of cedar, herbs, licorice and red fruit that seem a bit dried out. It's lighter in style, showing elegance along with a light squeeze of tannins.
Name: Kontos 2011 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: A splash of Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon supports this juicy, smoky wine, from vineyards scattered across the wider Napa Valley appellation. Textured, it tastes of brambly, just-picked blackberry, with a robust body through to the finish, which ends lean.
Name: Textbook 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red cherries, ripe strawberries and recently tanned leather aromas greet the nose on this wine. It's quite lively and spicy once sipped, with more strawberry fruit as well as a plum skin tartness and pencil lead tannins.
Name: Le Vigne 2012 Di Domenico Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Bright and brooding, this lightly-textured, medium-bodied wine offers smoke, leather, blackberry and baked plum. There's an underlying richness akin to decadent crÃ¨me anglaise, with a finish of clove and coffee.
Name: Swanson 2011 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This well-balanced, medium-bodied wine blends ripe strawberry aromas and blackberry flavors with a lively texture that's bolstered by good acidity and firm tannins. It's easy to enjoy the fresh fruitiness.
Name: Greenwood Ridge 2012 Estate Bottled Merlot (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Exuberantly floral, this perfumed, pale-pink wine offsets ripe peach and strawberry flavors with zesty, spine tingling acidity. Robust in body, it finishes briskly on a savory herb note.
Name: Atwater 2014 Dry Rosé of Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: Medium in build, with soft, approachable layers of texture and tannin, this wine is big on blackberry and black olive, blending the sweet and savory successfully. It builds tension as it goes, finishing with a taste of smoky leather.
Name: Franciscan 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Rich in plum, black cherry and blackberry, this wine is subtle in cinnamon and dried herb, with additional embellishments of leather and earth. Soft and subdued, it's approachable and versatile.
Name: Frei Brothers 2013 Reserve Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Sanguine in black olive tapenade, this is a soft, smooth, 100% varietal wine that's full-bodied and expressive in black cherry and dark plum. It finishes in tight, chewy tannins.
Name: Ty Caton 2012 Caton Vineyard Upper Bench Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Leather, dried cherries, plums, dark chocolate and sagebrush aromas are woven into a decent if not entirely lively nose. Lots of chopped fresh and dried herbs arise once sipped, along with gravel, black fruit and sticky tannins.
Name: Sculpterra 2012 Estate Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Softly layered in crisp red fruit, from currant to strawberry, this is a medium-bodied wine with a medium finish, seasoned in compelling jolts of cinnamon spice. From the relatively cool climes of its appellation, it's juicy without ever becoming overwhelming in tannin.
Name: Clos Pegase 2012 Mitsuko's Vineyard Merlot (Carneros)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of woodspice, char, pickling spices and herbs are out in front of red and black fruit. The flavors are light and appealing, but ultimately the oak provides distraction.
Name: Gordon Estate 2013 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Cinnamon and clove adorn a medium-sized body that's soft and relatively silky, with ample plum and black cherry. More fruity than savory, the wine is enjoyable now, with a mid-length finish.
Name: Peter Cellars 2012 Carneros Estate Merlot (Carneros)

Description: Cherry, raspberry and vanilla combine for an inviting mix of ripeness and sweet bouquet. A fruity component also sits nicely atop this structured wine marked by soft, fine tannins. The finish is robust in black pepper and clove.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2013 Signature Series Merlot (Oakville)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red cherries, dark spices of clove and anise and gingerbread show on the nose of this wine from the Foley family portfolio. Darkness pervades the concentrated palate, with black fruits, dark chocolate, beef char and condensed purple flowers. It's so deep that it lacks noticeable flavor layers.
Name: Firestone 2011 The Chairman Series Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's much to enjoy with this wine's aromas of vanilla, coffee, baking spices, raspberry and green wood. The sweet flavors show cranberry-like tartness and grainy tannins.
Name: Waterbrook 2012 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Woodspice, herb and dark fruit aromas are out in front. The flavors show a lot of barrel influence, with the tannins providing some grit.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A 100% varietal wine, this opens in floral violet perfume, delicate notions that are soon overpowered by the chock-a-block blackberry and plum. The tannins are robust and still integrating, giving the wine a somewhat harsh feel.
Name: Barlow 2012 Unfiltered Merlot (Calistoga)

Description: Smoky barbecue and big oak and tannin combine for power and density in this wine, which has a handful of Malbec blended in. Hard to penetrate at first, it over time reveals notes of blackberry, savory leather and cedar.
Name: Peju 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a gigantic expression of the variety, from high-elevation sites, an explosion of coffee, black licorice and red fruit. With a powerful backbone of bittersweet tannins and weight, the finish is reminiscent of cigar smoke.
Name: Delectus 2012 Merlot (Knights Valley)

Description: This 100% Merlot offers a lot of heat around its otherwise approachable lift of soft, smooth tannins and reasonable oak. Sage, cedar and tobacco provide a weedy aspect to the wine, offset by plenty of ripe blackberry and cherry.
Name: Hanaiali'i 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Smoky tar and plum highlight this approachable wine that's straightforward in focus and intent. Meant for enjoying now, it stays firm and flavorful in the glass, finishing without a fuss.
Name: Decoy 2013 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This is box wine taken seriously, even featuring a picture of winemaker Denise Wordenon. Fresh-squeezed blueberry fruit mixes with black rocks, milk chocolate and cedar on the nose, followed by an easy-to-quaff juiciness on the lightly bodied palate. It's not very complex, but perfect for summer barbecues or car camping.
Name: Loft 2013 Merlot (Monterey)

Description: Smooth and fruity, soft and rich, this medium-bodied wine will be easy to enjoy at a casual meal or big party. The aromas are like black cherries, the flavors like candied cherries and the texture relaxed.
Name: 60 North 2012 Merlot (California)

Description: This bombastically brawny Merlot is blended with Syrah and Malbec. The grapes have been sourced from some fine vineyards, including Hudson, Stagecoach and Antica, as well as the cooler Trefethen in Oak Knoll. Juicy blackberry veers into syrupy territory, a thickness that never lets up, accented in smoky oak and vanilla.
Name: Thorn 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of mocha, tire rubber, herbs and blue fruit aren't entirely in sync. They lead to a palate with soft, fleshy fruit flavors and a light structure trying to hold it all together.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: San Lucas, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dust, black cherries and a hint of tarragon arise on the nose of this wine from a small appellation in Monterey County. Char and turned black soil power the very dark palate, which also shows a bit of sagebrush and prominent tannins.
Name: Lockwood 2013 Merlot (San Lucas)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The variety is hard to find on this wine with aromas of tire rubber, barrel spice, green pepper and herb in the lead. It's medium bodied in feel, with soft tannins.
Name: Kennedy Shah 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red and black currants, wild berries and a graphite minerality show on the nose of this attractively priced wine. The palate is a tad sweet, showing dark red fruits.
Name: Esser 2013 Merlot (Monterey County)

Description: Leathery cedar and ripe, almost baked blackberry and blueberry commingle in this generously tannic wine, which has a note of bitterness at its end.
Name: St. Francis 2012 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: This is a green, lean and somewhat sour wine, with an herbal personality that lies atop a world of smooth tannins.
Name: Rutherford Hill 2011 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This offers smoky, toasted oak and herb aromas, full candied cherry and plum flavors, low acidity and fairly firm tannins.
Name: Table No. 7 2011 Merlot (Lodi)

Description: A rustic, barnyard aroma greets one on the nose before a basic taste of stewed prunes waltzes in.
Name: Kunde 2012 Kinneybrook Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earth, mint and blackberry flavors make this full-bodied and firmly-tannic wine both flavorful and eccentric. As the wine sits in the glass for several minutes the aroma become like beef bouillon and the texture on the palate is a bit astringent.
Name: Garré 2010 Private Reserve Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Merlot has not fully ripened, with aromas of bell pepper, green herbs and savory notes overriding any sense of variety. Flavors are faint and lighter in style, trailing on the finish.
Name: James Wyatt 2013 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: One of Italy's most acclaimed Merlots, this concentrated wine opens with scents of black currants, cedar, sage and espresso. The firmly structured but polished palate delivers dried black cherry, black pepper, coffee and licorice alongside a backbone of velvety tannins. Drink 2017–2022.
Name: Tua Rita 2012 Redigaffi Merlot (Toscana)

Description: A rich, ripe expression of one of Italy's iconic wines, this displays the heat of the 2011 vintage. It opens with aromas of red currants, tobacco, oak and exotic spice while the full-bodied palate delivers dried black cherries, blueberry extract, licorice and black pepper. Densely concentrated and tightly packed with assertive but fine-grained tannins, you'll need to give this time to unwind. Drink 2017–2026.
Name: Masseto 2011 Merlot (Toscana)

Description: White truffle, dark chocolate, ripe plum and blue flowers are some of the aromas you'll find in this impressive Merlot. The powerful, extracted palate doles out fleshy blackberry, black cherry, clove, tobacco, licorice and cured meat. Velvety tannins wrap around the bold flavors, providing support and a smooth texture. You'll also detect the warmth of evident alcohol, which gives it a one-dimensional finish.
Name: Tenuta di Trinoro 2012 Palazzi Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Black currants, blackberries, grilled herb, cedar and clove aromas lead the nose on this delicious, creamy wine. The smooth, savory palate doles out ripe black cherry, fleshy plum, white pepper, mint and anise. Firm, polished tannins support the juicy fruit flavors.
Name: Fattoria Torre a Cona 2011 Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this full-bodied wine opens with aromas of ripe berry, coffee, vanilla, exotic spice and a whiff of grilled herb. The concentrated palate doles out fleshy black cherries, juicy raspberries licorice, chocolate and tobacco, while velvety tannins provide the framework. A note of dried sage closes the finish. It's already approachable but will continue to age well for several years or more. Drink through 2023.
Name: Le Macchiole 2011 Messorio Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this full-bodied red opens with aromas of menthol, dark berries and cooking spices. The firm, savory palate offers ripe plum, juicy black cherry, cinnamon, clove and dark chocolate alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Barone Ricasoli 2011 Casalferro Merlot (Toscana)

Description: This 100% Merlot opens with enticing aromas of wild mint, blackberries, blue flowers and allspice. The firm palate doles out black currant, fleshy plum, tobacco, clove and licorice alongside velvety tannins. It's savory and balanced but drink sooner rather than later to capture the juicy fruit.
Name: Terre del Marchesato 2011 Aldone Merlot (Toscana)

Description: This full-bodied Merlot opens with aromas that recall cedar, licorice, mature plum and blackberry that follow through to the robust palate, alongside cracked peppercorn, clove and tobacco. Firm but velvety tannins provide the framework. Drink through 2018.
Name: Cafaggio 2010 Basilica del Pruneto Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Black pepper and thick smoke accentuate the bouquet of this cinnamon-spiced wine, rounded out in taste by red plum and dark chocolate. Soft and juicy on the front palate, it will benefit with time to open further, suggesting either a decant or time in cellar, through 2020. The wine is blended with 7% Cabernet Sauvignon.
Name: Tamber Bey 2012 Merlot (Yountville)

Description: A pure expression of Merlot, this round, delicious wine opens with aromas of blueberry, blackberry, leather, licorice and tobacco. The juicy, smooth palate doles out fleshy black cherry, plum, mint, menthol and anise. Soft, velvety tannins give it a creamy texture. Drink through 2019.
Name: Rocca di Castagnoli 2009 Le Pratola Merlot (Toscana)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Smooth and pleasantly herbal, this is a silky wine with a mix of blueberry, plum and cherry fruit. It spent 20 months in barrel, which lends a light chocolate note to the fruit. Velvety, delicate and most delightful, it should be consumed while it retains its youthful freshness.
Name: Plaisance Ranch 2011 Merlot (Applegate Valley)

Description: From a producer that knows its way around the variety, this Reserve-tier wine shows off its burly pedigree in leather and tobacco, strapped around huge tannins. Crisper, high-toned red fruit makes itself felt midway through on the palate, finishing in handfuls of distinct black pepper.
Name: St. Francis 2012 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Red currant, vanilla, toasted oak, coffee and chocolate aromas lead the nose and follow through to the dense, full-bodied palate. It's one-dimensional but muscular, with ample, velvety tannins.
Name: Petra 2012 Quercegobbe Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Dried herb and green olive form an elegant bouquet for this mountain-grown wine that offers a mouthful of big, leathery tannin and oak. Larger bodied, it remains supple in spirit with a backbone of acidity that keeps it balanced through the tobacco-laden finish.
Name: Rutherford Hill 2011 Limited Release Merlot (Atlas Peak)

Description: Red currant, blackberry, espresso, wood shavings and cedar aromas unfold in the glass. The palate offers dried black cherry, anise, coffee, coconut and oak alongside alongside drying tannins that leave an astringent finish. The fruit is starting to dry up so drink sooner rather than later.
Name: Cennatoio 2010 Mammolo Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Concentrated aromas of plum and black currant come with a leathery, earthy accent. Dense, jammy and ripe in feel, this features blackberry, baked plum and chocolate flavors. A licorice note and controlled heat rise up on a powerful finish.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2013 Cefiro Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)
