Description: Cherry, plum and earth aromas form a sound bouquet. This Merlot is full, round and well balanced. Flavors of black fruits are helped along by integrated spice and earth tones, while the finish shows ripeness and a smooth texture.
Name: Lidio Carraro 2011 Agnus Merlot (Serra Gaúcha)

Description: Rich and structured, this shows the plushness of today's Bordeaux Merlot. Ripe berry fruits, dark plums and a touch of vanilla give spice and round off the texture. It's juicy, still developing and best from 2016.
Name: Château Sainte Barbe 2012 Merlot de Château Sainte-Barbe   (Bordeaux)

Description: A very rich, almost Port-like ripeness and dense black fruits give this wine powerful presence. It has weight and sweet fruitiness that is happily cut with acidity. Tannins provide a light reminder of the chance to age this wine. Drink now and until 2019.
Name: Château les Arromans 2012 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux)

Description: Earthy, ripe on the nose, with good black fruit aromas. Blackberry, mocha and chocolate flavors are straightforward on the palate and lead to a slightly linear finish.
Designation: Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled
Name: Santa Alicia 2013 Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Planks of brawny oak are framed around the blueberry and raspberry fruit brimming in this Merlot, a tribute to Jack London's once-home in nearby Glen Ellen. The herbal component lingers ominously, a refreshing taste of mint popping out on the finish.
Name: Kenwood 2011 Jack London Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The oak—52% new French— gets out in front of the fruit with notes of cocoa powder and woodspice overpowering herbs and red fruit. The palate is elegant in style, with barrel notes carrying through on the finish.
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is ripe and very soft, a wine made to be drunk young. It's full of ripe berries, sliced with acidity and black currant, and conveys a rich, jammy character. Drink now.
Name: Château La Mothe du Barry 2012 La Cuvée à mon Loup  (Bordeaux)

Description: Ruby red with garnet hues in color, this easy-drinking Merlot brings aromas of cherry, black berry and black raspberry on the nose. Tones of black plum and black cherry are ripe and persistent on the finish.
Name: Vini 2013 Veni Vidi Vici Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: Stewed and spicy tones of tomato and red fruit run the aromas. Baked berry flavors, herbal notes and a touch of salt vie for attention in front of a finish that shows a note of chocolate.
Name: Casa Silva 2012 Cuvée Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Smooth and round, this modern, polished wine is fresh while ripe at the end. Lush berry fruits and tannins provide broad support for the fruitiness. It's very ready to drink now.
Name: Château de Monrecueil 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Vanilla and baking spices waft amidst ruddy, ripe black fruit on this rich, luscious Merlot. It's straightforward and plummy in flavor profile, but finishes nicely on a brambly, softly tannic note.
Name: Keuka Spring 2011 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine doesn't seem entirely finished with notes of blueberry, char and barrel spice that haven't fully melded. It's medium bodied with coffee and vanilla flavors backed by astringent tannins, finishing on a sharply bitter note.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2011 Wild Child Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Principally Merlot, with smaller amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, this shows plentiful blackberry fruit, along with sugary flavors of molasses and brown sugar.
Name: Boomtown 2012 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This exclusively Merlot wine is soft, ripe and generous. It has red berry fruits, some broad tannins and attractive acidity. It's not for long-term aging, so drink from 2016.
Name: Château Lauriol 2012  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Shades of golden toast and crushed granite lend depth and complexity to crisp red cherry flavors in this unusually brisk, sprightly Merlot. Refreshingly quaffable, a fringe of soft tannins linger on the short finish.
Name: Fox Run 2012 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A faint whiff of herbs linger from nose to palate, adding earthy complexity to tart sour-cherry and cranberry flavors. It's crisp and invigorating, but a little restrained in character. Finishes on a pleasantly tannic, brambly note.
Name: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2010 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Tart, crisp cranberries and cherries lend a cool, brisk feel to this light-bodied Merlot. It's refreshingly  quaffable but feels shy and overtly restrained.
Name: Damiani 2011 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: Despite its heavy bottle, this is not a wine for aging. It's been made deliberately soft and fruity without any wood aging. Red berry fruits have a light acidity and only hints of a structure. Drink now and until 2018.
Name: Château Rousset-Caillau 2013 Cuvée SL  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Crisp red cherry and berry notes on the nose become increasingly ruddy and ripe on the palate of this soft, medium-bodied Merlot. It's pleasantly juicy, but whiffs of ramp and dried savory herbs are a distracting contrast.
Name: Knapp 2012 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: Deep purple in color, spicy berry aromas open on the nose of this mint-laden Merlot. Lush, core flavors of blackberry and plum show a saucy green pepper quality on the finish.
Name: Santa Ema 2012 Select Terroir Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Reductive elements of black coffee and damp mushrooms don't blow off on this wine, which offers plum on the palate, with a touch of mocha and cedar.
Name: Irony 2012 Merlot (Monterey)

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: All Merlot, this wine is soft, ripe and generous. It has red berry fruits, some broad tannins and attractive acidity. It's not for long-term aging, so drink from 2016.
Name: Château les Charmes Godard 2012  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This exhibits overripe characteristics and a sweetness that seems overdone. There is 8% Petit Verdot blended in.
Name: Wellington 2010 Estate Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Jammy aromas of red berries and rhubarb turn grassy in the glass. This wine is rough and tannic, with briny red berry flavors. Lacks balance on the finish.
Name: Cousiño-Macul 2012 Don Matias Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This enjoyable wine has notes of cherry, herbs, pencil eraser and barrel spices. It's medium bodied with plump fruit flavors, slightly chalky tannins and a bitter note on the finish.
Name: Cliff Creek 2010 Sam's Valley Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here's a quite dense Merlot, with plenty of grip and power. Black cherry and cassis fruit is firm and compact, with a generous frame of barrel char and dark chocolate. A lush and seductive selection that's delicious now.
Name: Cultura 2011 Meek Family Estate Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Full-bodied and richly textured, this ultradark, concentrated Merlot makes a statement. Toast and vanilla shadings mark the bold cassis fruit, which glides easily into a long, velvety finish tinged with mocha. Drink now–2020—and possibly beyond, as this should prove to be a long-lived example.
Name: Villa Maria 2010 Reserve Gimblett Gravels Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend includes 14% Syrah and 11% Cabernet Sauvignon. As usual the scents of barrel toast lead the flavors. The wine shows excellent structure, and the flavors are a spicy mix of plum, cherry and kirsch. It's got crisp definition, ripe tannins and medium length, with a toasty beginning and a toasty finish.
Name: J. Bookwalter 2011 Foreshadow Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bit reductive, yet pleasantly so, this bouquet also expresses herb aromas of dried oregano and chopped green pepper. The palate is a strong blend of spice, particularly black pepper, and fruit, including plum jam and sour and black cherries.
Name: Esser 2012 Merlot (Monterey County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this vintage the aromatic profile has swung noticeably away from the American oak that has in part defined this wine in previous vintages. In its place are woodspice, coffee, raspberries, licorice and light gamy notes, presumably from the Syrah blended in (7%). It's richly flavorful with a pleasing texture and a good sense of balance throughout.
Name: Fielding Hills 2011 Riverbend Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sweet brown spices are front and center here—a sensual swirl of ginger, cumin and more, with a dash of brown sugar. High-toned raspberry fruit anchors the midpalate. It's altogether delicious and tilting toward the hedonistic.
Name: Sineann 2012 Champoux Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Merlot is not afraid to show its rough side, with aromas of tobacco smoke, cigar box, thick blackberry, ripe blueberry, black cherry and dust. The mouth-coating tannins are strong on the plush, grippy palate, as are flavors of burnt orange, plum and dark chocolate. Let it chill out for a few years; drink 2017 onward.
Name: Ridge 2011 Estate Monte Bello Vineyard Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in just 33% new French oak, the fruit is front and center, with notes of fresh raspberries, medicine cabinet and dustings of spice. The flavors are luscious, fruit-filled and precise, with firm tannins and tart acids providing the frame.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2011 Reserve Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sour cherry aromas mix with freshly turned black dirt and button mushrooms on this bottling from a winery that's been in the Santa Cruz Mountains for 80 years. The mouthfeel is soft, with flavors of blackberry emerging first followed by pomegranate, roast pork and black pepper. Serve with beef in mushroom sauce.
Name: Bargetto 2011 Reserve Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: One of a string of great values made at Terravant near Santa Barbara. Attractively oaky, it's full-bodied, full-flavored and just tannic enough to make it a good pairing for rich meat or cheese courses. It is deep in color, with a slightly tawny rim. It smells like wood smoke and grilled bread, tastes deep as blackberry and delivers cherry flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Cookies & Cream 2010 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bell pepper is present on the nose of this 90% Merlot-5% Cabernet Sauvignon-5% Cabernet Franc blend made by Doug Margerum. There are ample red fruits too, along with gingerbread cake and dried violet. The flavors recall dark red strawberries and crushed herbs, and the smooth but strong tannins ensure that this will drink well and likely better in the years to come. Enjoy 2017 onward.
Name: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2009 Barrack Brand Merlot (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fully ripe, estate-grown fruit, 100% varietal, starts it on solid ground. It's soft and plummy, with purple fruits in abundance, and brings flavors of light chocolate threaded through smooth tannins. Just a little more acidity would elevate it further. Drink soon and enjoy.
Name: Gifford Hirlinger 2010 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Principally sourced from the Cold Creek Vineyard, this reserve-level Merlot does not quite come up to past vintages. It's balanced and firm, with red and black fruits that currently seem overtaken by the time (22 months) spent in 78% new French oak.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2011 Ethos Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Full and fruity, ripe and round, this value-priced Merlot is done in a surprisingly lush style. Perfectly ripe, clean flavors are backed by smooth tannins. Black cherry fruit carries a suggestion of spices, but it's the delicious fruit that wins you over.
Name: Milbrandt 2011 Traditions Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy in red plum and layered in subtle suggestions of herb and cinnamon spice, this will please a wide range of palates and pocketbooks, the wine given a year in American oak. It's a good one for the dinner table or larger gathering.
Name: Pedroncelli 2012 Bench Vineyards Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Prune, stewed plum and warm cranberry sauce blend with anise and brown spice on the nose of this wine from Paso Robles' Eastside. The flavors, framed by good acid and tannins, are evenly presented red fruits, with a distinct strawberry finish.
Name: Phantom Rivers 2010 Still Waters Vineyard Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This very limited reserve is from a particular block, and as with most block selections, it offers focused, somewhat constrained flavors. Precisely defined red berry fruit is set in a frame of vanilla, toast and coffee. It's a pleasant, albeit generic quaffer.
Name: Columbia Crest 2011 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In a challenging vintage, this shows excellent structure around rather light fruit. Strawberry and cherry come into play, with some well-managed tannic strength from the addition of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cab Franc and a splash of Malbec.
Name: Hightower 2011 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: This mellowed-out red is ready to drink now. A good level of flavor complexity and a layered texture that is smooth but firm with tannins make this medium-bodied Merlot tasty. It feels so soothing and appetizing that one forgives the fruit and spice notes for being subtle.
Name: Twin Arches 2010 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark, chewy fruit flavors of black cherry come with a generous amount of espresso and dark, smoky toast. Highlights of anise and coffee grounds continue into a finish with slightly grainy tannins.
Name: Columbia Crest 2012 Grand Estates Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Robust, concentrated black-fruit aromas bring accents of citrus rind and spice. The palate is rough and rugged, while flavors of blackberry, spice, fig and chocolate finish dark and toasty, with minty oak and tannins still needing to be resolved.
Name: Concha y Toro 2012 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (Peumo)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The oak—50% new French and American—gets far out front with its notes of coffee, toffee and vanilla. But there's still much to enjoy, with abundant red fruit and a soft, sultry feel.
Name: Milbrandt 2011 The Estates Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a ruffle of herbaceous, green leaves that lingers from nose to finish, adding freshness to this otherwise rich, sumptuous Merlot. The mouthfeel is robust and velvety, with layers of fine, penetrating tannins that linger long on the finish. Enjoy now after a robust decant, but better yet from 2016-2019.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2012 Blackbird Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatically appealing wine with notes of macerated cherries along with raspberries, cola and licorice, as well as tart acids.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2011 Gravity Destiny Ridge Vineyard Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Soft and immediately accessible, this offers reliable and seductive flavors of vanilla and coffee cream, with light raspberry fruit at the center. It's clean and ready for immediate enjoyment.
Name: 14 Hands 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A bit of bell pepper and black chile shows on this wine, alongside Dr Pepper and licorice aromas. Raspberry and a strong acidity kick off the palate, but pyrazine-pushed capsicum flavors emerge as well. Depending on preference, these can be quite pleasant, but anyone would find them tasty if paired with chicken mole or a roasted peppers.
Name: Joullian 2010 Estate Family Reserve Merlot (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This remains tight and somewhat impenetrable, with focused, tart flavors of red berry, lemon and pineapple. The scent of oak references considerable time in 40% new barrels. Once the fruit flavors fade, it's mostly acid that remains in the finish.
Name: Kontos 2010 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Strong oak aromas and flavors wrap around this full-bodied, rather tannic and bold Merlot. It shows ripe fruit flavors and a gripping texture that makes it appropriate to match with red meat. Blended with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon.
Name: Vino Vargas 2012 Matador Merlot (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Merlot from the Red Willow vineyard, this does not skimp on the scents and flavors of green herb. It's true to the vineyard's style and will require further bottle age to flesh out a bit and show its best strengths.
Name: Barrage Cellars 2010 A.K.A. Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced from the DuBrul and Meek vineyards, this pure varietal Merlot remains tart, earthy and shy of fully ripe. Pomegranate and rhubarb flavors dominate, with plenty of leafy herb.
Name: Stevens 2011 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Earthy, lightly stewed aromas of plum and berry set up a lively but pinched and narrow palate with candied flavors of mixed red berry fruits. Additional red-fruit friendliness rolls onto the finish of this pleasant but basic Merlot.
Name: La Playa 2012 Block Selection Reserve Block N. 10 Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Leathery, briny plum aromas are full and herbal. This feels solid and medium in size and body. Flavors of earthy, roasted berry and plum finish lightly green and herbal, with a touch of sweetness.
Name: Terrapura 2012 Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: Nothing is out of place in this solid, attractive and well-priced Merlot. It is a straightforward red wine that feels well-balanced, is medium to full-bodied, and has tasty, mellow plum and cherry flavors. Firm tannins mark the clean finish.
Name: Stomping Ground 2010 Merlot (California)

Description: Dry spice and plum flavors are lean but fair. This feels snappy, crisp and high in acidity, while flavors of plum and berry are loamy and finish mild except for a touch of residual zesty acid.
Name: Santa Carolina 2012 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Wild berry aromas come with a cool hint of herbal mint. This is full, grabby and solid in the mouth. Flavors of dark fruits come across lightly stewed and pruny, while the finish dishes up a final taste of prune and foresty notes.
Name: Concha y Toro 2012 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This has a reductive nose, with stewed blackberry giving a fruity side to the barnyard-y aromas. The flavors are earthy and savory, with some cigar box surrounding it all, but not tons of fruit.
Name: Deep Sea 2011 The Octopus Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Potent black-fruit aromas are forward. In the mouth, this is choppy and punchy. Flavors of mint, coconut and jagged black fruits finish oaky and grabby, with tartness. There are many disparate parts to this wine.
Designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Maule
Name: Concha y Toro 2012 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Maule Merlot (San Clemente)

Description: Ripe in color and aromas, this chunky wine delivers heavy baked-berry and raisin aromas in front of a jammy, extracted palate. Raisin and cooked berry flavors finish plump, with earthy notes.
Name: Balduzzi 2012 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Gritty, tarry, green aromas are punchy but herbaceous. This has a lively, juicy, grinding mouthfeel and herbal, peppery flavors of plum and berry. The finish is minty green in flavor, with an upright, lively feel.
Name: Montes 2012 Classic Series Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Here's a supple, velvet-textured Merlot from the all-around successful 2012 vintage in California. It pulls together baking-spice aromas and attractive, ripe flavors of raspberry and cherry on the medium-bodied palate. It conveys a sense of breadth and meatiness without being heavy.
Name: Oak Grove 2012 Family Reserve Merlot (California)

Description: This smells and tastes fruity and lean, almost like straight grape juice. It could serve well as a lunch wine or at an outdoor concert wine. Light to medium-bodied, it's also light in texture and cherrylike in flavor.
Name: CK Mondavi 2012 Wildcreek Canyon Merlot (California)

Description: Scratchy, raw, green-tobacco aromas set up a choppy palate with hard tannins. Green-leaning, herbaceous berrry flavors finish abrasive and tannic, with mild heat.
Name: Cousiño-Macul 2012 Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Dusty potpourri and tomato-leaf notes lend a rustic tone to this sweet, fruity sparkling full of ruddy plum and cherry flavors. It's delicate in mousse, but a bit clumsy and dull on the palate.
Name: Pugliese 2009 Dolce Patricia Estate Bottled Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Aromas start sharp. Following the nose, this feels edgy and angular. Flavors of herbal berry and plum border on weedy, while creamy oak on the finish offers up sweetness and texture.
Name: Anakena 2012 Enco Reserve Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Quite tannic, this has smoky, peppery aromas and dark fruit flavors. Deep and dark in color, it's medium-bodied and firm and dry in texture.
Name: Campus Oaks 2012 Old Vine Merlot (Mendocino)

Description: Bursting in vibrant red plum and raspberry fruit, this bright, juicy wine is layered in black peppery seasoning and vanilla. Smooth and age-worthy, the finish is lingering and as satisfying as a triple encore with drum solo from your favorite band.
Name: World's End 2010 Little Sister Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: Full-bodied, structured and leathery, it's characterized by a combination of plum and gamy meat, accented by a taste of black olive tapenade. It finishes smooth and toasty.
Name: Yates Family Vineyard 2010 Fleur de Veeder Merlot (Mount Veeder)

Description: Brilliant pink with a touch of orange, this refreshing and light-bodied wine tastes fresh and strawberrylike. It has an appetizingly crisp texture and clean fruity finish.
Name: Lusso Della Terra 2013 Rose of Merlot (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep aromas of cherry liqueur and cedar make a very appealing nose. Cigar box and cherry juice flavors continue to the palate alongside cola nut, and there are very chewy tannins. So either serve now with a hearty cut of beef, or wait until 2015 for the grip to mellow out.
Name: Pull 2010 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: A finely made Merlot with smaller amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Malbec and Petit Verdot blended in. It offers soft red currant fruit, with a nice integration of tannins on the palate. There's a long grip of black pepper and clove on the finish, and the wine is balanced in weight and alcohol.
Name: Charles Krug 2011 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intoxicating, inviting aromas of vanilla pipe tobacco and rich blueberry form the nose. It's quite extracted on the palate, thick and viscous, with powerful cherry and cigar flavors.
Name: Still Waters 2009 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Boysenberry, cracked peppercorn and caramel frame the nose of this rich red. Although not particularly complex, lush flavors of berry juice and espresso on the palate prove rather tasty and enjoyable.
Name: William Hill Estate 2012 Merlot (Central Coast)

Description: Complex and grippy, it offers classic layers of spicy black pepper, clove and red cherry and plum fruit. Not overpowering on the palate or in price, it will pair with flair.
Name: Robert Mondavi 2011 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: A collaboration between winemaker Nick Goldschmidt and his daughter Chelsea, this 100% Merlot delivers great value. Oaky in plummy black fruit and tobacco, it shows a touch of cedar and clove amidst mountainous tannins. An ideal wine for pepper steak off the grill.
Name: Chelsea Goldschmidt 2012 Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Description: Black cherry and vanilla aromas lead this young Merlot. There are big flavors of red plum and cooked black fruits in the midpalate, with balanced acidity on the finish.
Name: Cramele Halewood 2013 La Umbra Merlot (Colinele Dobrogei)

Description: Taking time to come around aromatically, it opens up with plum and bright red cherry fruit that follow on the palate, a touch of savory tobacco suggested around the tannins. On the finish expect a balance of spice and sweet as black pepper and caramel compete for affection.
Name: Decoy 2012 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Description: Plummy, soft and supple, this 100% Merlot dances in bright black cherry fruit and vanilla. Juicy on the palate and food-friendly, it finishes dusty and fast.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a well-constructed, with 95% of the grapes from Napa Valley and the rest supplied from nearby Lake County. Merlot makes up 85% of the wine; the remainder is Cabernet Sauvignon. Hearty, it offers juicy plum and black cherry as well as streaks of cedar and black pepper. The tannins are soft and integrated while the finish hints at mocha and chocolate.
Name: Educated Guess 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Description: This has aromas of vanilla, plum and black raspberry. In the mouth, there are ripe fruit flavors followed by a wave of tart cherry flavor.
Name: Cramele Recas 2013 Dreambird Merlot (Recas)

Description: This garnet colored wine has aromas of red plums and black pepper. There are jammy flavors of ripe cherry and red raspberry on the palate. There's a nice acidic bite and a pleasant touch of astringency on the finish.
Name: Vini 2012 Veni Vidi Vici Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: There's a spicy cinnamon character to this wine that's otherwise flush in blackberry and chest-pounding ripe fruit and oak.
Name: District 2011 Merlot (Oakville)

Description: A big, ripe and jammy wine made from old vines. There are black plum fruits but the wine is dominated by licorice, black coffee and wood. It is powerful and very solid. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château des Landes 2010 Cuvée Prestige  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh smells of blue raspberry and black licorice characterize the nose. On the palate, it's heavily tannic, beginning with some cherry before becoming distractingly grippy. Hold until 2017.
Name: Broken Earth 2010 Estate Merlot (Paso Robles)

Description: Bordeaux wine should not have high alcohol; it detracts from the play between fruit and tannins, as in this wine. It is powered by its extracted structure, with flavors of bitter chocolate that leave the fruit behind.
Name: Château des Landes 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

Description: A mix of plum and vanilla, this is an easygoing Merlot that's good for most group occasions and palates, muted in aroma but developed in flavor.
Name: Benziger 2011 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a big Merlot, earthy but a tad flat, with a tobacco-like bitterness on the tail end.
Name: Michel-Schlumberger 2011 Le Sage Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rarely does a Merlot in this price range display this much power and concentration. Sourced from several vineyards, it's ripe right to the border of raisin flavors, with generous dollops of maple syrup and brown sugar adding further complexity. Still fruit-driven, yet with plenty of barrel flavor, this massive Merlot can take your richest, tangiest barbecue sauce.
Name: Dumas Station 2012 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pure Merlot coats the mouth with opulent berry and cherry fruit and silky tannins. Crafted from Ciel du Cheval, Conner Lee and Stonetree vineyard grapes, the poise, balance, integration and persistence are outstanding, as is the value.
Name: Guardian 2011 Confidential Source Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This aromatic, Bordeaux-style blend is built from a generous mix of well-loved vineyards scattered across the Columbia Valley. Balanced and detailed, it combines fresh herbs, rhubarb, raspberry and tart acidity. The result is a young, still tight, well-structured wine with excellent aging potential through 2024.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Previously from all Seven Hills vineyard grapes, this estate bottling now sources almost half its grapes from the high-altitude, mineral-driven Ferguson vineyard. Peppery spices elevate the nose, leading into a young, tight wine with compact cranberry and strawberry fruit. The depth and minerality are exceptional.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2011 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Deep garnet in color with a bright rim, this wine has a nose of black cherry, strawberry and anise. Flavors of black cherry, wild strawberry, fennel bulb and a touch of eucalyptus mingle on the palate amid velvety tannins. A last-second burst of bright cherry lights up the silky finish.
Name: Suvla 2012 Merlot (Thrace)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Solvang's family- and pet-friendly Carivintas Winery is dedicated to rescuing dogs that have been cast aside, but they focus on making quality wine too. That cares shows in this Merlot, which smells rich and thick like a Chinese plum-hoisin sauce, with some minerality peeking through. On the palate, it's medium bodied with more plum jam and clove elements.
Name: Carivintas 2012 Merlot (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 100% varietal from one of Washington's most esteemed vineyards, it's tightly wound and slow to reveal its charms. Notes of clove, woodspice, raspberry and cherry re supported by firm, slightly dry tannins that need time to soften.
Name: Fidelitas 2010 Champoux Vineyard Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Winemaker: David Trafford. This opens a bit green around the edges, supported by a core of black plum and blueberry fruit that takes over the palate alongside notes of fudgy brownie and soft toast. The tannins are soft, yet structured, and are coupled with bright acidity that keeps the mouthfeel fresh and the fruit lifted through the finish. Drink now–2017.
Name: de Trafford 2009 Cape Winemakers Guild Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: Winemaker: Jeff Grier. Thin Mint is the first thing that comes to mind here, thanks to intense, upfront aromas of menthol and dark chocolate. Behind that are layers of black raspberry, plum and cherry, as well as touches of earth and tree bark. Soft, dusty tannins and ripe fruit flavors translate to a smooth, accessible palate. Drink now–2018.
Name: Villiera 2012 Cape Winemakers Guild Drip Barrel Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This seduces with flavors of juicy, ripe berries, spicy plums and black cherries. It delivers the complexity, density and mocha finish of a much more expensive Merlot.
Name: StoneCap 2012 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A savory nose of roasted red pepper and marinated black olives makes this wine from the Santa Ynez Valley's first estate winery stand out from the crowd. There are green elements that some may consider unwanted, but the round, peppery spiciness makes for an intriguing, distinctive palate. This would go well with a New York strip and could stand up to prime rib with horseradish.
Name: Firestone 2010 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consulting winemaker Michel Rolland oversees this bottling in the Long Shadows series. Fans of his forward, sometimes voluptuous style may find this vintage a bit thin. The fruit is peppery and the tannins chewy, while the barrel flavors of chocolaty oak have not quite assimilated. Further bottle age might improve the wine.
Name: Pedestal 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is dark garnet in the glass, with aromas of raspberry and boysenberry that set the palate up for flavors of eucalyptus, thyme, oregano and black cherry. The flavor profile leans a little too far towards the herbal end of the spectrum, but it is ultimately a pleasant and easy-drinking wine.
Name: Tabor 2012 Mt. Tabor Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Firm and compact, this marries tart red and purple fruit to tannins, with a soft streak of leather and a dusting of coffee grounds. Flavor integration is excellent, and the wine will drink well through 2019.
Name: Goose Ridge 2011 g3 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Just a bit of Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon is added to the blend, most of which comes from the Ciel du Cheval, Tapteil and Weinbau vineyards. In this cooler vintage, an herbal character emerges, lending firm tannins and structure to the tight black cherry and cassis core.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Woody, brambly notes lend an earthy complexity to fresh blackberry and cassis notes on this bright, brisk Merlot. A shower of cranberry acidity jolts the palate and cuts through the fine, but penetrating tannins that fringe the finish. An elegant, refreshing example of a cool-climate Merlot.
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2012 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: At first this muscular wine feels tight, even stiff, with crisply defined plum and cassis fruit. The only knock on it is the drying tannins, which leave a chalky aftertaste. Pair with a juicy cut of pork or salmon.
Name: Three Rivers 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The oak influence (20% American, 80% French) predominates on this 100% varietal wine with notes of mocha and spice. The fruit flavors are lighter in style, with a grainy feel to the tannins. Coffee flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Seven Falls 2011 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Santa Cruz Mountains-based winery Cinnabar turns to two vineyards (PMR and Twin Oaks) for this intriguing take on Merlot. It begins with a lifting herbal nose of sagebrush and tobacco. Next it carries into soft black cherry fruit on the palate, with vanilla flavors on the finish. It's got some tannic grip, so could be one to put away until 2016.
Name: Cinnabar 2012 El Pomar District Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The nose of this Merlot is lush and seductive with whiffs of vanilla, mocha and spice melding into rich blackberry preserves. By contrast, the palate is quite restrained and mineral in character with flavors of tart, crisp berries and cherries lined with fine, dusty tannins. A happy medium of ripeness balanced with nuance and structure.
Name: Keuka Spring 2012 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Smooth and sweet, it's ripe with flavors of strawberry preserves. Liberal accents of chocolate and coffee speak to substantial barrel time, and there is more than a hint of sweetness across the palate. But for those who like a big, blocky, ripe style, it's quite tasty.
Name: Jacob Williams 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Notes of dried sage and thyme persist, lending a nuanced complexity to this crisp, medium-bodied Merlot. It's elegant in style with concentrated blackberry and cherry flavors wrapped in layers of soft, velveteen tannins that linger on the finish.
Name: Stony Lonesome 2012 Estate Reserve Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of bramble, vanilla and spice accent aromas of ripe red berries and cherries on this bold, richly concentrated Merlot. The palate is crisp with sour cherry flavor, but nuanced with savory touches of cedar and earth. It's a nicely composed wine that finishes elegantly with a touch of savory herbs.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2010 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intensely ripe aromas of blackberries and cherries are touched with granite and bramble wood on this plush, somewhat sultry Merlot. The palate balances ripeness with crisp sour-cherry acidity and swathes of fresh, green herbs. Medium-bodied in style, it wraps up tightly with a coating of chalky, soft tannins.
Name: Standing Stone 2010 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Merlot, which includes a small amount of Syrah, at first feels a little disjointed, though some breathing time helps pull it together. Raspberry fruit enters softly and lingers nicely, though without much depth or further development.
Name: Stottle 2011 Elephant Mountain Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh red cherry and bramble notes are touched with mint, spice and vanilla on this concentrated, textured Merlot. While it's rich body and ripe berry flavors make it pleasing to a wide audience, zippy cranberry acidity and a dark mineral tone on the finish lends complexity and balance.
Name: Belhurst 2010 Merlot (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Still sorting itself out, it matches tart cranberry fruit to an astringent, tannic finish with highlights of espresso. More time in bottle may soften up some of the rough edges.
Name: Airfield Estates 2012 Runway Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rich, ripe scents of cherry pie and cherry cola waft from this profoundly aromatic Merlot. It's boldly alcoholic and full bodied, but the palate shows restraint with crisp red berry flavors highlighted by a streak of acidity. Soft, furry tannins coat the finish.
Name: King's Garden Vineyards 2010 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: Deep red violet to the eye, this wine offers aromas of ripe cherry, pomegranate and orange zest. There is a sensation of coolness dominating fruit, with flavors of blackberry, pomegranate, menthol, clove and orange zest. It is a bit chewy on the palate; the strong tannins are crying out to be served alongside grilled lamb or beef.
Name: Selendi 2010 Merlot (Aegean)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel flavors of toast and chocolate cover light strawberry fruit. It's pleasant enough, but the flavors have not yet jelled. Give it until 2016 to age.
Name: Eight Bells 2011 Red Willow Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tannic and earthy, it falls on the dark, herbal side, cloaking its cassis fruit in flavors of tannin and stem. It's best drunk with grilled meats, or a good, greasy pizza.
Name: Girly Girl 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of freshly cracked pepper and boysenberry introduce this wine. Once sipped, the promised complexity slips away, with plum flavors and even tannins but not much lingering finish. Serve with burgers and meatloaf.
Name: McIntyre Vineyards 2012 Kimberly Merlot (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Much like the other 2011 red wine releases from Cave B, this offers thin, tart red fruit, and strong herb and stem flavors in the finishing tannins.
Name: Cave B 2011 XXVI Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's a hard edge to the mocha, herb and cherry aromas. The palate has blocky, dry tannins that distract.
Name: Samson 2012 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Notes of rhubarb and cherry don't stitch together. It drinks just off dry with a tart finish.
Name: Cave B 2013 Dry Rosé Merlot (Ancient Lakes)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Among Wente's highest-priced offerings, this is an elegant Merlot, velvety textured and succulent in herbal cassis and luxurious red plum and cherry. With a gorgeous mouthfeel and some weight to the body, it'll stand up to equally elegant meals.
Name: Wente 2011 The Nth Degree Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: A plush, lush, value-priced Merlot, this is herbal and rich in truffle mushroom, fierce black-cherry fruit and oak. The generous finish suggests a measured helping of spice.
Name: Noble Vines 2011 181 Merlot (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Medium-bodied and well-priced for the quality, this Merlot is herbal in cassis and red cherry flavors, on the elegant side of the spectrum, and relatively low in alcohol. The tannins are firm and mellowed, the finish just fine.
Name: Heron 2012 Merlot (Mendocino County)

Description: Medium-bodied, this wine's ripe fruit characteristics offer dark plum and golden raisin flavors. It will serve most basic wine needs.
Name: Mustache Vineyards 2012 Merlot (Lodi)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and fruity, it has aromas of red currant, cranberry, plum and orange peel. These are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors with cranberry-like acidity.
Name: Schmidt 2010 Schmidt Family Vineyards Estate Merlot (Applegate Valley)

Description: Roasted, smoky initial aromas give way to olive and sassy red-fruit scents. This feels rubbery and grabby, with strong tannins. Rubbery, herbal flavors of plum and red berry finish racy and a bit tart.
Designation: Toro de Piedra Gran Reserva Single Vineyard
Name: Viña Requingua 2011 Toro de Piedra Gran Reserva Single Vineyard Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: Aromas that recall an ice cream sundae with chocolate sauce, vanilla and syrupy fruit are confected. Ditto the mouthfeel, which is creamy and resiny. These aromas transfer to the flavor profile, which is sweet, chocolaty and finishes like a vanilla marshmallow.
Name: Santa Ema 2010 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: This wine is marked by oak, baked vanilla and bacon, and is quite thick and syrupy, offering generic tones of berry and plum.
Name: Stama 2012 Merlot (Lodi)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the winery's first single-vineyard Merlot. Polished and dense, its aromatics are a multidimensional mix of cassis, espresso, cacao and tobacco. Firm and full, the flavors continue along the same lines, going deep into a thoroughly satisfying finish.
Name: JM Cellars 2011 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Leonetti's Merlot is the only wine among their four annual releases to debut a year early. It's a good thing with this wine, which is smooth and packed with rich black-cherry and cassis fruit flavors. Also in the blend are small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. The tannins are slightly granular, and soaked with cocoa flavor, giving it a pleasingly dark, toasty edge.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Merlot sourced from several Columbia Valley vineyards, this opens with inviting toasty scents, quickly moving into a broad, flavorful palate loaded with pretty cherry fruit. The balance between fruit and barrel is perfect, and the wine is ready for near-term enjoyment.
Name: Abeja 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With its deep garnet color and aromas of blackberry, black cherry and coffee, this wine signals early on that you are in for something special. Flavors of black cherry, blueberry, anise and caramel play across the palate amidst fine tannins, right through the bright orange-peel finish.
Name: Tabor 2010 Adama Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Iron and steel, rock and earth are the first things you notice about this mineral-inflected, single-vineyard Merlot. It's an ode to tannin and terroir, a tough, tight and dense wine with primary fruit flavors of cranberry and cassis.
Name: Januik 2011 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Merlot has long been a particular strength at Forgeron. Up front in this new release is a thick vein of chocolate around rich black cherry fruit. The wine dips a bit in midpalate, then re-emerges in a finish with chewy tannins and citrusy acidity. The odds strongly favor more improvement with further bottle age; try after 2016.
Name: Forgeron 2011 Boushey Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a carefully made, almost calculated wine that showcases controlled herbaceousness around tight, crisp black fruits. The mix evokes earth, herb, barrel and grape.
Name: Novelty Hill 2011 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Over the last few years, veteran winemaker Roman Roth's eponymous Merlot has proven to be a consistent winner. His 2007 vintage is no exception. While intensely ripe with a rich, almost raisined black-fruit character, it's balanced with hints of granite, smoke and brine that all lend a savory, earthy tone. Penetratingly tannic and robust in structure, it's a wine to decant now, or cellar through 2019–2021.
Name: The Grapes of Roth 2007 Merlot (Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Smooth and palate-coating, it's 100% varietal, with just the right balance between blackberry and black cherry fruit, and barrel-induced flavors of toffee, toasted macadamia nuts, and café crème.
Name: Seven Hills 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Black cherry and plum run deep, dark and rich throughout this concentrated Merlot (blended with Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot). Refreshingly brisk on the palate, it's nuanced with earthy hints of granite and bramble wood. It's bold and richly structured, yet impeccably balanced.
Name: Wölffer 2010 Merlot (Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Luscious blackberry and cherry notes are marked with hints of bramble and spice in this bold yet elegantly framed wine. The palate feels lush and warm with judicious oak, yet bright, with a shower of cranberry acidity and fine-grain tannins that penetrate through the finish.
Name: One Woman 2010 Estate Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plum and especially blueberry fruit compels your interest immediately. It's cloaked in precisely focused tannins that frame an extended, lightly chocolaty finish.
Name: Novelty Hill 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rock solid, this substantial Merlot is grounded in earth flavors, laced with butter cookie, and finished with tart tannins. The fruit is tight and tangy.
Name: Januik 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromatic and fruity, this is front-loaded with pretty accents of toast and baking spices. There's 10% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, but it's Merlot's show, with forward, smooth, chocolaty goodness around a core of raspberry candy.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This spicy, fruity blend sources from seven different vineyards, and includes 5% portions of Cabernet Franc and Syrah. The acids bring up hints of pink grapefruit and orange, while the cherry and plum fruit flavors hold the center. The wine seems to thin out a bit through the finish.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Dry aromas of leafy, spicy red-berry fruits register as complex and mature. Medium in body, it has integrated tannins and acids. Flavors of lightly baked cherry and sweet red currant are earthy and finish with notes of cocoa powder, raspberry and plum. Drink now.
Name: Hubert Weber 2006 Vineyard Selection Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of barnyard and earth lend a rustic, yet comforting, tone to black cherry and berry aromas on this elegant, Old-World style wine. The palate is crisp with tart black-fruit flavors framed within layers of soft, chalky tannins. It finishes moderately long.
Name: Palmer 2009 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Fresh black cherry and plum aromas are pristine and primary, accentuating flavors of spiced cherry pie in this approachable wine. Juicy and ripe on the palate, it's also elegant with soft, finely-grained tannins that linger on the finish.
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2010 Oregon Road Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of rich, concentrated blackberry preserves are accented with spice and char on this medium-bodied wine. Soft acidity adds refreshment to the midpalate, guiding a moderately long finish tinged with granite and fine-grained tannins.
Name: Raphael 2010 Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Aromas of fruits of the wood, clove and menthol pave the way for flavors of blackberry, clove, and eucalyptus. Cooling herb flavors predominate over fruit, and the soft finish offers a burst of anisette with a bright cherry splash.
Name: Bazelet HaGolan 2010 Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is fruity and clean, with plenty of pretty cherry-fruit flavor. A whiff of wood smoke and pipe tobacco carves its way through the fruit and into the finish.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though the wine saw just less than 25% of new American and Hungarian oak, the vanilla and baking spices stand out at present along with tart cherries, cough syrup and dried herbs. It's tart and somewhat lean in style with a firm handshake of tannins.
Name: Waterbrook 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though Syrah makes up only 14% of this wine, it seems to take over the show with its notes of plum and smoke playing against barrel accents of pencil lead and vanilla. It drinks off dry (9.5g/L residual sugar), with dry grainy tannins.
Designation: The Expedition Canoe Ridge Estate Vineyard
Name: Canoe Ridge 2012 The Expedition Canoe Ridge Estate Vineyard Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though not immediately identifiable as Merlot, it's an aromatically pleasing wine with notes of cocoa, pencil lead and herbs. Medium bodied, it drinks just off dry, with slightly bitter tannins.
Name: Bridgman 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: From a small parcel in the Lamothe-Vincent vineyard, this rich, structured wine shows a strong relationship with terroir and minerality. It has power and intensity, while still preserving enough freshness. Drink from 2016.
Designation: Le Grand Rossignol du Château Lamothe Vincent
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2010 Le Grand Rossignol du Château Lamothe Vincent  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Description: Dark berry aromas come with accents of spice, graphite and raisin on this ripe, healthy wine. In the mouth, this is medium to full in size, with proper balance. Flavors of blueberry and plum lead to a mellow finish that delivers lasting ripeness and clean lines.
Name: Viña Casablanca 2011 Nimbus Single Vineyard Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Charred and heavily oaked from the opening gun to the closing tape. Amid all the barrel influence and toast, you'll find black plum and wild berry aromas and flavors. On the finish, oak reasserts its control over this wine.
Designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Maule
Name: Concha y Toro 2011 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Maule Merlot (San Clemente)

Description: Berry and currant aromas are jumpy and fruity in nature, while in the mouth, creamy oak creates a sticky feel. Candied, barrel-driven flavors of vanilla and clove outlast the wine's fruit content on the finish.
Name: Santa Ema 2011 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: A ripe, full wine that has almost too much weight, it offers a very rich texture and firm tannins. The blackberry jelly fruits are dense and powered by a fruity feel. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Larteau 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

Description: Jammy blackberry and plum aromas come with hints of Band-Aid and iodine. This is big and broad on the tongue, but also a little flabby. Flavors of prune, oak, blackberry and licorice finish without much drive.
Name: Chilcas 2011 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Surprisingly tannic, this juicy wine shows intense structure and a smoky character from wood aging. It feels as though the tannins and extract have smothered the natural fruitiness of the wine. It will need time to come round, so wait until 2017.
Name: Casal do Conde 2011 Terras do Vale Colheita Seleccionada Merlot (Tejo)

Description: This is an old-school Chilean Merlot in the sense that the nose is rustic and leathery, but not unappealing. The wine is on the light side in terms of weight and extraction, while leafy flavors of roasted plum and berry finish with hints of toast and bitterness.
Name: Echeverria 2011 Reserva Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Description: The phenomenal 2010 vintage shows why this wine is considered Italy's top purebred Merlot. Revealing structure, finesse and mesmerizing depth, it delivers blackberries, currants, cedar, exotic spices and mocha alongside firm, polished tannins and fresh acidity. It's well balanced with fantastic length and while it's delicious now, hold for more complexity. Drink 2015–2030.
Name: Masseto 2010 Merlot (Toscana)

Description: One of Italy's truly great 100% Merlots, this wine opens with aromas of plum, black currants and exotic spices. The opulent, smooth palate delivers blackberry, white pepper and a note of creamy milk chocolate alongside firm, velvety tannins. Soft and round, it's delicious now, but it will also develop for a decade or more. Drink 2016–2026.
Name: Tua Rita 2011 Redigaffi Merlot (Toscana)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Alpha is a new offering from Market Vineyards, and boosts the flavor meter past the winery's excellent, value-priced Benchmark Merlot. Tightly-structured and showing a barrel-heavy mix of dark, toasted flavors, this complex effort brings lead pencil, clove, charred meat and black fruits into play. Enjoy it with your thick grilled steak, or tuck it away until 2020–2022.
Name: Market Vineyards 2010 Alpha Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A high water mark for Barrister, this ripe and lush Merlot is sourced from the Dwelley vineyard. Chunky berry and cassis fruit is soaked in delicious baking spices, vanilla and chocolate. There's nothing shy here, but it is thoroughly enjoyable.
Name: Barrister 2011 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An outstanding value, the newest Benchmark Merlot was sourced equally from Hightower (Red Mountain) and Weinbau (Wahluke Slope) vineyards. It offers plenty of rich barrel flavors, wrapped in a dark, toasty, smoky wine with fruit ripe enough to handle all the oak. Black cherry, cassis and dark chocolate coat the palate.
Name: Market Vineyards 2010 Benchmark Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is a young, tight, firm Merlot, blended with 16% Cabernet Franc and 8% Malbec. Those two grapes pull it even tighter, framing the black cherry fruit with sleek, polished tannins. The acidity and natural minerality suggest that a bit more bottle age will add extra depth and flesh.
Name: Pepper Bridge 2011 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This excellent Merlot speaks to many of Reininger's proven strengths. It's quite smooth and supple, loaded with ripe plum and cherry fruit, seamless and chocolaty. The balance is right on, the length and texture captivating.
Name: Reininger 2010 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consulting winemaker Charlie Hoppes has imprinted his benchmark style on Gamache fruit. This is a big, ripe, blocky but powerful wine—all Merlot as only Washington State can grow it. The ripe cassis fruit is enveloped in a mix of French and American oak, half new, yielding strong flavors of smoke, tobacco and mocha. A blockbuster style, ready to drink right now.
Name: Gamache 2010 Estate Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This captures the spicy vitality of Les Collines Merlot, with pretty cherry and plum fruit set against a smattering of new oak toast. It's a clean, well-defined wine that continues into a tasty finish with highlights of roasted walnuts and clove.
Name: Burnt Bridge 2011 Les Collines Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Hamptons, Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Crisp, pristine blackberry notes are deeply penetrating on the nose and palate. It's ripe and luscious on the palate with layers of savory herb, smoke and hay that add complexity and flair. Big, impenetrable tannins need time to mellow, but are likely to smooth out beautifully through 2019.
Name: Wölffer 2010 Christian's Cuvee Merlot (The Hamptons, Long Island)

Appellation: The Hamptons, Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Deeply saturated with blackberry and plum flavors, this powerful, boldly structured Merlot balances rich fruit with complex shades of earth and mineral. Umami-rich whiffs of soy sauce and hay linger from nose to finish, hinting towards its development. It's pleasant now, but should meld considerably through 2019.
Name: Wölffer 2010 Lombardo Merlot (The Hamptons, Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Merlot is usually the best wine in any budget lineup of Washington reds, and this excellent entry from the new regime (Gallo) at Columbia is no exception. Polished and flavorful, it has textural, detailed flavors built upon black cherry, plum and cassis fruit. There is a light dusting of fresh herbs, and the wine has real grip and presence in the mouth.
Name: Columbia Winery 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A very limited (three barrels) block selection, this is a tough, chewy wine that remains stubbornly closed even after being open a full 24 hours. Hard cherry candy is concentrated in a tannic casing, with streaks of licorice, dark chocolate, and slightly bitter herbs wrapped around it. But the power and stuffing are there for significant improvement over time.
Name: Gordon Estate 2010 Estate Grown Block 3 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a muscular Merlot, exotic in cinnamon/cardamom spice that's otherwise soft, structured and complex. The tannins are most pronounced on the finish and need time to further integrate, but make the wine long-lasting in leathery cassis and tobacco flavor.
Name: Occasio 2010 Thatcher Bay Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: An elegant, cool-climate Merlot that's inviting in perfumey red plum and cherry, slightly tart, aged in all French oak. With layered acidity, it'll go well on the table with herb-slathered roast chicken.
Name: Greenwood Ridge 2011 Estate Bottled Merlot (Mendocino Ridge)

Description: Pure Merlot from the Barde-Haut vineyard gives a smooth and ripely fruited wine that is now on the way to maturity. It combines soft tannins, an elegant structure and juicy acidity. The aftertaste is fruity with a more mature edge.
Name: Château Barde Haut 2008 Le Vallon de Barde-Haut  (Saint-Émilion)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In a change of style, this is now 100% varietal, and much the better for it. Tart and juicy, with pure fruit flavors of cranberry and raspberry, it pushes deep into the palate and on through a clean, racy finish.
Name: Mercer 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Unmistakably Washington Merlot with its notes of milk chocolate, raspberry, espresso and cherry. It's light in style but still sumptuous in feel with slightly rustic tannins framing a lingering chocolate and vanilla-filled finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2011 H3 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A Merlot with close to 18% Cabernet Franc and the tiniest percentage of Grenache (.5%), this well-put-together wine offers herbal leather, licorice and black currant amidst a core of soft tannins.
Name: Lava Cap 2010 Estate Bottled Merlot (El Dorado)

Description: This wine offers good value in aromas full of violet perfume and a suggestion of cedar. Taste-wise it offers raspberry liqueur in a soft, understated package, and long, straightforward finish. A great go-to for mid-week meals and larger gatherings, it'll pair with versatility.
Name: Parducci 2011 Small Lot Blend Merlot (Mendocino)

Description: This is a pretty good price for a wine that imparts juicy dark plum and toasty oak, a soft texture and long-lingering finish. Versatile with food, it'll neither overpower nor underperform.
Name: Peirano 2012 Six Clones Merlot (Lodi)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromatic in black cherry and herb, this is a smooth, round Merlot that'll please many palates, balanced in pleasant fruity tones and vanilla oak.
Name: Wente 2011 Sandstone Merlot (San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley)

Description: Leathery in tobacco and black currant, this wine leaves a bold imprint of toasty tannins.
Name: Brutocao 2010 Bliss Vineyard Merlot (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A savory, herbal Merlot with small percentages of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc blended in, Lake County-based Chacewater sources from the Sierra Foothills for this wine, which imparts dry tannins and leather saddle throughout.
Name: Chacewater 2011 Merlot (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bright and cheery with ripe red-berry and plum flavors accented with a hint of sweet spice, it's soft and lushly textured. The palate is fleshy and yielding, but wraps up with big, chunky tannins.
Name: Raphael 2010 First Label Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though it's 100% Merlot from Red Mountain, this seems more generic than representative of what that AVA can produce. It could be any modestly priced Bordeaux red variety or blend—red fruits, stiff tannins, and a seamless, yet one-dimensional mouthfeel.
Name: Two Brothers 2010 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This very light, thin Merlot shows modestly ripe fruit and fairly substantial tannins, perhaps from the addition of 16% Petit Verdot. Flavors are herbal and the finish fades quickly.
Name: Patterson 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from the cool 2011 vintage, this wine seems to bear more resemblance to Cabernet Sauvignon than Merlot with its notes of plum, herbs and bell pepper. The sweet cherry and vanilla flavors are buffeted by firm, dry tannins with a vanilla-filled finish.
Name: Desert Wind 2011 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Merlot from a cool site in a cool vintage yields a somewhat attenuated wine with tart berry fruit. The barrel aging has contributed flavors of sandalwood and chocolate, but the chalky tannins need some rich red meat to soften them up.
Name: Merry Cellars 2011 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Soft and slightly bitter, this wine offers straightforward highlights of herbs and toasty vanilla.
Name: Wattle Creek 2010 Merlot (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: Not a good year for this wine, which is green and fuzzy on the tongue, a strange waft of chemical overpowering over all.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2011 Schoolhouse Cuvée Merlot (Clarksburg)

Description: Chocolate covered cherries, dried black cherries and a touch of tobacco leaf draw you in. This wine is seductive and ripe, with well-integrated tannins and a bright, fruity cherry splash at the end.
Name: Bibich 2008 Sangreal Merlot (North Dalmatia)

Description: Flavors of cherry and blueberry pie, featuring vanilla and a full complement of baking spices, are joined in the mouth by a touch of spearmint. Velvety tannins and roundness on the palate carries through the long-lasting finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2009 Yarden Merlot (Galilee)

Description: An almost Port-like nose of stewed fruit, nutmeg and allspice sets the scene for flavors of cooked cherries and raspberries, with touches of oregano and orange zest. Zippy acidity leads the way, with tannins making their entrance just in time for a balanced finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2009 Gilgal Merlot (Galilee)

Description: This is a pleasingly tongue-coating wine, with flavors of cherry preserves, eucalyptus and butterscotch. A nice touch of pleasant salinity makes way for an enduring finish.
Name: Recanati 2012 Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This pure, full-bodied Merlot coats the palate with purple fruits and a creamy mix of mint, spice and vanilla. The herbal highlights are subtle and proportionate, and it's a very flavorful wine for the price.
Name: Watermill 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: While this is a bit rustic and herbal on first take, with time it settles and improves. Aromas of tomato and berry fruits lead to a crisp, firm palate with earthy plum, black cherry and herbal flavors. A soft fade away with earthy, baked notes doesn't hurt.
Name: Domaine Jean Bousquet 2012 Reserve Merlot (Tupungato)

Description: A garnet color with a violet rim, this has aromas of black cherry, pomegranate juice and a touch of vanilla, followed by flavors of tart cherry, blackberry and black licorice. The finish boasts pleasant acidity coupled with a bright fruit finish.
Name: Domaine Boyar 2011 Reserve Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: Blocky, roasted, rubbery black-fruit aromas settle with airing. This is full in body and expands across the palate. Flavors of earty, loamy black fruits finish with mocha and mild chocolate notes. This isn't overwhelming but it shows well at all key checkpoints.
Name: Tierra Brisa 2012 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Rubbery aromas of asphalt vie with berry fruits and hints of green herbs, particularly mint. The palate is big, soupy and round in feel, with herbal flavors of baked plum and raspberry. On the finish, things turn salty and herbal, with roasted overtones.
Name: Viña Cobos 2012 Felino Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Soft and lightly sweet at the end, it shows black and dried fruits, light tannins and spice from the wood aging. Drink now.
Name: Le Petit Panier 2012 Merlot (Vin de France)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The 2009 Lewis Merlot is in peak form—a dark, smoky, dare we say 'brooding' wine with generous swatches of cassis, espresso, cacao, licorice and sandalwood. It glides into a silky, seamless, sexy finish, lingering generously for a minute or more.
Name: Dunham 2009 Lewis Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first vintage for Upright—100% Klipsun Vineyard and 100% varietal Merlot. Thick and syrupy, it's a full throttle wine, with deep flavors of berry, cherry and cassis. Red licorice lightly streaks through the back end, and the wine makes a smooth landing on a strip of Bourbon barrel notes.
Name: Efeste 2010 Upright Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: This Merlot from one of Greece's most exciting producers offers aromas of plum, black cherry and vanilla on the nose, followed by smooth, integrated flavors of black fruit, cinnamon, pepper and a spin of mint on the finish. Layered and elegant, with good acidity for food pairing.
Name: Alpha Estate 2008 Alpha One Unfiltered Merlot (Florina)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is the best of the current red wine releases from Bergevin Lane, a Merlot blend that includes 5% of each Petit Verdot and Malbec. Dense and potent, it's loaded with black fruits, coffee and tobacco flavors. The wine is wonderfully rich, with excellent definition and body. Drink now or cellar for another decade.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2010 Wild Child Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This round, rich and spicy estate-grown Merlot greets you with all the right stuff (and stuffing) from the first sniff. Clean berry and cherry fruit, with a light touch of peppery herb, rolls into silky tannins and pretty baking spices. A fine value.
Name: Gordon Estate 2010 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A spicy, herbal Merlot, sourced from a site on the Royal Slope, this distinctive wine ranges from strawberry to cherry, brambly and rather tightly wound. Woven through are threads of seed, herb, stem and earth. It's as close to a Bordeaux style as this winery ever comes.
Name: K Vintners 2010 Stoneridge Vineyard Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine shows notes of raspberry and chocolate sprinkled with oak spices from time in 50% new French barrels. It's wound up tightly at present, packed to the brim with red fruit flavors and firm, slightly gritty tannins.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2010 Estate Grown Merlot Block 8 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rather blocky and oaky at first, this can seem a bit overwhelmed with flavors from barrel aging. The tightly-wound red fruits appear slowly with hours of breathing, along with some alcohol heat in the finish. Give this as much aerating as possible.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a fine bottle of Merlot, released under Woodward Canyon's second label, Nelms Road. Firm blackberry and cassis fruit flavors anchor a substantial wine that has accents of smoke, licorice, tar and toast. Delicious!
Name: Nelms Road 2012 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though labeled Columbia Valley, this is in fact 100% Merlot from the estate vineyards on Red Mountain. It's chewy and tannic, as is often the case with Red Mountain reds, with black cherry and cassis fruit wrapped by astringent tannins hinting at dark chocolate. In short, a fine steak wine, that needs some fat to cut the tannins.
Name: Kiona 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine spent more than two years in barrel, yielding some grainy, textural tannins. The plummy fruit is backed with licorice, vanilla and black tea flavors, all nicely integrated.
Name: Mannina Cellars 2010 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of blue flowers and granite, spicy chocolate and vanilla notes add complexity to this Merlot. It's crisp and tart on the palate, but balanced, with penetrating flavors of blackberry and bramble bush. Finishes briskly with a leafy, herbaceous flair.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2010 Estate Bottled Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Whether due to vintage conditions or simply the result of re-prioritizing the brand, production of the Muleskinner has plummeted. Too bad, as this 100% estate-grown varietal wine is a unique expression of Walla Walla fruit. Here, it's tight, tannic and sharp-toothed with wild, brambly berry fruit in a compact frame. The aromatics promise more, so this could age for a bit before drinking.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2010 Muleskinner Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This leafy, Bordeaux-style Merlot is applealing for its moderate approach and emphasis on herbs and spice over oak and extraction. The wine is smooth and and round, with berry, cassis and herbal offsets. Classic Merlot from Chile, with just enough oak and fruit to rank as modern.
Designation: Gran Reserva de Los Andes Estate Bottled
Name: Santa Alicia 2011 Gran Reserva de Los Andes Estate Bottled Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This Merlot is concentrated with tart, crisp blackberry and cherry flavor, with a wisp of brambly stems on the nose and palate. It's bright with acidity and big, but velvety tannins that should allow the wine to mature well over 5–7 years.
Name: Bellangelo 2010 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A whiff of roasted nuts adds a rustic character to ripe black fruit on this Merlot. It's big and bold on the palate with concentrated fruit framed rigidly with tannins and acidity, but a hint of leafy, herbaceous notes adds elegance.
Name: Damiani 2010 Reserve Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: It would be hard to find a better $8 Merlot anywhere. This is soft and full-bodied, quite flavorful and fruity, with pretty black cherry fruit. Drinking especially nicely with a bit of bottle age, it finishes with well-proportioned notes of tobacco and clove.
Name: Columbia Crest 2010 Two Vines Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of vanilla and spice add warmth to pristine blackberry and plum flavors in this brisk, medium-bodied Merlot. It's tart with cranberry acidity and finishes with a lingering granite minerality.
Name: Damiani 2010 Sunrise Hill Vineyards Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: Muscular, rubbery aromas of black fruits are minty and tough. On the palate, this is rough as nails, with pounding tannins. Lead flavors of coconut, vanilla and chocolate are oak based, while the finish keeps that profile going. This is a big, dark, oaky wine with generic black-fruit character.
Name: Lapostolle 2011 Cuvée Alexandre Apalta Vineyard Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This Merlot includes 13% Syrah, along with smaller amounts of Petit Verdot and Cabernet. Vanilla and tobacco scents open the door to a sharp, peppery wine, with flavors cloaked in bark and scorched earth. It's rustic, big and flavorful, with a fat, meaty finish. This is the wine to go with your tri-tip.
Name: Boomtown 2011 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Juicy and plummy, this is a wine with generous amounts of purple fruit scents and flavors up front. The tannins turn a bit green and show some bitterness in the finish.
Name: Two Mountain 2010 Copeland Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though the oak is high quality (62% new American and French), it's in your face on this 100% varietal wine, with notes of char and toast. It's soft, silky and elegant in feel but the barrel flavors take over making it hard to get all the fruit notes.
