Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2011 Canoe Ridge Estate Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Warm toast, vanilla and spice notes are inviting on this deeply penetrating Merlot. Despite its rich black-fruit profile, the palate is surprisingly delicate displaying tart cranberry notes that linger long and lean.
Name: Fox Run 2010 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: An enticing herbal streak is often identifiable in Thelema's wines, and this is no exception, with hints of menthol, fynbos, tobacco and fig leaf, as well as a gamy accent in the background. There's plenty of fruit to mingle with these earthy tones—flavors of black plum, currant and a touch of fig paste all abound on the palate.
Name: Thelema 2009 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: Here's a ripe and round Merlot, brimming with fruity tones of prune, date, fudgy brownie and mocha on the nose and palate. It's lushly textured, with soft, fine tannins and a medium-length finish.
Name: KWV 2009 Cathedral Cellar Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: Crisp, direct aromas of cherry and briar define the nose on this herbal Merlot. A zesty palate is driven by snappy acidity, while herbal flavors of raspberry and spice finish with a raw feel and controlled green notes.
Name: Chilensis 2012 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light but pretty scents and flavors of berry and cherry push through this pleasant, fruity Merlot. Hints of tea and vanilla are there, but not intrusive. The tannins carry some slightly stemmy flavors.
Name: Snoqualmie 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Merlot smells rooty, with licorice and mint to boot. A wide, sort of flabby palate is, at its base, oaky as can be; there's also stewed plum and herbal blackberry flavors in front of a blocky, chunky finish.
Name: Montes 2011 Alpha Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Volatile and sharp from the get-go, this Merlot bites rather than soothes. Dried cherry fruit carries streaks of licorice and baking chocolate, along with some suggestions of volatility.
Name: Vin du Lac 2009 Barrel Select Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Spicy, crisp plum and berry aromas set up a medium-full palate with some roughness and edgy acidity. Flavors of herbal, peppery black fruits finish mild. This is dry, spicy and just solid enough.
Name: Viña La Fortuna 2012 Culpeo Made with Organic Grapes Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: There's more than enough herbal-olive character to the nose, and also berry scents. The palate is zesty and fresh in feel, with normal-for-Chile leafy, dry, spicy berry flavors. A crisp-feeling finish is herbal in flavor.
Name: Santa Alicia 2012 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Asphalt, crusty leather and herbal berry aromas are the opening on this racy Merlot. Flavors run from herbal, peppery and olive-driven to red-berry fruits. A spicy finish brings enough red-cherry character to make things work.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2012 Petirrojo Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Rubbery, tarry, herbal berry aromas lead to a fresh, lean, somewhat acidic palate. Flavors of plum, red currant and green herbs finish with zest and juicy acidity.
Name: Vaya Vadiso 2012 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: This young Merlot is 100% varietal, with bright notes of berry, ash and herbs. It's light with little apparent oak influence making it direct and accessible with chalky tannins rounding it out.
Name: Washington Hills 2012 Merlot (Washington)

Description: This opens with a blast of bell pepper and leafy berry aromas. The palate is juicy but scratchy, while flavors of plum, raspberry and herbs finish tart, with no evolution.
Name: Santa Ema 2011 Select Terroir Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine appears to have suffered from the cool 2011 vintage with prominent herbal notes that lean far into the green. It seems to carry noticeable residual sugar, with the sweetness making for an odd juxtaposition to the aroma profile.
Name: Sagelands 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Composer Joseph Haydn was the court composer for the Esterházy family which still owns this winery. This strongly wood-aged wine has its own elegance and style with fruit coming through strongly from under the darker exterior. Give this finely structured wine time and drink from 2017.
Name: Esterházy 2009 Haydn Merlot (Burgenland)

Description: This small-batch Merlot (57 cases total) is concentrated up front, with aromas of balsam wood, cigar box, asphalt and hard-charging black fruits. The palate is hard as rocks, with intense but narrow dark-berry flavors in front of a pinched finish loaded with blackberry, pepper and chocolate flavors as well as fierce leftover tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: Krasia May 2010 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: This soft, round wine opens with aromas of oak, vanilla and black fruit. It has big, ripe flavors of blackberry, plum, espresso and chocolate alongside smooth tannins. While it's not complex, it's delicious and ready to enjoy now.
Name: Falesco 2012 Merlot (Umbria)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Blended with 16% Cabernet Sauvignon and aged in a mixture of French and American oak (50% new), this wine highlights notes of raspberries and cream speckled with oak spices and an herbal edge. The palate is light and elegant in style while still retaining a sense of depth, plushness and balance.
Name: RoxyAnn 2011 Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Description: Made from Merlot and aged in barriques, this wine offers aromas of currants, bell pepper and plum. The palate presents ripe black cherry, black currant and chocolate layered with spice, oak and vanilla sensations. It's still aggressively tannic. Drink 2016 to 2023.
Name: Renieri 2008 Grido Merlot (Toscana)

Description: This 100% of Merlot from Tuscany opens with aromas of prune and raisin that recall uve passite or dried grapes. The palate offers concentrated fig, raisin and mocha and you'll also detect the warmth of evident alcohol. The overall lack of freshness makes this appear clunky and evolved.
Name: Olivi 2009 I Puri Merlot (Toscana)

Description: This ready-to-drink wine opens with berry and plum aromas layered with subtle oak. The palate is smooth and round, with blackberry, mocha, white pepper and mint flavors alongside polished tannins.
Name: Tenuta Le Velette 2009 Gaudio Merlot (Umbria)

Description: This wine offers aromas of ripe plum, raisin and mocha, with hints of toasted oak. The palate opens with ripe blackberry and plum notes, but finishes abruptly, closing on an astringent note.
Name: Cantina dei Colli Amerini 2010 Olmeto Merlot (Umbria)

Appellation: Val di Cornia Suvereto, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Tuscan Merlot opens with dominant aromas of raw wood and wood chips with hints of black fruit muffled beneath the surface. Oak is also at the forefront of the palate, followed by toast, espresso and vanilla. There's not enough fruit richness to carry off the oak, and it finishes on a bitter note of astringent wood tannins.
Name: Gualdo del Re 2008 I'Rennero Merlot (Val di Cornia Suvereto)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Coming from the cool 2011 vintage, this 100% varietal wine doesn't seem entirely ripe with notes of green herbs, poblano and red fruit. It's tart and plump in feel with chalky tannins.
Name: Del Rio 2011 Estate Grown Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: Strong new wood and black fruit aromas suggest the power and character of this full, rich wine. From a single parcel, it has concentration, density and a wonderful mix of smooth wood-based flavors and more rugged fruits and tannins. Age this wine and don't drink before 2017.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2010 Les Gendres Parcelle no A307 Merlot (Côtes de Bergerac)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This estate-grown Merlot is a standout among the Goose Ridge reds produced in 2010. A firm and substantial mix of red and black fruits comes on a bed of juicy acidity. Medium-bodied, it extends gracefully through the finish with hints of chocolate-covered raisins.
Name: Goose Ridge 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This vineyard-designated Merlot includes 14% Cabernet Sauvignon. This vintage, Syrah is eliminated and alcohol is lowered—a welcome shift. Rich and loaded with black fruits, it carries interesting accents of caramel popcorn, yielding a delicious, tongue-coating wine with a silky-smooth mouthfeel. It has good length, and the possibility of aging for another five or six years.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2010 Cold Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Generous and aromatic,  this flavorful Merlot is a showcase for ripe black cherry fruit, accented with strong streaks of vanilla and tobacco. The plush, dark fruit leads into a tasty, toasty finish, with notes of licorice and smoke.
Name: Columbia Crest 2011 Grand Estates Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The wine spent 20 months in 50% new French oak, and tastes like it still has the substantial, ripe, dark rich fruit to more than handle the barrel flavors. Black cherry and cassis meet mocha and espresso head on, swirling together into a lush, tasty finish.
Name: Two Vintners 2010 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 2011 was an excellent year for this affordable Merlot, with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Syrah included in the final blend. It seems to tilt more toward Bordeaux and away from California in style, bringing well-integrated hints of herb, tobacco and earth along with a core of black currant fruit.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hand harvested from Block 15 of StoneTree Vineyard with a dollop of Cabernet Sauvignon from Block 14 (10%), it brings notes of coffee, cocoa and plum. The fruit flavors are elegant in style accented by barrel notes and mouthwatering acids. It doesn't seem to have fully reached its potential yet, with the tannins bringing a slightly gritty feel.
Name: Columbia Crest 2010 Reserve StoneTree Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The latest Merlot release from Ethos pushes the alcohol up past 15%, and the wine remains stubbornly closed and tannic, even after several hours of breathing time. Blueberry and cassis fruit are in play, though the tannins take over quickly, leading into a finish with some chalky minerality.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2010 Ethos Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Lush aromas of ripe black cherries, graham crackers and menthol are generous and inviting on this promising Long Island Merlot. It's luscious and concentrated on the palate, but bracingly taut with acidity and a tart Morello-cherry finish.
Name: Gramercy Vineyards 2008 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of dark chocolate and bramble wood lend richness to bright black cherry notes on the nose and palate. It's concentrated with flavor, but crisp with cranberry-like acidity and soft tannins on the finish.
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2010 Estate Grown Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Full, rich wine that combines an aromatic herbal element with ripe red fruits. It's the wood aging that knits this dense wine together, adding the spice and the smoothing element. Still young, this wine should be kept and drunk after 2015.
Name: Domaine Guillaman 2010 Les Hauts de Guillaman Merlot (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Saturated and dense in color, this Merlot hits hard with berry and cassis aromas along with graphite and pine. It feels full bodied and wiry, with ample oak and tannic grip. Flavors of toasty wood and herbal berry fruits finish medium long.
Name: Concha y Toro 2011 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (Peumo)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Brambly berry and wood notes lend complexity to the luscious cassis and black cherry flavors. It's intensely concentrated with fruit, but bright bursts of acidity and layers of fresh sage and thyme add balance, leading to a long, harmonious finish. Drink now–2020.
Name: T'Jara 2010 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of milk chocolate and graham cracker lend a sweet-spice quality to crisp red-plum and sour-cherry flavors in this brisk but concentrated wine. It's vivaciously fresh with bursts of acidity and a pleasant herbaceousness throughout. It finishes moderately long with layers of soft, chalky tannins.
Name: Long Island Merlot Alliance 2010 Merliance Merlot (Long Island)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A roasty, toasty wine with notes of mocha, vanilla and red fruit along with herbs that lean a touch into the green. Its sweet flavors are offset by tart acids that lead to a spice-filled finish.
Name: Milbrandt 2010 The Estates Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Almost all varietal with just a dash of Cabernet Sauvignon (5%) to fill it out, this is an intriguing wine with notes of cherry cordial, chocolate and herbs. With very little new oak influence, the soft, supple fruit flavors are allowed to shine through, giving this wine a real sense of polish.
Name: Cascade Ridge 2011 95% Merlot, 5% CS Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: La Prunée is a delightful Merlot from northern Italy. It is simple and fresh, delivering ripe plum and currant flavors that are easy to enjoy. Pair this with hearty pastas topped with meat sauce or risottos.
Name: Tommasi 2011 La Prunée Merlot (Venezie)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of barnyard and leather give this penetrating Merlot an Old World rusticity. The palate is concentrated with Morello cherry and red plum flavors, but with a ripe, brambly character. Finishes on a mouthwatering cranberry note.
Name: One Woman 2010 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine appears to still be in its shell with light notes of cocoa, chocolate and wet stone that don't seem fully evolved. It's light, tart and chalky in feel with abundant chocolate flavors.
Name: 14 Hands 2010 The Reserve Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of espresso and ripe bramble wood lend a dark profile to crisp black cherry and currant flavors in this elegant Merlot. Zippy cranberry acidity and a thick coating of powdery tannins accumulate on the palate for a powerful finish. Boldly structured, it's likely to improve during the next 5–10 years.
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2008 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Tough and tannic as a box of nails, this is not one of Lapostolle's best Merlots. The palate is astringent and sappy, with pinching tannins. Live-wire plum and wild berry flavors come with saucy, herbal notes, while the finish tastes loamy and feels hard as a rock.
Name: Lapostolle 2010 Cuvée Alexandre Apalta Vineyard Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Made entirely from Merlot grapes, this rosato from northern Italy has pretty aromas of violet, berry and spice. The palate is bright and fresh, with strawberry, peach and red apple notes. It makes a nice apéritif or pair with lightly seasoned fish.
Name: Maculan 2012 Costadolio Merlot (Veneto)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is bright and fruity with notes of red currant, plum and herbs. The flavors are pure and juicy with a pleasing wash of acid and a tight core of tannins lifting the wine up.
Name: Magnificent Wine Company 2011 Mountain Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a pretty floral note that persists from start to finish in this brisk, elegant Merlot, adding complexity to layers of crisp black cherries and cranberries. It's round and rich in mouthfeel, with a soothing hint of menthol. The finish is moderately long, and marked with a kiss of chalky tannins.
Name: Martha Clara 2010 Estate Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, from a light, cool vintage in the Walla Walla Valley. Strawberry and raspberry highlights come through quickly, with earthy tannins filling out the finish.
Name: Garofalo 2011 Les Collines Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Castle Rock is one of the most reliable sources of inexpensive Columbia Valley red wines. Ignore the generic label—what's inside the bottle is well-made. Light flavors of black cherry, soft tannins and a finishing flourish of mocha and red apple give this both lift and length.
Name: Castle Rock 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is quickly maturing, with strong flavors of vanilla rather than fruit. Tannins are stiff and strong. Drink now.
Name: Script & Seal 2010 Merlot (Washington)

Description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this is a simple Merlot for everyday fare. It offers a pretty fragrance of red berry and white pepper accompanied by raspberry, cherry and red currant flavors with a hint of pepper.
Name: Pizzolato 2012 NSA Merlot (Veneto)

Description: Light in color and style, this wine seems more similar to a Pinot Noir than a Merlot. There's no apparent oak influence to interfere with the notes of ash, red currant, saline and bell pepper that are supported by a light grip of tannins.
Name: Pine & Post 2011 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Heavy flavors of vanilla syrup coat the tongue, obscuring the fruit but not quite hiding the green tannins. Though such flavors are not unusual in many inexpensive Merlots, it's a little disappointing from a grower with such excellent fruit to work with.
Name: Milbrandt 2010 Traditions Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Chemical aromas are barely lifted by bland berry fruit scents, and overall this smells like wet cement. Tannic but weak in the middle, this tastes herbal and green, with a raw, herbaceous finish.
Name: Santa Rita 2010 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: A special cuvée of Château Siaurac, this is dark, dense, seriously young at this stage, but destined for a powerful, rich, black fruit and tannin future. It has weight and concentration, layered with new wood and acidity. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Siaurac 2011 Baronne de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)

Description: This Tuscan Merlot has a fragrance of ripe plum, berry and cocoa. The palate delivers black currant layered with chocolate and finishes on a drying note of wood. It doesn't have much complexity but it has very attractive fruit.
Name: Castello di Bossi 2010 Girolamo Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Tomato, chili pepper, saucy notes and roasted berry and plum aromas give this a traditional nose. The body is rich and round, with an extra layer or two of structure and tannins. Flavors of baked, stewed berry fruits and herbs provide a salsa-like component, while dryness and herbal flavors drive the finish.
Name: Santa Luz 2011 Gran Reserva Corte Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though labeled merlot, this is truly a Bordeaux-style blend with Cabernet Sauvignon (6%), Malbec (5%), and Petit Verdot (2%) added to the mix. It is reserved in style with notes of cherry, dried herbs and pickling spices backed by firm, dry tannins.
Name: Abacela 2009 Merlot (Southern Oregon)

Description: Toast, black fruit and herbal aromas are 100% typical of value-priced Merlot from Chile. This feels fresh, wiry and a bit choppy, while herbal plum and raspberry flavors come with touches of licorice, mint, toast and anise.
Name: Concha y Toro 2011 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Description: This is a good yet basic Merlot with baked berry aromas. The mouthfeel is more lively and raw in feel, with modest berry and spice flavors that hit quick and hollow at just as quickly. A standard finish is fine but doesn't evolve.
Name: Santa Carolina 2011 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Colli della Toscana Centrale, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Merlot from Tuscany has interesting aromas of berry, fig and orange rind. The soft, simple palate shows plum and red currant with a touch of vanilla. Try it with barbecued chicken and grilled vegetables.
Name: Piazzano 2010 Merlot (Colli della Toscana Centrale)

Description: This Tuscan Merlot offers aromas of underbrush, tobacco leaf, tilled earth and black fruit. The palate is on the lean side, revealing black currant and licorice along with a smoky element. It's also very tannic and closes on an overly drying note.
Name: Michele Ventura 2010 San Sebastiano Merlot (Toscana)

Description: Meaty, tarry aromas get reduced to simple darkness and shoe polish as this Merlot opens. A full-bodied palate is home to oaky, minty, chocolaty flavors of generic berry and herbal flavors. A crisp finish is nothing but ordinary.
Name: Caliterra 2011 Reserva Estate Grown Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: A ripe, very smooth second wine of Château Siaurac, rich while still full of fresh fruit that already shows elegance and a light touch. The wine is likely to age well and soon, so drink from 2015.
Name: Château Siaurac 2011 Plaisir de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)

Description: A ripe, juicy wine that is full of fresh black currant and berry fruits. It shows off the freshness of the vintage well, bringing a bright texture, soft tannins and a structure that is well integrated. Drink now.
Name: Château Montet 2011  Bordeaux

Description: While this smells a bit rough and herbal, it's more generous than the winery's varietal Tannat. This Merlot has some of the same scratchy qualities of the Tannat, but it shows more body and richness as well as riper black-fruit flavors.
Name: Marichal 2011 Premium Varietal Merlot (Canelones)

Description: A blast of rubber is the aromatic greeting, followed by herbal notes and leather. A sharp, tight, acidic palate proves difficult to penetrate, while crisp, herbal red-plum flavors finish green.
Name: Emiliana 2011 Natura Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Description: Baked, raisiny aromas indicate a very ripe wine. This feels full and heavy on the tongue, with dark, toasty flavors that turn bitter, oaky and peppery on the finish.
Name: San Nicolas 2011 Maigo Reserve Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consulting winemaker Michel Rolland oversees this Long Shadows Merlot, which includes 19% Cabernet Sauvignon (from Red Mountain's Tapteil Vineyard) in the blend. It's a flat out yummy wine from the moment the cork is pulled, loaded with spice and thick, ripe, dense tannins. There's plenty of rich fruit to balance the depth of flavor from a generous mix of new French oak. It would be hard to find a better Merlot from anywhere at this price.
Name: Pedestal 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Entirely estate-grown, 100% Merlot from old vines, this unfined wine is labeled vegan. Plush, briary, brambly fruit from the 30 year old vineyard brings an extra dimension to the wine, which shows a lovely balance of cranberry, raspberry, pie cherry and baking spice flavors. There's a hint of pastry crust in the finish, which is seamless and long. An absolute delight.
Name: Seven Hills 2011 Seven Hills Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An A+ trio of vineyards—Olsen, Stonetree and Boushey—contribute equally to this pure Merlot. In a Forgeron portfolio that regularly shines with a variety of red wines, Merlot is usually the best of show, as it is here. Tight, tart and perfectly proportioned, this at first offers scents and accents of sweet tomato paste and a whiff of oregano, then opens further with lush cherry flavors and a dash of dried tobacco. Merlot and pasta? Why not?
Name: Forgeron 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A sure-fire crowd-pleaser, this tightly-wound Merlot comes on very Cab-like, but with red fruits more than blue or black. It opens up into a broad mid-palate, showing well-balanced nuances of olive and earth, fresh herb, pepper and licorice. Dense, textural and smoky, it's delicious now or could be cellared for another five or six years.
Name: Januik 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an almost picture-perfect example of an excellent Washington Merlot, loaded with rich fruit flavors of plum and black cherry. The mouthfeel is satiny, the tannins round and ripe, with a smooth and supple finish.
Name: Elevation Cellars 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a fine effort, culled from a single block of 15-year-old vines. Firm and tannic, it shows focused flavors of blackberry and cassis, highlights of clove and cacao, with admirable precision through a lingering finish.
Name: Airfield Estates 2010 Estate Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This soft, supple and seductive Merlot (with 25% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend) is both earthy and sensuous. The mouthfeel is like smooth felt. Black cherry, blackberry and a dash of cola fill the mouth, with lush tannins and a long finish. There's just a hint of brown sugar as it wraps up.
Name: Obelisco Estate 2010 Estate Grown Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry, blueberry and cassis fruit flavors penetrate into a base of mineral and clean earth. The tannins, for Klipsun, are all but restrained, and the overall impression is that of a balanced wine with a long life (a decade or more) ahead.
Name: Januik 2010 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With fruit drawn from Clifton Hills, Dionysus, Artz and the Seven Hills vineyard, this pretty, elegant wine showcases the broad strengths of the Columbia Valley. Raspberry and cherry fruit carries a streak of licorice and a whiff of toast. Perfumed and bright with natural acidity, this is a wine to enjoy now and in the near term.
Name: Seven Hills 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The vineyard-designated wines from Novelty Hill consistently reflect the site in terms of a deep-seated earthy, herbal character. It's quite like a modern Bordeaux, taking the cassis fruit as a base and cloaking it with toasted flavors from earth and barrel.
Name: Novelty Hill 2010 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A smooth, almost satiny Merlot, with generous flavors of plum and cassis. The ample fruit is wrapped in darker flavors, providing a coating streaked with licorice, dusted with coffee grounds and finished with chocolate.
Name: Novelty Hill 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, sends up toasty aromatics richly imbued with the scents of new oak. John Bookwalter consistently makes wines in this style, which in a cooler year such as 2010, can seem to mask the fruit. Give it plenty of breathing time and the blackberry and black cherry core will begin to emerge from the toast, mocha and coffee.
Name: J. Bookwalter 2010 Foreshadow Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: At first a stiff, unyielding wine, this shows promising—though compact—dark fruits with a strong herbal streak. Fresh greens and other herbs move into a finish with barrel flavors of tar and espresso.
Name: Hogue 2010 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: A very good Merlot rich in baked plum and rhubarb with a back note of olive. Slightly spicy and medium-bodied, the finish offers smoke and spice.
Name: Bink 2009 Hawks Butte Vineyard Merlot (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a thickly tannic wine, cloaking its mix of mulberry, plum and cassis fruit in a robe of dark chocolate. The tannins are textured and grainy, but ripe enough, with plenty of supporting acidity that cuts through.
Name: J Bell Cellars 2010 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a satin-smooth Merlot, nicely blended with 11% Syrah and a splash of Cabernet Sauvignon. Forward flavors, seamless, supple and flat out tasty, it weaves in threads of vanilla, cola and licorice around taut red fruits.
Name: Hogue 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mokelumne River, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Pedro Vargas has made a nice Merlot in this strongly herbal, plum and cassis concoction inviting in its layers of oak and tobacco. Soft, it finishes lean and is all in all integrated and well-made.
Name: Vino Vargas 2011 Miserere Merlot (Mokelumne River)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Nearly all varietal with just a splash of Syrah (3%) added, it has notes of sweet spices, cocoa, and cherry backed by dry, chalky tannins. A pleasant easy drinker.
Name: Seven Falls 2010 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has lots to recommend, from its soft, slightly spicy introduction, to big berry and vanilla flavor follow through. But most memorable is its beautiful perfume, encompassing all those singular elements. Give it some time in bottle to show through.
Name: Mineral Wines 2009 Merlot (Calaveras County)

Description: Roasted, burnt, savory aromas of black fruits, char and campfire announce that this Merlot spent time in toasty oak. In the mouth, this is fresh but full bodied, with staunch tannins. Flavors of foresty blackberry, plum, vanilla and fall leaves finish dry and tannic.
Name: Castillo de Monjardin 2009 Deyo Merlot (Navarra)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A soft, nicely oaked Merlot with flavors of baked plum and ripe blackberry. Full-bodied in every sense of the word, with just a sprinkling of spice on the finish.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2009 Estate Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's labeled Merlot, but the blend includes Syrah and other grapes, and the result comes across as a rather generic red wine. Soft and very buttery, it has light red fruits and some green tannins.
Name: Mercer 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hailing from the cool 2011 vintage, it's light in style with notes of red currant, herbs and olive with little apparent oak influence. A straight-forward easy quaffer.
Name: Hyatt 2011 Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: An inexpensive Merlot packed in sweet vanilla and smoky oak that has 5% 2008 Dolcetto, 3% 2010 Syrah and 3% 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon.
Name: Lapis Luna 2012 Merlot (North Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This new winery makes pure varietal wines from a vineyard in eastern Oregon. Lightly scented with smoke, tar, incense and tobacco, this spicy, somewhat peppery wine makes the most of light red-fruit flavors from fairly young vines.
Name: Echo Ridge 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (OR))

Description: Powerful, toasty aromas of herbs, black fruits and chocolate precede a fresh palate with lift and balance. A flavor profile of plum and berry is accented by herbal shadings, while the finish tastes loamy and chunky, with a spot of heat.
Name: Andeluna 2011 1300 Merlot (Uco Valley)

Description: Woody aromas of tree bark, forest floor and earthy, minty berry fruits lead to a full and stocky feeling palate with wiry, herbal, oak-heavy flavors of plum and mint. On the finish, this is tannic, with strong spice notes and a hint of green.
Name: Domaine Jean Bousquet 2011 Made with Organic Grapes Reserve Merlot (Tupungato)

Description: Hard, rubbery black-fruit aromas end with a whiff of cherry-cola. This feels zesty and fresh, with a medium body and snappy acids. Short, choppy flavors of red plum and cherry finish quick, with a salty note.
Name: Mil Piedras 2011 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Among a strong lineup of 2009 reds from Tulpen, this Merlot is the standout. It's really a Bordeaux-style blend, with Merlot taking up three quarters, and the rest split among Cabernet, Cab Franc and Malbec. Stiff and herbal upon opening, it opens to reveal a firm scaffolding of flavors, with muscular cassis and black cherry going deep into the finish. Tannins are ripe, and carry an herbal edge.
Name: Tulpen 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This generous, Bordeaux-style, Merlot-dominated blend incorporates some old block fruit from a mix of first-class vineyards scattered across the Columbia Valley. Lovely floral and clover notes arise, with bright berry and cassis fruit just behind. Sleek, detailed and long, this is a terrific value as well.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged 19 months in American and French oak (68% new), it's lush and appealing with notes of vanilla and other barrel spices accenting herbs and red fruit. The palate is creamy in feel with tart, mouthwatering acids that draw out the flavors for a long finish.
Name: Fielding Hills 2010 RiverBend Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Merlot remains a solid strength at Dumas Station, thanks to the Minnick Hills and Birch Creek Vineyard fruit. Half the barrels were new, an equal percentage of French and American oak, lending a strong bourbon aroma, along with tobacco and vanilla components. The fruit remains a bit constrained, with black fruits leading into a core of cassis. Give this one a good decanting.
Name: Dumas Station 2010 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rich cherry fruit anchors this excellent, estate-grown Merlot. It's lush and textural, with deep, dark fruit flavors and pleasant roasted notes of coffee and smoke. Half the barrels were new American oak, the rest French, mostly new.
Name: Gamache 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This estate-bottling shows single vineyard focus, and a more herbal profile than the winery's Columbia Valley Merlot. Accents of clean earth and dark, cassis fruit suggest a wine with Bordeaux-like strengths and the possibility of cellaring for a decade or longer.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2010 Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Direct and appealing with notes of dried herbs, cherry, and toast. It's broad in feel with good depth and structure with dry tannins the only thing holding it back.
Name: Northwest Collection 2010 Limited Release Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Always a fine value, Barnard Griffin's Merlot is a brightly fruit wine with tart red and purple berry flavors. Tannins are still a bit stiff, but proportionate and ripe enough, with hints of café mocha in the finish.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a good bottle, single vineyard-sourced, toasty and still tightly-wound with tart red fruits. It's pretty and forward, perhaps best enjoyed in the next year or two.
Name: Balboa 2010 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This opens with a good mix of tobacco, black cherry, cola and mocha aromas. In the mouth, this offers good body, size and balance along with lightly herbal, leafy flavors of mossy black fruits. A mellow finish with a solid structure is a welcome ending.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2011 La Joya Gran Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a tough, chewy Merlot, a bit of a stylistic departure for Walla Walla Vintners. Perhaps it's the addition of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, or perhaps just the result of the challenging 2010 vintage in the Walla Walla Valley. But the greenish tannins bring a lot of herbal flavors to the forefront, and tend to bury the fruit.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2010 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The French oak (35% new) brings notes of cocoa and vanilla that meld with the grape's currant and herbs. It's on the lighter side of medium bodied, fresh with a tart bite on the finish providing distraction.
Name: Apex 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 100% Merlot, the oak (73% American, 26% new) seems a bit overbearing with notes of sweet spices and pine overlaying red fruit. It's medium bodied with tart, citrusy flavors and firm tannins.
Name: Waterbrook 2010 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: It's not easy to get 16.5% alcohol from a vintage as cool as 2010 in Washington. The wine has a grain and grass bouquet, wild and brambly fruit, and plenty of Asian spices. Interesting, though not especially typical for the grape variety
Name: Hawks View 2010 Merlot (Washington)

Description: Brandied berry, root beer, char and toast aromas define the bouquet. This is wiry and a touch acidic on the tongue, but only initially. That same acid-first quality is found on the flavor profile, where things go from shrill to soft in no time. A simple, slightly tangy finish is the conclusion.
Name: Echeverria 2010 Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: This solidly tannic wine is largely balanced by ample fruit. Perfumed and smoky, but with its dry wood and firm, extracted tannins, it is likely always to be a dry wine.
Name: Jean-Michel Cazes 2011 Michel Lynch  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruity, with plum flavors soaked in a good dose of vanilla, this is an easygoing wine for casual entertaining or everyday use. The blend includes 8% Syrah.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This opaque Merlot is charred to the max, with burnt coffee, grilled beef and campfire aromas. The palate is wiry but mostly good in feel, while mossy, herbal-leaning flavors of toast, blackberry and black pepper finish with coffee and herbal notes.
Name: Viña Casas Patronales 2010 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though 100% Merlot, it seems more reminiscent of a Syrah with notes of blue fruit and ash. The flavors are light with chalky, mouthcoating tannins.
Name: WildHaven 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine's bright purple fruit tastes as if the fermentation has only just stopped. Jammy red berries are laced with some tannins, and acidity freshens the wine, only spoilt by a slight oxidative edge.
Name: Château de Lagarde 2012 Cuvée Nature  (Bordeaux)

Description: 100% varietal, it's intriguing with notes of toast and cherry. Though the fruit concentration is good, the tannins are dry and bitter.
Name: WildHaven 2010 Reserve Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite the almost syrupy fruit and alcohol pushing 16%, the fruit scents are less than optimal, suggesting that perhaps the grapes were pushed too far. Along with notes of plant material, the alcoholic heat mars the finish.
Name: Holmes Harbor Cellars 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of tire rubber, eucalyptus and scratchy black fruits set up a shear, acidic palate with flavors of salty, herbal, somewhat sour berry and plum. A rough, scouring finish is par for the course.
Name: Morandé 2010 Reserva Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe black-cherry notes are accented by herbs and stems that lend a dark savoriness to this bold, penetrating Merlot. Rich with fruit, and layered with spice and granite, it lingers long on the finish in a murmur of velvety tannins.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2010 Blackbird Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Comtesse Thérèse's Aquebogue Estate Merlot is refined in structure, with crisp black-cherry flavor layered with fresh mint and a hint of savory black spices. Brisk and balanced, it finishes with a flurry of gripping but fine-grained tannins.
Name: Comtesse Thérèse 2008 Aquebogue Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of leather and black pepper add complexity to concentrated black-fruit flavors in this bold yet surprisingly finessed Merlot. Tannins are a shade grippy and unripe, but add structure and power.
Name: Coffee Pot Cellars 2008 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aged entirely in new French oak, this is an unabashedly juicy, decadently spiced Merlot that's rich with vanilla and black-cherry pie flavors. Structurally, it's quite refined, with fresh acidity and soft, feathery tannins that linger.
Name: Comtesse Thérèse 2006 Château Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A bit exuberant in the nose, with luscious notes of cherry pie and sweet spice, this Merlot is surprisingly lean on the palate, with crisp red-fruit flavors balanced by fresh acidity and soft, delicate tannins. It's a juicy, easy-drinking wine that's nicely balanced.
Name: One Woman 2008 Estate Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This medium-bodied Merlot boasts an abundance of ripe, juicy black-cherry and plum flavors, but with a shade of savory green herbs that persist on the palate. Bright acidity and soft tannins make it brisk and easy to drink.
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2007 Estate Grown Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This 100% Merlot was—intriguingly—aged for three months on Chardonnay lees. It has notes of herbs, cherries and green vegetables. It has an appealing, broad texture, finishing on a bitter note.
Name: Fujishin 2009 Merlot

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bursting with ripe, juicy peaches, this intensely fruit-forward white Merlot is surprisingly dry and dainty on the palate. It's straightforward and approachable in style, with just a hint of stony minerality on the finish.
Name: Sannino 2012 Bianca Rosé Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: There is a roasted, slightly burnt scent to this wine, leading into smoky flavors of ground coffee and tar, wrapped around light red fruit.
Name: Clearwater Canyon 2009 Merlot (America)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a thick cloak of tar and darkly toasted oak that dissipates with aeration to reveal ripe, roasted black-fruit flavors in this medium-bodied Merlot. Dense with fruit and hints of dark spice, the palate gets a hit of freshness from vibrant acidity.
Name: Waters Crest 2008 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Despite its alcohol and potential richness, this has as much green, herbal character as fruitiness. It's structured and juicy, and shows considerable acidity.
Name: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2009 Má Partilha Merlot (Península de Setúbal)

Description: Fiery, punchy aromas of red berries and herbaceous plants make for a rough start. Flavors of leafy red raspberry and plum are typical for basic Merlot, while the finish is juicy in feel, with herbal, leafy, lightly cooked flavors.
Name: Vinos Magbel 2010 Merlot (Valle de Guadalupe)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal Merlot, aged 15 months in new and neutral French oak barrels and botti. It's tangy, sleek and supple, with a spectrum of fruit from cranberry on through blackberry. Tannins are polished and mouth-coating, with substantial power. The finish brings hints of herbs and black olives.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2011 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy and still showing some youthful sharpness, this pure Merlot is loaded with penetrating raspberry fruit, juicy and tart. The mouth-cleaning acidity both sharpens the palate and intensifies the flavors, and leads into a finish dotted with super dark chocolate.
Name: Reininger 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tim Stevens showcases Yakima Valley terroir as well as any winemaker in the state. This is sourced from the DuBrul and Meek vineyards, and it is remarkably complex, though still tight and tart. The dark fruits are highlighted with toast and baking spices, along with clove and ginger. Look for this to be a 10+ year Merlot.
Name: Stevens 2010 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: This very fairly priced Merlot from the Cosumnes River sub-section of Lodi has a juicy berry roundness that makes it inviting to drink, and softly textured all around. On the long finish is a remarkably vibrant strain of caramel-mocha flavor, and interesting secondary notes that may have developed over time on this 2007 vintage.
Name: McConnell Estates Winery 2007 Wackman Ranch Merlot (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Kimmel's Merlot is satisfying in dark cherry, vanilla and a streak of toasted coconut. Its finish is long and textured, and the wine should have a lengthy shelf life of 3–7 years more at least.
Name: Kimmel 2010 Merlot (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's plenty of toasty oak flavor (the wine spent 27 months in barrel) along with pretty raspberry and cherry fruit. Dark notes come in with the tannins—smoke and char, along with a coconut kick to the finish.
Name: Gordon Estate 2009 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a straightforward Merlot with herbal aromatics, oaky tannins and a layering of quiet raspberry and spice. Well priced for the quality and food-friendly nature of this wine.
Name: Wente 2010 Sandstone Estate Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: With dark-berry aromas and pointed toughness, this is a solid wine with creamy oak, some stickiness and a lactic element. Flavors of herbal dark fruits and minty oak lead to a dry, minty, hot and spicy finish with more than enough residual oak flavor.
Name: Lapostolle 2011 Casa Grand Selection Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mango, presumably, is the dog pictured on the label. This is a heavily-extracted, somewhat bitter Merlot, with fruit flavors of blackberry syrup, alcohol at 15%, and still a fair amount of green bitterness to the tannins. Notes of iodine and anise come into play in the finish.
Name: Passion Vineyards 2009 Mango's Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is concentrated and dark in color, with chocolaty berry and plum aromas. A full-bodied, plump and oaky palate houses milk chocolate and herbal blackberry flavors, while a healthy, driving finish with residual oak winds things down.
Name: Vistamar 2011 Sepia Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A moderately aromatic Merlot with notes of raspberry, ash, and herbs. Completely coats the palate with an unusually chalky, thick feel.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2011 The Expedition Merlot Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: That this wine is all Merlot is the reason both for its jammy richness and its high alcohol. It gives a wine that is out of balance, with pepper, spice and wood dominating the super-ripe black cherry fruits. It's unlikely to age for long.
Name: Château de Brondeau 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Not sure what's going on at StoneCap, but after a couple of outstanding Merlot vintages, it seems to have lost its way in 2011. Spritzy, bitter and herbal, there's a big splash of vanilla, as if intended to cover the vegetal flavors of unripe grapes.
Name: StoneCap 2011 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Scratchy rhubarb aromas run tart and weedy. The palate on this basic Merlot is high in acid and thus shrill, with sharp raspberry and cherry flavors. A short, choppy finish with sour plum flavors closes out this marginal, crisp wine.
Name: San Nicolas 2011 Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a terrific Merlot, offering structure and balance (hallmarks of all Seven Hills wines) along with rich fruits, accented with earth and herb. There is lovely density and texture at work here, plenty of black cherry fruit, and a gentle hint of composted earth.
Name: Seven Hills 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is done in an open, palate-friendly style, with rich, generous black fruits accented with cocoa, coffee and caramel. There's a streak of vanilla custard also, and the fruit has enough depth and mass to hold up through a satisfying finish.
Name: Market Vineyards 2009 Benchmark Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Only in Washington can you find pure varietal, single-vineyard Merlot at this price that shows such power and depth. Aged in American oak barrels with French oak stave inserts, it displays plenty of smoky caramel and coconut flavors, but the fruit is there in good proportion. This wine is sure to find plenty of admirers; if only more than just 58 cases had been produced.
Name: :Nota Bene 2009 Conner Lee Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Dark spice, mild herbal aromas, lightly stewed berry scents and tomato carry the nose on this Merlot. The mouthfeel is firm and full, and overall quite good, while flavors of baked plum, blackberry, herbs and toast lead to a chocolaty, round finish. This is a good red wine with kick and character.
Name: Santa Alicia 2010 Gran Reserva de Los Andes Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: This Maule Merlot is a bruiser with berry and cassis aromas accented by campfire and chocolate. In the mouth, it's drawing but lively, with firm acidity and toasty flavors of oak-rich blackberry and dark chocolate. At the end, it's tight, tannic and boasting a powerful oak character.
Designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Maule
Name: Concha y Toro 2010 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Maule Merlot (San Clemente)

Description: Round black-fruit aromas are bold and friendly, while in the mouth this is grabby and full bodied. Flavors of roasted plum and berry are generous albeit a hint green in the middle, while toasty darkness defines the finish, which brings a touch of bitterness.
Name: Viña La Rosa 2010 La Capitana Barrel Reserve Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Yakima valley Merlot is forward and leafy, with hints of dried herb alongside fruit flavors of strawberry and raspberry. It seems more delicate than its listed alcohol (13.8% abv) would suggest, but it's a nice bottle for near-term enjoyment.
Name: Two Mountain 2009 Copeland Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Dark berry and cassis aromas are intense, oaky and fall off toward char, shoe polish and minty oak. As a whole, this is a black, chewy wine with staunch tannins and oak-based flavors that run minty and dark. The finish is pretty much all oak, with some black cherry fighting through dominant wood grain.
Designation: Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2010 Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas are light and elusive here with pencil eraser, dried cranberries, leather, and currant. The palate is full of tart cherry and cranberry flavors backed by grainy tannins. Shows some heat on the finish.
Name: David Hill 2009 Reserve Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mostly Merlot, with Cabernet Sauvignon and a splash of Malbec filling it out. It's tannic and earthy, definitely accenting the herbal side of flavor, with a hint of pepper also. The mid palate shows some decent concentration.
Name: Bridge Press 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Starts out distinctly herbal but as it opens up notes of red currant and pencil lead emerge. The plump fruit flavors are supported by a firm structure of fine grained tannins.
Name: RoxyAnn 2009 Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Description: An estate-grown 81% Merlot (the rest Cabernet Sauvignon), this wine takes time to come around in the glass, the alcohol overpowering the fruit at first. But in time, the red fruit and soft tannins mellow and make themselves known and this mostly-Merlot becomes a savory, food-friendly quaff.
Name: Albertina 2009 Lorilai's Reserve-Zmarzly Family Vineyards Merlot (Mendocino)

Description: There's no avoiding this wine's roasted, herbal character. On the nose, it's lightly green, with red plum aromas. The palate has a fresh, smacking feel and flavors of oak-infused plum and raspberry. On the finish, it's herbal and oaky tasting, with grabby tannins.
Name: Morandé 2010 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Typical for Navarran Merlot, this wine opens with leaf, rubber and stalky berry aromas. It's blocky but mostly good in feel, with lightly herbal and stalky tasting plum and berry flavors. It hollows out and turns a bit hot on the finish.
Name: Vega Sindoa 2011 Merlot (Navarra)

Description: This small-production Merlot (40 cases made) has reached its point of no return. It's mature and tannic, with a hard outlook and some odd characteristics, namely a nose that smells of cheesy leather and agave. In the mouth, it's hard like a brick, with oaky, red-berry flavors that finish hard and with no place to go.
Name: Gillmore 2007 Hacedor de Mundos Old Vines Merlot (Loncomilla Valley)

Description: This Merlot is dry, herbal and scratchy smelling. In the mouth, it's crisp and zesty, with red plum, bell pepper, tarragon and other green-leaning flavors. The finish has a solid feel, leftover herbal flavors and mild heat. Overall this comes across as a cool-climate wine from a cool year.
Designation: Edición Limitada Gran Reserva de Los Andes
Name: Santa Alicia 2010 Edición Limitada Gran Reserva de Los Andes Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The aromas on this wine run jammy, soft and baked. This is medium in intensity, with some dilution and herbal flavors of tobacco, berry and spice. The finish is modest and a bit green.
Name: San Nicolas 2010 Maigo Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: One hundred percent varietal, this vineyard designated Merlot seems a casualty of the cool 2010 growing season with prominent herbal notes, tart plum flavors, and astringent tannins.
Name: Desert Wind 2010 Desert Wind Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: This inky, unfiltered Merlot is a chore to get through. For starters, the saturated bouquet is murky and less than fresh. In the mouth, expect a blocky, extracted mouthfeel and roasted flavors of herbal berry and raisin. Lastly, there's a tannic grab as well as particles and chunks floating about.
Name: Loma Larga 2009 Unfiltered Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This rusty-colored Merlot is burnt smelling, with oregano and tomato-driven aromas. The palate feels dried out and raw, while flavors of burnt grass, roasted plum and tomato finish with an oxidized flavor.
Name: Tres Palacios 2009 Cholqui Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Heavy wood aging dominates this rich wine at this stage. That should integrate to leave an almost California ripeness from the 100% Merlot. It has a full and rounded structure, cushioned by generous fruits.
Name: Château Carignan 2010 Prima  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: While this smells directly from the Old World, it's appealing and unique in style for Argentina. For starters, it's mature, bordering on old. Because of vital acidity, it's in good shape, with stewed berry, tobacco, spice and chocolate flavors. On the finish, pepper and bitter coffee notes enter the picture. Drink this one-of-a-kind Merlot now.
Name: Weinert 2006 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Livermore Valley Merlot has a smooth, seductive aroma of cinnamon spice and clove upon opening, followed by rich notes of dark velvety plum. Long on the finish, it's a classically mannered California Merlot ready for the dinner table or to sip on its own.
Name: Cuda Ridge Wines 2010 Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: This is a friendly, fresh, open Merlot, not a variety that Argentina is known for. Aromas of cassis and red plum lead to a mild, fresh-feeling palate with red-fruit flavors and a pinch of vanilla. Beyond that, it's not demanding and finishes well.
Name: Familia Schroeder 2010 Saurus Select Merlot (Patagonia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine hails from Canyon Vineyard Ranch and Oasis vineyards. It's tart and puckering with notes of cocoa, raspberries and licorice and a firm squeeze of tannins. Barrel notes of vanilla and dill linger on the finish.
Name: Waterbrook 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A soft, concentrated Merlot with plenty of tannic structure and density. Expansive in blackberry and plum fruit, there's a trace of herb in the mix before the wine finishes on a vanilla and caramel note.
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2010 Triska Crane Ridge Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe red cherry and mint are enrobed in a velvety swathe of tannins in this bold, richly textured Merlot. It's muscular in style, but hints of minerality and bright acidity add elegance and balance.
Name: Six Mile Creek 2010 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bramble and savory herbs add a green, earthy character to preserved black cherry and plum flavors in this dry, full-bodied Merlot. The tannins are penetrating, but velvety in structure, and extend long on the cherry-kissed finish.
Name: Keuka Spring 2010 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Ripe, brambly wood and plummy black-fruit flavors are concentrated in this dense, boldly structured Merlot, but shaded by tart green notes and staunch, grippy tannins.
Name: Brotherhood 2010 New York Premium Selection Merlot (New York)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is an herbal Merlot with a taste of green olive tapenade. It's soft and round with a caramel-like oaky note on the finish.
Name: Weibel Family 2009 Merlot (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very pale in color, this is a lightly aromatic Merlot with notes of raspberry, cherry, ash and tobacco. The palate is tart with dry, chalky tannins.
Name: Sagelands 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The cool 2011 growing season seems to have presented a ripeness issue for this Merlot, which includes a healthy dollop of Cabernet Sauvignon along with Syrah and Cabernet Franc. It leans far into the green with notes of jalapeño, bell pepper and herbs backed by chalky tannins.
Name: Washington Hills 2011 Merlot (Washington)

Description: The nose deals a mix of exotic aromas along with offputting sweat, compost and funky cheese. The palate is pasty feeling and tannic, with lactic flavors of oak, licorice and medicinal berry. On the finish, clove and spice notes dominate.
Name: Telteca 2010 Roble Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This vineyard-designated Merlot includes 11% Cabernet Sauvignon, also sourced from Klipsun. Classy from the get-go, this is limned with notes of graphite, mineral and cinnamon, with dense black-cherry and cassis flavors that anchor the core. Its excellent texture, depth, length and structure suggest that this can be cellared for a decade, at least.
Name: Januik 2009 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is toasty, dense and inviting from the first sniff to the last swallow. It's an authoritative, tightly woven and complex wine that offers a core of plum and cassis flavors, annotated by streaks of coffee, licorice and iron. The tannins are textural and gripping. Delicious now, this can also be cellared for a decade.
Name: Abeja 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Although this is currently aggressively oaky, this full, fleshy Merlot is on the path to excellence. Bright berry and plum flavors are kissed with notes of vanilla, cinnamon and toast, plus a hint of herb.
Name: Reininger 2008 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The vines from which the fruit for this wine were sourced are, on average, 15 years old. Aged primarily in French oak, this concentrated wine shows fine depth, with an emphasis on black cherry and cassis flavors. Full and ripe, this well-structured effort has the balance and polished tannins to be cellared for a decade, at least.
Name: Northstar 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Production of this Merlot was further dampened in 2009 by an early freeze. But the quality is as good as ever, which is apparent in the pretty core of strawberry, raspberry and red plum flavors. Aging in 55% new French oak gives the fruit a Bourbon-soaked appeal as it rolls onto the rich finish streaked with dark chocolate.
Name: Northstar 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pure Merlot is made from fruit that was sourced from Bacchus, Conner Lee, Dionysus and Klipsun vineyards. Sappy, spicy and loaded with black fruits, this delivers plenty of flavor across the rich midpalate. Notes of black cherries, coffee grounds, licorice and smoke all come into play.
Name: Arbor Crest 2010 Four Vineyards Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made in fairly modest quantities, this Merlot bears dark fruit that shows a pleasing, dusty quality. The blend includes 11% Cabernet Sauvignon, which keeps it in the Bordeaux-style camp. Firm and concentrated, it finishes with a tasty mix of cocoa, coffee grounds and Asian spices.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2010 Canoe Ridge Estate Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This wine opens with ripe aromas of black plum and boysenberry fruit, accented by hints of licorice root and menthol. The fruity core continues to shine on the smooth, round palate, alongside accents of purple violet, black tea and oak-driven spice that linger through the close.
Name: Carmel 2009 Sha'al Single Vineyard Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% Merlot is full bodied and juicy, and it offers a sappy red-berry flavor. There's a nice dash of spice, and it demonstrates good balance overall. It needs an hour or so of airing before it really opens up.
Name: Helix by Reininger 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This vineyard-designated wine includes 13% Cabernet Sauvignon and 9% Syrah. The Syrah component seems to take over, in the form of tart berry, herb and dried leaf flavors. The alcohol, which is 15.5%, mutes any other complexities. It's a nice wine, but it doesn't offer standard Washington Merlot flavors.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Cold Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy red-fruit flavors run the gamut from cranberry to cherry, which creates a substantial, flavorful core. The wine dries out and turns chalky on the finish, but it comes with highlights of nutmeg and cocoa powder.
Name: Januik 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Solid herbal notes of fresh thyme and bay leaf lead the nose of this Merlot, but are supported by a core of ripe dark fruit. Accents of vanilla bean and licorice root add depth to the medium-full mouthfeel. The texture is round, yet structured with fine tannins, while the finish boasts a decadent mocha touch.
Name: Flam 2010 Reserve Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made from estate-vineyard fruit, this Merlot is medium bodied, and it has a mix of red fruit flavors, plus grace notes of leaf and mushroom. The finish leaves an impression of dried toast.
Name: Tapteil Vineyard 2010 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: A rare Marlborough Merlot, this is a superficially charming wine that shows cassis fruit and lashings of smoky, cedary oak. It does lack a bit of richness, particularly on the finish, but it scores for its upfront display of ripe fruit and toasty oak.
Name: Saint Clair 2010 Rapaura Reserve Merlot (Marlborough)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As in the past, this is loaded with vanilla. Streaks of cut tobacco and light, pretty cherry capture the midpalate, and some chewy tannins kick in on the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2010 H3 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This is an approachable and easy-pleasing Merlot, with notes of black plum, boysenberry, milk chocolate and oak-driven spice. The mouthfeel is round and creamy, but the finish is clean and loaded with fleshy fruit flavors that linger nicely. Drink now–2015.
Name: Tulip Winery 2011 Just Merlot (Judean Hills)

Description: This wine is crisp, medium bodied and surprisingly firm for an inexpensive Merlot. Drink this wine over the next year or two for its potent cassis and black cherry fruit. Some rare beef will help show the wine to best effect.
Name: Oyster Bay 2011 Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light plum and cherry flavors give a good first impression. The blend is not strictly traditional, with small doses of Syrah and Grenache in the mix. It fades quickly, and it shows some sourness on the finish.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Bright and juicy, this wine offers upfront fruit aromas and flavors of blueberry, black cherry and plum. Hints of fudgy brownie and berry preserve add depth and decadence to the palate, and stay well into the medium-length finish. Drink now.
Name: Recanati 2011 Merlot (Galilee)

Description: This shows the herbal side of Merlot, as it deals tobacco and cherry tomato flavors in addition to cassis. It's medium in body, and it has a silky texture and crisp acids on the finish. Drink now and over the next year or two.
Name: Crossroads 2010 Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Youthful and compelling, this 100% estate Merlot comes with a seductive smoky note. The juicy berry flavor is rich and racy, while the barrel aging—50% new—hits exactly the right toasty note.
Name: Tero Estates 2009 Herb's Block Windrow Vineyards Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Côtes de Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: One of the single parcel releases (this is numbered A307), this is a pure Merlot that's earthy, rich and smoky. Intense and concentrated, it has acidity that balances the ripe fruit. Age this wine for 4–5 years.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2010 Les Gendres Merlot (Côtes de Bergerac)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is the best of the new releases from Seven Bridges, a Portland-based winery with a penchant for Washington State fruit. Smooth, balanced and mouth-filling, this offers a truffle highlight that sits over the bright berry and cherry flavors.
Name: Seven Bridges 2009 Golden Ridge Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: This has spice and dried fruit notes, plus firmly structured tannins. The refreshing acidity partners with the fruit, creating a wine that still needs a few years to age.
Name: Château Laulerie 2010 Le Raisin Merlot (Bergerac)

Description: This is dry, spicy and subdued on the bouquet, with a red berry aroma leading the charge. Focused and fresh on the palate, it has spicy, mildly oaky flavors of toasty berry fruit. Pinches of pepper and chocolate add weight and darkness to the finish.
Name: Santa Alicia 2009 Gran Reserva de Los Andes Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Fresh on the bouquet, this has tomato leaf, plum, raspberry and spice aromas that are similar to those found in simple Bordeaux. The palate is snappy and fresh due to its acidity, while flavors of cherry pie filling and red plum lead to a spunky, lightly oaked finish.
Name: Tres Palacios 2010 Family Vintage Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Using fruit that was sourced from a 12-acre property planted to Merlot, this wine is laden with wood. A burnt edge covers what will inevitably be attractive, ripe plum fruit. It has acidity on the finish, and its juicy element promises good things in 2–3 years.
Name: Château Lamour 2010 Réserve  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: A hard, piercing blackberry aroma forms the greeting on this full-bodied, dark-styled Merlot. Look for roasted, peppery black-fruit flavors and a spice-dominant finish that comes with mint and herbal notes.
Name: Casa Silva 2010 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: A berry aroma comes with cola and herb notes. The palate is tangy and racy, and it delivers raspberry and plum flavors, with a modest finish.
Name: Sundance 2011 Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: This starts out fresh on the nose, with a modest herbal accent. The palate is lively and clean, with ample body and good balance. Flavors of cherry, plum and herb lead to a mildly green-tasting finish.
Name: Lomas del Valle 2011 Coastal Cool Climate Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This Merlot is dry and scratchy on the nose, with raspberry and spice aromas. It's fresh and clean on the palate, with a quick wave of spicy red-berry flavor. It remains spicy and a touch minty on the finish.
Name: Con Carne 2011 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Light in color, this has a nose that's defined by a leafy, herbal red-fruit aroma and a rubbery scent. The palate is light in feel and drying, with a spicy, dry red-fruit flavor and a buttery oak tone. Mellow and leafy on the finish.
Name: Tres Palacios 2010 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: The nose is a bit prickly and jumpy, with a candied red-fruit aroma. On the palate, there's some grab and stickiness along with flavors of mint, woo-driven spice and berry fruit. It loses some character on the finish.
Name: Sombras del Sol 2011 Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This Merlot has small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petite Sirah. It's fairly tannic, with a trace of stewy greenness in the background.
Name: Souverain 2010 Merlot (North Coast)

Description: A leafy compost aroma shows plum and berry scents. The palate has a fresh but choppy feel, with pasty berry and resiny flavors. Short, minty and herbal on the sticky-feeling finish.
Name: Millaman 2010 Estate Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Wet clay, tomato paste, oregano and carob aromas form the bouquet that's more strained than smooth. The palate is lively and herbal in flavor, with a baked berry note that ends in a wash of herb. It gets better with airing.
Name: Carmen 2010 Gran Reserva Maipo Alto Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Both wines from this new producer show significant bottle variation. In both instances, the scores reflect the better bottle of the two 2010s tasted. The Merlot offers a firm cassis flavor, concentrated and balanced, with a streak of black olive, and a pastis-like licorice note.
Name: Coach House 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tannic and earthier than its companion Cabernet, this has almost tongue-scraping dryness. The plum and cherry flavors are tightly wound and tart, and the early impression is that drying tannins take over the finish. With a lot of breathing, it opens up, and the fruit shines through.
Name: 14 Hands 2009 Reserve Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend includes 7% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Cabernet Franc. It's tight, herbal and earthy, with a scent of forest floor. As it opens, it adds layers of wild berry, bramble, graphite and leaf, all in good balance. This has lovely proportion and follow through, as in all of the Novelty Hill reds.
Name: Novelty Hill 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a firmly tannic, solid wine, with a black currant note, tight acidity and good depth of flavor. It is worth aging for 2–3 years.
Name: Château Sainte-Barbe 2010 Merlot de Château Sainte-Barbe  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cranberry, Bing cherry and red plum flavors dominate the fruit profile, enlivened by a bright spice note. The tannins turn quite chalky and drying, which lessens the pleasure of the finish.
Name: Three Rivers 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend includes 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Malbec. A scent of egg and an herbal edge diminish the fruit somewhat. A peppery berry note and stiff tannins come with a green tea edge, suggesting that this is just on the edge of ripeness. Perfectly fine for a steak dinner.
Name: Novelty Hill 2009 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a medium-bodied Merlot, with dark fruit flavors that are cloaked in chewy, chalky, earthy and herbal tannins.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Proprietor's Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A rich but well balanced wine, this features ripe flavors and integrated tannins. A juicy black-currant note sits with the dusty structure, with fragrant acidity on the finish. The Château Sainte-Barbe is at the end of the promontory that lies between the Dordogne and Garonne Rivers just before they meet.
Name: Château Sainte-Barbe 2010  Bordeaux

Description: This is firm and reasonably substantial, with strong streaks of vanilla and licorice. The oak treatment masks the rather light red-fruit flavor, and may seem overdone to some tasters.
Name: Boomtown 2010 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: At first there is a whiff of something slightly sweaty, but it blows off to reveal a compact, unyielding wine, with wild berry flavors and a strongly earthy, tannic finish.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Les Collines Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This lists its alcohol at a hefty 15.5%, but the soft, light red-fruit flavor doesn't reflect the abv. It opens with dusty, toasty barrel scents, then quickly fades.
Name: Basel Cellars 2009 Pheasant Run Vineyard Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This no-frills Merlot follows the general 14 Hands style of laying off the oak influence. It's a solid wine, though not particularly fruity, and it puts the emphasis on balanced notes of earth, herb and licorice.
Name: 14 Hands 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herbal and earthy, this dry and tannic wine shows almost no hint of ripe fruit. It might be best with a burger or skirt steak to absorb the tannins.
Name: Maryhill 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
