Description: This is virtually indistinguishable from its companion Cabernet Sauvignon, also a nonvintage, unripe, generic red.
Name: Copper River Estate NV Diversion Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Michel Rolland's Long Shadows wine is 83% Merlot, 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc. Bay leaf and pretty herb scents introduce a wine that remains tightly wound. Black cherry and cassis flavors are set in a frame of smoky espresso. The tannins are polished, and the finish is deliciously long.
Name: Pedestal 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A hint of mint can be detected in the opening aromas of this Merlot, which includes a splash of Cabernet Franc in the blend. Licorice, smoke and deep cassis flavors all contribute to an intense, seductive wine, with velvety tannins enrobing a lingering finish.
Name: Forgeron 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This tastes far more expensive than the price would suggest. Sourced from both Red Mountain and Royal Slope vineyards, it's a smoke-, coffee- and licorice-laden wine, with expressive cassis and black cherry flavors at its core. It finishes with lovely, fine-grained tannins.
Name: Elevation Cellars 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This excellent estate-grown Merlot is a standout in the current Goose Ridge lineup. A scent of violet introduces a dark and potent wine. Plum and black cherry are enhanced by streaks of rock and tar. The tannins are supple and substantial.
Name: Goose Ridge 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A deep, dense blackberry flavor suggests that this is cellar worthy. Notes of ground coffee, cacao and clean earth abound. The finish is long and compact, with nicely polished tannins.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Ethos Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a very firm, tight and focused effort, with a clean cherry flavor. It is not at all like most Washington Merlots, which are often heavily influenced by new oak aging. Here is a concise, pure expression that may come across as a little monochromatic, perhaps because it seems to be somewhat shut down at the moment. Made using grapes from 10-year-old vines, it shows great promise.
Name: K Vintners 2009 Stoneridge Vineyard Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Firm and compact, this is a blend of 83% Merlot and 17% Malbec, offering a broad red-fruit flavor, finishing streak of mocha. As with all Hightower reds, it is immediately accessible and drinks with smooth power.
Name: Hightower 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Garrigue and savory dried-herb hints accent the ripe, rich black-cherry and plum notes on the nose and palate of this brawny, yet lusciously concentrated, Merlot. Big, chunky tannins are piercing on the palate, but these should smooth considerably over the course of an evening.
Name: Kabaj 2007 Merlot (Goriska Brda)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Well balanced and 100% varietal, this is a mix of berry, plum and cassis flavors that are annotated with notes of licorice, tar and coffee. Moderate in length and clean, this has polished tannins to keep it all in balance.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2009 Mule Skinner Estate Grown Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pure Merlot has the grip and muscle often found in Washington fruit; in fact, it's a bit tight at first. Notes of red plum, strawberry and stiff tannins carry the medium finish, with a nice hint of dried herb.
Name: Thomas O'Neil Cellars 2009 Fahrenheit 100 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Toasty and firm, this substantial Merlot is based in powerful cassis flavor, with muscular tannins and a solid foundation of earth and extract.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2010 Indian Wells Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Some opening spice and a rich coating of milk chocolate are the main pleasures is this bottling. The strawberry flavor is light and peppery, the wine solidly made but sliding into a generic style.
Name: Palouse 2009 Mystique Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Martin Ranch makes a consistently good Merlot, this one marked by sweet red fruit and licorice, with layers of cinnamon spice. Full-bodied and meaty, its layers are concentrated enough to stand up to steak or hamburgers.
Name: Martin Ranch 2009 J.D. Hurley Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of five Bordeaux grapes has the style and lightly herbal character of a cru Bordeaux. Notes of brambly red fruit and peppery herb combine in a well-balanced wine of medium length, with restrained, lightly earthy tannins.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This muscular, dark and oaky wine includes 9% each Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot in the blend. Cassis, licorice and ground espresso notes contribute still darker notes, leading into a finish that's marked by astringent, drying tannins.
Name: Cave B 2009 Estate Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has a lightly funky nose that leads into a rather flat midpalate, with barrel toast and simple red fruit. It all resolves quickly into a one-dimensional finish.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Plum and cola aromas set up a spunky, rubbery Merlot that features a mix of roasted berry and chocolaty oak flavors. It is mild on the finish.
Name: Zolo 2011 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: This is an oaky Merlot that's thick with black olive and blackberry flavors, encased in a wall of dark chocolate and roasted coffee. Somewhere in the midst of it all is also a taste of bread.
Name: Peirano 2010 Heritage Collection, Six Clones Merlot (Lodi)

Description: This is a slightly syrupy Merlot that has flavors of overripe plum, black pepper and vanilla, especially on the finish. The blend is mostly Merlot with small amounts of Petite Sirah, Malbec, Cabernet and Zinfandel, all from Clarksburg, a cool subregion near Lodi.
Name: Gen5 2010 Merlot (Clarksburg)

Description: This opens with a familiar taste of artificial, roasted char, then it moves on to soupy berry aromas. It feels scratchy, with flavors of hickory, baked plum and berry.
Name: Funky Llama 2011 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Burnt and angry in smell, this has earthy red-berry aromas. It feels astringent, with jumbled, baked berry flavors that come with a weedy note. Turns to leather and baked fruit tones on the finish.
Name: Rutini 2011 Trumpeter Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: This smells of generic red fruit and pasty oak, and it tastes burnt, slightly chemical and rubbery, with creamy berry fruit flavors taking over.
Name: Tilia 2011 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This begins like an aged Merlot, soft in cinnamon spice aromas, then it delves into the supple dark-plum flavors of a younger-drinking Merlot.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2007 Estate Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Merlot features noticeably soft, supple fruit, tasting of red plum and dark cherry, with mellow, sweet tannin. Still, the wine has a big presence and a wall of structure around it, the finish laced with cedar.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2008 Crown Block Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Merlot begins with a fragrant cinnamon-spice nose, followed by a healthy amount of bright red-cherry and plum flavors. It's light-bodied and satisfying all-around, with a long finish.
Name: Fenestra 2008 Thatcher Bay Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is unmistakably a mountain-grown Merlot, hefty with dark fruit and layers of baking spice. Concentrated and ready to age another 5–7 years, it has a long and leathery finish.
Name: Lava Cap 2009 Merlot (El Dorado)

Description: A large-production wine that's simple and straightforward in its dark cherry flavor and soft texture, this wine is a crowd-pleaser. It finishes quick but satisfying.
Name: Noble Vines 2010 181-Merlot Merlot (Lodi)

Description: Using grapes sourced primarily from Lodi, this Merlot is oaky and smoky, expressing an aroma of cooked black olive. It also features a subtle and toasty berry cobbler flavor, and the finish is all cedar and caramel.
Name: Spellbound 2010 Merlot (California)

Description: Dry berry aromas feature a minty, spicy side. The palate feels drying, with a raspberry flavor and a green herb note. It's medium-bodied, with a hint of plum in addition to resiny wood and green flavors on the finish.
Name: Rios de Chile 2011 Reserva Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: This is raspy and rough on the nose, with heavy mint, green herb, latex and bell pepper aromas. It feels fairly full, with herb and peppery berry flavors, leading to a green, minty, scratchy finish.
Name: Casas del Toqui 2011 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: This wine's cola, forest floor, cherry and cassis aromas are promising, but on the palate it's a tannic crusher, with mouth-blasting acids. It feels abrasive and tastes of rubbery black fruits.
Name: Lidio Carraro 2010 Agnus Encruzilhada do Sul Merlot (Serra do Sudeste)

Description: Pinched cherry and berry aromas are lean and leathery. It feels tight and scouring, with oaky, green flavors of berry and cherry. It tastes dried out and herbal on the finish.
Name: Chilensis 2011 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Earthy, leathery aromas are hot and end up smelling like a field in summertime. It feels hard on the palate, with a buttery oak note that sets up flavors of plum and raspberry mixed with green herb.
Name: Viña Requingua 2011 Puerto Viejo Reserve Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: An herbal cherry aroma comes with notes of leather and mulchy earth. It feels and tastes dried out, with tart, grating acidity and medicinal, herbal flavors on the finish.
Name: Arauco 2011 Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Smooth and instantly appealing, this estate-grown Merlot has a broad, chocolaty palate that's loaded with cherry fruit. There are peppery, herbal highlights, and plenty of lingering, polished tannins.
Name: Hyatt 2009 Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a very late release for this 2007 Merlot, and the wine is well on its way to full maturity. Smooth and supple, its fruit is drying out, showing cherry-flavored fruit leather as the main component. Streaks of coffee and tobacco fill in the finish.
Name: Hogue 2007 Reserve Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Merlot has a fair splash of both Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. It does not shy away from underbrush accents of leaf and herb, adding complexity to the cherry fruit.
Name: Roza Ridge 2009 Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a bit lighter than the previous vintage, offering tart red-berry fruit, accented with a note of fresh herb. The chocolaty barrel accents smooth out the midpalate and lead into a pleasant finish.
Name: Waterbrook 2009 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Firm, hard and tight, this offers black cherry flavors with some peach-pit phenolics. It's sharp and edgy, definitely on the herbal side, with a hint of stem.
Name: Hogue 2008 Genesis Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Firm, hard, tart and chewy, this has tight black fruits, high acids and earthy tannins, which are lightened with a note of pretty baking spice.
Name: Airfield Estates 2010 Runway Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a fruity Merlot with a strong lemony streak. There are hints of pepper as well. Drink soon.
Name: Tildio 2009 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Powerfully lush and concentrated, this has a heady layering of spice and tannins that coat the back palate. With a big, fruity mouthfeel, this is ready for braised meats or herbed roast chicken with garlic smashed potatoes.
Name: Kimmel 2009 Merlot (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This has flavors of dark cherry and mint that hover above its herbal tendencies. It resolves nicely on the finish, with flavors of juicy plum and black tea.
Name: Concannon 2009 Conservancy Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: This is a Merlot with dark plum flavors, integrated tannins and good structure. Juicy fruit and an appropriate level of herbaceousness in the background.
Name: Mad Housewife 2009 Merlot (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This Merlot has good plum and cherry flavors up front and is straightforward enough to pair with just about any food, but the finish falls a bit flat.
Name: Parducci 2009 Small Lot Blend Merlot (Mendocino County)

Description: This Merlot is muted aromatically. On the palate it's gigantic in tannins—big and bold for sure.
Name: LangeTwins 2008 Reserve Merlot (Clarksburg)

Description: This is an herbal Merlot that tastes of toasty oak and finishes slightly sweet.
Name: Cable Car 2009 Merlot (Lodi)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A classic take on Merlot—this is 100% varietal, and was aged for 15 months in new and neutral French oak barrels and botti. The flavors move through strawberry, raspberry and Bing cherry, with great breadth of flavor and texture throughout. The midpalate is concentrated and full, with a fine, lingering, superclean finish.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2010 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Estate grown and skillfully made, blended with 9% Cabernet Franc, this captivates with its sophistication and elegance. The Cabernet Franc brings some floral highlights to the nose, while the sturdy Merlot—dressed in accents of incense and sandalwood, cocoa and cinnamon—powers its way through a marvelously long finish.
Name: Seven Hills 2009 Seven Hills Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 96% Merlot, with just a splash of Cabernet Sauvignon. Firm and focused, it sports a toasty nose, with rich blackberry and cherry fruit. The oak treatment brings in generous flavors of coffee and mocha.
Name: J. Bookwalter 2009 Foreshadow Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As with the 2008 Tulpen Cabernet, the Lewis (Yakima Valley) and Wallula (Horse Heaven Hills) Vineyards provided the fruit. A muscle Merlot, this is smooth and round, bearing flavors of mixed berry and ripe cherry, with added notes of iron and clean earth.
Name: Tulpen 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This has a lovely entry that explodes with scents of toasted almond and espresso. The black cherry and sour plum flavors command your attention, with texture and balance throughout. Drink soon.
Name: Boudreaux Cellars 2007 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Dense with fruit yet finely textured, Shinn's Nine Barrels Reserve boasts a penetrating dark-cherry flavor offset by shades of leather, granite, spice and mocha. Rippling with acidity and bold, mouth-coating tannins, it evolves beautifully in the glass, but would likely improve in the cellar over 5–7 years.
Name: Shinn Estate 2008 Nine Barrels Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This is a limited production wine—a rich and firmly tannic. It has weight and density, backed plum skin and blackberry notes. It's all wrapped in a concentrated, structured package. Age for at least 4 years.
Name: Château Haut-Goujon 2010 La Fleur du Barril  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While this is supple and rich with loads of sweet blackberry and blueberry fruit, the penetrating minerality and a swathe of fresh flower and herb add depth and grace to this lovely Merlot. The tannins are still quite taut, yet they're ripe in nature. It drinks deliciously now, but it's structured enough to improve over the next five years.
Name: Paumanok 2007 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% estate-grown Merlot opens with meaty aromas of plum and black cherry. There is a pleasant, roasted character to the flavors, with nutmeg and cinnamon spice. Still youthful and tight, this breathes open into a supple wine with a finishing streak of pencil lead.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2009 Vineyard Select Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Unfiltered and broad shouldered, this is a fine expression of pure Merlot from the Walla Walla Valley. Though plenty ripe, the sweet fruit flavors have a pillowy elegance—the wine feels light but the flavors run deep.
Name: Kontos 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Ripe and fruity, this has sweet black-currant and plum fruits, a layer of rounded tannins and a juicy, full-in-the-mouth character. It will be ready to drink in a year.
Name: Château Tour du Moulin 2009 Les Terres Rouges  (Fronsac)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Lush and forward with juicy blackberry fruit, this supple Merlot is richly concentrated and creamy in texture, yet it's invigorated by rippling acidity and hints of freshly cracked pepper. It finishes with a touch of fresh mint and briar.
Name: Macari 2007 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: From the southern slopes of Bordeaux's Entre-deux-Mers, this is rounded, fleshy and packed with plum and smoke flavors. It has the vintage's richness and the soft tannins, making it already drinkable.
Name: Château Thieuley 2009 Clos Sainte-Anne  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Rich blackberry and black-cherry flavors are a luxurious backdrop to the notes of savory Worcestershire sauce, sweet spice, and darkly toasted wood in this full bodied, yet elegantly structured Merlot. The tannins are ripe, but grippy, and they linger long on the violet-inflected finish. Drinks well now, but it would likely improve until 2015.
Name: McCall 2008 Corchaug Estate Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There are drying tannins and an earthy underpinning to this bottling of the Gravity Merlot. The cherry and cassis flavors have good grip, leading into a coffee-coated finish.
Designation: Gravity Destiny Ridge Vineyards Estate Grown
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2009 Gravity Destiny Ridge Vineyards Estate Grown Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: The Hamptons, Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Herbaceous and brambly on the nose and palate, Wölffer's Estate Merlot is concentrated in red plum and cherry fruit but lean in structure, with lively acidity and a softly tannic finish. It drinks well now, but it could benefit from decanting.
Name: Wölffer 2008 Estate Merlot (The Hamptons, Long Island)

Description: Berry, brown sugar and prune aromas are nice, while the palate is tannic, with a rugged mouthfeel that should be softened by hearty foods. This tastes of plum and dark berry, while the finish is oaky, chocolaty, spicy and strong.
Name: Lapostolle 2009 Cuvée Alexandre - Apalta Vineyard Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 75% Merlot, with Cabernet, Malbec and Syrah comprising the other 25%. Despite all of the components, it tastes like there is a bit of a hole. The fruit is soft and plummy, and the overall balance is excellent.
Name: Obelisco Estate 2009 Reserve Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While plush with notes of superripe red plums and vanilla on the nose and palate, Shinn's Estate Merlot is remarkably complex with shades of dark cocoa powder, purple flowers and a spray of freshly-cut herbs. Sharp acidity and velvety tannins add structure and style.
Name: Shinn Estate 2008 Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Superripe red fruit mingles with hints of milk chocolate and sweet spice on the nose and palate of this lush Merlot. Fresh herb, a spray of violet and soft, fine-grained tannins add structure and finesse to the palate.
Name: Macari 2008 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Simple, forward flavors of vanilla syrup and fresh-cut tobacco seem to define the Milbrandt lineup. A tart berry flavor and chocolaty tannins make for a supple, flavorful Merlot.
Name: Milbrandt 2009 Traditions Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The nose is lifted and the flavors a bit austere, but the mix of red fruits and soft tannins is nicely balanced. There are hints of chocolate throughout the finish.
Name: Boomtown 2009 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Forward and—at least for the moment—quite oaky, this is tasty, although it does not expand into more complicated flavors. The 70% new French oak barrels seem to over-ride the fruit, giving it a somewhat monolithic impression. Drink up while it retains its youthful freshness.
Name: Two Vintners 2009 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Cherry and black fruit aromas are capped by a rubbery note. It feels juicy and fresh, with raspberry, red plum and vanilla flavors. Drying but fresh and nice on the finish.
Name: Siegel 2010 Crucero Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Although the alcohol is relatively high, it's balanced by the wine's rich and ripe fruit core and soft tannic structure. The nose needs time to fully open up, revealing intense black-plum and cherry aromas. Jammy and full on the palate, this has a hint of black pepper on the close.
Name: Bazelet HaGolan 2010 Merlot (Golan Heights)

Description: Berry and crisp currant aromas make up the bouquet. It shows racy acidity and moderate sharpness on the palate along with solid berry flavors. Tangy, lively and fresh on the finish.
Name: Chilcas 2010 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Smoke, toasted coconut and dill notes amplify the underripe black-fruit and cassis notes on the nose and palate of this Merlot. Taut with tannins and acidity on the midpalate, it finishes with hints of resin and spice.
Name: Peconic Bay Winery 2009 Lot #1 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: The nose is a tad fleshy with ripe red-fruit and sweet spice notes, but the palate is crisp with striking acidity and hints of green leaves and forest floor. It tastes fine now, with ripe, chalky tannins, but it should hold well until at least 2015.
Name: Long Island Merlot Alliance 2008 Merliance Merlot (Long Island)

Description: Raisin, black plum and modest spice aromas set up a full and tannic palate, with flavors of blackberry, molasses and resiny oak. Raisin and brown sugar flavors dominate the finish on this structured, fairly high-acid Merlot.
Name: Ventisquero 2009 Grey [Glacier] Single Block Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Bacon aromas and very dense tannins give this a lean, rather than fruity, character. It does have some density along with a more juicy black-fruit finish, although high amounts of toast also show strongly.
Name: Duval & Blanchet 2010  Saint-Émilion

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Smoke and dark chocolate notes abound on this elegant Long Island Merlot (made with 10% Petit Verdot). A touch austere on the palate, it has a black plum flavor shaded with hints of resin, leaves and game. Bold tannins add structure and power.
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2007 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Black plum and cherry aromas take second stage to the earthy notes of bramble, spice and crushed iris petal. Medium weight with satiny tannins, this has a spicy black-cherry finish.
Name: Recanati 2010 Merlot (Galilee)

Description: Strawberrry and rhubarb aromas open the bouquet of this Merlot, with hints of cinnamon, bark and raw cocoa nib unfolding shortly after. Medium weight with soft, approachable tannins, this has a clean, cherry-flavored finish.
Name: Odem Mountain 2009 Volcanic Red Dry Merlot (Galilee)

Description: A solid effort, with cherry and red currant aromas. The palate bears scratchy tannins and flavors of raspberry and red plum, with mild, dry and crisp finish. This should pair well with basic foods.
Name: Casa Silva 2009 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Solid, chunky and dense, this shows a rich character based around dark tannins. It has a ripe black-plum flavor and juicy acidity on the finish.
Name: Duval & Blanchet 2009 Les Notes Fruitées  (Bordeaux)

Description: Firmly structured, this has a dry core that's solidly based on smoky tannins. The fruit is holding back, although in a few months the blackberry flavor should surface. The finish retains the dry, firm character of the wine.
Name: Duval & Blanchet 2010 Les Notes Fruitées  (Bordeaux)

Description: The briary red-berry and plum aromas are earthy and rubbery. This is medium in body and a bit heavy, with just-adequate acidity and solid flavors of plum, berry and resiny oak. The finish is oaky and medicinal tasting.
Name: Cuevas del Sur 2010 Reserve Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: Dark in color, this delivers black fruit aromas along with a toasty note. While it's slightly hollow in the middle, it's wide around the edges, tasting of mossy blackberry and herb. The finish is toasty, big and grabby.
Name: Viña La Fortuna 2010 Culpeo Made with Organic Grapes Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: The bouquet is hard, carrying a mild chemical note along with a hickory aroma. Medium to light in body, with berry flavors blended with a woody spice note. Minty and medicinal on the finish.
Name: Cremaschi Furlotti 2010 Reserva Merlot (Loncomilla Valley)

Description: Earthy berry, lemony oak and horseradish aromas in the nose. Clacky and tight on the palate, this has beastly tannins in front of modest red-berry and plum flavors. Rough in feel, with warmth on the finish.
Name: Cremaschi Furlotti 2009 Single Vineyard Merlot (Loncomilla Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The herbal, thin fruit is covered with a strong streak of vanilla. It finishes with bitter tannins.
Name: Cedar River Cellars 2010 Watershed Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is charred and burnt smelling, with a rubbery, hickory aroma that covers up the wine's cherry and berry scents. The palate bears flavors of raspberry, pie cherry and green herb, finishing quick as a flash, with tannic residue.
Name: Casa Silva 2009 Angostura Gran Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A simple rendition of Merlot, with soft plum fruit and supple tannins. Easy to drink and pair, this should make for a fine midweek wine with roast chicken or turkey meatloaf.
Name: Fenestra 2007 Thatcher Bay Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: Black fruit and graphite aromas come with an earthy heaviness. This is intense, with driving tannins pushing the flavors of black plum and stewed meat. The finish is big and fruity, with a rubbery feel.
Name: Andeluna 2010 Merlot (Tupungato)

Description: Dense on the nose, this has aromas of wet clay, tomato and herb-accented berry. It feels tight and tannic, with notes of red plum, berry and hard spice on the back palate. The finish is peppery and mildly herbal.
Name: Bodega Norton 2009 Reserva Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Red plum and raspberry aromas mark the nose. Fairly acidic in nature, the palate bears cherry, plum and spice flavors. Red pepper heat and spice mark the crisp, high-acid finish.
Name: Tapiz 2009 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: The aromas smell rubbery and soupy, especially at first. Flavors of roasted berry and plum taste slightly burnt and bitter; overall, this Merlot is herbal, oaky and heavy.
Name: Viña Cobos 2010 Felino Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: This smells sweet and rubbery up front. The palate is tannic, with a blackberry flavor that starts sweet but turns bitter.
Name: Coiron 2010 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Green aromas of oregano and basil blend with tomato and red plum. It feels grabby and thick, with heavy flavors of carob and herb-accented red berry.
Name: Viñas de Vila 2009 Reserva Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Three quarters Merlot, with 17% Cabernet Franc and 8% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a bit lighter than the 2007 Merlot, but just as good, if not better. Lush and loaded with black cherry, blackberry, cocoa and baking spices, it extends deliciously and seamlessly into a long, ripe, smooth finish.
Name: Dumas Station 2008 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A standout from the first sniff, this powerful Merlot displays dark fruits across a broad, lush midpalate. Textural and tongue coating, it lifts the tannins with flavors of cacao, coffee and cedar from barrel aging. Excellent integration and length.
Name: Three Rivers 2008 Champoux Vineyard Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This reserve spends 30 months in barrel. It has lovely aromatics, with subtle suggestions of tobacco and clove woven through the base of ripe black cherry and cassis. The tannins are polished, and the finish lends a thread of iron.
Name: Camaraderie 2008 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Merlot is certainly one of the real strengths at Fidélitas, and two different versions are offered. This broad and flavorful effort has pretty cherry fruit backed with pleasing baking spices. The finish is focused and precise, adding streaks of cinnamon and chocolate.
Name: Fidelitas 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy, peppery and still a bit sharp, this Merlot-dominated blend includes fruit from both estate vineyards—Seven Hills and Pepper Bridge. It shows the seamless polish that marks all of Jean-François Pellet's wines. The finish is focused and long, with delicious highlights of cinnamon and dark chocolate.
Name: Pepper Bridge 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Deliciously full and fleshy, this lusty, muscular Merlot brings boatloads of dark cherry fruit and seams of rich cacao. Tannins are firm and slightly chalky, but the overall structure and length suggest a decade of life ahead.
Name: Camaraderie 2009 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A chocolaty delight, this is a soft and smoky style of Merlot. The dark fruit flavors are accented with some toasted, slightly charred notes, and cinnamon spices. As very good as it is, the mouthfeel seems just a little broad as it flattens out the finish.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A whiff of volatility brightens up the aromas of this ripe Merlot. The structure is tight and compact, and the acidity is substantial. Clean fruit flavors of red and black berries can be found, but this is a year in which all of the Fielding Hills wines would benefit from a bit more bottle age to knit together.
Name: Fielding Hills 2009 RiverBend Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Surprisingly, this Red Mountain Merlot is rather light and tart, showing cranberry fruit with a streak of smoke. The tannins are peppery and earthy, with a hint of stem; a European style, with poise and good balance.
Name: Fidelitas 2009 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has pretty fruit flavors of plums and spicy black cherries. At first the wine seems sharp and slightly warm, but it mellows with air.
Name: Eight Bells 2009 Roosevelt Red Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This shows a strong Bourbon barrel flavor from the new oak that is still being integrated into the fruit. Tart wild-berry flavors surfacewith air, but the impression is of a high-acid, sharply-defined Merlot; it's structured for aging.
Name: Sinclair Estate Vineyards 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced from the Spofford Station Vineyard, this pure Merlot offers medium concentration, with mixed blueberry and plum fruits, and a suggestion of some raisiny fruit as well. All neutral oak was used, imparting no barrel flavors.
Name: Adamant Cellars 2008 Winemaker's Select Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hard and showing an herbal edge, this single-vineyard Merlot will require some further bottle age and/or decanting. It drinks more like a Cabernet than a Merlot, with a green slant to the tannins.
Name: Tertulia 2008 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This young Merlot shows some muscle and some stem; the tannins and the herbal flavors override the fruit, which has a sweet cherry-candy character. Further bottle age should help pull it together.
Name: Maryhill 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is stewy smelling, with tomato leaf and raisiny notes. It feels dense and mature, with mild acidity creating jammy raspberry and plum flavors along with a lot of barrel spice. The oak flavor is dominant on the finish.
Name: Castillo de Monjardin 2007 Deyo Merlot (Navarra)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Yakima Valley Merlot is forward and light, with a dried leaf character complementing the fruit flavors of melon and strawberry. A peppery note strikes home in the finish, with just a hint of Band-Aid.
Name: Two Mountain 2008 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hard and tannic at first, this young wine grudgingly reveals a core of very tart cherry fruit, encased in flavors of stem and wood. A coffee-infused finish does not conceal the chewy, tough tannins.
Name: Gamache 2008 Estate Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A candied nose introduces light fruit and there's and impression of some residual sugar on the finish. With extra breathing time tobacco and vanilla notes emerge, but the fruit is ephemeral.
Name: Gifford Hirlinger 2008 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Soft and lightly fruity, this has an underlying chalkiness. That chalky sensation runs across the palate and seems to mute the other flavors, such as herb, which are on the light side.
Name: Maryhill 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Coteaux de Peyriac, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Layers of black raspberry and cherry are intensified by a decadent mocha note in the background. The mouthfeel is round and opulent, but structured with dusty tannins. A coffee note stays through the medium-length close. Drink now.
Name: Château du Donjon 2008 Le Merlot du Donjon Merlot (Vin de Pays des Coteaux de Peyriac)
Region: Vin de Pays des Coteaux de Peyriac

Description: An unusual Merlot icewine, this is clear and quite lovely in the glass, with shades of sunset orange and mahogany, like burnished wood. It's unctuous and sugary in the mouth, with grainy flavors of sugarcane, strawberry jam and sweet cherry liqueur. Quite thick for an icewine, with a cloying finish.
Name: Ex Nihilo 2008 Journey of Hope Icewine Merlot (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Concentrated aromas of blackberry, cherry and mashed fig abound, while flavors of black plum skins dominate the palate and coat the mouth with a firm texture. Medium tannins linger on the finish alongside a hint of roasted cocoa nib.
Name: La Noble 2009 Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Here's a solid and satisfying Merlot, boasting bright notes of blackberry and plum laced with accents of carnation potpourri. Medium tannins give structure to the palate, and the slightly lifted finish ends clean.
Name: Barrière Frères 2008 Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: A solid and very drinkable wine, the forward black fruit elements are accented by hints of fudge and sweet spice on the finish Drink now.
Name: Les Vignerons de la Méditerranée 2009 Réserve St. Martin Merlot (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Barely ripe, with strong flavors of herb and leaf, this is a rough, chewy wine whose stemmy tannins will need a hearty cut of beef to tame them.
Name: Del Rio 2009 Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Firm raspberry fruit, tight and concentrated, is swathed in a generous coat of deliciously toasty oak. Tart and youthful, the wine's depth comes through as it breathes open in the glass, adding licorice, coffee grounds, and buttered nuts to the toasty finish.
Name: Dunham 2008 Lewis Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% Merlot, and all Red Mountain fruit. Ripe plums and cherries are accented with hints of dried leaves, tobacco, and sweet herb. Baking spices reflect its 20 months in oak, and the wine has a soft finish that is ideal for immediate enjoyment.
Name: Hightower 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A dark and rich style of Merlot, this wine boasts intense aromas and flavors of black forest berries, plum flesh, cocoa powder and pencil shavings. Succulent, with a creamy texture, the tannins are fine but mouth-coating and provide a good frame to the sultry flavors. Chocolate and cedar spice linger on the close.
Name: Ernie Els 2009 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is all Merlot, tight and toasty, with generous black fruits compacted into a dense core. This one needs more bottle age, and/or substantial decanting time, but it shows excellent depth and polish already.
Name: Airfield Estates 2009 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: At first, a rush of front-loaded plum and blackberry fruit hits the palate, then the flavors seem to sag a bit entering the midpalate. A wall of still-to-be-resolved oak leads into a hard, astringent, somewhat woody finish. Yet there is a substantial and well-built wine here, waiting to resolve its components into a more seamless whole. Retasted after being open a full day, it showed well, suggesting good aging potential.
Name: Steppe Cellars 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Jammy black fruit and berry notes fill the nose and mouth, while a hint of bramble and milk chocolate add depth and interest. Medium weight, with dusty but structured tannins, and a fudgy finish.
Name: Glenelly 2009 The Glass Collection Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: Herbal accents grace the black plum and berry aromas and flavors, and a touch of biltong spice and meat mingle with the fruit for added character. Approachable and soft, with delicate tannins and an easy, friendly finish. Drink now.
Name: Ken Forrester 2009 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Humboldt County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a confounding wine in many ways, one that could have easily scored higher, or scored lower. It starts with an almost alarming taste of vanilla and cherry coke and a slight bite of alcohol, but over time, got much more interesting. Finally, it turned earthy with pleasant hits of olive and caramel competing for dominance.
Name: Cabot Vineyards 2007 Merlot (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A dark, plummy Livermore Valley Merlot that reminds one of herb-encrusted roasted meats, and would be a good wine to pair with such a feast. Full-bodied and lush, with a smoky, oaky finish and cedar lurking throughout.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2009 Crown Block Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A light, easy-drinking Merlot that spent two months in new French oak and otherwise speaks of dark plums and earth. Some bottle variation; two bottles tasted.
Name: Middle Ridge 2008 Reserve Merlot (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Made from organic grapes, Yorkville's light-bodied Merlot is dry and herbal, with cedar in spades rounded out by elegant plum and chocolate softness. This vintage has 10% Cabernet Sauvignon as well, and would match well with lighter meats, like chicken.
Name: Yorkville Cellars 2009 Rennie Vineyard Merlot (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: Red plum and small berries lead the nose of this Merlot, with hints of dusty dried blackberry in the back. The palate offers similar flavors, with a touch of sweet spice hanging on to the short but clean finish.
Name: Helderberg Wijnmakerij 2009 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hannah Nicole's Merlot is one of its better wines, tasting of red plum and vanilla-laced toasted oak, its tannins grippy, with plenty of dried herb flavors in the background. Smooth and big.
Name: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2009 Merlot (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Smooth and almost creamy, this simple sipper has cherries and chocolate in abundance. The flavors of vanilla and tobacco are also prominent.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2010 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An inexpensive Merlot that's herbal. It also shows cranberry and menthol amid a light toasting of oak.
Name: Brass Tacks 2009 Merlot (Central Coast)

Description: Hints of rose petals are a curious contrast to earthier scents of soil and beets on this full bodied, slightly chunky Romanian Merlot. Pleasant for everyday dining; flavors of charred wood and preserved plum would pair nicely with an assortment of smoked meats and cheeses.
Name: Cramele Halewood 2009 Vitis Metamorfosis Merlot (Dealu Mare)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Not as good as Darcie Kent's Crown Block Merlot, this one is smooth, with big-shouldered tannins. It tastes of raisin toast, dried plums and tobacco, with menthol darting in and out along the edges.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2008 Picazo Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Abeja winemaker John Abbott sources fruit for this 100% Merlot from the estate (Heather Hill) vineyard and old-vine Bacchus grapes. Lush and full across the palate, this utterly delicious wine marshals an army of pretty red and black fruit into a silky smooth flavor formation, then wraps them in a tapestry of floral, caramel, coconut, coffee and chocolate highlights.
Name: Abeja 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tamarack blends grapes from an astonishing number of sites scattered across the length and breadth of the Columbia Valley, and yet makes wines that are distinctive, polished, generous, and focused. The 2008 Merlot includes 5% each Cabernet Sauvignon and Cab Franc. Its structure is firmly Cab-like, its fruit broadly displayed across the midpalate, a mix of ripe strawberries and cherries dusted with sweet baking spices and cocoa. It's a joyride from start to finish.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Reserve caliber fruit—a throat-coating mix of blueberry, cherry and cassis—rolls into a rich, full throttle wash of barrel flavors. Toast, smoke, espresso and dark chocolate give the wine depth and gravitas. Ageworthy to be sure, but also enjoyable right now.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2008 Cold Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Another outstanding value from Three Rivers, this powerfully-built wine mixes ripe berry and plum fruit with polished, astringent tannins. It opens well, but really hits its stride on the back palate, with the balance and concentration to age. That said, it's drinking awfully well right now.
Name: Three Rivers 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A concentrated and seductive Merlot that's perfect for folks who like 'em big, ripe and oaky. Mulled boysenberries and blueberry compote flood the nose and mouth, with lush notes of milk chocolate, blackcurrant liqueur and dark coffee spicing up the finish. Round and velvet-textured, with medium tannins.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2007 Yarden Odem Vineyard Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Nicely done, with plum and cherry compote anchoring the core. Ripe, almost jammy, full and fleshy, this snaps into focus with crisp acidity and gentle tannins.
Name: Mannina Cellars 2009 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A chocolaty wine with very pretty red fruit, this smooth and lightly spicy vintage is particularly well made given the cool year. In the blend are small amounts of Cabernet and Syrah, but Merlot is the star here, with rich black-cherry flavors wrapped in mocha.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2008 Ethos Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark and dusty, with streaks of metal and mineral, this complex Merlot retains the elegance so rarely found in domestic versions. Cassis and plum flavors melt into supple tannins soaked in espresso. Ready to drink now.
Name: Milbrandt 2009 The Estates Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sweet, rich and luscious in a palate-enveloping style, this cherry-bomb of a Merlot opens with a rush of ripe, round, fruit-liqueur flavors. Delicious as it is, it hangs there right into a slightly alcoholic finish. Some further bottle age should make for continued improvement.
Name: Pepper Bridge 2008 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A Port-like nose sends up scents of raisins and prunes soaked in chocolate. The wine is thick, dark and tannic, evoking the Barrister house style and the heavier tannins of the Red Mountain vineyard site. Just a hint of green stem creeps into the finish.
Name: Barrister 2009 Artz Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Thoroughly delicious, this seamlessly integrated, palate-coating Merlot matches pretty berry fruit to impressive barrel flavors. Coffee, toffee and chocolate are there in abundance, smoothing out dusty tannins and adding a suggestion of sweetness.
Name: Columbia Crest 2008 Grand Estates Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quickly becoming one of Washington's best go-to Merlots, the latest from Waterbrook is pretty and smooth, richly endowed with ripe cherry and cassis fruit, snappy acidity and a bright, clean finish. The lovely fruit is accented by hints of herb and dried leaves.
Name: Waterbrook 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With 20 months spent in new French oak, this is a lush and woody wine, with assertive aromas and flavors of sweet spice, vanilla and coffee accenting the black plum and berry fruit core. Round and full in the mouth, with a texture like crushed satin and a long, sweet oak-driven finish.
Name: Shiloh Winery 2009 Secret Reserve Merlot (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A spicy start of snappy raspberry and cherry fruit mixes with notes of dried leaf and citrusy acidity. Orange peel highlights accent the acid and bring a slight bitterness that's not unpleasant.
Name: Basel Cellars 2008 Pheasant Run Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: A little coarse and rugged on the nose, there's a meaty and earthy cedar streak to the otherwise black plum and berry fruit core of this Merlot. The concentrated fruit carries through to the medium-weight mouth, with a softly chewy texture of dusty tannins and powdery mocha flavors.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2007 Yarden Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The almost-16% alcohol is difficult to ignore here, as it seems to blow away the nuances that these Woodward Canyon Merlots are usually so good at expressing. As a result, the fruit seems simple, with sweet berry and hints of oranges. It's round and concentrated, but not as textural and detailed as past vintages.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Released more than four years after harvest, this astringent, oaky Merlot remains in a dumb phase. Barrel flavors of bourbon and vanilla quickly take over the nose and the palate, though there is a suggestion of compact power and black fruit lurking in the background. Give it a lot of decanting time.
Name: Forgeron 2007 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: Decadent berry compote leads the bouquet of this wine, while secondary notes of fig and date unfold on the back. The balanced, medium-weight mouth is rich and ripe, with assertive flavors of cherry skin, fudgy chocolate and sweet woody spice that flood the palate and linger on the finish.
Name: Psagot 2009 Merlot (Judean Hills)

Description: A touch green and stemmy on the nose, but ripe red plum and cherry notes unfold on the palate alongside accents of dusty chocolate-milk mix and sweet baking spice. Medium weight, with an approachable structure and a solid finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2006 Yarden Kela Vineyard Merlot (Galilee)

Description: Fresh red fruit flavors are framed with interesting and lifting notes of savory herbs, whole tobacco leaf and a touch of milk chocolate. It's juicy and lively with fine tannins and a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Gamla 2009 The Reserve Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasant, soft and smooth upon entry, this supple, almost buttery wine feels unusually light for this vineyard designate. Flavors suggest watermelon and strawberry, gently coated with a soft layer of coconut, cracker and butter cookie. Tasty, but not for long keeping.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Canoe Ridge Estate Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A cool vintage shows through in the lighter style of this Merlot. Strawberry is the dominant fruit flavor, although the time in new oak is what dominates currently. The scent and vanilla flavor of American oak, though accounting just 20% of the barrels, comes across quite powerfully. Give this one another year or two.
Name: Forgeron 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A soft acetone streak permeates the red cherry- and berry-driven bouquet, while red fruit and pomegranate flavors dominate the palate. A slightly twiggy herbal accent adds depth and staying power to the finish. Drink now.
Name: Bazelet HaGolan 2007 Reserve Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasantly fruity, with tart raspberry fruit, this easy, accessible Merlot from a single vineyard finishes with a light lick of toast.
Name: Balboa 2009 Mirage Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Lightweight and easy in the mouth, with bright, juicy red fruit aromas and flavors spiced up by olive tapenade and fruitcake accents. Clean and balanced with a medium-length finish.
Name: Galil Mountain 2009 Merlot (Galilee)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla and cookie dough flavors dominate. The fruit is light and simple cherry candy; the tannins are equally light. Quaffable and refreshing.
Name: Columbia Crest 2009 H3 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: An easy and drinkable wine, with soft notes of soft black plum and cherry guts along with a hint of savory herb stems. Clean and bright on the finish; drink now.
Name: Binyamina 2007 Reserve Merlot (Upper Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A cedary, slightly chemical aroma masks the fruit, and it is barrel flavors, more than berry flavors, that flood the palate. Overall it's a smooth, modestly-proportioned Merlot that's ready for near-term drinking.
Name: Preston 2007 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Mulled red-berry aromas and flavors dominate this wine, with secondary accents of foliage and sweet spice unfolding in the background. It's lean and tight in the mouth with a slightly sharp alcoholic warmth to the close.
Name: Flam 2008 Reserve Merlot (Israel)

Description: There's a high-toned streak to the red fruit core of this wine, with secondary accents of chocolate-milk mix and vanilla extract to keep things from being too sharp. Drink now.
Name: Alexander 2009 Reserve Merlot (Galilee)

Description: Cedar plank-grilled meat and herbal accents jazz up the heady black fruit core of this wine. Rich and dark, flavors of black berry, plum flesh, cigar box, licorice and pepper dance in the mouth and stay through the solid finish. Fine but firm tannins provide structure and texture, and the wine, though delicious now, should age nicely through 2014.
Name: Remhoogte 2007 Reserve Merlot (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)

Description: A good amount of sweet smoke and cured bacon aromas integrate seamlessly with the boysenberry and black plum notes. Ripe, juicy fruit flavors provide a mouthwatering sensation on the palate, while a touch of tobacco leaf and charred cedar lingers on the long finish.
Name: Hartenberg 2007 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: The immediate impression you get is of strong menthol aromas, followed long after by supporting fruit flavors of blackberry and cherry. The minty sensation also carries through to the mouth, but a touch of fruitcake spice adds something different to the finish. Smooth and approachable now.
Name: Post House 2007 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: Composed and dry Merlot made somewhat in an Old World style. Cola, tobacco and basic berry fruit aromas come in front of a juicy, high-acid palate. Tastes spicy and toasty, with plum and red berry flavors. Fresh and clean; best with food.
Name: Gouguenheim Winery 2009 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: A fully oaked Merlot that yields cinnamon, spearmint and good berry aromas. Feels lively, with tannic grip in support of raspberry, plum and sweet oak flavors. Thick and tannic all the way through, with pepper and woodspice to the finish.
Name: Rutini 2007 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: This is a friendly red with aromas of cinnamon, red berry and pepper, followed by a lightly sweet combination of vanilla, cherry and strawberry. Easy drinking and soft overall, this will pair well with many dishes—turkey, pork and lamb alike.
Name: My Big Fat Greek Wine 2010 Merlot (Peloponnese)

Description: Deep in color, with raisiny, fully ripe and heavy aromas. Feels tannic, extracted and rubbery, but amid the weight and bite there's black plum, pepper and coffee flavors. Finishes with drawing tannins and a dark wave of toasty flavor. A big wine with mouthfeel issues.
Name: Sottano 2010 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy in aromas, with notes of leafy tomato and red plum. Feels narrow and compact, with herbal, slightly tart flavors of red berry mixed with peppery barrel spice and green herbal tinges. Light, then toasty and spicy on the finish.
Name: Lagarde 2010 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: A touch green and horsey smelling, with tomato and leafy berry aromas. Feels heavy and bullish, with a beam of acid pushing plum flavors that end in a short, simple finish.
Name: Noble Aconcagua 2009 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: This one's heavily about the oak. Comes out with spiced-up, minty aromas. Next up is a full and biting palate with buttery lead flavors followed by bitter black fruit. Flashes by quick on the finish.
Name: Tilia 2010 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: A reedy, green opening tells you the story up front. The palate is reduced and scratchy, with rubbery, herbal berry flavors that don't register. Finishes bland and weak.
Name: Twigs 2008 Reserva Made with Organic Grapes Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Smells gaseous and murky, like a compost pile. Rough and not well balanced in the mouth, with simple berry and burnt brown sugar flavors. Hot, heavy and barely acceptable.
Name: Alberti 154 2010 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A real success, this 100% Merlot, sourced from the Stillwater Creek and Conner Lee vineyards, is exotically scented with a rich mix of baking spices, coffee, dust, pencil lead and cedar. Lots of oak influence, but it plays well against the tart and mellow berry flavors. There is a suggestion of dried leaf, perhaps an indication of older vines.
Name: Market Vineyards 2008 Benchmark Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of 81% Merlot, 12% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Cabernet Franc and 3% Petit Verdot. An unusually tight Pedestal, this absolutely must be decanted. It opens well, with black fruits, toasted grain, and firm tannins, then hits a wall and stops short. However, with a lot of breathing time and/or aerating, it broadens out a bit and shows more length and finesse.
Name: Pedestal 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Broadly fruity, this dark and smooth Merlot is loaded with a luscious mix of black fruits. The flavors play out in forward, accessible fashion, flecked with a pleasing minerality.
Name: O•S Winery 2009 The Tusk Elephant Mountain Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Cailloux refers to the pebbles that are an essential part of the vineyard's makeup. They give the wine its mineral edge that adds an extra dimension and structure to the rich Merlot fruit.
Name: Château Penin 2009 Les Cailloux  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Description: Simple cherry fruit, with a delicately earthy base, defines this everyday Merlot. It keeps its herbal component in check, balanced appropriately against rather light fruit.
Name: Hedgeline 2009 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Smooth and clean, with a soft, buttery style. This broadly fruity, immediately enjoyable Merlot is clearly intended for near-term enjoyment.
Name: Flying Fish 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very young, this is a fine follow-up to the winery's outstanding 2009. Dark and rich, the estate-grown fruit offers far more flavor than almost any domestic Merlot in this price range. Blackberries, black cherry, smoke and espresso lead into a grainy, chocolaty, tannic finish.
Name: StoneCap 2010 Estate Grown Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Fresh and colorful, with black cherry, cassis, sweet oak and coffee aromas. Feels big and grabby, with big tannins supporting blackberry and olive flavors. Sort of a rough ride but generous with the baked flavors and fruit content.
Name: Lapostolle 2010 Casa Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cherry fruit with candy highlights quickly fills your mouth. Washington Merlot is often more substantial in this price range than competing wine regions. Nonetheless, this is a lightly herbal effort, with a slightly metallic finish.
Name: Hogue 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With its dark color and rich fruit, this is a powerful wine. It is jammy in its character, although acidity and wood also play a part. At the end, the acidity comes to dominate.
Name: Château Sainte-Barbe 2010 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

Description: Brambly plum and leafy berry aromas are quite typical of value-priced Chilean Merlot. The wine has a good mouthfeel and solid structure, with bright but basic berry fruit flavors. Short and generic on the finish. Good for the price.
Name: Sundance 2010 Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: A soft, round Merlot made from what tastes like extremely ripe fruit, slightly sweet with flavors of spicy cinnamon, cola and plum.
Name: Simaine Cellars 2009 Larry Venturi Vineyards Merlot (Mendocino)

Description: Sweet and herbal smelling, then firm and tight in the mouth, with clampy tannins and generic, dark flavors of black plum and berry. Feels a little reduced and heavy on the finish.
Name: Cousiño-Macul 2010 Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Herbal and reedy like a Cabernet Franc. The oak presence on this Merlot is high and its tannins soft and thick without much to say by the wine's end.
Name: Pavillion Crossing 2010 Reserve Merlot (Lodi)

Description: Chunky and loud on the nose, with olive, oak resin and candied black fruit aromas. Feels astringent and drawing, with herbal plum and roasted berry flavors that are tart in the middle. Staunch, grabby and tight on the finish.
Name: Cono Sur 2010 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Roasted black olive and rubber aromas set up a tannic and heavy palate with a lot of oak but not much fruit to back it up. Tastes like cinnamon and spice, with middling blackberry and bitterness on the finish.
Name: Montes 2010 Classic Series Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vineyard sources in 2008 are Spring Valley and Anna Marie (in the Seven Hills region). Tannic and aromatic, this spicy effort leads with black fruits, fresh herbs and a whiff of chocolate. An underlying minerality gives texture and length. Still young, it's balanced and already well-integrated. It should improve even more with a few years of bottle age.
Name: Northstar 2008 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart and bright, with an almost-jammy mix of raspberry and strawberry preserves, this concentrated, fruit-powered Merlot overdelivers for the price. Along with the luscious fruit are darker streaks of iron, coffee grounds and char, all in a classy, well-designed, four-vineyard blend.
Name: Arbor Crest 2009 Four Vineyards Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine gets the all-star treatment, blending fruit from 14 vineyards, and aging it in 60% new French oak. It's a substantial, muscular effort, with dark fruit, earth and tar components. A small addition of Petit Verdot darkens the color and thickens the tannins. There is just a hint of alcoholic burn in the finish.
Name: Northstar 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Big and brooding with richly concentrated black plums and velvety, mouthfilling tannins, Roman Roth's namesake Merlot is boldly structured, but beautifully nuanced as well, with sprays of violet perfume and just a whiff of wet, earthy forest and dried herb notes. Drink now with a good decant, or hold for another 2–3 years.
Name: The Grapes of Roth 2005 Merlot (Long Island)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Soft and chocolaty, this smooth and broadly expressive Merlot has immediate flavor appeal. From a pair of Walla Walla vineyards, it's a showcase for silky fruit and buttery tannins.
Name: Kontos 2008 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An elegant wine, with nicely framed red berry fruit flavors. Hints of dried herbs and modest tannins put everything in balanced proportion.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Indian Wells Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A balanced and well-structured wine, this Merlot expresses attractive aromas of black plum, soft sweet licorice and delicate spice. The mouth is lush and round with soft tannins and a chocolaty finish. Drink now.
Name: Guardian Peak 2010 Merlot (Western Cape)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart and sappy, with tasty blueberry and cherry fruit. A bit like biting into a big slice of cherry pie, with baking spices and toasty highlights. It's got a good tang to it, and plenty of ripe fruit.
Name: Fort Walla Walla 2007 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: If the label is to be believed, this pure Merlot, from a relatively cool site in a relatively cool year, tops 16% alcohol. The flavors reflect that; a thick mix of tar, smoke, asphalt, espresso and coffee grounds. Buried in there is some black cherry fruit, but it is definitely the barrel flavors and the alcohol that dominate.
Name: :Nota Bene 2008 Conner Lee Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Scents of wine-soaked prunes and Armagnac are tempting on this Merlot blend. Soft tannins and a crisp acidity frame a palate full of concentrated black cherry fruit flecked with tobacco and dried herbs.
Name: T'Jara 2007 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Generally ripe, clean and fresh. Smells pure and spicy, with blackberry aromas setting up a crisp palate. Tastes a little herbal as do almost all Chilean Merlots, but the berry fruit and spice elements are uncompromised and uncomplicated. A likable value Merlot.
Name: Errazuriz 2010 Estate Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While soft on the nose with a generous dose of cooked black fruit, Jamesport's Bloc E is surprisingly crisp and lean on the palate. Pristine red fruit shines amidst layers of mocha, spice and forest floor, finishing on a grippy, darkly toasted wood note.
Name: Jamesport 2005 Bloc E Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit from Seven Hills and Pepper Bridge vineyards is sourced for this pure Merlot. In this somewhat difficult year it doesn't quite hang together; the fruit flavors run from prune and raisin to simply grapy. Citrusy, chalky acids seem not quite integrated, giving the finish a somewhat disjointed feeling.
Name: Otis Kenyon 2008 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Merlot opens with a big berry nose and is concentrated, lush and rich, bursting into vanilla cream midway through, ending with a strong note of toffee. Would pair well with any number of midweek meals, from roast chicken to tacos.
Name: Martin Ranch 2008 J.D. Hurley Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart to the point of sour, this hints at cherry fruit, with toasted grain and cracker flavors equally strong. The wine seems just on the edge of ripe; definitely for those who seek high acid flavors.
Name: Gordon Brothers 2009 Block 3 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It was difficult to get much out of the glass; the wine may have entered a dumb phase. There were vague hints of barnyard and plastic, suggestions of red fruits, and overall the wine left a rather sharp, herbal impression.
Name: Seven Hills 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Floral notes of crushed violet petals add depth to the otherwise fruit-driven core of this wine. Juicy flavors of blueberry and raspberry abound in the silky mouth and light tannins linger through the close. Easy and approachable; drink now.
Name: Stellar Organics 2010 No Added Sulfites Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: Not an inexpensive taste of Brazil despite the one-liter bottle, but this is about as refined and worldly as you're going to find from the land of samba. The nose is roasted and solid, with baked berry aromas that draw you in. Coffee, raisin, pepper and plenty of fruit work the palate, and the finish is long and leathery. One of the better wines from Brazil that we've tried.
Name: Vinícola Miolo 2005 Terroir Merlot (Vale dos Vinhedos)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Sweet vanilla mingles with ripe cherries and plums on the nose and palate of this supple, soft Long Island Merlot. Bright acidity and a hint of green, leafy herbs add freshness on the palate. Finishes on a slightly grippy, tannic note.
Name: Castello di Borghese 2006 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: An interesting note of sweet smoke graces the nose of this Merlot, adding another layer to the otherwise traditional characteristics of rich black berry and dark plum guts. Round and satisfying in the mouth with approachable tannins and a medium finish.
Name: Indaba 2010 Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: Mossy, furry, leafy black fruit aromas are a reasonably good opening. Feels upright and alert, with bright acidity. Flavors of plum and berry blend with chocolate, herbs and spice in front of a grabby, slightly clacky finish.
Name: Siegel 2010 Crucero Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Concentrated notes of vanilla bean marry with raspberry and ripe red cherry aromas and flavors, while the finish shows a touch of a waxy red plum skin character. Clean and simple; drink now.
Name: Two Oceans 2010 Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: Prune and metallic aromas are not fully integrated and fresh but improve with airing. The palate is heavy and tannic, a touch abrasive in feel, with big berry flavors that hammer away due to fierce tannins. Comes on big with berry fruit but always feels rough.
Name: Pizzato 2005 DNA 99 Single Vineyard Merlot (Vale dos Vinhedos)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sharp, tannic, and showing some burn in the finish, this brings mixed berry fruit with a wash of mocha. The tannins are astringent and seem to cut the fruit short.
Name: DaMa 2008 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light fruit flavors of watermelon and strawberry, along with some thin black cherry and cola flavors are what you'll find here. This is pleasant and drinkable, but not a wine to cellar or match with any really spicy foods. A good quaffer.
Name: Sweet Valley 2008 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: If you're ready to jump head-first into the emerging but sketchy realm of Brazilian table wine, then Merlot is a good place to start. This one has baked, earthy aromas of clay, spice and leather. The palate is fruity and saturated, with deep cherry, berry, coffee and prune flavors. Good in its class. Imported by GM Miolo, USA.
Name: Vinícola Miolo 2005 Family Vineyards Merlot (Vale dos Vinhedos)

Description: Simultaneously green and sweet on the nose, with murky fruit aromas and marshmallow. Tannic and tight in the mouth, with crisp acidity pushing olive, herb and plum flavors. Peppery and drying late, with a final wave of minty green.
Name: Chilensis 2010 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A bold dose of Cabernet Franc adds layers of dried herbs and a slightly dusty wood note to this Long Island Merlot. There's a hint of green that trails from start to finish, but plenty of bright red fruit balanced with refreshingly high acidity.
Name: Clovis Point 2006 Vintner's Select Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Smells like a jumble of latex, vanilla, dried cheese, olive, plum and berry. Feels hard and grabby, with herbal black fruit flavors and a dash of forced, faux oak. Finishes sweet and green, with herbal overtones.
Name: Santa Ema 2010 Selected Terroir Merlot (Peumo)

Description: Tomato, red fruit and resiny oak aromas don't exactly scream “fresh.” Feels rustic and scratchy, with herbal, sawdust and vanilla flavors clouding out any quality fruit that might exist. Not much here, really.
Name: San Elias 2010 Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Not the best showcase for Mendocino fruit, this inexpensive, high-production Merlot is tight and one-dimensional with not a lot of fruitiness and a slight bitterness on the finish.
Name: Castle Rock 2008 Merlot (Mendocino County)

Description: Woody accents of bark and berry leaves somewhat overwhelm the dark fruit core to this wine. Lean and light with an overall green tinge.
Name: Leopard's Leap 2010 Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: Thick and dark at every check point, starting with the wine's minty, herbal, black fruit aromas and descending through a rich, meaty palate toward toasty blackberry and black plum flavors. Spicy, woody and herbal on the finish. A modern, polished, oaky Merlot.
Name: Concha y Toro 2009 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (Peumo)

Description: A step up from previous years. It's ripe and minty on the nose, with coconutty oak but also offsetting raspberry and plum aromas. Forward and full, with berry and plum flavors that handle ample toast and mint accents. Spicy, dry, peppery and long on the finish.
Name: Viña La Rosa 2009 La Capitana Barrel Reserve Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Narrow, forward black cherry aromas are dark and positive. It's a bit choppy and showing acidity on the palate, with plum, red berry and additional edgy zest. Flows fast and direct due to its bright fruit and lively acids. A good everyday red wine that's tasty and charged up.
Name: Lapostolle 2009 Casa Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Description: Earthy, lightly herbal cherry and plum aromas come with a whiff of smoke. The palate is round and feels well balanced, with blackberry, dark plum, chocolate and spice flavors. Long and slightly herbal on the finish. Contains 5% Syrah.
Name: Chilcas 2009 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Smells minty and leafy but pleasant, with spice, coffee, bacon and woodsy berry aromas. The palate is lively and clacky, with roasted berry, bacon and herbal flavors. Smoky on the finish, with a final blast of spice.
Name: Montes 2009 Alpha Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Hints of anise, black pepper and toasted coconut make this dark, smoky Merlot a bit exotic and unexpected. Full-bodied with a concentrated yet vibrant black fruit palate, it ends with flair on a rather tropical coconut finish.
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2009 Merlot (Monticello)

Description: Red fruit, cherry cough drop and earthy, rubbery aromas form a solid bouquet. The wine is fairly round and totally healthy in feel, with herbal red berry and plum flavors along with mild chocolate and pepper for depth. Good, easy wine for the money.
Name: La Playa 2009 Block Selection Estate Reserve Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Starts with light tomato leaf and herbal red fruit aromas. The palate is tight and fresh, with juicy acidity propelling roasted, oaky plum flavors. Finishes with a mix of herbal fruit and barrel toast.
Name: TerraNoble 2009 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sultry and rich with ripe black cherries and dark damson plums, this menthol-spiked Merlot is a stand-out with an intensity in fruit and body that's unusual in the Finger Lakes. Brisk acidity and a dry, elegant palate keep things in balance through a soft, vanilla spice finish.
Name: Shalestone 2008 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: Mint and spice notes settle on wood shavings and cheesy leather. The palate has a tight, narrow feel and woody, spicy flavors of red berry fruit. Finishes similarly, with ample juicy acidity and a lasting flavor of oak.
Name: Arboleda 2009 Merlot (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Warm and spicy on the nose and palate, this Virginia Merlot boasts a sour cherry aroma combined with hints of gingersnap cookie and ripe bramble. Ample and rich with slightly stewed black fruit notes, the palate is bathed in waves of anise and cinnamon that linger on the finish.
Name: Veramar 2009 Estate Club Merlot (Virginia)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bright with a purity of pomegranate and sour cherry flavors, Shaw's late-release 2006 Merlot is beautifully spiced on the nose and palate with generous anise and cinnamon notes. Dry and lean with a brisk, bracing acidity, it's a wine to accompany long meals of spiced duck or lighter meat dishes.
Name: Shaw 2006 Merlot (Finger Lakes)
