Description: Intensely aromatic with notes of sweet pomegranate and fresh violets, Lovingston's standard label Josie's Knoll is soft and a tad sweet on entry with a ripe black cherry juice note. Hints of fresh herbs on the midpalate combine with grippy tannins on the finish, adding a dose of style and structure.
Name: Lovingston 2008 Josie's Knoll Merlot (Monticello)

Description: Minty spice and vanilla are the lead aromas on this heavily oaked Merlot. There's also raw wood grain and clove to the nose. Full-bodied in the mouth, with overt creamy notes and then woody, spicy, fruit flavors. The fruit is generic and hidden; the pressing oak just the opposite.
Name: Santa Ema 2009 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: In a gigantically heavy bottle, this Mendocino Merlot, grown in the Potter Valley, struggles to eke out currant and cranberry aromas and is perfectly fine but lacking in depth and vibrancy.
Name: Kimmel 2008 Merlot (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While brisk and lean in style, there's a core of vanilla-scented morello cherries and ripe brambly wood. Tannins are so wispy they're barely detectable, but carry through to a soft finish marked by notes of autumn leaves and a gentle spray of raspberries.
Name: Knapp 2008 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: Herbal, lightly green aromas start out gaseous and rubbery but shed that excess with airing. The palate is crisp and tight, with bell pepper and oregano-like flavors outmuscling background red berry. Dry and simple on the finish.
Name: Terrapura 2009 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Medicinal, sweet berry aromas show latex, rubber and mustardy accents. The spongey palate has weight and solidity along with herbal berry and faux-oak flavors. Finishes with some green character.
Name: Santa Carolina 2010 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Rustic on the nose and palate, there's an abundance of smoke and char that envelops all the pretty layers of fall foliage, sour cherry and black pepper spice. Notes of green leaves in the midpalate turn riper and bramblier on the finish.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2008 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: Pickle, rubberband and briary berry aromas give way to a full but choppy palate with stewy, herbal berry flavors. Oak rises up on the finish in the form of burnt toast and mint. Standard but herbal; average for inexpensive Chilean Merlot.
Name: Odfjell 2010 Armador Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Pickled berry and vinegar aromas send the wine toward an acidic palate with cherry, plum and herbal flavors. Tart, simple, a little toasty and herbal. Run of the mill, with price as the main attribute.
Name: La Playa 2010 Estate Bottled Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Scratchy, rubbery plum and berry aromas set up an equally scratchy palate that's abrasive in feel and tastes of medicinal berry fruit mixed with raw oak. Hot and peppery on the finish.
Name: Morandé 2010 Pionero Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Cherry and menthol meld with whiffs of forest floor and bramble on this dry, medium bodied Merlot. The palate is pleasant with black fruit and a rustic fall foliage character, but the finish falls short with a hint of bitterness at the end.
Name: Standing Stone 2008 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Description: Smells green and weedy at first, and then oak aromas rise up to cover the green overriding character. Clacky in the mouth, with green-leaning berry flavors and oak. Finishes herbal, with a lasting flavor of pole bean.
Name: Concha y Toro 2010 Casillero del Diablo Reserve Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: L'Ecole is one of the three partners in the Seven Hills vineyard, and sources its grapes from some of the oldest vines. The blend includes 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Cabernet Franc, tight and spicy at first, then opening into a deeply flavored, brambly wine with a vivid mix of berry and stone. Firm tannins anchor it solidly and the overall structure suggests it could age for at least a decade, maybe two.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2008 Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Not your average mid-priced Merlot, this complex and well-crafted blend includes 12% Cabernet Franc, 4% Petit Verdot and 2% Malbec. Young, sappy red fruits lead into a wine with depth and substance, annotated with highlights of citrus and steel. Nuances keep coming on... black cherry, licoriceq and iron filings. A delight.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this cooler vintage, winemaker John Bookwalter has introduced Syrah into his Merlot blend, along with smaller portions of Bordeaux varietals. A complex, satiny wine, spiced with herb and eucalyptus highlights, lush black fruits, and toasty espresso in the finish.
Name: J. Bookwalter 2008 Foreshadow Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This young wine saw plenty of new oak, and those toasty, appealing scents and flavors are right up front, wrapped around pretty plum and berry fruit. It has a round, plump middle, polished tannins and plenty of initial mouth appeal. Hints of barnyard and green tea seep into the finish. The wine improved perceptibly on the second day.
Name: Barrister 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Smooth as silk, its lush fruit seamlessly integrated with generous barrel flavors, this oak-aged, ripe Merlot marries its deep, black cherry fruit to generous layers of chocolate and caramel. It spent 24 months in barrel.
Name: Sinclair Estate Vineyards 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite tart and tannic, this wine, though four years old, might have come from a much more recent vintage. It's deep and concentrated with raspberry and red currant fruit, racy acidity, thick tannins, and barrel notes of charcoal and chocolate.
Name: Three Rivers 2007 Champoux Vineyard Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart and tannic, with aromas that promise deep black fruits touched with smoky earth. A Merlot for Cabernet lovers, with a Cab Franc-like streak of coffee around powerful, dark fruit flavors of berry and cassis. Give this a lot of breathing time, or pop it in the cellar for at least five years.
Name: Apex 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though this is pure Merlot, it is structured much like a Cabernet Sauvignon. It shows more depth than breadth, with smoky black fruits, plum and black cherry, and a pleasing purity. It finishes with a distinct herbal edge, slightly bitter. Can it gain a bit of mass with further bottle age? Time will tell.
Name: Waterbrook 2008 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has the assertive vanilla and tobacco flavors that often come with certain oak treatments; these are friendly, familiar components of many inexpensive California bottlings. The difference here is that there is real, substantial fruit at the heart of the wine—it's bursting with berries and cherries.
Name: Milbrandt 2008 Traditions Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A round and juicy Merlot with very ripe fruit flavors of plum and blueberry and enough texture to be paired with an array of meals. Very pleasant all around and priced fair and square.
Name: Concannon 2008 Conservancy Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Description: Despite its alcohol, this is a very fresh wine, its ripe fruit showing typical Merlot cherry jam and soft tannins. It is intensely fruity, perhaps lacking complexity, although an attractive wine to drink now.
Name: Fiuza 2009 Merlot (Tejo)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Broadly flavorful when first sipped, this turns aggressively oaky in the mouth. The liquorous barrel flavors will please some tasters, while others will wonder where the fruit went?
Name: Gamache 2007 Estate Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: From a new South Coast producer is this cherry-fragranced Merlot with nice texture and balance, juicy red fruit and cinnamon spice in the background.
Name: Triple B Ranches 2008 Estate Bottled Merlot (South Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Deep red fruit is at the core of this nicely balanced, no-frills Merlot. A fine every-day red, with enough muscle to qualify as almost Cabernet-like.
Name: Bridgman 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A simple Merlot that's priced fairly and is a little tannic at first, the fruit acting shy, but that opens into a fine Merlot that would go well with rich red meat. .
Name: Cartlidge & Browne 2007 Merlot (North Coast)

Description: Pretty blueberry fruit highlights this clean, fresh, forward wine with genuine fruit character. Any rough edges have been softened by aging in neutral oak.
Name: Rainier Ridge 2009 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine's dark cherry aromas veer into lipstick territory a bit and then the North Coast-sourced Merlot becomes overly tannic and a tiny bit green. Decent for the $10 price tag but not going to convert anyone into Merlot (this one's got 22% Cabernet Sauvignon blended in as well).
Name: Line 39 2009 Merlot (North Coast)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This young, tart and tannic Merlot has an earthy, astringent base supporting tight and sharply defined cranberry/cherry fruit. Highlights of anise and clove seep in, but the earthy tannins ultimately rule.
Name: Del Rio 2008 Merlot (Rogue Valley)

Description: Balsam wood, earthy notes and lightly leafy berry aromas lead to a juicy palate with plum, herb and tea flavors. Fresh on the finish, with size, nice flow and clean berry flavors. Nothing unusual here.
Name: Rutini 2010 Trumpeter Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Young and fruity smelling up front, with a dusting of hard, dry spice. The palate is firm and juicy, with lightly medicinal red fruit flavors. Finishes with dryness, lots of spice and pepper.
Name: Argana 2010 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Fairly full and dark smelling, with generic berry aromas and some damp earth. It's lively and grabby in the mouth, with heat and scour along with sweet, medicinal berry flavors. Bright but also a touch raw and green at the end.
Name: Bodega Norton 2010 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Rusty in color for a young wine, with mulchy, faded berry fruit aromas. It has life on the palate, which tastes earthy, peppery and a little bit burnt. A dry, spicy wine with cherry flavors interspersed.
Name: Palo Alto 2010 Coiron Merlot (Maipú)

Description: Regular raspberry and plum aromas show a pinch of heat and rubber. The palate is snappy and comes with modest red berry and light spice flavors. Simple, generally clean and a bit sharp at the edges.
Name: Funky Llama 2010 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though 2009 was a difficult vintage for Washington Merlot, this is a truly luscious wine. It welcomes the taster instantly with massive, generous fruit cloaked in toasty, chewy, mocha and caramel flavors. Tasted over the course of 48 hours, it held up well, developing broad, well-integrated flavors of berries to complement the hedonistic oak. Sure to be a favorite among all the current releases from Leonetti.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2009 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: If any wine can blow away the thought that Merlot is a thin, wimpy, nondescript red, this is the wine. From the iconic Champoux Vineyard, it has magic and muscle, a broad and deep display of black fruits, coffee, licorice, dark chocolate, baking spices and beautifully built tannins. Explore and enjoy.
Name: Sineann 2009 Champoux Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Black and crusty on the nose, with char, smoke, wild blackberry and chocolaty aromas. The palate is full and offers the right tannic grip, while blackberry, bitter chocolate and peppery flavors finish with gravitas. A full-bodied and lusty varietal wine, probably the best of its type from Chile.
Name: Lapostolle 2008 Cuvée Alexandre Apalta Vineyard Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The mouthfeel is surprisingly soft right on through the middle palate, then hits an astringent wash of black fruits, dark toast, smoke and a vein of roasted espresso running through the finish. The tannins are toning down, but still very evident. Let it breathe and nuances of pepper, clove, mineral and graphite emerge.
Name: Forgeron 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A nicely structured Merlot from the Wahluke Slope, with aromas of sandalwood and blueberries. The mixed berry flavors run into tart pie cherries, sprinkled with a little pepper (from a small amount of Cabernet Franc in the blend). Well crafted and balanced.
Name: Saint Laurent 2007 Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Toasty, rich and spicy on the nose, with big black fruit aromas, a dusting of raw oak and smoked meat. It's full, round and lush in the mouth, with ripe flavors of blackberry and oak but nothing candied, faux or cheap tasting. Smooth, full and chocolaty on the finish; excellent overall for $11 Merlot.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2010 La Joya Reserve Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This wine has a floral tone in the aroma that is quite lovely, along with strawberry, spice and pepper tones. On the palate, savory waves of spiced meat, balsamic and spice are rounded out by plum and cherry fruit.
Name: Hatzimichalis 2005 Domaine Hatzimichalis Merlot (Atalanti Valley)

Description: Dark fruit aromas lead a rustic, earthy, smoky bouquet towards a crisp, healthy palate with ample oak that creates a buttery taste to accent dry berry flavors, a light herbal character and pepper. Fresh, solid and well oaked.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2008 Ecos de Rulo Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: The nose on this layered Merlot offers dark cherry, cocoa and spice aromas. Cedar, cigarbox, cherry and chocolate on the palate are balanced with a clean, chalky mouthfeel. The wine can age but has appeal now, and a serious focus.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2008 Château Julia Merlot (Drama)

Description: Dry, spicy and floral smelling, with modest herbal accents. The palate is saturated and fairly rich, with good texture and broad, satisfying flavors of berry and plum. Sturdy, consistent and fresh, with easy drinkability.
Name: Santa Alicia 2010 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Oyster Bay's Merlot is a classy drop at a reasonable price, displaying scents of mocha, dried herbs and black cherries and featuring an expansive, soft mouthfeel. Flavors of coffee, chocolate and crisp berries persist on the smooth finish. Drink now.
Name: Oyster Bay 2009 Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A delicious bottle, that starts with first-rate, estate-grown fruitó80% Merlot, 15% Syrah, and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon. Lots of pretty cherry fruit, wrapped in smooth, chocolaty tannins.
Name: Stonecap 2009 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Berry and leather aromas show a spot of green herb and floral hints. The palate is lively and shows slightly prickly acidity along with snappy flavors of red berry, herbs, oregano and fresh tomato. More lively and elegant in style than big and bulky.
Name: Lomas del Valle 2010 Unfiltered Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Deeply concentrated on the nose with pure black fruit and whiffs of toast and wood, this Merlot packs a lot of bang for the buck. Full bodied and dry, it's mellow but bright, overflowing with cassis and black cherry flavors and a fresh, herbal finish.
Name: Cameron Hughes 2009 Frunza Merlot (Viile Timisului)

Description: Crusty and peppery aromas blend with wild berry and herbal scents to create a very nice opening. The palate is tight and healthy, with black currant, dark cherry and plum flavors. Despite controlled herbal notes, this is very good Merlot for the money.
Name: Quasar 2007 Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Roman numeral 23 is an indication of the vineyard age; in the blend is 20% Cabernet planted at the same time. This is stiff and herbal, with brambly, wild raspberry and light cherry fruit and a dusty ash flavor as the tannins fade. Good length and balance.
Name: Cave B 2008 XXIII Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With 13% Cabernet Franc in the blend, this has significant heft and a dark streak with flavors of herb, bark and fungus. The fruit is light and tangy, but the overall structure is fine, with supporting acidity and alcohol at 13.5%.
Name: Washington Hills 2008 Merlot (Washington)

Description: Harmonious on the nose and palate with ripe black plums and cassis enveloped by a layer of char and smoke. Medium to full bodied with structured acidity, it's a straightforward but sound Merlot with powdery, soft tannins and a tasty black cherry and graham cracker finish.
Name: Vini 2009 Veni Vidi Vici Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: The label reads Washington, but it's a single-vineyard Yakima Valley Merlot, with small amounts of three other Bordeaux varieties blended in. Sharp, earthy and firm, with rather thin fruit flavors and a finish both tart and tannic.
Name: Animale 2008 Merlot (Washington)

Description: Pleasant, with soft texture and tannins and notes of cinnamon and clove, this Lodi Merlot drops a bit at the finish and is 13.1% alcohol.
Name: Pavillion Crossing 2009 Reserve Merlot (Lodi)

Description: Forceful, meaty and a little herbal on the nose, but still pretty solid for $9 Merlot. The palate is full and sizable, with plum, berry and herbal flavors creating Chilean typicity. Falls off on the finish, turning more herbal, but overall it's a good value wine.
Name: Viu Manent 2010 Estate Collection Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brambly fruit, loam, pencil lead and tarry notes morph into a high acid, thickly tannic mouthfeel. Spicy plum and pie cherry fruit thins out quickly, with a lightly toasty finish.
Name: Cave B 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Plum and black cherry on the nose and mocha, vanilla and spice on the palate give this Merlot wide appeal. Medium-bodied, easy-drinking and modern, the red is a solid, if somewhat straightforward, selection. Pair with game, poultry.
Name: Hatzimichalis 2007 Estate Hatzimichalis Merlot (Atalanti Valley)

Description: Strawberries rule here, gliding into a substantial finish with none of the faux flavors (excessive tobacco, vanilla, etc.) that mar too many inexpensive Merlots.
Name: Pine & Post 2009 Merlot (Washington)

Description: Light, rather thin Merlot fruit is coated with lush flavors of licorice and vanilla. The oak treatment may seem over the top to some, just right to others. There's plenty of acid to wash the palate clean.
Name: Boomtown 2008 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Thick tannins take the fruit out fairly quickly, though the alcohol, just under 15%, suggests plenty of ripeness in the grapes. Dark flavors prevail––black cherry, cola, toast and bitter chocolate.
Name: Mercer 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A solidly made, easy-tasting Merlot made from organic Mendocino grapes that tastes of cherry and cranberry and is smooth in texture. The wine includes 13% Syrah as well as smatterings of Petite Sirah, Zinfandel and Carignane.
Name: Bonterra 2008 Merlot (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Merlot, with muscle and sharp tannins. The scent suggests butter and caramel, but the wine itself has more herb and earth flavor than barrel or grape.
Name: RiverAerie 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Shows an aggressive, roasted set of aromas that feature leather, meat, olive and char. The palate is full and thick, with chewy, flat tannins and then herbal flavors that mute the wine's black fruit content. A good midlevel wine that delivers within its price range.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2010 Petirrojo Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Made from Clarksburg grapes, a small appellation near Lodi, this soft Merlot tastes a touch metallic and its blackberry and cherry notes finish a tad bitter.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2009 Schoolhouse Cuvee Merlot (Clarksburg)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A Sierra Foothills-area Merlot without much aroma or deep flavor, fairly middle of the road and 14.9% alcohol.
Name: Lava Cap 2008 Reserve Merlot (El Dorado)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A low-price, high-production Merlot from Mendocino County grapes that smells musky and tastes a bit bland.
Name: Castle Rock 2007 Merlot (Mendocino County)

Description: There's a serious minty core to the black cherry and berry fruit aromas of this wine that continues into the medium-weight palate. Creamy with satiny tannins and a hint of mocha spice and cigar tobacco on the close. Delicious and approachable now.
Name: Ken Forrester 2008 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: Sweet, rich plum and spice aromas precede a juicy, ripe palate that's right in terms of feel. Blackberry, spice and light herbal flavors are nice, while the finish is chocolaty and smooth. Very nice in an average, understandable way.
Name: Tapiz 2008 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Full and warm aromas of bacon, moss and black fruits set up a round, solid palate with dark plum, berry, herb and olive flavors. Finishes more dry and savory than jammy and fruity, with a final dose of herbs.
Name: Pascual Toso 2008 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy black fruit and berry notes lead the way on this Merlot, with supporting notes of tree bark and black tea. The medium-full mouth offers more juicy dark fruit flavors and dusty tannins that linger through the close. Drink now.
Name: Plaisir De Merle 2008 Merlot (Paarl)

Description: Much better than prior vintages, when it was known as Finca El Portillo. The nose is jammy and shows black fruit aromas, while the palate is complete and full but juicy, with plum and black cherry flavors. Pepper and toast flavors infiltrate the finish.
Name: Salentein 2009 Portillo Estate Bottled Merlot (Uco Valley)

Description: Blackberry and other sweet aromas lead to a soft, mildly oaky palate with sweet, ripe plum and berry flavors. There's juicy acids and reasonable amounts of toast, licorice and spice on the finish. Not sure what differentiates this from Reserve, but the Barrel Select seems better balanced.
Name: Bodega Norton 2008 Barrel Select Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Peppery notes emanate from the bouquet first, followed by more traditional notes of black plum, black currant leaf and dried fig. The mouth is loaded with more brambly fruit flavors against an easygoing structure and light tannins.
Name: Eikendal 2008 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: Berry preserves, black plum flesh and tobacco abound on the nose, while the medium-weight mouth provides more dried berry flavors laced with cocoa powder. Soft on the palate with an off-dry finish. Drink now.
Name: Backsberg 2008 Kosher Merlot (Paarl)

Description: Herbal and spicy, here's an easygoing Merlot that's perfect for entertaining. Pepper and anise add character to the black fruit core, and the pronounced acidity keeps things lively and clean on the finish.
Name: KWV 2008 Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: Dark and rubbery on the nose, with a slight pickle-and-olive accent but mostly black fruit aromas. Juicy and also stout in terms of feel, with blackberry and herbal flavors. Finishes with a touch of buttery oak, chocolate and toast.
Name: Tilia 2009 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Pointed, sharp aromas leave an angular bouquet. The rest of the wine is jumpy, furry and a bit funky, with pointed plum and raspberry flavors and then a toasty, oaky finish with bitterness, heat and leftover butter flavors.
Name: Bodega Norton 2008 Reserva Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Red licorice candy and sweet red berry aromas lead to a narrow, prickly, semitart palate with sharp raspberry and strawberry flavors. Finishes quick, with the taste of red Twizzlers. Not much depth here, but decent for the price.
Name: Ambiente 2009 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A full-throttle effort, with big flavor swashes of blackberry, cassis, black pepper, coffee grounds and ripe tannins. This is Cold Creek Merlot at its most powerful; the 35-year-old vines are in their prime and the flavors show it. Few American Merlots—indeed few in the world—can stand on their own and deliver a wine this complete and powerful. It needs more years to knit together, but no worries—this is a 20-year wine.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2007 Cold Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Right out of the chute this has sappy, delicious black cherry fruit, accented with scents of tobacco and graphite. Streaks of ash and more juicy berries fill the middle, as it unfolds into a taut, sculpted finish. A classical style from a vintage that favors it; accessible, yet built for cellaring.
Name: Seven Hills 2008 Seven Hills Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Ripe, round, toasty and full-bodied, this is a style close to very high-end California Merlots costing two to three times as much. Black cherry, cassis, smoke, toast and coffee grounds dominate, but the seductive blend and the beautifully managed tannins keep the wine palate-friendly. Drink now or cellar for 6–8 years.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2007 Ethos Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A fragrant, rich mix of olive, smoke, earth, black cherry, cassis and more. It offers fine value, good texture, grip and a very appealing, silky-smooth evolution in the finish.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2008 Destiny Ridge Vineyard Gravity Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark fruit flavors of cassis and black cherry, with supporting acids and firm tannins. Young and tight, this is well-made and driven by pure, clean fruit that has been aged in a mix of French, Hungarian and American oak.
Name: Basalt 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The lush aromas are dense and dark, with streaks of coffee, baking chocolate, iron ore, and earth. In the mouth the fruit explodes into full bloom—broad flavors of cherry and chocolate, lovely Asian spices.
Name: Va Piano 2008 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: A rare example of really good Australian Merlot, this wine features a supple attack that gradually builds in tannic intensity into a softly dusty finish. Herbal overtones mingle with notes of cassis, mocha and leather.
Name: Clarendon Hills 2007 Brookman Merlot (Clarendon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the artist label Merlot; a firm, spicy expression of fruit from the Lewis vineyard. Threads of liquid smoke, spice and coffee are woven into the red fruits—a mix of strawberry, raspberry and cherry flavors. Still young and sharp, it has some heat in the finish. Additional bottle age recommended.
Name: Dunham 2007 Lewis Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rapidly maturing, with some brick coloring and secondary fruit flavors of prune and raisin. Drinking nicely, and quite delicious. Along with the smooth fruit you get smoke, dust, cocoa and a hint of caramelized sugar.
Name: Otis Kenyon 2007 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A strong, spicy, sharp-edged take on Washington Merlot, sourced from a trio of excellent vineyards – StoneTree, Klipsun and Boushey. Dark and meaty, this brings bacon fat and black cherry, cassis and chocolate, in a full-bodied, forward style. Bring on the steak.
Name: Kontos 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure varietal, with alcohol around 13.5%—typical for Robert Karl reds. Smooth entry, rich fruit and excellent structure. Bright cherry flavors dominate, gliding smoothly through a pretty midpalate into the tannins. The tannins just barely hint at an herbal underpinning, but are plenty ripe.
Name: Robert Karl 2008 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is tasty, forward, juicy fruit—a fresh berry mix of strawberry, blueberry and raspberry. There is firm acidity to balance the tannins, which bring just a hint of herb. Well done; it lacks only some depth in the finish to bring the score up.
Name: Basalt 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark fruits envelop this rich, fat, tannic Merlot. It's loaded with cassis and ripe black cherries, set against generous barrel flavors of cedar, smoke and coffee. The tannins have a black olive streak and a bacon fat finish. Yummy stuff.
Name: Basel Cellars 2007 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Excellent grapes from the Horse Heaven Hills, Walla Walla and Yakima Valley AVAs combine to craft a supple, smooth, lightly chocolatey red wine that harks back to the great Waterbrook Merlots of the late 1980s. Along with the pretty plum and cherry and the satiny tannins are high notes of peppery spice.
Name: Waterbrook 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Why a 2005 vintage Merlot from this excellent vineyard is just being released six years later is one of those mysteries of wine. But it's a fine bottle, with plenty of life ahead. The tannins are softening up, and the fruit is smooth and ripe, with berries and plums and cassis. There is a generous wash of caramel and mocha also, and it's well-integrated and drinking at its peak.
Name: JLC 2005 Spofford Station Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Soft and pretty, in the well-established style of this Red Mountain winery. Hints of bramble and leaf annotate soft berry fruit flavors. The acids keep it fresh and a bit of Cabernet Franc (8%) gives it just enough tannic toughness to put a frame around the finish.
Name: Hightower 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Solid up front, with spicy notes and good red fruit aromas. The palate has snap and edgy acidity, but it's not too sharp or sour. Flavors of olive, spice and generic berry flavors lead to a dry, peppery, juicy finish. Totally regular, but good regular.
Name: Cono Sur 2009 Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: No fruit sources are cited, but the vintage and the herbal undertones suggest Yakima Valley grapes. It's a well-crafted wine that softens the tannins enough to give the shy red fruit a chance to shine. Pale cherry flavors are balanced against the acids and tannins; with no tricks or frills.
Name: Castle Rock 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Checking in at a whopping 15.8% alcohol, this take-no-prisoners Merlot marries Port-like fruit to ripe, rich, massive tannins and a chocolaty wash of oak. There is enough acid to hold it all together—in fact, it may profit from another year or two in bottle. But the sheer weight of the alcohol makes it a wine to sip rather than guzzle.
Name: Airfield Estates 2008 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Dark and crusty smelling, with raisin and baked dark fruit aromas. The palate has some fullness but also piercing acids, and the flavors are your standard mix of black fruit, plum and herbal leafiness. Solid enough but highly regular.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2009 La Joya Reserve Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: A touch medicinal to start, then with airing you get some faux oak, vanilla and cream. The palate has a mild scratchiness and grate to it, but it's by no mean harsh and the flavors of berry and cherry are pretty good. A little high in acidity and low in volume, but for an $8 wine that's to be expected.
Name: Santa Rita 2009 120 Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Firm, tight and crisp on the nose, then juicy and herbal in the mouth, with olive, pepper and reedy fruit flavors. More olive and herbal notes carry the finish. Overall this is highly standard; decent but average.
Name: Chilensis 2009 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Hard, herbal, leathery and overloaded with olive and rubbery aromas. The palate is sheer and sharp, with weak, herbal red fruit flavors that fall apart. The finish is green and tart. Not that appealing.
Name: Ventisquero 2009 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: A full, spicy wine, with weight from wood and attractive fruits. There is a touch of stalkiness here, a sign of the vintage, but the wine is maturing well in a food-friendly way.
Name: Château Haut Ballet 2007  Fronsac

Description: Chocolate-covered cherry and vanilla aromas are an alluring start to this sultry Merlot. On the palate, soft, integrated waves of black cherry, vanilla and balsamic are followed by a clean berry finish. A mellow sip with class.
Name: Estate Biblia Chora 2006 Merlot (Pangeon)

Description: Like all Terranoble reds, this begins with charred, lemony aromas of burnt toast, black coffee and smoke. As the oak blows off, it reveals an underbelly of black fruit, floral notes and exotic spices. It's deep and meaty, with blackberry and black cherry flavors. Finishes earthy and herbal, with black olive and chocolate flavors.
Name: TerraNoble 2008 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Flowery and herbal, with standard redberry aromas. Healthy and juicy, with herbal blueberry, blackberry and chocolate flavors. Finishes with a final dose of herbal character, earth and good layering and feel.
Name: Emiliana 2008 Eco Balance Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Description: Fairly hard on the nose, with a hint of plastic and then raspberry and plum aromas rising as it settles. The palate shows decent zest and body along with narrow flavors of berry and pepper. Finishes with mild intensity and a note of saline.
Name: Emiliana 2009 Natura Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Description: Leafy, dry and earthy on the nose, with a hint of flowery red fruit. The palate rings with sharp acidity, which livens up blackberry, herb, black tea and carob flavors. Shows a lot of wayward, unintegrated oak on the finish but stays bright due to juicy acidity.
Name: Santa Rita 2008 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Warm, earthy and baked smelling, with aromas of black olive and herbal raspberry fruit. The palate is tight, regular, acidic and snappy, with sweet, herbal cherry flavors. Finishes with hints of olive and green herbs.
Name: Santa Alicia 2008 Gran Reserva de los Andes Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Big, oaky and roasted up front, with charred aromas. The palate is full but clacky, with piercing acidity leading to a saucy, sharp set of tangy red berry and herb flavors. There's a chocolaty element to smooth things out on the finish, but it's always snappy and sheer.
Name: Morandé 2008 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Sharp on the nose, with herbal, cabbage-like aromas. The palate is better, albeit rubbery in feel and infiltrated by bitter notes. Along the way, there's reasonably good berry fruit and then a piquant bite to the finish. Improves with airing; has its merits.
Name: Odfjell 2009 Armador Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Berry fruits and dense red jelly flavors are the hallmark of this wine. It is full, although edging on stalky, its black berry flavors mixed with acidity and dry tannins.
Name: Château Sainte Barbe 2008 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

Description: Leafy cherry aromas are herbal and a bit muddy. The palate is scratchy and on the heavy side, with candied, woody berry flavors. Feels a little syrupy and medicinal; basic on its best day.
Name: Miguel Torres 2009 Santa Digna Reserve Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Opens with acrid, rubbery aromas. The mouth shows astringency and generic, rubbery berry fruit. Finishes with burnt flavors and bitterness. Ultimately it's bringing the minimum in terms of what's expected.
Name: Viña el Aromo 2009 Private Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Green and funky smelling, with a grassy, tomato character. Sticky and unctuous on the palate, with a strange, weedy set of red fruit flavors. Finishes creamy and weak; barely acceptable but still not fresh or well balanced.
Name: Indomita 2009 Selected Varietal Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Once again the Merlot is the best of a very fine flight of Tulpen wines. More muscular than the Cabernet, it includes 10% Malbec and 5% Petit Verdot in the mix, resulting in a dense, dark wine loaded with black fruits. Polished tannins are lightly layered in streaks of leaf, herb and earth. The alcohol tops 15%, but there is not a hint of heat in the finish.
Name: Tulpen 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Estate-grown, spicy and fresh, this exciting wine from a new Red Mountain producer shows outstanding potential. Carefully crafted by the winemaking team of Pete Hedges and Sarah Goedhart, it's stylish, European, sleek and polished. The fruit is spicy and bright, the barrel accents just right, the tannins smooth and supple, and the length surprising. A fine effort.
Name: Obelisco Estate 2008 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tightly wound, this young Merlot, from a blend of Red Mountain vineyards, has a steely spine and muscular tannins. The fruit is a bit subdued at the moment, but there is a clear sense of structure, verticality and depth. Notes of graphite and earth accent the tart red fruits. Give this one plenty of decanting.
Name: Fidelitas 2008 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A fine effort in this classic vintage, the Merlot is firm, almost muscular, and dappled with fresh herbs—cilantro and basil. The brambly blackberry fruit has the power to more than hold its own after 18 months in two-thirds new French oak.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2007 Canoe Ridge Estate Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The 2008 Muleskinner is toned down, perhaps from the cooler vintage. Though still plenty ripe and full throttle (almost 15% alcohol), it brings in nuances of herb and earth that add some depth and interest; the fruit flavors run to pomegranate and tart red berry. The new oak is again pulled back (to 40%), and adds just a hint of toast and coffee to the finish.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2008 Muleskinner Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Youthful and tart, this tangy and fruit-driven Merlot opens with berries, pie cherries, baking spices and hints of cocoa, smoothes out in the midpalate and thoroughly seduces by the time it gently fades. Delicious now, but give it another four or five years and it may dazzle.
Name: Fidelitas 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An interesting, fecund nose carries aromas of wet hay along with cherries and plums. Well-balanced and high-toned flavors are bright and set the fruit against firm tannins and a layer of loam and graphite. Give it a few years in the cellar to bring out all the complexity.
Name: Sinclair Estate Vineyards 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tight, sharp, and toasty, this thick and compact wine shows plenty of cherry fruit wrapped in chocolaty oak. It hints at toast and cracker, but never quite breaks through into the complexity that is promised by the first whiff or two.
Name: Beresan 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Soft, plump and fruity, this pleasing, pure Washington Merlot pushes black cherry, coffee and baking chocolate flavors into a roundly accessible wine with no rough edges at all. It's a quaffer with cojones.
Name: :Nota Bene 2007 Conner Lee Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Dark chocolate and rich plum sauce add complexity to this black fruit-driven Merlot. Blackberry preserves and soft plum guts fill the mouth, with a touch of green pepper appearing on the finish. Medium weight with a creamy texture and a medium-length finish. Drink now.
Name: Domaines Astruc 2009 Reserve Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A dusty, well-integrated Merlot from one of Wente's estate properties, with plum, licorice and vanilla most prominent on the palate and a touch of Italian spice, given the little bit of Barbera and Sangiovese (also Petit Verdot) mixed in.
Name: Wente 2007 Crane Ridge Merlot (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brown spices around sour cherry fruit flavors roll through the midpalate; then the wine turns a bit thin and hard. More time in the bottle may soften it up a bit further; right now it drinks well with food, especially a nice, fat roast of beef.
Name: Silver Lake 2007 Roza Hills Vineyard Reserve Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: Slightly granular smelling and seemingly oversized on the bouquet. In the mouth it folds itself back into standard form, with earthy, jammy flavors of wild berry and spice. Seems a touch heavy and slightly green on the finish, but overall it gets the job done.
Name: Alberti 154 2009 Merlot (Tupungato)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Soft and ripe, with fruit flavors that border on raisin and prune, this nicely bottle-aged Merlot is good to go right now. In fact, it could pass for an older wine, or perhaps a nonvintage blend; it's smooth and mature, with good balance and very soft tannins.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Straightforward but good, here's an easy-drinking everyday wine with light tannins, a satisfyingly round mouthfeel and assertive dark fruit flavors. A touch of milk chocolate appears on the close.
Name: Les Jamelles 2009 Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is quite far along the aging curve, dark and showing brick along the edges. The nose has some interesting brown sugar nuances, plenty of stiff tannins, and mature, secondary fruit aromas. Smooth, ripe and ready to drink.
Name: Hyatt 2006 Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: Roasted dark fruit aromas form a generic opening, while the palate is perfectly acceptable even with some scratchiness. The flavors are your basic berries and pepper, while the finish is dry and toasty. Good but regular, plain and simple.
Name: Rutini 2009 Trumpeter Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: With 15,000 cases imported, this should be an easy wine to find and at such a price. Standard but easily enjoyable with notes of black plum, dark cherry and fruitcake spice throughout. Drink now.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2009 Reserve Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: A sturdy Merlot with a black cherry-driven nose. The palate is kind of sticky and maybe a touch over the top in terms of its syrupy feel and flavors. It's a ripe and oaky wine with a baked character and candied finishing flavors. Flavorful and full, but also sweet and sticky.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2009 Reserve Merlot (Tupungato)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Lightweight but round, this Merlot is missing a bit of lushness to its dark fruit core, with more skin-driven flavors of cherry and plum.
Name: Château de la Tuilerie 2009 Celebration Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: While I generally like and sometimes even love the Cobos wines, this Merlot underwhelms. The nose is reedy and stemmy, with earthy, herbal raspberry aromas. In the mouth, it's scratchy and spicy, with herbal berry fruit leading to a mildly bitter finish. Better than in the past, but still a compromised wine due to its minty, green characteristics.
Name: Viña Cobos 2009 Felino Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Somewhat jammy and soupy on the nose, with a flavor profile that follows suit; it tastes slightly stewed and spicy, with both sweet fruit flavors and some bitterness. Finishes much like a soup or stew, with herbal, earthy notes. Adequate but not super fresh or fruity.
Name: Verum 2009 Merlot (Río Negro Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: There's a green edge to this wine that struggles with the richer dark berries and fudge cake flavors. Soft and round in the mouth with a short finish.
Name: Mont Tauch 2009 Le Dog de Jean Marc Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is pure Merlot from the StoneTree vineyard in the Wahluke Slope AVA. It's been aged almost two years in new French oak barrels, and has the delicious mix of fruit and barrel flavors to prove it. Supple, succulent, smooth and spicy, it's a showcase for cherry and cassis fruit, accented with pungent, almost piney herb. Excellent texture and mass shows good winemaking.
Name: Hestia Cellars 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though not indicated on the bottle, this is Pepper Bridge Vineyard fruit. Soft and lush, it broadens out quickly across the palate, a friendly mix of strawberry, peppery spice, and light toast. Ready for immediate enjoyment.
Name: Two Vintners 2007 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Rubbery and hard on the nose, but with solid berry and cassis aromas lying in wait. The palate is solid, fresh and good, with raspberry, plum and herbal flavors. Finishes dry and herbal but there's enough fruit and clarity to push it up a notch or two.
Name: Caliterra 2009 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Black berry and plum aromas keep greener notes from dominating the bouquet, along with accents of stale burnt coffee that lingers in the back. The medium-weight mouth is juicy and driven by more dark fruit flavors with a hints of olive. Soft, round and easy to drink.
Name: Binyamina 2006 Reserve Kosher Merlot (Galilee)

Description: Here's a somewhat big and full-bodied Merlot with aromas of black cherry and violet florals leading into flavors of black plum and raspberry preserves. There's a good tannic grip on the mouth that lingers through the strong mocha-flavored finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2005 Yarden Tel Phares Vineyard Kosher Merlot (Galilee)

Description: Here's a bright, fruit-forward Merlot with notes of small black berries, black cherry and cassis accented by soft fruit cake spice. Balanced and drinkable with soft tannins and a solid finish.
Name: Recanati 2009 Kosher Merlot (Galilee)

Description: This wine comes off a bit green and vegetal with aromas of tomato leaf, plum skins, pepper and black olive. The mouth is firm and assertive with gripping young, green tannins that linger, leaving a strong sense of astringency on the finish.
Name: Segal's 2004 Dovev Single Vineyard Kosher Merlot (Galil)

Description: Herbal on the nose, with basil and tomato leaf aromas. The palate feel is reasonably good if a bit hollow, while the flavors reflect the bouquet via dry, herbal, peppery red fruit. Spicy with green olive and standard red berry on the finish.
Name: Errazuriz 2009 Estate Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: Very ripe and fruit-driven with notes of all-fruit preserves, reduced black plum sauce, sweet black licorice rope and a touch of mocha. Round and full-bodied with soft tannins and a chocolaty finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2005 Yarden Kosher Merlot (Galilee)

Description: Starts with hard, charred, overly oaky aromas. After some settling the wine remains somewhat scratchy and tannic, with flavors of raspberry, dry spice and wood resin. A little fiery and overoaked for standard Merlot.
Name: Montes 2009 Classic Series Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Starts with hard, charred, overly oaky aromas. After some settling the wine remains somewhat scratchy and tannic, with flavors of raspberry, dry spice and wood resin. A little fiery and overoaked for standard Merlot.
Name: Montes 2009 Classic Series Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Chandler Reach grew the grapes for this big, chewy, rather blocky Merlot. It offers pleasant red fruits and light chocolaty barrel notes.
Name: Northwest Totem Cellars 2006 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Dilute and thin, with candied, generic aromas and a citrusy, sweet flavor profile that fails to connote a high level of seriousness or quality. Barely working as a premium wine.
Name: Cousiño-Macul 2009 Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Very soft, open wine. It is rich, with an opulent texture, while its tannins are a whisper among the ripe red berry fruits and sweetness. The acidity brings the wine attractively to a close.
Name: Weninger 2007 Merlot (Burgenland)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A fruity, black cherry nose is accented with leather and forest floor scents. The flavors follow, with smoke and licorice wrapped into the black fruits. Tannins show black tea and a hint of bitterness.
Name: Zimri Cellars 2008 Merlot (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Slightly grassy and jammy on the nose, but otherwise you get basic cherry and raspberry aromas. The palate is medium bodied and a bit sharp in feel, with fresh, simple cherry and raspberry flavors. Tight and straightforward on the finish, with a hint of spice and chocolate.
Name: Rutini 2006 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Pepper, violet, rhubarb and plum aromas give this Merlot assertive character. On the plate, the wine has equal attitude, delivering flavors of dried red fruit, tobacco, cigarbox and leather. Spicy but balanced by a good minerality, the wine will pair well with salty, hard cheeses and grilled lamb. A fun find.
Name: Protopapas 2004 Merlot (Pageon)

Description: Earthy and rubbery, then more leafy and red, on the nose, with raspberry and plum fruit. The palate has a solid, ordinary feel and jammy flavors of baked berry. Standard finish with a fast fade.
Name: Andeluna 2006 Reserve Merlot (Tupungato)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fruity and tart, with cranberry and not quite ripe wild blackberry flavors. The acidity is front and center here, the fruit second, and the wine fades away with no additional complexity in the finish. A pleasant, fruity, no-frills red.
Name: Melrose 2008 Merlot (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A light-bodied, fresh red that has very gentle cherry fruit flavors. The acidity gives a fine final bite. Think about chilling slightly. Screwcap.
Name: Haut Marin 2009 Merlot (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: Strained on the nose, with dirty fruit aromas, gaseousness and candy. The palate is cloying and confected, with muddy, jammy, herbal fruit flavors and a cooked, weedy finish. Bulky but not very good.
Name: Bodega Norton 2007 Barrel Select Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Herbal, green, stemmy Merlot with sourness and compromised aromas, flavors and mouthfeel. Tastes bitter and on the harsh side, with a narrow, grabby finish. Too green and mean, especially for $20.
Name: Bodega Norton 2007 Reserva Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All Dwelley Vineyard Merlot, with 9% Cab Franc and 6% Cab Sauvignon. Lots of pretty barrel toast and dense purple and black fruits, mixed with spicy vanilla/clove. Tannins are silky smooth, supple and powerful, and the wine really kicks it!
Name: Barrister 2007 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This classic Merlot is roughly half Pepper Bridge fruit, half Seven Hills fruit. What is particularly striking is how it displays enticing floral aromas over deliciously thick fruit, with streaks of coffee, chocolate and forest floor delicately laid in. Complex and tight, it has the potential to cellar for at least a decade, maybe 15 years.
Name: Pepper Bridge 2007 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A unique expression of this well-known vineyard, the Barnard Griffin Ciel du Cheval vineyard Merlot has bright berry flavors, sharp acidity, some cut tobacco flavors, and penetrating minerality. The alcohol is listed at 14.4% and seems even lighter; the focus here is on elegance and clean fruit flavors, yet the wine leaves a strong finishing impression and does not limp away.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2008 Ciel du Cheval Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: A big-boned, rich 100% Merlot, this is a dark and chewy wine whose cherry fruit is set amidst an explosion of hickory smoke, dark chocolate, and tar. The tannins—quite astringent and drying—suggest a long cellar life ahead. Drink it now or lay it down for up to a decade.
Name: Boudreaux Cellars 2006 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This strong and supple Merlot brings finesse and power to play, mixing black fruits with veins of coffee, dark chocolate, and a hint of pepper. Small percentages of Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc add muscle, but Merlot is the star here, firm and persistent, streaked with smoke and finished with butterscotch.
Name: Januik 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is 100% estate Merlot from the original 1981 planting. It's very tight, and immediately showing a lot of barrel flavor, including some spicy pickle accents. The wine has excellent balance, with a firmness that is almost Cabernet like. Smooth, polished, cranberry and cherry fruit is threaded with black olive and red licorice.
Name: Tero Estates 2007 Herb's Block Windrow Vineyards Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A precise and penetrating mix of black cherry fruit, cut tobacco, and blended barrel notes that mix in streaks of clove, cinnamon, coffee and bitter chocolate, this wine has the structure and depth to age gracefully for another 6–8 years.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2007 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Novelty Hill's Merlot includes 6% Cabernet Sauvignon and a splash of Cab Franc; the wine is beautifully proportioned and silky in the mouth. Smooth fruits mix berries with chocolate, all buoyed up on just the right amount of acidity. This is elegant and pretty, more than a powerful wine, but there is plenty of ripe fruit flavor and a pat of buttery toast in the finish.
Name: Novelty Hill 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Super smooth and open, this loose and lovely Merlot coats the palate with pretty cherry and raspberry fruit, slathered in tasty milk chocolatey oak. Not a deep wine, but deeply enjoyable, and ready to drink right now.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, spicy and tart, with fine balance and focus. The fruit trends toward cherry and prune, with an earthy, tannic finish.
Name: Arbor Crest 2008 Four Vineyards Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Horse Heaven Hills Merlot has a powerful clove flavor running right up the middle; along with it come streaks of vanilla and tobacco. What elevates it above cheaper wines with similar flavors is the structure and the penetration of the fruit, which has the vivid berry character of the region. The tannins are quite astringent.
Name: Columbia Crest 2008 H3 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Forward and spicy, this puts some muscle into the Merlot with earthy, tongue-gripping tannins. The fruit has a sweet tomato flavor, with a streak of cherry candy. Though not entirely knit together, it's a pleasant drink best enjoyed young.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2008 Indian Wells Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A young wine from a high-acid year, and it's showing a fair amount of earth and green, herbal flavor. The fruit seems just on the edge of ripe, with hints of brambly berry. Well balanced in a tough year.
Name: Gordon Brothers 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Standard berry and cherry aromas are clean and round, while the palate is full and honest, with medium tannins and controlled acidity. For basic Merlot it's nice because there's sweetness, ripe fruit flavors, cola and juicy snap to the finish.
Name: Calcu 2008 Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Dusty cherry aromas are slightly spiky and feature some tomato, while the palate is solid, a touch sharp and prickly, but good overall. Snappy raspberry is the one and only flavor, while the finish offers heat and some mild oak. Average to good, and fully drinkable.
Name: Echeverria 2008 Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: Brambly red-fruit aromas of currants and pie cherry are on the sharp side, while the palate is clacky and tannic, with crisp red-plum, herb and wayward oak flavors. Finishes full and rugged, with toasty heat and an herbal aftertaste. Not a bad wine but it's fairly typical for Chilean Merlot.
Name: Ventisquero 2008 Queulat Gran Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Brambly with a mild vineagary sourness to the nose. The palate is tart, crisp and scratchy, with sweet-and-sour flavors of plum, herbs and even grass. Finishes green and challenged. Kind of weak for $17.
Name: Catrala 2008 Grand Reserve Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Description: A creamy, faux-smelling-and-tasting wine with loads of bogus oak character and limited stuffing or quality backing it up. Smells like a berry marshmallow or county fair cotton candy, yet the palate is hollow and sour. A masked wine that's trying to be tricky and isn't.
Name: Santa Ema 2008 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite dry and thin, with an odd mix of unripe fruit, sugary fruit, toasted seed and plastic. Just doesn't sit well in the mouth.
Name: Heaven's Cave 2008 Alder Ridge Vineyard Inspiration Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% Merlot is sourced from Sagemoor Farms' Bacchus and Dionysus vineyards. For the first time, there is no Cabernet Franc in the blend. Richly fruity, with loads of cherry, raspberry compote and black currant flavors, this melds in grace notes of chocolate and caramel, seamlessly. Thick and flat-out luscious, yet structured with a tannic spine that gives definition and focus all the way through.
Name: Abeja 2008 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: True to the dense, muscular style of Woodward Canyon's Merlots, this elevates the complexity in a near-perfect vintage. Deep and textural, it packs together concentrated red fruits, preserves and cassis. At first it shows a little heat from the 15% alcohol, but as it breathes open over hours (and even days) the primary fruit gives way to subtle veins of olive, earth, coffee and toast.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit sources for this limited-production Walla Walla bottling of Northstar Merlot include Leonetti's Loess vineyard, and Windrow and Anna Marie in the Seven Hills. Thick, lush and richly evocative, it shows Napa-like density. Chocolatey black fruits and baking spices add to the rich midpalate, which qualifies for the often-abused word ‘hedonistic.'
Name: Northstar 2007 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fragrant and inviting with lush aromas of red berries, black cherries and chocolate. In the mouth the wine is loaded with powerful ripe fruit flavors, still compact and primary, but promising excellent development in the cellar. Threads of iron and coffee appear, and the wine takes a sinuous path through the palate and into a lingering finish.
Name: Fielding Hills 2008 RiverBend Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From a superb year, this wine saw all French oak, but an ongoing reduction in exposure to new barrels brought the percentage down to 60%. Young and muscular, the blend of black fruits, sweet oak and toasty spice is focused and compelling. Pure fruit flavors include black cherry and plum, smooth and concentrated, with a smoky kick in the lingering finish.
Name: Northstar 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The ripeness and heat are immediately noticeable in the liquorous nose. Supple and smooth in the mouth, it shows a blend of pretty purple fruits and polished tannins, layered with barrel flavors emphasizing espresso and strong toast. Classic Michel Rolland, inviting and generous.
Name: Pedestal 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a stellar and immensely attractive Merlot that's sure to impress any true wine lover. Fig, black plum flesh, sweet cola glaze and black raspberry sauce dominate, with accents of leathery spice and cigar tobacco adding depth and complexity. It's round and full in the mouth with dainty fine grain tannins and a long finish. This can easily be drunk now or cellared for another 2–5 years.
Name: Shannon 2008 Mount Bullet Merlot (Elgin)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The best of Olsen's 2008 reds, this 100% Merlot is generous and forward, with rich cherry and raspberry fruit. Spicy in the nose and in the mouth, it is lightly herbal, adding texture and length, and has the concentration and depth to develop nicely over the next decade.
Name: Olsen Estates 2008 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is pure Washington Merlot, sourced from Klipsun, Ciel du Cheval and the original 1976 planting at Kiona. Initially stiff and herbal, it opens grudgingly, streaked with black olive, black cherry, earth and dark chocolate. The muscularity is a fine demonstration of why and how Washington Merlot is ageworthy; a showcase of tight black raspberry and cassis, with a core of iron.
Name: JM Cellars 2007 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: Medium-intense and herbal with notes of licorice root and cedar spice among the dark fruit and soft green-pepper flavors. It's easy to drink and well structured with moderate acid and soft but present tannins. A good amount of sweet woody spice lingers though the finish.
Name: De Grendel 2007 Merlot (Durbanville)

Description: Crushed violet petals, plum, roasty coffee and cocoa dusted black cherry aromas all welcome you on the bouquet of this wine. The round mouth is just as opulent and inviting, with more dark fruit and mocha notes backed by sweet spice. Tasty and easy to drink.
Name: Beau Joubert 2007 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of lush black cherries, coffee grinds and darkly toasted oak meld effortlessly in winemaker Roman Roth's powerful Long Island Merlot. After 21 months in French oak, the wine is smooth as silk yet intensely focused with a rich fruit palate accented by hints of forest floor and bramble, velvety soft tannins and a balanced astringency. Lovely all around.
Name: The Grapes of Roth 2004 Merlot (Long Island)

Description: Dark and full-fruited, with coffee, cumin and big berry fruit aromas. This is a pleasant surprise and a great value; the palate is bright and clean, with black-fruit flavors and cola galore. Creamy, mildly toasty and rich on the finish; overall it excels at its price point.
Name: Concha y Toro 2009 Xplorador Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Grand Estates Merlot holds center court in the vast Columbia Crest portfolio. This new release, which has received extra bottle age, is seamless, smoky, supple and seductive. Exotic sandalwood and Asian spices weave from the nose into the palate, wrapped around broad black cherry and blackberry fruit flavors. A darker streak of black olive and licorice runs into a finish replete with tannins that are tight and hint at stem.
Name: Columbia Crest 2007 Grand Estates Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Charred oak is prominent here as it is with most Long Island reds, but exceptionally well integrated within a rich, round wine full of supple dark chocolate and fruit flavors. A good example of yin and yang, Clovis Point's blend of Merlot, Cab Sauvignon and Franc, and Syrah offsets dense, sweet boysenberry and mocha notes with firm tannins and a dark char finish.
Name: Clovis Point 2007 Vintner's Select Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All five Bordeaux grapes are included in this Merlot, a substantial and well crafted wine with bright berry and cassis flavors front and center. Good complexity for the price, with olive, dust, mocha and caramel in the mix. Tannins are balanced and slightly grainy, with good length through the finish.
Name: Apex 2006 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: A winning combination of sweet and savory, Belhurst's Traditions smells deliciously of syrupy boysenberry jam amidst the backdrop of a rustic barnyard. On the palate, juicy, ripe black fruit flavors gain complexity from a rich, earthy mushroom notes in the midpalate. Luscious and smooth with medium body and soft acidity.
Name: Belhurst 2007 Traditions Merlot (New York)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Judicious use of darkly toasted Hungarian oak results in a surprisingly sexy, supple wine that's dripping with vanilla and spicy dark plum flavors. There's a slight green twinge to the black cherry flavors on the palate, but this is a smooth, easy-drinking Merlot with a long, earthy, espresso finish.
Name: Comtesse Thérèse 2005 Hungarian Oak Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Made from hand-picked grapes and unfiltered, this is a richly concentrated, full-bodied Merlot with an abundance of sweet, juicy black plum and freshly roasted coffee flavors. Two years of aging in French oak results in a supple, silky wine with beautifully integrated tannins and pleasant notes of darkly toasted wood. A great pairing with roasted pork tenderloin.
Name: Pindar Vineyards 2007 Barrel Select Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Stocky, meaty and full on the nose, and despite a hint of leafy, herbal green it's a more than solid offering. Black cherry and herbal flavors are generous, while the finish is full and competent. Shows good overall quality and solidity compared to prior vintages.
Name: Santa Ema 2009 Selected Terroir Merlot (Peumo)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bright and cheerful with a candied black cherry nose, this is a deliciously fruit-forward yet focused wine. On the palate, soft, fresh fruit and supple vanilla flavors meld beautifully with supple tannins and a rich, dark, roasted coffee finish.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2007 Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Full bodied with a velvety heft on the palate, this Reserve Merlot from Hudson-Chatham offers a striking balance of intensity and elegance. From the nose to the palate, there's a bounty of rich dark fruit, bramble and smoke layered with silky oak and firm tannins.
Name: Hudson-Chatham 2007 Reserve Merlot (New York)

Description: This is classic Merlot at a great price, with notes of black plum, cherry, blackberry and licorice on the nose and mouth. Balanced and softly textured with medium tannins and a solid, clean finish. Drink now.
Name: Fleur Du Cap 2008 Bergkelder Selection Merlot (Coastal Region)

Description: Dark yet a touch murky on the bouquet, with weight and black-fruit aromas. The palate is plump but healthy, with peppery flavors accenting core blackberry and chocolate. Chunky and proper, if a tad bit bitter on the finish. Gets better as it airs out.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2009 Altosur Merlot (Tupungato)

Description: There's an interesting counterplay between the bright and the dark in Lovingston's hand-picked, small lot Josie's Knoll. On the nose, black cherry preserves are countered with black pepper spice and char. On the palate, ripe, concentrated black fruit is layered with tar, earth and bramble. It's elegant and seductive, but anchored by a core of gripping tannins.
Name: Lovingston 2007 Josie's Knoll Merlot (Monticello)

Description: Rich and round, this offers plenty of concentrated blackberry notes enveloped in warm spices and supple oak. There's a hint of green tomato leaves throughout, but the lush fruit combined with sturdy grape tannins and high acidity would pair well with fatty short ribs or braised pork.
Name: Veramar 2008 Estate Club Merlot (Virginia)

Description: The blend includes 6% Syrah, and the wine has a pretty plum and blueberry color, that (perhaps by the power of suggestion) carries through into the aromas. It's tight, tart, and clean, offering a mix of berry fruits and a finish lined with vanilla and tobacco. Overall the balance is excellent, the wine juicy and fresh, and the blend just about perfect.
Name: Columbia Crest 2008 Two Vines Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Wonderfully rich with lush dark chocolate and espresso notes, this is another lovely, highly drinkable Merlot from Comtesse Thérèse. There's a good amount of charred oak, but it's integrated seamlessly with concentrated black plum and berry flavors. The finish is long, and accented by pleasant astringency of walnut skins and tobacco.
Name: Comtesse Thérèse 2005 Traditional Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Slightly earthy and herbal smelling but with enough clean fruit on the nose to make the grade. The palate is fairly flush, with blackberry, baked notes and bitter chocolate flavors. Fleshy and warm overall, with a thick finish that's lightly peppery and toasty.
Name: Bodega Norton 2009 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a profusion of charred oak on the nose and palate, but smoke and tar notes combined with a slightly cooked plum and cherry profile make this hearty Merlot a good match for smoked meats or bacon enhanced meals. Subtle violet and barnyard aromas add some complexity, but the finish drops quickly on a charred wood note.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2007 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: After the scent of char blows off a bit, this first harvest Merlot opens sweetly to aromas of vanilla, cinnamon spice and plush, red plums. There's a hint of green stalks and leaves detectable on the palate amidst underripe black cherry and plum flavors, but bright acidity gives this wine a fresh character and the spiced plum finish is pleasant.
Name: Comtesse Thérèse 2005 First Harvest Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: The nose offers plenty of cooked plum preserves, warm spice and toasted, nutty oak. There's a nice, lush texture and body, and bright red cherry and plums flavors on the palate. The fruit flavors may be slightly lacking in concentration, but supple tannins make for smooth, easy sipping.
Name: Comtesse Thérèse 2006 Aquebogue Estate Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Layers of char, black pepper and briar patch help to build complexity in this dense, concentrated black plum Merlot. There's a touch of green leaf and tomato throughout, but overall, it's a fruit-driven, luscious wine accented with spice and smooth, supple tannins. Aged 24 months in new French oak.
Name: Comtesse Thérèse 2004 Château Reserve Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Rich and jammy with concentrated, cooked blackberry flavors, this medium-bodied Colorado Merlot melds nicely with aromas of toasty, nutty oak. There's a raw, green pepper note that peeks through, but overall, it's a pleasant, accessible wine with a delicious roasted coffee finish.
Name: Two Rivers 2008 Merlot (Grand Valley)

Description: This single-vineyard Merlot smells sweetly of ripe black plums with just a whisper of menthol and Band Aid. Soft on the palate, there's a good amount of dark fruit, but it's a tad tired and dusty. The finish is strong with a high-toned acidity and firm tannins.
Name: Vivác Winery 2006 V. by Vivác Single Vineyard Merlot (New Mexico)

Description: The nose is a pleasant harmony of dark, ripe fruit, espresso grinds and carefully charred French oak. Coffee and cigar box notes carry through the palate as well, marrying with fresher red-fruit flavors. There's quite a bit of tannin to grapple with still, but overall, it's a pleasant medium-bodied red.
Name: Vivác Winery 2007 Merlot (New Mexico)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's a suppleness to the way oak envelops the ripe, plummy aromas on this Finger Lakes Merlot. The palate is dry, but ripe and lush with an intensely concentrated dose of fruit. Low in acidity and tannins, it's a bit plush, but makes for easy sipping with food or on its own.
Name: Keuka Spring 2007 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Well integrated charred oak melds well with ripe blackberry and black plum aromas in this blend of Merlot from a cooperative of Long Island winemakers. This is a full-bodied wine with an intensely concentrated black fruit character, a kick of earthy, barnyard funk and firm, structured tannins.
Name: Long Island Merlot Alliance 2007 Merliance Merlot (Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Despite intriguing notes of ripe red cherries, menthol and barnyard that peek through, tar and smoke from heavily charred French oak dominate both the nose and palate. There's a pleasant midpalate of black fruit and pepper spice but its brief appearance is overshadowed again by a deep char finish.
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2004 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Starts with distinct, hard aromas of mustard, horseradish and jerky. In the mouth, it's full, bullish and tannic, with flavors of bacon, wood resin, smoke and stewed blackberry. Very smoky and dark, with hard tannins, and just not as good as past vintages.
Name: Castillo de Monjardin 2006 Deyo Merlot (Navarra)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: After the initial bouquet of charred oak and espresso blow off, pretty aromas of ripe black cherries, spice and smoke linger on this beautifully balanced, regal Merlot blend. There's plenty of coffee and char on the palate as well, but layers of earth, mushroom and smoke flavors add complexity and depth.
Name: Wölffer 2005 Lambardo Merlot (Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Spicy, sweet red plums and charred oak marry well in this limited release wine from Sherwood House. There are hints of tobacco leaf and green grass throughout, but soft, supple tannins and a dark, smoky finish make this a pleasant sip.
Name: Sherwood House Vineyards 2005 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Although there's some underripe black cherry and espresso notes on the nose, char dominates both the bouquet and the palate. It's a savory, rustic wine without a lot of fruit intensity, but it's a simple wine for casual dining with rich, meaty fare.
Name: Clovis Point 2005 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
