Description: A nose of black cherry and red berry leads on this Romanian Merlot, followed by flavors of cherry and spice. Backed by a solid tannic structure but slightly acidic, this wine will pair well with grilled meats.
Name: Cramele Recas 2008 La Putere Merlot (Recas)

Description: Basic cherry and raspberry aromas have a candied tone to them, yet the palate is zesty and tart, with linear raspberry flavors that are crisp and finish like a red-fruit sucking candy. A lot of acidity and not much body. Decent but stretched thin.
Name: Occhioverde 2007 Merlot (San Carlos)

Description: Slightly prickly and pickled on the nose, with snappy red fruit in the raspberry vein. Resiny on the aftertaste, with dry tannins and an elevated level of acidity. Basic and a bit raw.
Name: Morandé 2007 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Distinctly smells of bell pepper, while the racy palate is raw in feel and offers flavors of raspberry, red plum and wood resin. Sheer stuff, with a lightly woody, toasty, lean finish.
Name: Portal Del Alto 2007 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Dense and dark, but buried with marshmallow and cloying sweet-oak flavors and aromas. Tastes rather funky and artificial, with vanilla, oak, cream and resin, but very little true fruit.
Name: Santa Ema 2007 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Acceptable aromas but all acid in the mouth. A sour, bitter, red fruit dominant wine with very little going for it. Offers nothing but sourness on the palate and finish.
Name: Alta Cima 2007 Reserve Merlot (Lontué Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend includes 11% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Cabernet Franc, seamlessly integrated into a smooth and compelling whole. Cedary and silky, supple and substantial, this powerful wine lets the muscular Merlot dominate, while the Cabs bring in nuances of herb and the vineyard's minerality. Excellent length and aging potential.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2007 Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Merlot-dominated blend includes 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Malbec and 2% Cabernet Franc. There's a lovely floral top note to the aromas, anise, some cocoa, and a pleasing dusty character. The fruit is still young and tart and tight, and the tannins carry flavors of leaf and olive.
Name: Pepper Bridge 2006 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: A juicy, savory nose of cedar, cassis, red berries and balsamic are followed by flavors of smoke, berries and spice in this spunky Merlot. Rich, complex and sultry, this wine can age and will be delicious with seared duck breast.
Name: Thelema 2006 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: Lush vanilla, cocoa and plum aromas lead into velvety waves of fresh berries, chocolate and spice on the palate. Elegant and unfolding, with a lingering fresh finish. A classic food wine.
Name: Rust en Vrede 2007 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Estate grown, fragrant and refreshingly un-jammy, this elegant wine matches tart, ripe red berries and plums to perfectly balanced flavors of earth and bark. It finishes gracefully, with polished tannins and hints of cinnamon and cedar from light barrel aging.
Name: Gordon Brothers 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A 15.1% alcohol bruiser, this is beautifully made. The Stillwater Creek vineyard fruit tastes like fresh-picked blackberries, with firm acids and underlying minerality that keeps it clean and fresh right through the finish.
Name: Merry Cellars 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is ripe, textured, sexy fruit; given two years in mostly neutral oak, which has softened the wine, and taken the edge off the herbal notes. It's ready to drink, a delicious, spicy wine that keeps going long after you expect the flavor to stop.
Name: Stephenson Cellars 2006 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: L'Ecole's vineyard sources are remarkable, and this Columbia valley Merlot brings in fruit from top sites in Walla Walla, Red Mountain, and the Wahluke Slope. Plump red fruits are dappled with hints of peppery herb, acids are natural and lend vibrancy, but the finish carries just a little too much heat. The blend includes 11% Cab Franc, 3% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Petit Verdot.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Despite some initial hints of tomato leaf on the nose, this is a soft, round, lush Merlot, filled with plummy notes and even some mocha notes. With its long, supple finish, this is a budget-priced Merlot worth buying.
Name: Bulletin Place 2008 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Description: A lovely nose, delicately perfumed with plum, cherries and flowers, is followed by elegant, approachable flavors of plum, smoke, mocha and blackberry. An all-around good red that will pair well with duck and soft cheeses.
Name: Indaba 2008 Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: Good blackberry aromas and flavors along with structure make this solid and enjoyable. The nose of blackberry intrigues, and the bulky palate of plum and berry is healthy, balanced and able. Turns a bit more wild and herbal as it opens.
Name: Ombu 2006 Merlot

Description: A little awkward early on, but overall it's a concentrated, sweet style of Merlot that blends bulk, density and sweetness with just enough integrity and acidity to work. Heat and coffee on the finish hammer home the fact that it's ripe and oaky.
Name: Bodega Norton 2006 Barrel Select Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This medium-bodied Merlot seems a little jammy on the nose, but in the mouth it shows a modicum of structure to go with its moderately intense cassis and chocolate flavors. It's even reasonably long on the finish.
Name: McWilliam's Hanwood Estate 2007 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: An excellent option for those who enjoy a more gentle, approachable style. Moderate black plum, blackberry and herbal notes flesh out the full, round mouth. Soft and easy to drink with a solid, juicy finish.
Name: La Noble 2007 Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: Friendly and easygoing with aromas of smoke and plum and fruity flavors of plum and berry. Spice accents add complexity. A good everyday red for both warm and cool weather. Pair with duck or stews.
Name: Ondine 2007 Merlot (Coastal Region)

Description: Aromas of forest berries, violet, pepper and spice give this Merlot an intriguing start. On the palate, it offers indigenous character—smoke, spice and savory red berry. Rustic but full of character, the wine will pair well with game and grilled meats.
Name: Porcupine Ridge 2008 Merlot (Coastal Region)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This new vintage of Donedéi Merlot was tasted twice; both bottles showed some browning around the edges, and volatile, slightly burned aromas. This is not a vintage to cellar; it should be consumed quickly and paired with spicy, hearty food.
Name: Donedei 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Can't fault the pricing on this full-bodied Merlot out of Victoria. Vanilla and toast shadings accent cassis and mint aromas, before the fruit turns just slightly overripe and raisiny on the palate. Still, there's a velvety texture and richness to the finish that's often lacking in wines at this price.
Name: Four Sisters 2006 Merlot (Central Victoria)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Ripe, jammy and sure to please most palates. Round and soft with loads of black plum, berry preserves and a hint of milk chocolate on the finish.
Name: Les Tours 2007 Estate Bottled Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: Nicely made Merlot, from the aromas of black cherries, dried herbs and café au lait to the black cherry and plum flavors. It's medium bodied, finishing with a bit too much tartness.
Name: Yalumba 2008 The Y Series Merlot (South Australia)

Description: Can you say, “toasty”? A thick layer of oak veneer covers the dark fruit of this medium- to full-bodied wine. You get toasty, slightly mentholated flavors, a wood-defined structure and a toasty finish.
Name: Penley Estate 2007 Gryphon Merlot (Coonawarra)

Description: Hot, spicy and a little green and stalky as Navarran Merlot is prone to be. The palate has size and tannic grab, while the flavors of plum and berry are round in size but herbal at the core. Touches of cherry and chocolate work the finish.
Name: Señorío de Sarria 2005 Viñedo N° 4 Merlot (Navarra)

Description: This organic Merlot offers herbaceous, cedary aromas and a spicy, smoky character on the palate. Though slightly rustic, it has a fresh, vibrant character with ageability and charm.
Name: Stellar Organics 2008 Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: Cherry aromas cross over into cough drop country, while the palate is a mix of plum and berry flavors with pepper. The feel is tight, but there isn't much variety of depth. Not a bad wine, but it doesn't develop much momentum.
Name: Occhioverde 2006 Merlot (San Carlos)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This budget-priced Merlot takes fresh herbs and tart cherries, then wraps them in soft, silky tannins. Crisp on the finish.
Name: De Bortoli 2008 dB Selection Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This budget-priced Merlot takes fresh herbs and tart cherries, then wraps them in soft, silky tannins. Crisp on the finish.
Name: De Bortoli 2008 dB Selection Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: The vibrant acidity helps to keep the red fruit lively and upfront, but otherwise the wine is lighter in intensity and quite soft in the mouth with no real tannic presence. Subtle hints of pepper provide a touch of complexity.
Name: The Frenchhouse 2007 Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: Opens with a harsh, rough nose that settles with airing. The palate is tangy and raised by zesty acidity, while the flavors rest on searing raspberry and red plum. Shows a lean personality but too much bite and scour for Merlot.
Name: Jean León 2005 Vinya Palau Merlot (Penedès)

Description: A case of bigger not being better. Powerful but pruney, with tons of oak, molasses, BBQ sauce, caramel and blackness but hardly any fruit to speak of. You might admire the breadth and potency of this New World Merlot, but probably not its heavyness and lack of vitality.
Name: Salentein 2004 Pr1mum Merlot (Uco Valley)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: A fruit-driven, slightly confected Merlot, but one that manages to impress for its moderately lush feel, black cherry, carob and herb shadings. Soft and easy to drink.
Name: Alice White 2008 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Round, soft and seemingly a little sweet, this is the sort of wine that simultaneously sells well and gives rise to certain stereotypical views of Australian wine. There's a hint of mint, but mainly black cherry preserves that lack real structure. Drink now.
Name: Kalbarri 2007 Bin Select 770 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Green and vegetal with green pepper, asparagus, and mushy black plum skins thoughout the nose and palate. The mouth is round with soft tannins and low acidity.
Name: La Forge Estate 2007 Reserve Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: A touch medicinal and candied; smells like red Jolly Rancher, mashed black plum guts and cherries. Simple but drinkable with a lighter weight and decent finish.
Name: Petit Bistro 2007 Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: Safe to say that Merlot isn't Weinert's best stuff. This is brackish in color, with murky aromas of fallen leaves and baked fruit. The palate is definitely baked, thus molasses, licorice and fig paste rule. Also a bit scratchy in mouthfeel.
Name: Weinert 2004 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a floral take on Merlot, in both scents and flavors; owing at least in part to the inclusion of 7% Petit Verdot. The wine gathers strength and fleshes out as it warms in the glass, and layers in darker notes with smoke and coffee and tar. A steely style, muscular and tight, it smoothes out nicely with breathing time, and shows excellent aging potential.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2007 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The best Pedestal since the 2003. The focus is immediately apparent, with dark, toasty scents and flavors wrapped into ripe black fruits. The generous (85% new) French oak aging brings in clove, licorice and smoky spice, but the fruit has the muscle and breadth necessary to keep it all harmonious.
Name: Pedestal 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Amazing stuff—dense, rich, full-bodied and loaded with dark fruits, smoke, toasted walnuts, coffee grounds and appropriate notes of bark and soil. Persistent, with a strong spine and a long finish.
Name: Otis Kenyon 2006 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Violets, lovely and fragrant, leap from this broad, soft and open Merlot, loaded with beautiful sweet black fruit. The oak is showing a lot of toast now but that's not a criticism; this is really tasty, pleasing and a fine value.
Name: Seven Hills 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is a good value effort, smoky, chewy and dense, with strong flavors but solid Merlot varietal character. There is unusual smokiness in the wine—presumably from barrel toast—but enough ripe fruit to offset that and the substantial tannins. The spicy finish suggests American oak barrels were used.
Name: Whidbey Island Winery 2005 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Lots of color and dark fruit, but a little too generic to score higher. This is a smooth, polished wine with blackberry, cassis and licorice aromas and flavors. It doesn't vary much from its core identity but it's healthy, structured and not short on tannins and acidity. Expect more from the 2006 vintage.
Name: Gillmore 2005 Hacedor de Mundos Reserva Merlot (Loncomilla Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Scents of prune, coffee and smoke lead into a chewy, substantial wine with plenty of concentration. The cherry fruit has a syrupy character, and it's loaded with dark layers of coffee, licorice and char. The best of the new releases from Lone Canary.
Name: Lone Canary 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Opens with broad, rich flavors of black cherry, but then turns one-dimensional. The finish hits a wall, with tannins still herbal and not quite ripe.
Name: Three Rivers 2006 Champoux Vineyard Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in barrel (mostly new) for 22 months, this 84% Merlot/16% Cabernet Sauvignon really shows the new oak and vanilla scents and flavors, but that is to be expected at this stage of the game. Nothing subtle about this wine, which shows typical cherry/berry fruit flavors.
Name: Vin du Lac 2006 Barrel Select Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Burly aromas of mint, leather, shoe polish, olive and herbs all come together fairly well, and the palate is alive with fruit, especially red cherry and plum. A second layer of heat, chocolate and raspberry carry oaky remnants of toast and spice, and overall it comes across as a real wine waiting to be drunk.
Name: Arboleda 2006 Merlot (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Early rubbery aromas give way to purer black-fruit notes. The mouth is generous and shows good feel and structure, while the flavors of blueberry and blackberry are simple to like, modestly sweet and generally quite ripe. Decent length and spice on the finish close it out nicely.
Name: Miguel Torres 2007 Santa Digna Reserve Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Firm, with herbal flavors of olive and some interesting violet/floral highlights that carry into lightly plummy fruit and chocolate. After a promising start, the flavors quickly tail off, and the wine finishes smooth but muted.
Name: Cedergreen Cellars 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Merlot is blended with 10% Cabernet Franc, scented with black olive, herb and fresh berries. The alcohol hits 14.5%, but despite that, and the deep color, the wine feels a little thin in the middle, and the tannins override the fruit with astringent, black tea flavors.
Name: Isenhower 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Fairly earthy and a little bit herbal on the nose, with aromas of tomatillo, oregano and light fruit that almost amount to a nice salsa fresca. The body is a little big and flat, but there's also generous fruit, size and finish. Richer than many Merlots in this price class, but with peppery, herb notes throughout.
Name: Chilensis 2007 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: A strong hint of charcoal and leather carry the nose, while the palate is snappy and fresh, with good feel, texture and flavors of berry, plum and herbs. Mainstream, familiar and in good balance, with freshness, acidity and toast on the finish. Holds no surprises.
Name: Veramonte 2007 Reserva Merlot (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Olive and herb aromas carry the bouquet, while the body and mouthfeel are big, bulky, a touch unfocused but definitely not miserly or wanting for power. Tomato and oregano are prominent flavors, and the tannins start to build right from the start. Solid as a block, but herbal like an old-school Chilean Merlot.
Name: Odfjell 2007 Armador Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Fairly straightforward and solid Merlot from Chile. The nose is sort of brambly, but there's reasonably fresh plum and berry aromas. The palate is acid-charged and thus not sloppy or muddled, with bright cherry and red-plum flavors. Hints of pepper and herbs accent a zesty finish.
Name: San Fernando 2004 Gran Reserva Merlot (Central Valley)

Description: Slightly dusty and fresh smelling, with cherry/berry aromas that should ring familiar. The palate is zesty, tight, crisp and driving, although the fruit is anything but gigantic or exciting. With some kick and spice late, this is the definition of an everyday, no-fuss Merlot.
Name: Calina 2007 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Full and fiery smelling, with black cherry, cola and oaky aromas of butter and cream. The flavors are a touch herbal and creamy, while the fruit leans toward berry and fat plum. With airing it settles into a simple, reasonably good Merlot.
Name: Terravid 2005 Private Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

Description: Opens with fiery cherry-berry aromas and then some mossy dankness. The palate is tight and snappy, with basic berry flavors and then a blast of burnt toast and herbal notes. Incongruent in its mix of acid-based feel and flavors along with herbal, heavier characteristics.
Name: Portal Del Alto 2005 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Like the Chilean Merlot of olden days, this one is fairly mulchy and astringent. And it's also a bit old tasting, with some core berry fruit but mostly earthy flavors and forced spice. Some red fruit on the finish helps it, but still there isn't much essence to this wine.
Name: Viña Tinajas 2005 Viejo Feo Merlot (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark and extracted, this is scented with smoky oak, herb, and some lifted cherry fruit. Once again, it seems to have over-reached for color and extract given the rather lean, leafy, watery finish.
Name: Airfield Estates 2007 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Earthy and chocolaty at first, but with air it reveals a more candied, coco-puff set of aromas and flavors. There's sweetnees, sharp acidity, marshmallow notes and snap. Not much in the way of excitement or high quality here; it tastes candied but also a little sour.
Name: Santa Ema 2005 Reserve Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: A bit aggressive and hot at first, and then mossy and earthy. The palate delivers weight and forceful acidity, while the berry flavors are robust but grating and weighed down by a lot of warm, woody overtones. Like a bucking mule; at $28 it seeks to be more than it is.
Name: TerraMater 2005 Altum Single Vineyard Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A welcome return to form after the disappointing 2005. Massive, dark, saturated and spicy; laden with black fruits, smoke and charcoal. The dark flavors run right into bitter chocolate and roasted earth, but don't mistake the descriptors to suggest this is anything but extremely delicious, with a long and very satisfying finish. 100% Merlot, all estate grown.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2006 Muleskinner Merlot Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: About 4% of the blend is Malbec; the Merlot is from the Lewis and Gamache vineyards. This is broad-shouldered, with sweet berry fruit jam flavors. The alcohol tops 15%, but there is no discernable heat; it's supple and the fruit is absolutely delicious.
Name: Tulpen 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal Merlot is a blend of three top Red Mountain vineyards: Klipsun, Ciel du Cheval and old vine Kiona. It really demonstrates the power of these Red Mountain sites; it's a well-made, muscular wine that extends itself through the midpalate into a textural and complex finish. Layers of graphite and smoke, black olive and coffee are wrapped in dark berry fruit.
Name: JM Cellars 2006 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Thick, chewy, dense and powerful. The blend is 75% Merlot, 15% Cab Franc, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. A very fine effort, it's smooth and supple, with alcohol listed (somewhat surprisingly) at 13.5%. Scents mix mocha, espresso, liquid smoke, iodine and black licorice; flavors also run to black and smoky. But there is fruit as well, deep black cherry and cassis, tightly packed and lingering.
Name: Donedei 2004 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An outstanding example of Washington Merlot. It needs more bottle age, but has all the right stuffing. There is plenty of still-to-be-integrated new oak, toast, and a dark and earthy core. Note that the Loess (Leonetti) vineyard contributes to the blend. Decant this; it could be a real sleeper.
Name: Waterbrook 2006 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the Costco house brand, and the new Merlot comes through with exceptional flavors for the price. It's lush and loaded with black cherry and mocha flavors. Tannins are ripe and smooth, the concentration is surprising, and there are no holes in this wine; it plays out smoothly with a very satisfying richness.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Alamos takes Merlot to the next level with this ripe, jammy, crusty offering. The black fruit on the nose is dense and pure, the mouthfeel is round and generous, and the flavors of ripe plum and berry ring true. Layered, long and easygoing on the finish. Very nice for Argentinean Merlot.
Name: Alamos 2007 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Stiff, with a lot of green flavors (but not veggie); more like sweet pea matched against black raspberry with 40% new French oak giving it a toasty thrust. Unfined, unfiltered, with good grip and a finish showing a fair amount of dark notes.
Name: Tertulia 2006 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This sophisticated Merlot starts with aromas of dark chocolate, cherry and plum, followed by balanced flavors of plum, berry and toast. Complex but smooth, and a good partner to grilled meat and hearty stews.
Name: Tishbi Estate 2005 Kosher Merlot (Upper Galilee)

Description: Blackberry and plum aromas have just enough leather and horsehide accents to give this wine character. The mouth is centered squarely on purple fruits like plum and wild blackberry, and the feel and finish are comfortable and fresh. Lively and with all the basics in the right places.
Name: Alberti 154 2007 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A little hot and a bit thinner than the 2005, but showing the supple grace of Chuck Reininger's wines. Fruit flavors are true and clean, but lacking some of the depth of past years.
Name: Helix by Reininger 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Round, velvety and mouthfilling, this is a satisfying Merlot at a bargain price. Aromas of black cherries and herbs fold in hints of cinnamon and mocha, while the flavors are generally fruity, but with a slightly tomatoey note. Soft on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Yellow Tail 2007 The Reserve Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 100% Merlot from Hedges North Block on Red Mountain. It's light, spicy and simple, without the muscle and verve of the state's best Merlots. The fruit is forward, crisply defined, and tastes like fresh raspberries, with some sharp-edged tannins.
Name: Ward Johnson Winery 2006 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Chandler Reach vineyards supplied the fruit. This is tart, opening with sharp berry flavors and lots of citrus, then settling into a moderately long finish that brings in a mix of strawberry, raspberry and cherry fruit. It's simple but ready to go.
Name: Northwest Totem Cellars 2005 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tight, tart and lightly spicy, this leads with raspberry and strawberry fruit, amplified with moderately high acids. In the mouth it feels more like a Washington Cabernet than a Merlot—Merlots in this state usually have more midpalate weight and flesh.
Name: Covey Run 2005 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Plump and sweet smelling, with bacon, wood smoke, sawdust and cotton candy aromas. The feel is jammy and the flavors of bacon-infused roasted fruit suggest some forced wood treatment. But overall the wine is satisfying, with pretty good mouthfeel. Approach it noncritically and it should do the trick.
Name: Pascual Toso 2007 Merlot (Maipú)

Description: Opens with sweet berry aromas that are inviting yet generic. The palate has plenty of acidity, making this Merlot food-friendly but racy on its own. Flavors of black cherry and dark plums are juicy, and there's a touch of spice and chocolate late.
Name: Tilia 2007 Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: The Ratbag makes for a pleasant, if somewhat generic dry red. Dried fruit and prune notes are complemented by chocolate overtones and the mouthfeel is soft and user-friendly.
Name: Hugh Hamilton 2005 The Ratbag Merlot (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Starts off with scents of black cherry, mocha and a touch of tomato, which intensifies on the palate, picking up a roasted or grilled nuance. It's medium-bodied, silky in texture and pleasantly dry on the finish.
Name: Madison Ridge 2007 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Description: For the price, this is a commendable effort, with scents of toast and vanilla layered over modest cherry fruit. The wine is medium bodied and marked by the a fine, soft texture, then finishes on a tart note.
Name: Ballast Stone Estate Wines 2006 Steeple Jack Merlot (South Australia)

Description: Strawberry, cherry and other red-fruits comprise a thin-styled bouquet, and pretty much the rest of the show follows suit. The palate is of medium weight, without much heft or structure. Flavors of red fruits are lean.
Name: Bodega Norton 2007 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite 15.1% alcohol, this is dull, one dimensional and rather light. The tannins are a little beefed up, but there's marginal fruit and everything seems a bit out of whack.
Name: Mount Baker Vineyards 2005 Barrel Select Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Rubbery and rhubarby on the nose, then confected and frankly sweet-tasting on the palate, with a short finish.
Name: Friday Monkey 2006 Merlot (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Right away this wine smells of good black fruit with mild earth and herbal accents. It's dark, sultry and pure, with black cherry, plum and cassis all vying for attention. While dark fruit is the star here, there's also good balance, mouthfeel, depth and herbal offsets. In the end it's about as good as you're going to get in under-$15 Merlot from Chile or anywhere.
Name: Lapostolle 2007 Casa Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Description: Meaty, condensed and full of understated plum and berry fruit. This is a nice bargain Merlot with currant, plum and pepper for flavors, and then a dash of mellow coffee on the finish. With solid core flavors and an integrated mouthfeel, it ranks as a positive wine for the money.
Name: Quasar 2006 Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: A springy nose of cherry, raspberry and chocolate is a good opener, while the palate boasts a mix of herbs, tobacco, olive and plum flavors. The feel is a high point, with lushness and balancing acidity each making a cameo. Finishes mildly peppery. Good Merlot for the money.
Name: Santa Alicia 2007 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Fiery and wild at first, with aromas of cinnamon, pepper and Juicy Fruit gum. Strange as that may sound, the wine finds a more familiar place on the palate, where plum, cherry and cassis flavors are flashy and the feel is a bit clangy. Rounds out with air and settles down fairly nicely.
Name: Aresti 2007 Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: A controlled mix of rubber, berry, olive and leather gives this bargain hunter's wine a legitimate bouquet. The palate is herbal but also full of red fruits like currants, raspberry and plum, while the finish is mostly clean and sound. A solid wine for the price.
Name: Santa Rita 2007 120 Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Description: A very saturated specimen, with hot, piercing aromas that soften and terminate at baked berry pie and marzipan. The palate is just as sweet and thick as the bouquet, with chunky plum, blackberry, chocolate and tobacco flavors. Finishes Porty and rich, with weight and not much tannin or structure.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2007 Casa La Joya Gran Reserve Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: A little roasted and leafy smelling, which is typical for base-level Chilean Merlot. The palate is sweet almost to the brink of being candied, with plum and chocolate flavors running the show. Not much structure or tannic bite here, but as a whole it's tasty and gets better as it opens up.
Name: Montes 2007 Classic Series Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Dry, lean and sawdusted on the nose, with vanilla aromas blending with simple plum and berry notes. Whole on the palate, with a creamy, mildly tacky feel, while the flavors of red fruits are regular at best and smothered with butter and wood resin. Solid enough but probably too woody given the wine's weight and overall quality.
Name: Aresti 2006 Reserva Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: Sizable plum and berry aromas blend with hints of char, rubber and herbs to create a decent but challenged bouquet, while the palate is fairly raw in feel and offers the standard four-pack of Chilean Merlot flavors: raspberry, cherry, plum and herbs. Finishes fairly zesty, with another wave of herbal flavor.
Name: Santa Ema 2007 Selected Terroir Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: While this Merlot is far from a thriller, you have to give the winery credit for consistency: its basic $9 Merlot has scored 84 points three years in a row. This version has chocolaty oak and some red fruit on the nose, and then herbal cherry and raspberry flavors before a short, edgy finish.
Name: Viña Casas Patronales 2007 Estate Bottled Merlot (San Clemente)

Description: Smells almost as much like a pizza as wine with its herbal notes of basil, fresh tomato and pepper. Along with those saucy aromas come berry and plum fruit; but again, any fruit on the nose or palate is mixed with a strong dose of herbal essence. Soft and chewy in terms of feel. Standard Chilean Merlot.
Name: Viña Requingua 2006 Puerto Viejo Reserve Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: A little green and entirely basic, but in this price range it's not disappointing. The nose offers oregano, tomato and plum all in a savory wrapping, while the palate is lively and plummy, with no huge faults. Juicy as far as feel goes, with a bouncy red fruit-meets-herbal personality.
Name: Santa Ema 2006 Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Rubbery and roasted initial aromas give way to heavier, earthy scents that fail to resonate. The palate is kind of bland, with red fruit and olive notes along with medium length and mild tannins. Not much focus or structure here, but not bad.
Name: Aresti 2007 Estate Selection Merlot (Curicó Valley)

Description: More vegetal than fruity, with aromas of green bean, tobacco and pasty fruit. The palate is hard yet not tannic or fierce, with lactic flavors of plum mixed with green herbs. Seems like one of those classic old-school Merlots with green elements and not much going for it.
Name: Santa Rita 2006 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Description: Leather and animal notes on the nose are backed by sweet aromas of hay and carob, while the palate feels and tastes extremely creamy and milky, with raspberry, malt and vanilla. Not a lot of fruit-forwardness or structure here; it's mostly just sweet and lactic.
Name: Misiones de Rengo 2007 Merlot (Central Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The best of Sineann's Merlots, this powerful effort from Washington's Champoux vineyard brings muscle and verve to the much-maligned grape. The substantial cherry and plum fruit is buttressed with stiff tannins and plenty of alcohol, yet retains a sense of elegance. This wine won't reach its peak for another decade.
Name: Sineann 2007 Champoux Vineyard Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Columbia Valley designated Merlot from Northstar accounts for six times as many cases as its Walla Walla Merlot, yet in quality terms it sometimes equals or even surpasses the pricier bottling. The 2005 vintage was stellar, and this lovely wine is bursting with fruit—raspberry, blackberry, plum and more. Spicy aromas and flavors wrap around chocolaty tannins; there are exotic hints of curry and plenty of toast.
Name: Northstar 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Given the exceptionally high standard that Merlots have established in Washington, this wine delivers. The sappy, juicy fruit flavors bring in a mix of berries, cassis and cherry; then there are layers of chocolate, coffee, smoke and toast. But the real joy is the muscle—the underpinning of structure (from acid, tannin, oak and of course great fruit) that contributes sinew and strength. This wine should age for a decade or more.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2005 Ethos Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The opening scents carry an interesting floral note, along with bright raspberry and light chocolate. It's 100% varietal, and rare indeed is the Merlot from anywhere that can carry itself with such powerful fruit and complete structure, let alone at this bargain price. Still young and not quite filled in, this wine has tight berry/cherry fruit, licorice and toast, and plenty of power to age gracefully for up to a decade.
Name: Arbor Crest 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a gem—smoky, substantial, packed with sweet, ripe berries and cherries. It opens broad and flavorful, but there's much more, a density and a steely spine that carries the wine deeper and pushes it into a finish that adds spice, chocolate, mocha and toast. A very fine value.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2005 Indian Wells Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though it feels lighter in the mouth than its companion Columbia Valley bottling, the Walla Walla Merlot offers similar floral and spice in the nose. The addition of Petit Verdot (about 4%) can really be noticed in the floral accents. Dark and extracted, with a leathery undertone, this tightly wound wine is a bit reluctant to show its fruit at the moment. With more bottle age, the score could improve.
Name: Northstar 2005 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a nicely balanced, tightly constructed effort, a Merlot that will surprise anyone who has not tasted Washington Merlot in this price range. It is miles apart from the herbal, stemmy Merlots of other New World regions, or the vapid, watery $15 junk that comes from our neighbor to the south. This is ripe, full, meaty, structured, laden with plum and cherry, spice and just a hint of herb.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Merlot has a spirited nose of plum, black cherry and spice, followed by ripe fruit and spicy flavors on the palate. Soft tannins and a lingering finish give the wine an elegant, easydrinking appeal.
Name: Meerlust 2005 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry flavored fruit holds down the center, buoyed by firm acids, and loaded with darker flavors of licorice, tar and coffee. Tannins are smooth and compact; this will reward decanting.
Name: Saint Laurent 2005 Mrachek Vineyards Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: This wine has a rich, velvety character that gives it solo sipping appeal. Pepper and mocha on the nose flow into dark fruit and mocha flavors on the palate. Paired with a good structure and long finish, the wine is both elegant and intriguing.
Name: Guardian Peak 2007 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Juicy, bright, loaded with young, grapey, berry flavors. Bright and polished, with a Grenache-like character, though it is 100% varietal.
Name: Washington Hills 2007 Summit Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This solid Merlot begins with savory aromas of cloves, black cherry, and smoke, leading into like flavors in a structured, spirited package. The wine could continue to age, but makes for a good sip now. Pair with smoked meats, roasted duck.
Name: Backsberg 2005 Merlot (Paarl)

Description: Here is another fine effort from a re-invigorated Washington Hills brand. It's fresh and brimming with berry, cherry and cassis fruit. Supple and bright, it's got perfect structure and weight, with light pepper in the finish.
Name: Washington Hills 2007 Merlot (Washington)

Description: Fresh eucalyptus, pepper and savory spice start this pretty, balanced Merlot. Herbs, lush plum and cherry fruit, and a classy overall character make it a great wine for myriad dishes.
Name: Porcupine Ridge 2007 Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: Black cherry, pepper, cinnamon and cedar on the nose offers a dignified start to this Merlot from Hartenberg. The palate is a dense, structured combination of cherry, plum and spice flavors, with layers that unfold in the mouth. The lingering finish is elegant, smooth. Pair with meat dishes, cheeses.
Name: Hartenberg 2006 Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: For Washington Merlot this really sets the bar for bargain basement wines. It's solidly crafted, with clean black cherry fruit, firm acidity, light but supple tannins, and a long, refreshing finish. No hint of excess green or stem or anything funky; it's easily the best $6 Merlot in the country.
Name: Pine & Post 2006 Merlot (Washington)

Description: This wine offers hefty aromas of mocha, pepper and smoke on the nose and a very smooth, integrated collection of jammy fruit and spice flavors on the palate. A spicy underlay and good tannic structure mean the wine can age, but it's good to drink now. Pair with duck, turkey.
Name: Swaai 2007 Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: The nose of this Merlot is intriguing, with its cinnamon spice and plum character. On the palate, straightforward fruit flavors with a spin of spice and lingering, perky finish. A good overall wine for everyday enjoyment.
Name: Morgenhof 2005 Fantail Merlot (Stellenbosch)

Description: This wine's smooth texture is soft, velvety, needing tannins to give it a sense of shape. As it tastes in the mouth now, it shows pleasant sweet berry flavors and a dense mouthfeel. In the end, it is an easy-drinking, early maturing wine.
Name: Château Sainte Barbe 2005 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

Description: This wine starts with a savory nose of cherry, plum and mocha, unfolding into slightly sweet, spicy flavors of spice and plum. Exuberant and playful, it's a wine that can age or be enjoyed now with spiced meats, duck.
Name: Indaba 2007 Merlot (Western Cape)

Description: Cedar, red fruit and savory spice on the nose and plate and a silky, easy drinking character make this wine a great everyday choice. Pair with duck, smoked meats, cheeses.
Name: Golden Kaan 2006 Merlot (Western Cape)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Scents are beyond ripe, diving into raisins, prunes and balsamic. The wine smoothes out somewhat in the mouth, with figs and prunes and cooked cherries; but then turns dry and tannic. It seems to be on a fast-track aging curve.
Name: Kestrel 2005 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A thin, characterless red wine, this has a little spicy clove but nothing else that stands out. Dull, thin, ordinary.
Name: Goose Ridge 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is a little Cabernet Sauvignon (15%) and Syrah (4%) in the blend also. This is a silky, yet muscular— let's say it, masculine—style of Merlot. Meaning that the fruit is concentrated with deep blue and black berry and cassis flavors, augmented with lead pencil. Beautiful polish and concentration characterize this wine, yet it's quite approachable.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Chuck Reininger has fashioned a Merlot that captures his personal style as well as the signature of the vineyards. Smooth and seamless, juiced up with spicy berry and plum, then softened with barrel flavors of butterscotch, milk chocolate and coffee, this wine just glides along on a carpet of silk, tossing out bursts of spice and herb along the way.
Name: Reininger 2005 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pure varietal blend of Merlot opens fragrantly with scents of black raspberry, black cherry, plum and smoke. Very young, tight and firmly packed, it's a wine that is already showing finesse and a pleasing tension between the tart fruit and the toasty, mocha-flavored oak. Given time in the bottle, it may well prove to be one of the best-aging Beresan Merlots ever made.
Name: Beresan 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From a mix of Milbrandt vineyard sites, this outstanding blend includes small amounts of Cabernet, Syrah, Malbec and Barbera. The blend was so well done that each component adds a vital piece to the whole—smooth berry and cherry fruits, spice, tobacco, licorice and smoke, folding into a lush and chocolaty finish.
Name: Milbrandt 2006 Traditions Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Included in the blend is 11% Cabernet Sauvignon and 9% Syrah, all estate-grown. It shows both the broadness and the depth of Washington Merlot, mixing plummy fruit with streaks of tobacco and licorice. There's a suggestion of earth and a savory aspect to the finish, which exits smoothly and softly, with a last kick of cinnamon.
Name: Fielding Hills 2006 RiverBend Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: A vivid, fresh and fragrant wine, this is alive with a luscious mix of flavors from the intriguing mix of grapes, including Syrah, Dolcetto and Barbera. Lots of strawberry, sweet cherry candy and lively, juicy acids make this a standout. There are more and more well-made red blends selling at this price point in Washington, but this goes right to the top.
Name: Nelms Road 2007 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This new lineup from Columbia Crest features fruit exclusively from the Horse Heaven Hills AVA, which provides a welcome focus to the wines. Fruit-powered, but more substantial than either the Grand Estates or the Two Vines, this shows persistent flavors of tangy raspberry and blackberry, moderate acids and plenty of cocoa in the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2006 H3 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Bisquertt usually does well with its value-priced Merlots, and seeing that 2007 was an excellent vintage in Chile, this wine excels in the value price range. The nose is dark and saturated, but pure and inviting. And the palate is ripe and smooth, with spice, plum, blackberry and herb notes, particularly anise. Finishes clean, smooth and peppery. Drink now.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2007 Casa La Joya Reserve Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: A slightly green nose is tempered by aromas of cherry, spice and dried herbs in this Bulgarian Merlot. Soft, integrated flavors are of vanilla, spice and berry. Firm and complex, the wine offers a lingering, warm finish. Aged for at least six months in Bulgarian oak barrels, it's ready to drink now.
Name: Pulden 2005 Salta Terra Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Description: Soft blackberry, cinnamon and pepper aromas lead flavors of juicy berry and savory spice in this Merlot from Bulgaria. Good tannins and structure give the wine ageability, which will also temper its oaky character. Overall, an impressive effort from an emerging region.
Name: Vini 2006 Veni Vidi Vici Merlot (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dry and tannic, this has some sweet and lightly chocolaty boysenberry, cherry and cassis fruit holding down the center. The wine seems wrapped in a fair amount of acid and tannin, and it needs both food and air to show its best. It's a good steak wine, firm and reasonably substantial, with some indications of red licorice and black coffee in the finish.
Name: Hogue 2006 Genesis Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hogue is back as a value player. This is a fine effort, ripe enough to avoid the greenies, and showing some detail and cut to the tannins. There's nothing wimpy here; it's got some chewy red fruits backed with earthy tannins, acids proportionate, and a finish that's just under 14% alcohol.
Name: Hogue 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Supple and balanced, this 100% Merlot brings ripe berries and cherries  matched to moderate acids and silky tannins. It's a ready-to-go, pleasant-drinking young wine, with a whiff of Earl Grey tea and light loam in the tannins.
Name: Balboa 2007 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vino da Tavola della Svizzera Italiana, Switzerland
Description: A savory nose of smoked meats, pepper and spice is bolstered by rich flavors of spice, cedar and black cherry on this smooth sip from Switzerland. Simple but food friendly, with a fruity finish.
Name: Delea 2006 Marengo Merlot (Vino da Tavola della Svizzera Italiana)
Province: Vino da Tavola della Svizzera Italiana

Appellation: Hunter Valley, New South Wales, Australia
Description: The Hunter Valley isn't known for its Merlot, but this offering is surprisingly mouthfilling, featuring appealing cola and black cherry notes. Hints of menthol and roasted meat creep in, but the finish is dominated by fruit—a good sign. Soft enough to drink now.
Name: Hope Estate 2007 Estate Grown Merlot (Hunter Valley)

Description: A solid effort, marrying a soft, mouthfilling texture with crisply delineated flavors of cherries and an herbal element. Silky tannins provide just enough structure to pair this wine with red meats. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2007 The Y Series Merlot (South Australia)

Description: If a bit of herbal/leafy character isn't a turn-off, then this colorful, nicely balanced Merlot should do the trick. It smells a little old-school, sort of like a circa-2000 Merlot or Carmenère. But it tastes like herb-tinged plums and berries, and the mouthfeel is exemplary for a $10 wine.
Name: Santa Carolina 2007 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A sweet and juicy Merlot, this is wide open and ready to go with your favorite pizza. Light red fruits are dusted with fresh herbs, all broadly displayed and easy drinking.
Name: Substance 2007 Me Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Hints of smoked meat, cedar and vanilla lead the way, lending oak-derived complexity to this otherwise cheery red. It's easy and round, marked by suppleness and cherry fruit.
Name: Deakin Estate 2006 Merlot (Victoria)

Description: This Merlot is so gently extracted it's almost Pinot Noir-like, with delicate cherry and beet aromas and a noticeable herbal tinge to the dark cherry fruit.
Name: Climbing 2006 Merlot (Orange)

Description: Sort of creamy and unconvincing on the nose, with carob and stemmy berry aromas. The palate runs toward red fruit, but it's also a bit green and herbal. Finishing notes of chocolate and green herbs are typical of Merlot, yet there isn't enough ripe fruit or excitement. Hence, it's a mid-level red wine with some green character. Contains 9% Cabernet and 5% Shiraz.
Name: Caliterra 2007 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Smoky, pungent and earthy, with cola and plum notes that fill the mouth, then turn crisp on the finish.
Name: Oxford Landing 2007 Merlot (South Australia)

Description: Bold and saturated to the eye, with black fruit, olive and other slightly herbal aromas. But where this wine loses points is in the mouth. It's sharp and overtly acidic, which makes the cola and cherry flavors ring and seem tangy. Thus it finishes short and scouring.
Name: Concha y Toro 2007 Casillero del Diablo Reserve Merlot (Rapel Valley)

Description: A soft blackberry, vanilla and plum nose is followed by a rustic mélange of dried tea, berry and spice flavors in this Merlot. Tannins are firm and the overall flavors good, but the wine needs a little more cohesion.
Name: Delea 2004 Carato Merlot (Ticino)

Description: Fairly stemmy on the nose, with herbaceous aromas. The palate blends green notes and candied plum flavors, while the finish is basic and a bit hot and grating. Tastes like a mass-market wine.
Name: Ventisquero 2007 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: A big wine for Merlot, this high alcohol (14.6%) effort ramps up its black cherry fruit with volatile acidity and brings in chocolaty barrel flavors under an earthy, tannic finish. Another year or two in the bottle can only help; at this young age it seems a little blowsy and sharp.
Name: Sineann 2007 Hillside Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (OR))

Description: Soft berry and pepper spice aromas give this elegant red a mellow start. On the palate, savory meat and cherry flavors are touched with an herbal lift. Smooth and delicate in nature, and a pretty sipping wine.
Name: Koenig Vineyards 2006 Estate Vineyard Merlot

Description: A ripe, juicy Merlot that is sure to be a crowd pleaser. Soft, dusty tannins and a plump mouthfeel make this wine immediately approachable, and an easy selection to pair with most entrées. Loaded with aromas and flavors of red plum and cherry accented by hints of African violets and bay leaves.
Name: Recanati 2007 Kosher Merlot (Galilee)

Description: Smooth and integrated but punctuated by spicy oak and plum flavors, this Texas Merlot is a welcome surprise. It starts with aromas of savory meats, smoke and pepper and ends with a lingering finish. A food-friendly wine that's not overly complex, but enjoyable.
Designation: Limited Edition Father and Son Cuvée
Name: Paulo 2002 Limited Edition Father and Son Cuvée Merlot (Texas)

Description: Bright cherry, pepper and spice aromas lead on this flavorful red. Fruity flavors of cherry and plum are laced with pepper. Vibrant and fun—and food friendly. Think duck or a meat lasagna.
Name: Vivác Winery 2005 V. Single Vineyard Merlot (New Mexico)

Description: Moderate aromas of burnt coffee, cocoa dustings, black plum and berries lead into a similarly confectioned mouth loaded with sweet spice and chocolate-covered dried cherries. Solidly structured, but the 10 months spent in 90% American oak is a tad too apparent and somewhat overwhelms the palate.
Name: Kadesh Barnea 2006 Estate Bottled Kosher Merlot (Negev Hills)

Description: A beautiful dark plum color and elegant aromas of cherry, allspice and pepper lead this Virginia Merlot. Rich and savory notes and a bright fruit character are appealing but need time to age and integrate. Overall, a solid red for the cellar.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2006 Adagio Merlot (Virginia)

Description: Anise, blackberry and pepper on the nose and palate create an appealing Merlot that is nonetheless a touch acidic. Balance it with a rich meat stew or duck entrée.
Name: Reif Estate 2002 First Growth Merlot (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatic, seductive wine, scented with smoke and chocolate, cedar and strawberry. Thick and chewy, with ripe raspberry fruit and a liquorous, barrel-inflected finish. This is a big wine for those who like sheer power, in both fruit and tannins.
Name: Barrister 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: These Dwelley vineyard grapes display bright raspberry fruit, lively acids, and a more tightly refined structure than the other Barrister Merlots. Along with the higher acidity of the 2006 vintage, there seems to be a more gentle touch with the new oak as well, although plenty of coffee and smoke flavors roll out in the finish.
Name: Barrister 2006 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy and a little hot right after opening, this wine breathes into shape, firming up with classic Red Mountain fruit flavors of plum and cherry, laced with graphite and accented with new oak. This is as muscular and authoritative as Merlot can get, and priced at a third of what comparablebottles from California cost.
Name: Barrister 2005 Artz Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Description: It's obvious from the alcohol that the Merlot here was very ripe. But, happily, it doesn't taste that way. The balance of rich raisin and red plum flavors are well balanced by acidity. There is some smokiness from wood, the ripeness finishing freshly with a black cherry taste.
Name: Hans Moser 2006 Merlot (Burgenland)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is Pepper Bridge Merlot, and it beautifully expresses the vineyard trademarks: fresh fruit flavors of strawberry and raspberry, spread out broadly across the palate, and backed with tart acids and light tannins. There is a strong streak of Asian spicebox as well, but overall the wineis very approachable, which makes it is a Merlot to enjoy with rich fish, such as salmon. It's bright and lightly spicy and not too heavy.
Name: Des Voigne Cellars 2006 The Emcee Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Chocolate and bitter cherries dominate this full-on wine, packed with spice and toasty wood flavors. In mouthfeel, it is very rich, smooth, dense and velvety at the same time.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2006 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Nicely styled, showing lots of licorice in the nose and in the flavors. Blackberry and plum, cedar and spice are gently introduced, and the balance of fruit, acid and tannin is taut and proportionate.
Name: Cadaretta 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the winery's first Merlot. It's a simple, pleasant effort, fruit forward and lightly oaky. The usual flavors of berry are there, and the balance is fine; it just could use more concentration through the finish.
Name: Dumas Station 2005 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is nothing wimpy about this 100% pure Merlot. The firm core of tart berry and currant adds iron and clove highlights through a concentrated midpalate; the finish is a bit rough and hints at green tannins.
Name: Kamiak 2006 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Simple but meaty, this 100% Merlot has substantial weight in the midpalate. There are plenty of powerful herbal flavors, yet the grapes seem ripe enough, offering prune and cassis and a little pepper from aging in American oak.
Name: Hyatt 2005 Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The entry is oaky and the fruit light; it seems a bit unbalanced. The fruit suggests pomegranate and very tart raspberry, with plenty of acid; the oak layers in thick flavors of espresso and chocolate. Tannins are stiff but not too rough; and the finish suggests that some American oak mayhave been used.
Name: Bonair 2006 Chateau Puryear Vineyard Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light, spicy and well made, with pale fruit flavors of strawberry, cranberry and raspberry. Tannins remain stiff and peppery; the fruit does not seem to have the ripeness to fill out the middle, even with more bottle time.
Name: Robert Karl 2006 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The high alcohol (15.5%) and pruney character suggests that this was picked late—a bit too late to retain any elegance. The acids are sharp and citric and not well integrated, leaving the fruit almost invisible. Decanting opens it up a bit; this is an excellent vineyard, but it has not been all that well served here.
Name: Merry Cellars 2006 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Oddly, Silver Lake's least expensive Merlot is its best. It's a solidly made, straight-ahead varietal wine, with a core of black olive and currant, stiff tannins and enough grip to hold up to hearty main meat dishes.
Name: Silver Lake 2006 Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: This structured wine has ripe black fruits followed by red berries. There is a good depth of flavor, the tannins giving the bright fruit weight and a mouthfilling character.
Name: Château Sainte Barbe 2006 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Earthy, stemmy and tannic. Here the sweetish raspberry and cherry flavors that open the wine are buried in rough and bitter tannins. The stemminess is too much for the simple fruit.
Name: Roza Ridge 2004 Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: Applesauce and fruit salad are rather strange, unconvincing aromas for Merlot, and the palate of plum and wild berry is big, broad and lunky. Jammy on the back end, with herbal berry flavors on the finish. Acceptable red wine but nothing special.
Name: Bodega Norton 2006 Reserva Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Rusty in color, with meaty, dry aromas of beef broth, oak and leafy fruit. The palate is baked and candied, with lactic flavors of vanilla, caramel and herbal cherry. Fairly tannic and hard.
Name: Gimenez Riili 2006 Perpetuum Merlot (Mendoza)

Description: Rubbery and sulfuric, with hard, tart red-fruit flavors. Too drying, edgy and sour to draw much of a smile. Not exactly a fun or interesting wine to drink.
Name: Finca El Portillo 2007 Estate Bottled Merlot (Uco Valley)

Description: Not very fruity, with gritty cherry flavors and a hard, edgy, almost sour profile. Does nothing for the reputation of Merlot in Argentina. Overpriced, too.
Name: Tapiz 2006 Merlot (Mendoza)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A complete and expressive wine, with vibrant berry/cherry fruit, supple textures and a gentle hand with the oak. The tannins have been well managed and mediated; the wine is tannic but smooth with no roughness or excessively green flavors. It captures just a hint of pepper and herb, and is streaked with coffee highlights through the finish.
Name: Januik 2005 Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% Merlot and barrel aged in 100% new oak. It has lovely, sweet black cherry fruit, with concentrated flavors but without even a hint of jammy or overripe character. The acids are in balance, and the wine is very pure, adding streaks of tobacco, espresso and licorice through the lingering finish.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2005 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sharp, tight, herbal and dense; this is a young wine that needs breathing time. The balance is perfect, with beautiful notes of spice and peppery herb; the fruit is tight and tart, a mix of wild berry and bramble.
Name: Januik 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Once upon a time this Concha y Toro label was a Best Buy regular. At $21 it no longer qualifies, but it's every bit an excellent wine in 2006. Aromas of plum, cola, pepper and Christmas spice are alluring, while the palate is saturated yet balanced. Flavors of plum and berry are perfectly ripe, and the structure and texture are just right.
Name: Concha y Toro 2006 Marques de Casa Concha Merlot (Peumo)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This potent Merlot has a rich, lush and complex bouquet that suggests a wine of considerable depth. In the mouth it shows black cherry, some smoke, leaf and well-integrated tannins. Rare indeed is the pure Merlot from anywhere at this price that can show this much concentration.
Name: Chandler Reach 2005 Estate Select Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Description: Campfire smoke, charcoal, cola and berry aromas are handsome and convincing. This is one stacked and packed New World Merlot. It oozes baked berry, plum, spice and cinnamon flavors, and then backs that up with toasty coffee and chocolate finishing notes. A stylish wine that's complex, dark and complete.
Name: Ventisquero 2006 Grey Apalta Vineyards Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Another winner from Castle Rock, this is a lovely Merlot, pure and true, with a luscious core of soft, sweet cherry candy fruit. Medium weight, excellent balance, exceptional clarity and freshness for the price.
Name: Castle Rock 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a good baseline Merlot, blended with small amounts of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Once again the wine opens with a very pretty nose, scented with pipe tobacco and cherry. Those flavors move into a satisfying middle, with nothing vegetal or even too herbal, but the black cherry fruit is joined by dried leaves and black olive complexities.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Dark and herbal, with solid fruit and texture. This is Merlot from Chile as it should be, meaning it is meaty, ripe, naturally herbal and comfortable. Not a fancy wine, but one with honest cherry, plum, herb and pepper flavors. A little bumpy, hot and oaky, but convincing as a whole. Imported by Baystate Wine Co.
Name: Viu Manent 2006 Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first-ever Walla Walla wine from Ron Bunnell's RiverAerie label, and the excellent fruit is mostly from Spofford Station. It's 77% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Syrah. A young wine, with pretty flavors of young vines, it leads with cherry candy and adds on some spicy herb, with hints of tomato leaf, as it weaves across the palate. Simple and satisfying.
Name: RiverAerie 2006 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Upon opening, the wine has scents that are ripe, leafy and slightly pruney, but the flavors come across as light and true. Cherry, fig and plum fruits, somewhat cooked, somewhat candied, mingle in a soft and fruity wine that takes some hours to smooth out. The fruit is both a little too ripe, and a bit green, the tannins green and the finish leafy.
Name: Michael Florentino Cellars 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A little sharpness on the nose tilts things toward red fruit and rhubarb, yet the palate is more deep and dark, albeit slightly tough. Ripe berry, plum and a hint of burnt brown sugar work the palate, followed by a hot, slightly charred finish. A brawny specimen with natural vigor and ample oak.
Name: Ventisquero 2006 Queulat Gran Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High-toned and already considerably far down the aging path, this 98% pure Merlot (2% Cabernet Sauvignon) brings the heat (14.9% alcohol) and packs substantial, earthy tannins. The fruit flavors remain on the lighter side of strawberry and raspberry, with a strong herbal component running through the middle and into the finish.
Name: Hogue 2005 Reserve Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Description: A little bit wild and sauvage, as Merlot from Chile is known to be. Flavors of herbal berry fruit and plum work the core, while the finish is woody and resiny, but also a little zingy and acidic. Not so much tart but definitely a little more snappy and “red” than the norm.
Name: TerraNoble 2006 Gran Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a pleasantly fruity wine, with tangy cherry fruit limned with some herbal, earthy tannins. Hints of tobacco and vanilla are there, but the wine quickly shows rather harsh, chalky acids that descend into a bitter, herbal finish.
Name: Maryhill 2005 Proprietor's Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: For a $15 Washington Merlot, this offers fair value. Despite the earthy, slightly stemmy tannins, the wine has substantial fruit flavors of cranberry and pie cherry, and the acids give it some extra lift. This will go well with fatty meats and grilled steaks.
Name: Maryhill 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Strawberry fruit is set against some pretty stiff tannins; it seems to have over-reached in color and extract, given the rather lean fruit. Leafy, herbal and a bit off-kilter.
Name: Airfield Estates 2006 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This bright, aromatic, vivid wine opens with a bowlful of berries and cherries. There is plenty of acid under the ripe fruit, which takes center stage at the moment. The significant addition of Carmenère (from the Seven Hills vineyard) adds black pepper to the engaging mix of flavors. Despite its youth, the flavors persist for a remarkably long finish.
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Whether by virtue of vintage or bottle variation, Boudreaux wines seem to gyrate a bit wildly when first released. This new 2005 is no exception. At first sniff it explodes into life, the aromas a mix of herb, spice, tar, smoke, earth and fruit. Flavors are threaded together into a seamless, saturated whole—plum, cassis and cherry liqueur up front, earth and tannin right behind. Some tasters may find it leaning toward the medicinal, but for those who love Rob Newsom's full-speed-ahead style, this is a gorgeous bottle.
Name: Boudreaux Cellars 2005 Merlot (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rich and chocolaty, this dense and detailed wine is loaded with brambly fruit, ripe cherry and baking chocolate. It's dotted with fine-grained, coffee-streaked tannins, and finishes with highlights of butterscotch and malted milk candies. As with all the 2005 Quilceda's, this is still young and tight. It is dominated by the barrel flavors that only slowly meld into the massive fruit with extensive breathing time (36 hours after being opened the wine was still improving).
Name: Quilceda Creek 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A beautiful evocation of Washington fruit, it has concentration, balance and structure, and the clean berry/cherry fruit is amplified by polished tannins, bright acids and light splashes of peppery spice. This is one of the finest pure Washington Merlots to be released in many years.
Name: Helix by Reininger 2005 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Winemaker Tim Stevens' dark, subtle, beautifully proportioned wines glide across the palate like Apollo Ono dancing with the stars. The cool site brings out some of the floral and citrus accents often missing from Merlot, and the darker cherry and plum fruit flavors fill in right behind. Supple and sensuous, this is a wine to savor and, if possible, cellar for another decade.
Name: Stevens 2005 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consistent with previous releases, this Michel Rolland effort is a soft, silky, smoky wine that introduces itself with round cherry fruit and then charges ahead with layers of licorice, citrus, coffee and rock that enliven the finish. There is plenty of tart raspberry fruit to open, and the balancing acids to give the wine a tight core. It's a very polished and appealing balance of forward, approachable fruit married to more elegant, ageworthy tannins and acids.
Name: Pedestal 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A strong contender for the best $22 Merlot in the country. Sculpted, dense and deeply layered, it's loaded with mixed blue and black fruits, fresh herb and sweet toast. The use of new oak is restrained and appropriate, extending the finish with nicely applied streaks of coffee around ripe, tight, dry tannins.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2005 Canoe Ridge Estate Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In the glass there is a sense of depth that goes beyond anything previously apparent; the mixed aromas of flower, berry and chocolate-covered rock lead into a wine of presence and power, its pretty, spicy berry and cherry flavors tightly wound and wrapped in seductive but lightly applied layers of chocolate and caramel.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2006 Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the second single-vineyard, pure Merlot offering from Fidélitas in 2005, and the better bottle. This one needs some breathing time, as it brings the classic Red Mountain stoniness to bear. It's all about structure, balancing tart red fruits on layers of graphite and mineral, with dry, austere tannins. It's rare to find an unblended Merlot with this much muscle.
Name: Fidelitas 2005 Red Mountain Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: If Washington “owns” Merlot as a category in the U.S. (not that anyone cares at the moment), this confirms it. You get ripe, sweet, tangy red berry fruit, fresh acids, ripe tannins and toasty oak; there may not be a better value in the country. The way the oak is used is magnificent and adds layer after layer to the extended finish.
Name: Novelty Hill 2005 Columbia Valley Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The estate vineyard Merlot includes a splash of Cabernet and Petit Verdot; it's beefed up considerably from the regular Columbia Valley Merlot. More muscle and weight translates more to a stylistic choice than a better wine; both Merlots are substantial and satisfying, with much more flesh to the red fruit flavors, and the tannic backbone to carry the wine through a smooth finish.
Name: Novelty Hill 2005 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The winemakers speak of “wild chokecherry jam” flavors. OK. There are interesting, wild berry flavors, along with the winery's generous, milk chocolaty, oaked-up finish. Still young and knitting together, if this wine follows the path of earlier successes, it will begin to expand and fill out over the next five or six years.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2006 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: H3, the newest tier joining the Columbia Crest brand, may quickly become the go-to bottle for Merlot lovers if this new effort is representative of the line. Great fruit is the story of course, sourced from Horse Heaven Hills (hence H3) vineyards. Balanced berry and cherry fruit flavors are underscored with dusty notes of earth and cocoa, then finished with some dark chocolate.
Name: Columbia Crest 2005 H3 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A first-time offering, this is pure Merlot from one of Washington's best vineyards. Fragrant and floral, the wine opens smartly with juicy and tart flavors of raspberry and cranberry. Medium concentration, with tangy, subtle flavors that meld into well-managed, soft tannins, and just a whisp of heat from the near-15% alcohol.
Name: Fidelitas 2005 Champoux Vineyard Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, soft and satiny, with a graceful mix of plum, blueberry and raspberry. The Sagemoor Vineyard fruit is plenty ripe but it does have suggestions of dried herb, chocolate and buttery toffee. It's got an appealing smoothness, yet gathers itself together and holds its focus through the finish, with just enough high-toned lift to tickle the nose.
Name: Couvillion Winery 2006 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Soft scents of spice, tobacco, olive and rose petals suggest an Italian style of Merlot. It's light on its feet, firm and tangy, with flavors of plum, blueberry and baking spices. Tannins are slightly green but rounded, and the flavors persist gently into a lingering finish.
Name: JM Cellars 2005 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: First impression is that this is a rather sharp, edgy, oaky young Merlot, without the broadly appealing fruit character that generally differentiates Washington Merlot from its Cabernets. That said, it offers up some nice, toasty flavors from the barrels, a mix of coffee, buttered nuts and mocha streaks running through the extended finish. As the fruit comes up it shows tart and sleek notes of pie cherry and wild raspberry, set against substantial acids.
Name: Mercer 2005 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cherries, chocolate and mushrooms cavort across the palate; the wine has matured into some nicely subdued but complex and even exotic flavors. It's drinking well, with plum and flower, chocolate and herb; all delicate but well integrated. Don't keep it long term, but enjoy it soon for its elegance and subtlety.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2004 Block 13 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Grand Estates Merlot is a sure-fire Best Buy, as especially in a ripe, sweet vintage such as 2005. The color is pure and deep, and the soft midpalate offers ripe cherry and prune flavors. Streaks of coffee lead into somewhat earthy tannins that add structure to the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2005 Grand Estates Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark, sappy and reductive, it shows skillful winemaking and sensitivity to vineyard management. The color is there, the aromas are pure and the flavors are balanced, without being overripe. It captures a pleasing mix of berries and currants. Tannins are quite dry and lightly peppery.
Name: Hestia Cellars 2005 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
